13/09/2021.headline: Regional supermarket operator accused of 'systematic' wage theft of more than $1m
13/09/2021.description: South Australia's shop workers union alleges the operator of 20 regional Foodland and IGA supermarkets owes at least 64 workers more than $1 million in unpaid wages, launching a claim in the Federal Court.
13/09/2021.author: Sara Tomevska

13/09/2021.headline: Citizenship rules change: Wallabies' Quade Cooper can become an Australian at last
13/09/2021.description: The Immigration Minister changes residency rule for "distinguished" applicants for citizenship to become Australians, after a Wallabies rugby star was rejected multiple times.
13/09/2021.author: Matthew Doran

13/09/2021.headline: US Secretary of State defends chaotic Afghan withdrawal, blames Trump deal
13/09/2021.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken pushes against harsh criticism, saying the Biden administration inherited a deal with the Taliban to end the war but no plan for carrying it out.
13/09/2021.author: Matthew Doran

13/09/2021.headline: Melbourne man who died of COVID-19 at home had not been tested, health officials say
13/09/2021.description: A man in his 20s and a woman in her 80s become the fifth and sixth people to die from COVID-19 during Victoria's Delta outbreak. The state has recorded 445 new local infections overnight.
13/09/2021.author: Matthew Doran

13/09/2021.headline: Decade-long ban for Algerian judoka's Olympic withdrawal
13/09/2021.description: Fethi Nourine's decision to pull out of the Tokyo Olympics judo competition because of the possibility he might face an Israeli opponent all but ends the Algerian judoka's career, after his actions draw a 10-year ban.
13/09/2021.author: Matthew Doran

13/09/2021.headline: Authorities praise families, contact tracers as one new COVID case detected in Queensland
13/09/2021.description: Chief Health Officer Jeannette Young says she thinks Brisbane's latest COVID-19 outbreak has been brought under control after a 15-year-old girl who attends St Thomas More College at Sunnybank tests positive.
13/09/2021.author: Matthew Doran

13/09/2021.headline: Prince Andrew challenges a US court's jurisdiction in sex abuse lawsuit
13/09/2021.description: Prince Andrew argues a US court does not have jurisdiction over a lawsuit filed by a woman who claims he abused her at Ghislaine Maxwell's home and Jeffrey Epstein's island.
13/09/2021.author: Matthew Doran

13/09/2021.headline: We fact checked Immigration Minister Alex Hawke on refugee resettlement. Here's what we found
13/09/2021.description: Immigration Minister Alex Hawke says Australia ranks around third globally every year in the amount of refugees it resettles. Is that correct? RMIT ABC Fact Check investigates.
13/09/2021.author: David Campbell

13/09/2021.headline: At 62, Ross watched a TV show and decided to go for his first run. It went for 10 hours
13/09/2021.description: Eight years and nine ultramarathons later, the 70-year-old endurance runner is eyeing off a 120km challenge.
13/09/2021.author: Zilla Gordon

13/09/2021.headline: Shipping costs have risen by hundreds of millions of dollars and you may be about to pay for it
13/09/2021.description: The competition regulator is investigating a dramatic surge in fees and charges imposed by port operators on trucking firms to load and unload cargo. ACCC chief Rod Sims believes the higher charges are being passed onto consumers in the form of higher prices.
13/09/2021.author: Sue Lannin

13/09/2021.headline: ASX slips, as NAB says business confidence is improving on 'vaccine rollout'
13/09/2021.description: Australian shares fall in morning trade, following a mixed performance on Wall Street as investors focused on potential corporate tax hikes in the United States and upcoming economic data.
13/09/2021.author: David Chau

13/09/2021.headline: Unlawful force used in 'disturbing' arrest shows need for better cultural training of police: lawyer
13/09/2021.description: There are renewed calls for greater training of police in Aboriginal towns after a court found officers used unlawful force during the arrest of an elderly Indigenous man.
13/09/2021.author: Julia André and Larissa Waterson

13/09/2021.headline: Aboriginal health workers fighting COVID vaccine misinformation
13/09/2021.description: In the Northern Territory's remote community of Yarralin there's a new push from the local Aboriginal health service to get residents vaccinated. While progress has been slow, despite door-knocking and community cook-ups, residents and health workers are determined to get their community protected.
13/09/2021.author: Kate Ashton

13/09/2021.headline: Crown floats mandatory vaccination policy for both staff and customers
13/09/2021.description: The resort and casino operator says it is consulting with staff about a mandatory vaccination policy for its 20,000 workers. Unvaccinated people would also be banned from visiting its venues.
13/09/2021.author: Kate Ashton

14/09/2021.headline: Pfizer vaccine available for over 60s in WA from next week, Mark McGowan announces
14/09/2021.description: West Australians aged 60 and older will be eligible to receive the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine from Monday next week, the Premier says.
14/09/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

14/09/2021.headline: 'Not very pretty': Whale carcass to be recovered by SA Museum as big 'stench' heats up
14/09/2021.description: The smelly carcass of a rare whale, which has been mauled by sharks and left to rot on a northern Adelaide beach, will be cut up and removed by SA Museum staff and the local council.
14/09/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

14/09/2021.headline: ACT lockdown extended for a month, as territory records 22 new COVID-19 cases
14/09/2021.description: The ACT will remain in lockdown for another four weeks amid persistent new case numbers in the community.
14/09/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

14/09/2021.headline: NSW records 1,127 COVID-19 cases, two deaths
14/09/2021.description: Deputy health officer Jeremy McAnulty says it is too early to tell if the drop in case numbers means the state is over the highest peak of the Delta outbreak as NSW records 1,127 new COVID-19 cases.
14/09/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

14/09/2021.headline: AIS vaccination hub booking error results in hundreds of rescheduled appointments, late-night doses administered
14/09/2021.description: More than 600 Canberrans have their COVID-19 vaccination appointments rescheduled after an overbooking error occurred at the AIS mass vaccination hub.
14/09/2021.author: Charlotte Gore

14/09/2021.headline: Could Lawn Hill mine be site of next Juukan Gorge tragedy?
14/09/2021.description: The fallout over the destruction of Western Australia's Juukan Gorge rock shelters is being felt at another mine in Queensland, where a group of Indigenous elders is trying to stop the proposed excavation around a sacred site.
14/09/2021.author: Peter McCutcheon and Bridget Brennan

14/09/2021.headline: Wild 'de-extinction' plan aims to bring woolly mammoths back to life
14/09/2021.description: Genetics company Colossal secures funding to create an "elephant-mammoth hybrid", saying its technology has the potential to bring back ancient extinct species and restore damaged or lost ecosystems.
14/09/2021.author: Peter McCutcheon and Bridget Brennan

14/09/2021.headline: 'Limb-threatening' injuries after massive brawl involving 40 armed men in Brisbane's south
14/09/2021.description: Queensland police investigate a brawl involving 40 men armed with bats and poles in a southern Brisbane suburb last night.
14/09/2021.author: Peter McCutcheon and Bridget Brennan

14/09/2021.headline: Amy spends up to $20,000 a year on magnetic therapy to treat depression. Medicare changes won't help her
14/09/2021.description: After years of lobbying, Medicare will soon partly fund repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation to treat severe depression. But existing patients won't see a cent.
14/09/2021.author: Edwina Seselja

14/09/2021.headline: Demand on Queensland's public hospital emergency departments outstripping population growth
14/09/2021.description: A Queensland Audit Office report says demand for emergency departments is growing at a faster rate than population growth, and more people are presenting at EDs with complex issues.
14/09/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

14/09/2021.headline: 'Please come forward': Rene Latimore's family say they're searching for answers
14/09/2021.description: Katie Marchetti is already living with the agony of losing a sister Rene in a suspected homicide but she fears the "worst is yet to come". She is urging anyone with information, no matter how small, to contact police.
14/09/2021.author: Angel Parsons

14/09/2021.headline: 'Close to not having an arm': Killick Beach shark attack survivor makes slow recovery
14/09/2021.description: Two months and eight surgeries later, great white shark attack survivor Joe Hoffman is on a long road to recovery after his near-fatal encounter on the Mid North Coast.
14/09/2021.author: Kate Aubrey

14/09/2021.headline: Queensland MPs give emotional speeches ahead of vote to legalise voluntary assisted dying
14/09/2021.description: Queensland MPs fight back tears, detail personal stories and reveal the "exhausting" experience of weighing up opposing views ahead of a vote on proposed laws to legalise voluntary assisted dying in Queensland.
14/09/2021.author: Kate McKenna

14/09/2021.headline: WA misses out on extra AFL grand final tickets as Bulldogs allocation sells out in hours
14/09/2021.description: Hopes of additional WA tickets have been dashed after the Western Bulldogs fans quickly snapped up the 12,000 AFL grand final tickets allocated to them.
14/09/2021.author: Blake Kagi

14/09/2021.headline: House prices jumped $52,600 in three months, and the RBA says it can't do much about it
14/09/2021.description: Reserve Bank governor Philip Lowe says he understands concerns about rapid house price growth, but it's helping household wealth to grow.
14/09/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

14/09/2021.headline: Mystery donors pay some of Christian Porter's legal fees
14/09/2021.description: Former attorney-general Christian Porter tells federal parliament anonymous donors have covered some of the legal fees he racked up during his defamation case against the ABC, and says he has no way of finding out who they are.
14/09/2021.author: Matthew Doran

14/09/2021.headline: 'They fall into our trap': WA Police pose as drug suppliers to infiltrate organised crime gangs
14/09/2021.description: WA Police say they posed as international drug suppliers to infiltrate local organised crime gangs, resulting in the seizure of more than 30 kilograms of heroin and methylamphetamine and $7 million in cash.
14/09/2021.author: Matthew Doran

14/09/2021.headline: ‘Exciting development': DNA water testing hoped to stop cane toads gaining foothold on Kimberley islands
14/09/2021.description: In the past decade cane toads have marched across most of the Kimberley, so protecting animals on island sanctuaries is now a key priority.
14/09/2021.author: Ted O'Connor

14/09/2021.headline: Perth sibling murder accused asked grandmother for shovel after neighbour heard muffled scream from apartment
14/09/2021.description: The grandmother of a man accused of murdering a brother and sister in Victoria Park told police he was bloodied and crying after she picked him up from an apartment complex where the bodies were later found, a court hears.
14/09/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

14/09/2021.headline: 'Held hostage in their own homes': People forced to stay in isolation long after 14-day period
14/09/2021.description: A staff member at a public health call centre in a Sydney hotspot area says people in isolation after testing positive for COVID are being trapped at home for weeks after the standard 14-day period because of paperwork delays.
14/09/2021.author: Sally Sara

14/09/2021.headline: 'I come from a lockdown under': T-shirt design competition relieves the stress
14/09/2021.description: When James Valentine posed the question "if you could sum up this lockdown in one sketch or design, what would it look like?" Sydney responded. And you can now wear it.
14/09/2021.author: Mawunyo Gbogbo

14/09/2021.headline: Boy and mother with COVID-19 transferred from Broken Hill to Adelaide hospital
14/09/2021.description: A boy sick with COVID-19 is flown to Adelaide for treatment, accompanied by his mother, who also has the virus.
14/09/2021.author: Eugene Boisvert and Leah MacLennan

14/09/2021.headline: NSW Premier in 'heated' meeting with mayors from Sydney's COVID hotspots
14/09/2021.description: Gladys Berejiklian's meeting with 12 mayors from Sydney's COVID hotspots becomes "a little bit heated" when the topic turns to discrimination.
14/09/2021.author: Alison Xiao

14/09/2021.headline: Hope, empowerment and a Balenciaga shadow on the Met Gala red carpet
14/09/2021.description: The highlight of the fashion year returns with stars switching out their sweatpants for elaborate and sometimes outlandish outfits.
14/09/2021.author: Sarah Motherwell

14/09/2021.headline: Federal Court judge orders minister to explain 'sudden' $21m Beetaloo Basin fracking grant agreement
14/09/2021.description: A Federal Court judge says he is "concerned" by Federal Resources and Water Minister Keith Pitt's handling of a $21 million grant agreement with a gas company eyeing the Northern Territory's Beetaloo Basin.
14/09/2021.author: Kate Ashton

14/09/2021.headline: Farmer escapes strawberry jam by making 25,000 jars of strawberry jam
14/09/2021.description: With no-one around to do the plucking on his pick-your-own farm, Anthony Sarks's crop looked bound for the back paddock. But he simply couldn't bring himself to waste the fruit.
14/09/2021.author: Keely Johnson

14/09/2021.headline: Albanese tells dumped Labor candidate not to be discouraged by Keneally seat swap
14/09/2021.description: Labor hopeful Tu Le is told not to be deterred from politics, after her candidacy was derailed by senior Labor figure Kristina Keneally being parachuted into her electorate.
14/09/2021.author: Nour Haydar

14/09/2021.headline: Political inquiry warns abuse of female journalists on social media poses threat to democracy
14/09/2021.description: Social media giants must do more to eliminate fake accounts and political parties must establish an online code of conduct, a multi-party Victorian parliamentary inquiry recommends, warning harassment of journalists represents a threat to democratic elections.
14/09/2021.author: Richard Willingham

14/09/2021.headline: Body modifier with no medical qualifications was 'very convincing' before woman ended up in hospital, court told
14/09/2021.description: A woman who had a procedure performed by body modifier Brendan Russell tells a Sydney court she felt she was in "really good hands" and doesn't recall being informed of all the associated risks.
14/09/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

14/09/2021.headline: Battery discovery could propel EVs from Sydney to Melbourne on one charge
14/09/2021.description: Australian researchers say they've opened the path to a new generation of batteries that could allow an electric vehicle to drive from Melbourne to Sydney on a single charge.
14/09/2021.author: James Purtill

14/09/2021.headline: Israeli boy orphaned by Italian cable car crash allegedly kidnapped amid custody battle
14/09/2021.description: Italian relatives of six-year-old Eitan Biran, who was the sole survivor of a cable car crash earlier this year, allege he has been taken to Israel by his grandfather without their permission.
14/09/2021.author: James Purtill

14/09/2021.headline: 'Her victory takes her way beyond tennis and sport': Raducanu tipped for earnings windfall
14/09/2021.description: Emma Raducanu is an instant millionaire after her stunning US Open win, but her rapid emergence, youth and background are all leading sports marketers to predict much bigger off-court earnings.
14/09/2021.author: James Purtill

14/09/2021.headline: How are we going to get to 80 per cent vaccinated? Here's what some experts think
14/09/2021.description: Health authorities say getting an extra 10 per cent of people on board to reach 80 per cent vaccination rates is going to be a challenge. This is what experts think will help.
14/09/2021.author: Claudia Long

14/09/2021.headline: British diplomat draws attention to removal of Chinese mosque minarets
14/09/2021.description: Changes to the nation's mosques come amid an ongoing crackdown on Muslims and other faith communities under the ruling Chinese Communist Party's "Sinicisation" of religion.
14/09/2021.author: Dong Xing and Max Walden

14/09/2021.headline: We’re back to record property price growth, so what’s being done about it?
14/09/2021.description: Officials from Treasury and the Reserve Bank front a parliamentary committee to wrestle with what is driving record property price growth and what can be done about it.
14/09/2021.author: David Taylor

14/09/2021.headline: Inside inner-city Sydney's latest COVID-19 battleground
14/09/2021.description: The inner-city Sydney suburbs of Glebe, Redfern and Waterloo have been flagged as new areas of concern — and all have high populations of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander residents.
14/09/2021.author: Nakari Thorpe

14/09/2021.headline: First dose COVID vaccination rates in inner Darwin and Palmerston jump by 10 per cent in two weeks, new data shows
14/09/2021.description: New Australian government data shows first dose COVID-19 vaccination rates have shot past 90 per cent in Darwin's CBD and inner suburbs, but rates are still progressing at a crawl in some remote parts of the NT.
14/09/2021.author: Kate Ashton

14/09/2021.headline: Dozens of 'liquid gold' vaccine appointments vacant at Queensland Health hubs
14/09/2021.description: Data finds dozens of appointments at Queensland Health vaccination hubs and clinics are still vacant the day before, despite the push to increase the state's slow inoculation rates.
14/09/2021.author: Brittney Kleyn

14/09/2021.headline: For you, this house may cost $500k. For Habib, it's $546,000
14/09/2021.description: Buying a house in Hobart right now is hard. For Habib ur Rehman, it's even worse. That's because migrants face an 8 per cent surcharge on the cost of a home.
14/09/2021.author: Sarah Jane Bell

14/09/2021.headline: A sixth of NSW Health staff 'completely unvaccinated'
14/09/2021.description: One in six NSW Health staff are yet to have their first COVID-19 jab, despite a looming mandatory vaccination deadline, according to documents submitted to state Parliament.
14/09/2021.author: Kathleen Calderwood

14/09/2021.headline: Booker Prize shortlist: Americans dominate, one author makes history
14/09/2021.description: Nadifa Mohamed is the first British-Somali author to be shortlisted for the Booker Prize, joining a Pulitzer Prize winner and a first-time novelist, while big name authors Kazuo Ishiguro and Rachel Cusk miss out.
14/09/2021.author: Dee Jefferson

14/09/2021.headline: Will everyone need a COVID booster shot? Here's what we do (and don't) know
14/09/2021.description: There's still a lot to learn about COVID-19 booster vaccines. And then there's the billions of people globally who haven't received their first jab.
14/09/2021.author: Olivia Willis

14/09/2021.headline: Last year we were all in it together. This year COVID demands an agonising choice
14/09/2021.description: Economics is called the dismal science in part because it is about hard choices — situations where we can't have our cake and eat it too. We're about to see a lot more of them when it comes to COVID, writes Peter Martin
14/09/2021.author: Olivia Willis

14/09/2021.headline: Online activity during COVID lockdowns sees surge in cyber attacks
14/09/2021.description: A cybercrime is now reported every eight minutes in Australia with criminals and spies taking advantage of large numbers of people working from home during COVID-19 lockdowns.
14/09/2021.author: Andrew Greene

14/09/2021.headline: Stranded Adelaide couple plead for health authorities to let them come home
14/09/2021.description: A young Adelaide couple stranded in Broken Hill are pleading for SA Health to let them cross the border after their camping trip took a turn for the worse.
14/09/2021.author: Isabel Dayman and Rebecca Opie

14/09/2021.headline: Trent Cotchin steps down as Richmond captain
14/09/2021.description: Cotchin will play on in 2022 but is handing over the reins following a decorated stint as Tigers captain, which includes three premierships.
14/09/2021.author: Isabel Dayman and Rebecca Opie

14/09/2021.headline: Roosters hit with finals blow as Sam Verrills receives two-match suspension
14/09/2021.description: Sam Verrills will only play again this season if the Sydney Roosters qualify for the NRL grand final, after the judiciary upholds his grade-two careless high tackle charge.
14/09/2021.author: Isabel Dayman and Rebecca Opie

14/09/2021.headline: The new freedoms given to NSW aged care facilities and why some may not use them
14/09/2021.description: After suffering through nearly 12 weeks of another strict set of COVID-19 lockdown orders, some freedoms are being returned to aged care residents in NSW.
14/09/2021.author: Tony Ibrahim

14/09/2021.headline: Inquiry shown video of 'extreme' bushfire tornado that flipped a fire truck, killing volunteer Samuel McPaul
14/09/2021.description: An inquiry hears how a fire tornado sucked smoke and flames six kilometres into the air into a whirling ball, created winds of more than 320 kilometres an hour and flipped a 10-tonne fire truck.
14/09/2021.author: Jessica Clifford

14/09/2021.headline: Rare raptors hatch but others fall prey to a fox in overnight raid
14/09/2021.description: Cameras show the vagaries of life for rare osprey chicks with two hatching successfully while two others are snatched by a fox.
14/09/2021.author: Jodie Hamilton and Emma Pedler

14/09/2021.headline: Rabbitohs brimming with confidence as they eye off first premiership in seven years
14/09/2021.description: The Rabbitohs, who are one win away from advancing to the grand final, feel they have the self-belief to claim the NRL premiership after beating the Panthers in the opening week of the play-offs.
14/09/2021.author: Chloe Hart

14/09/2021.headline: It takes a village: Ungarie community turns town hall into post office after death of local postmaster
14/09/2021.description: Residents in a regional NSW town take on the postal run after the death of the much-loved local postmaster.
14/09/2021.author: Melinda Hayter and Sally Bryant

14/09/2021.headline: 'They've cruelled this town': Border businesses say support package 'too late' to save some
14/09/2021.description: Despite fresh funding support for struggling businesses on the southern Gold Coast, many people fear it might be too late for some traders.
14/09/2021.author: Cathy Border, Alexandria Utting, and Tara Cassidy

14/09/2021.headline: AFL greats named to present premiership cup to winning team on grand final day
14/09/2021.description: Garry Lyon will hand over the cup to the Demons if they win the grand final in Perth, while Chris Grant will have the honour if the Bulldogs win the season decider.
14/09/2021.author: Cathy Border, Alexandria Utting, and Tara Cassidy

15/09/2021.headline: In pictures: How the world's sporting stars stole the spotlight at the Met Gala
15/09/2021.description: They may have been sporting some unfamiliar gear, but some of the world's top athletes were rubbing shoulders with the sartorial elite at one of the most extravagant events on the celebrity calendar.
15/09/2021.author: Tanisha Stanton

15/09/2021.headline: Snow industry on brink of collapse after second winter without trade
15/09/2021.description: Industry experts and retailers are concerned Australia's snow industry may not make it through to next year without significant aid from the state and federal governments, following a second winter without trade.
15/09/2021.author: Breanna Holden

15/09/2021.headline: 'Fire, explosions, rockfalls are recurring — why?': Mine safety expert warns against complacency
15/09/2021.description: There have been nine people killed in Queensland mining incidents since July 2018. Mine safety expert professor David Cliff says managing risks in the industry is complex.
15/09/2021.author: Erin Semmler

15/09/2021.headline: Disability carer's assaults only uncovered because father checked security vision on phone
15/09/2021.description: The family of a man with a disability who was assaulted by his carer said it took him six months to smile again after the incident, which was captured on home security footage.
15/09/2021.author: Matthew Smith

15/09/2021.headline: Star jockey Jamie Kah facing longer ban after misleading stewards about COVID breach
15/09/2021.description: Kah may be banned for up to five months after being found guilty of "wilfully" omitting details about a much-publicised gathering in Mornington, which was a breach of Victoria's lockdown protocols.
15/09/2021.author: Matthew Smith

15/09/2021.headline: SA teacher cries as she apologises for grooming high school student for sex
15/09/2021.description: Renee Underwood fronts the District Court charged with making a child amenable to sexual activity after earlier pleading guilty to the crime.
15/09/2021.author: Sarah Mullins

15/09/2021.headline: Two teen survivors of Launceston nurse sue health system
15/09/2021.description: Two teenage girls who were allegedly groomed and sexually abused by James Geoffrey Griffin sue the Tasmanian Health Service for failing to investigate the numerous complaints against him.
15/09/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

15/09/2021.headline: Third Big Bird bandit appears in court, bail curfew varied to allow work in hotel
15/09/2021.description: The third 'Big Bird bandit' appears in an Adelaide court over the theft of a $160,000 Big Bird costume.
15/09/2021.author: Matthew Smith

15/09/2021.headline: Brisbane school students tested for COVID-19 after allegedly mixing with locked-down teenagers
15/09/2021.description: Four students from Runcorn State High School and their families are isolating in the wake of the students allegedly mixing with locked-down teenagers from Sunnybank's St Thomas More College during a house party.
15/09/2021.author: Matthew Smith

15/09/2021.headline: Curtin University lobbies for retraction of unethical AI study on Uyghur facial recognition
15/09/2021.description: An Australian university implicated in unethical research using facial recognition technology to identify Uyghur and Tibetan minorities unsuccessfully lobbies for it to be retracted by publishers on multiple attempts.
15/09/2021.author: Henry Belot

15/09/2021.headline: A dispute over $30 fuels axe assault on grandmother, court hears
15/09/2021.description: A 30-year-old man, who threatened a woman at a Mount Gambier park with a tomahawk axe over a $30 dispute, has received a six-month suspended sentence.
15/09/2021.author: Grace Whiteside

15/09/2021.headline: Gold medalist Ariarne Titmus receives superstar reception on hometown visit
15/09/2021.description: Olympic medalist Ariarne Titmus returns to Launceston to inspire the next generation of elite swimmers.
15/09/2021.author: Damian McIntyre

15/09/2021.headline: What happened to Gulf Livestock 1? Questions remain unanswered a year on from sunken live export ship
15/09/2021.description: It has been 12 months since a live export ship sank off the Japanese coast, but a number of details about the tragedy remain a mystery.
15/09/2021.author: Matt Brann

15/09/2021.headline: 'He pushed me': Aged care resident identified alleged killer before death, court hears
15/09/2021.description: A Canberra man accused of pushing a fellow nursing home resident, who broke her hip and later died from complications, stands trial in the ACT Supreme Court after pleading not guilty to manslaughter.
15/09/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

15/09/2021.headline: 'I've never seen such a tight margin': Just two votes decide Alice Springs Mayor
15/09/2021.description: The Northern Territory Electoral Commissioner says he has never seen such a narrow result for such a high profile position, after the Alice Springs mayoral race was won by just two votes.
15/09/2021.author: Stewart Brash, Mitchell Abram, and Emma Haskin

15/09/2021.headline: Port Adelaide confirms interest in want-away Swan, open to move for GWS forward Jeremy Finlayson
15/09/2021.description: Port Adelaide confirms it has interest in want-away Swan Jordan Dawson, as pressure continues to grow on head coach Ken Hinkley.
15/09/2021.author: Camron Slessor

15/09/2021.headline: Mark McGowan's warning that SA 'may regret' border reopening prompts rebuke from Steven Marshall
15/09/2021.description: SA Premier Steven Marshall's decision to reopen borders to the eastern states once vaccination targets are reached could see the state's western border slammed shut, WA Premier Mark McGowan warns.
15/09/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin

15/09/2021.headline: Endangered fly with 'legs for days' named after drag queen RuPaul
15/09/2021.description: A luminous, long-legged soldier fly called Opaluma RuPaul is one of 150 new species named by the CSIRO in the past year.
15/09/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin

15/09/2021.headline: Fugitive on run for 30 years hands himself into police because life will be 'much easier' in prison
15/09/2021.description: Darko Desic, who broke out of Grafton jail 30 years ago, decides life will be "much easier" if he is behind bars again after the pandemic stripped him of work and left him homeless.
15/09/2021.author: Mark Reddie

15/09/2021.headline: 18yo man granted bail over alleged 'severe' group attack involving metal bat that left boy on life support
15/09/2021.description: The court was told police received an audio recording from the elevator in the building, which allegedly depicts the group "celebrating" after the alleged assault and referring to the child as "dead".
15/09/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

15/09/2021.headline: Mice breeding fast for another plague after short winter respite
15/09/2021.description: Experts have significant concerns about the plague exploding again with mouse numbers reported in Queensland, NSW, Victoria and WA.
15/09/2021.author: Lucy Thackray and Lucy Robinson

15/09/2021.headline: Stoush brewing after regions abolished in planned overhaul of WA's 'broken' electoral system
15/09/2021.description: The McGowan Government endorses new rules which critics say will diminish the voice of the regions in State Parliament.
15/09/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine and Jacob Kagi

15/09/2021.headline: Man dead after three-vehicle crash on Barton Highway
15/09/2021.description: Police confirm a man has died after a multi-vehicle collision on the Barton Highway in Canberra earlier today.
15/09/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine and Jacob Kagi

15/09/2021.headline: California's recall election results are in: Newsom stays
15/09/2021.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom defeats an attempt to remove him from office, a move coming from disapproval of his pandemic policies.
15/09/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine and Jacob Kagi

15/09/2021.headline: COVID-19 blamed for design delays on army's troubled $5b Boxer vehicles
15/09/2021.description: After first denying its largest-ever weapons project had a problem, Defence now says its Boxer fleet faces a 12-month delay.
15/09/2021.author: Andrew Greene

15/09/2021.headline: It's official — the flu did 'basically disappear' this year
15/09/2021.description: Before COVID-19 arrived, the number of influenza cases was soaring above 300,000. This year, there were less than 500.
15/09/2021.author: Melanie Vujkovic

15/09/2021.headline: Alfred Hospital, Ballarat building sites among latest on COVID-19 exposure list
15/09/2021.description: New tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites have been identified at The Alfred Hospital and building sites in Ballarat suburbs.
15/09/2021.author: Melanie Vujkovic

15/09/2021.headline: He's saved over 60,000 lives. Some want to stop him
15/09/2021.description: Oscar Camps was a lifeguard on the calm beaches of Barcelona. Then in a single day he saved more lives than in an entire career.
15/09/2021.author: Eric Campbell and Matt Henry

15/09/2021.headline: Former disability carer fined $15,000 over incident that left man with life-threatening injuries
15/09/2021.description: A former disability carer has been fined for breaching workplace health and safety laws over an incident that left a man with injuries that almost killed him.
15/09/2021.author: Michael Atkin

15/09/2021.headline: Children under 12 share their concerns as Australia attempts to open up without them vaccinated
15/09/2021.description: Australia's COVID-19 vaccination rollout is now in its next phase with 12 to 15-year-olds eligible for Pfizer, but younger children say they are worried they are not safe.
15/09/2021.author: Michael Atkin

15/09/2021.headline: Why Sydney's COVID-19 lockdown could end a week early for fully vaccinated people
15/09/2021.description: An ABC analysis shows NSW could reach its target of fully vaccinating 70 per cent of its population aged 16 and above as early as October 8 — something that would see its COVID-19 lockdown lifted a week ahead of schedule.
15/09/2021.author: Michael Atkin

15/09/2021.headline: With just two ways to flee Afghanistan, this is what it's like at one exit
15/09/2021.description: With the Taliban's flag flying over Afghanistan once again, there are only a handful of ways to slip out of the country. Those who make the treacherous journey to Torkham on the border must talk their way into Pakistan.
15/09/2021.author: Tom Joyner

15/09/2021.headline: As Australia burned, the oceans bloomed with algae feeding on the ashes
15/09/2021.description: Iron-rich ash and smoke from the Black Summer bushfires dropped from the atmosphere into the Southern Ocean, fuelling enormous blooms of algae between New Zealand and South America.
15/09/2021.author: Belinda Smith

15/09/2021.headline: Porter's 'blind trust' leaves more questions for Morrison to answer
15/09/2021.description: Porter's "disclosure" has raised far more questions than it has answered. It's created all-new political problems for the Morrison Government too, writes David Speers.
15/09/2021.author: David Speers

15/09/2021.headline: The stories of Australia's unemployment crisis: 'I noticed a decline the minute I turned 50'
15/09/2021.description: Finding work after being made redundant can already be a soul-destroying process — but it becomes crippling when you're facing further hurdles outside your control.
15/09/2021.author: David Taylor

15/09/2021.headline: Would you take a pay cut to keep working from home?
15/09/2021.description: Working from home is here to stay long after the COVID-19 pandemic, according to the federal government's key economic adviser, with a new report suggesting some people might even take a pay cut to remain in their home office.
15/09/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell and Peter Ryan

15/09/2021.headline: Australia to get nuclear-powered submarines, scrap $90b plan to build French-designed subs
15/09/2021.description: The ABC understands Australia will use American and British technology to configure its next submarine fleet in a bid to replace its existing Collins class subs with a boat more suitable to the deteriorating strategic environment.
15/09/2021.author: Andrew Probyn, Stephen Dziedzic, and Andrew Greene

15/09/2021.headline: These foreign-owned retailers received millions in JobKeeper and doubled their profits
15/09/2021.description: Two of Australia's most recognisable retailers doubled their profits after claiming JobKeeper, new figures reveal.
15/09/2021.author: Dan Conifer

15/09/2021.headline: Judge awards parents $125k for birth of seventh child after failed sterilisation procedure
15/09/2021.description: A WA woman who gave birth to her seventh child after a failed sterilisation procedure is awarded $125,000, which includes less than $90,000 for raising the boy.
15/09/2021.author: Briana Shepherd

15/09/2021.headline: TGA threatens Craig Kelly with legal action over 'seriously misleading' COVID texts
15/09/2021.description: The nation's medical regulator demands rogue crossbencher Craig Kelly stop distributing "seriously misleading" information about COVID-19 vaccines.
15/09/2021.author: Jane Norman

15/09/2021.headline: Property value evidence thrown out in windfarm court battle
15/09/2021.description: Two men are seeking damages from the Bald Hills Wind Farm in Victoria's south-east, claiming it has affected land prices while turbine noise is also a nuisance.
15/09/2021.author: Emma Field

15/09/2021.headline: Growing dissatisfaction with federal politics sees Coalition seats under threat from independents
15/09/2021.description: The next federal election is set to see a new wave of independents fight for safe Coalition seats, as discontent with the major political parties grows.
15/09/2021.author: Emma Field

15/09/2021.headline: WA's South West lives up to its 'seismically active' reputation
15/09/2021.description: Scientists have recorded more than 1,100 earthquakes in Western Australia's South West over a recent eight-month period.
15/09/2021.author: Madina Jaffari

15/09/2021.headline: Inmates sue NT government and Correctional Services over treatment after Darwin prison riot
15/09/2021.description: Two prisoners allegedly involved in a riot at the Darwin Correctional Centre last year commence legal action, claiming they were subjected to assault, battery and false imprisonment in the aftermath.
15/09/2021.author: Melissa Mackay

15/09/2021.headline: Shepparton locals share a message of hope as Ballarat prepares to re-enter lockdown
15/09/2021.description: For weeks, it's been quiet on the streets of Shepparton, but now that's about to change – much to the relief of its residents.
15/09/2021.author: Ellen Coulter and Kirsten Robb

15/09/2021.headline: Can the Wallabies win consecutive Tests for the first time in two seasons?
15/09/2021.description: The Wallabies took on the physical Springboks and won last weekend on the Gold Coast. The challenge this Saturday is to do something they’re yet to achieve under coach Dave Rennie — win back-to-back Test matches, writes Brett McKay.
15/09/2021.author: Brett McKay

15/09/2021.headline: BOM says La Niña's now an even chance to reign again this summer
15/09/2021.description: It's looking like a cool, wet summer — again — for much of the country with a good chance of the return of La Niña, amid other key indicators, say forecasters.
15/09/2021.author: Kate Doyle

16/09/2021.headline: Ex-partner of former minister Adam Brooks gets extension of interim family violence order
16/09/2021.description: Adam Brooks' ex-partner has been granted an extension of an interim family violence order against him. In court, the woman alleged the former politician stalked and harassed her and entered her home without permission.
16/09/2021.author: Emily Baker

16/09/2021.headline: Drivers are challenging Victoria's electric vehicle tax, arguing it may be unconstitutional
16/09/2021.description: Electric vehicle owners are taking action in the High Court against a levy introduced by the Victorian government.
16/09/2021.author: Margaret Paul

16/09/2021.headline: Roosters put faith in rookie hooker for NRL semi-final clash with Sea Eagles
16/09/2021.description: Sydney Roosters coach Trent Robinson backs reserve grade hooker Ben Marschke to be up to the task in Friday night's semi-final.
16/09/2021.author: Margaret Paul

16/09/2021.headline: Northern Australia Minister David Littleproud criticises NT's stage 3 roadmap
16/09/2021.description: Federal Northern Australia Minister David Littleproud says the Northern Territory government's decision to launch its own stage 3 COVID roadmap adds to inconsistency across the country.
16/09/2021.author: Samantha Dick

16/09/2021.headline: Memory lapse or new nickname? Joe Biden calls Scott Morrison 'that fella Down Under'
16/09/2021.description: It might have been an awkward fumble or just a term of endearment, but having Joe Biden give Scott Morrison a new name is not the most embarrassing thing that's happened to an Australian leader in the US.
16/09/2021.author: Rebecca Armitage

16/09/2021.headline: 'When a vet tells me to vaccinate a horse, I vaccinate a horse': Victorian racing industry to mandate COVID-19 vaccine for staff
16/09/2021.description: Horse racing spectators are not yet required to be vaccinated to attend races despite an industry-wide mandate to all staff to be vaccinated by the end of November.
16/09/2021.author: Emma Field, Shannon Schubert, and Kimberley Price

16/09/2021.headline: Immigration Minister to issue further bridging visas to Biloela Tamil family
16/09/2021.description: An Australian government barrister says the Immigration Minister intends to issue further three-month bridging visas to Priya, Nades, and Kopika Muruguppan next Thursday.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Semmler

16/09/2021.headline: Taiwan plans $11 billion boost in defence spending as it warns of 'severe threat' from China
16/09/2021.description: Taiwan's government is proposing extra defence spending over the next five years, warning of an urgent need to upgrade the nation's weapons in the face of a "severe threat" from neighbouring China.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Semmler

16/09/2021.headline: Targa rally report into triple fatality calls for speeds to be reined in to avoid 'further deaths'
16/09/2021.description: A report into three deaths during the Targa Tasmania rally earlier this year makes recommendations including dramatic changes to the route and warns the cost of the race will rise significantly.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Semmler

16/09/2021.headline: How Victoria's COVID restrictions will change this weekend
16/09/2021.description: There are slight changes to COVID restrictions for Victorians on the way. Here are the changes coming into effect from 11:59pm Friday.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Semmler

16/09/2021.headline: Former sex worker choked and threatened to kill MP after long-term relationship, court told
16/09/2021.description: A former Perth sex worker allegedly choked and threatened to kill an ex-politician with whom she had a long term relationship, a Perth court is told.
16/09/2021.author: Joanna Menagh and Rebecca Trigger

16/09/2021.headline: Morrison has gone nuclear — and there's no turning back
16/09/2021.description: The geostrategic wrestle between Washington and Beijing is one for the ages and Australia is now to play an even bigger role — in a stealthier and speedier bit of nuclear kit, writes Andrew Probyn.
16/09/2021.author: Andrew Probyn

16/09/2021.headline: Doctor in jail on attempted murder charges banned from practising medicine for the rest of his life
16/09/2021.description: A doctor who is serving a prison sentence for the attempted murder of a pharmacist has been banned from practising for the rest of his life, in the longest sanction ever imposed in Australia.
16/09/2021.author: Mahalia Carter

16/09/2021.headline: Murray border communities plead to be treated as one
16/09/2021.description: State governments have promised throughout the pandemic that border communities will be treated as one, but few people are feeling that it has been honoured.
16/09/2021.author: Mahalia Carter

16/09/2021.headline: Sly-grog laws unveiled to target illegal liquor trade in WA
16/09/2021.description: From this weekend, police will have right to seize and destroy alcohol carried in cars in Western Australia's north.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Parke and Ted O'Connor

16/09/2021.headline: Brad Scott out of the running to be Carlton head coach after taking up key AFL role
16/09/2021.description: The former North Melbourne mentor, who had been linked to the vacant Blues coaching position, takes a job in the AFL's football operations department.
16/09/2021.author: Erin Parke and Ted O'Connor

16/09/2021.headline: Police charge 15 men over 'large consensual fight' with clubs and swords in suburban Brisbane street
16/09/2021.description: Police say the men are aged between 29 and 36 and have been taken into custody and charged with affray. Several men are also facing more serious charges.
16/09/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

16/09/2021.headline: Alanis Morissette hits out at 'salacious' documentary about her life
16/09/2021.description: Alanis Morissette calls the HBO documentary Jagged, which she participated in, "reductive" and "salacious" just hours before the film's premiere at a film festival.
16/09/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

16/09/2021.headline: Mayor's 'genocide' comparison slammed as 'disgusting' by Deputy Premier
16/09/2021.description: John Barilaro has criticised the Broken Hill mayor Darriea Turley after she equated inadequate COVID planning as "tantamount to a genocide".
16/09/2021.author: Bill Ormonde, Callum Marshall, and Bension Siebert

16/09/2021.headline: They're silent and stealthy, but not always nimble. Why does Australia want nuclear submarines?
16/09/2021.description: Australia has announced a plan to make the Navy's next submarine fleet nuclear-powered. So what's so special about these subs — and why are we doing this?
16/09/2021.author: Henry Belot

16/09/2021.headline: Last tickets sell out within minutes for Perth AFL grand final amid fears over stadium staffing
16/09/2021.description: The final tickets to the first-ever Perth AFL grand final sell out within minutes, as the venue puts out an urgent call for 600 extra workers to cope with the capacity crowd.
16/09/2021.author: Tom Wildie

16/09/2021.headline: The grave of women's rights activist Jessie Rooke was lying in disrepair, then Harvey came along
16/09/2021.description: Harvey Jones has been restoring graves along Tasmania's north-west coast for the past 15 years, his latest project has been to bring new life to the headstone of women's rights activist Jessie Rooke.
16/09/2021.author: Jessica Moran

16/09/2021.headline: 16yo critical after 9m fall from Gold Coast balcony
16/09/2021.description: The 16-year-old's friends carried him back up two flights of stairs and paramedics weren't called for 45 minutes, by a stranger.
16/09/2021.author: Heidi Sheehan and Tara Cassidy

16/09/2021.headline: Remembering Australia's 'audacious' first scheduled air service 100 years on
16/09/2021.description: A century after Sir Norman Brearley led the first scheduled air service, bringing a lifeline to some of the most remote and rugged parts of the country, his feat is being celebrated.
16/09/2021.author: Samille Mitchell

16/09/2021.headline: Opening WBBL games move to Tasmania
16/09/2021.description: Cricket Australia announces the first fortnight of the Women's Big Bash League will be played in Tasmania due to mainland COVID-19 outbreaks.
16/09/2021.author: Samille Mitchell

16/09/2021.headline: How an awkward conversation over Christmas lunch unlocked a family's dark colonial legacy
16/09/2021.description: In a search for answers about his family history, Sam Carmody hears stories so disturbing that they have implications for an entire region, where his ancestors have a statue, a highway and even a town named after them.
16/09/2021.author: Samuel Carmody, Anthony Pancia, and Daniel Franklin

16/09/2021.headline: How voluntary assisted dying will work in Queensland
16/09/2021.description: Queensland's Parliament has just legalised voluntary assisted dying. Who is eligible, who can opt out and how does the law protect them? Here are the facts as set down by the legislation.
16/09/2021.author: Kate McKenna

16/09/2021.headline: COVID going undetected in NSW border zone because of home septic tanks
16/09/2021.description: Thousands of residents in the New South Wales border zone are not being monitored via sewage testing for COVID-19 infections due to their use of home septic tank systems.
16/09/2021.author: Rory Callinan

16/09/2021.headline: Nuclear sub deal sees Australia 'strategically naked' for 20 years
16/09/2021.description: Former prime ministers on both sides of politics are calling for a rapid acceleration in the building of a fleet of nuclear-powered submarines, with claims Australia will otherwise be left "strategically naked" for the next two decades.
16/09/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

16/09/2021.headline: Friday News Quiz: Do you remember all the headlines from earlier this week?
16/09/2021.description: Will you be proud of your score this week or will it make you want to hide your face like a certain Met Gala guest? Test yourself.
16/09/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

16/09/2021.headline: Hundreds of Australians stuck in New Zealand as National Cabinet examines home quarantine for overseas arrivals
16/09/2021.description: As more than 400 Australians wait to return home, National Cabinet looks to home quarantine for a solution.
16/09/2021.author: Jade Macmillan

16/09/2021.headline: For the first time, AFL Grand Final contested by two clubs with female presidents
16/09/2021.description: On September 25, either Melbourne or the Western Bulldogs will become the second club with a female president to win a flag.
16/09/2021.author: Georgie Tunny

16/09/2021.headline: International students work on COVID-19 frontline. Is it exploitation?
16/09/2021.description: The federal government has lifted working caps for international students in "essential sectors" during the pandemic, but some students and advocates say the change is exploitative.
16/09/2021.author: Georgie Tunny

16/09/2021.headline: As Victoria's months ahead come into focus, these issues could be game changers
16/09/2021.description: Employers' liability in the event of a worker's COVID-19 death and the chance of hospitality venues opening in time for the AFL grand final are some of the issues Victorian residents are businesses are the state's roadmap will provide clarity on.
16/09/2021.author: Richard Willingham

16/09/2021.headline: US raises concerns about China's economic coercion of Australia
16/09/2021.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken raises concerns about China's use of economic coercion against Australia.
16/09/2021.author: Richard Willingham

16/09/2021.headline: 'I never really understood the danger I was in': Rosie Batty joins new campaign to prevent coercive control
16/09/2021.description: Former Australian of the Year Rosie Batty is joining a coalition of family violence organisations and advocates calling for prevention to be at the heart of national solutions to coercive control — regardless of whether or not it is criminalised.
16/09/2021.author: Hayley Gleeson

16/09/2021.headline: 'Crikey!': Schoolkids' fossil find turns out to be new species of giant penguin
16/09/2021.description: A fossil collected by school children in 2006 on the west coast of New Zealand's North Island is a new species of extinct giant penguin that lived around 30 million years ago.
16/09/2021.author: Genelle Weule

16/09/2021.headline: From the seas to space, China is ramping up its military might — and Australia's position is now clear
16/09/2021.description: The announcement of a historic partnership between Australia, the UK, and the US to share nuclear submarines is likely to draw the ire of China. But are we ready for a showdown, asks Stan Grant.
16/09/2021.author: Stan Grant

16/09/2021.headline: 'A stab in the back': French anger with Australia over cancelled submarine deal
16/09/2021.description: France's Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian lashes out at Australia's decision to cancel a $90 billion submarine deal, saying that "trust has been broken".
16/09/2021.author: Jack Hawke

16/09/2021.headline: 'This intensifies the arms race': China slams AUKUS pact as Abbott warns China is a 'common danger'
16/09/2021.description: China's foreign ministry hits out at the AUKUS pact for nuclear submarines as a threat to regional peace, while former Australian PM Tony Abbott says it is the 'biggest decision' made by an Australian government in decades.
16/09/2021.author: Jack Hawke

16/09/2021.headline: Four arrested at Sydney cemetery amid calls for more compassionate approach to funerals
16/09/2021.description: Mourners at Rookwood Cemetery say they were treated unfairly and would like to see some exemptions surrounding funerals for communities in hard-hit Western Sydney after police were called over breaches to health orders.
16/09/2021.author: Kathleen Calderwood

16/09/2021.headline: Social media videos spark Illegal hunting charges
16/09/2021.description: Wagga Wagga man charged with illegal hunting offences after probe is sparked by videos posted on social media.
16/09/2021.author: Isadora Bogle

16/09/2021.headline: Northern Territory Police investigating Tiwi Island death
16/09/2021.description: A team of detectives travel to the remote Aboriginal community,  about 80 kilometres north of Darwin, to investigate the death of a 32-year-old man.
16/09/2021.author: Isadora Bogle

16/09/2021.headline: An Indigenous prisoner and sexual assault victim had her human rights breached during strip search, review finds
16/09/2021.description: A review into an incident at Canberra's jail where an Indigenous woman was forcibly strip-searched has found that she had her human rights violated.
16/09/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

16/09/2021.headline: Rocket catches fire during latest lift-off attempt on SA's Eyre Peninsula
16/09/2021.description: An anticipated rocket launch on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula has again been delayed after the rocket caught fire — but the company involved says the blaze was contained to the launch pad.
16/09/2021.author: Evelyn Leckie and Stacey Pestrin

16/09/2021.headline: Wondering why people are talking about nuclear submarines? Here are the basics
16/09/2021.description: Are you wondering why there's so much fuss about Australia's decision to acquire nuclear submarines? Here's what you need to know.
16/09/2021.author: Evelyn Leckie and Stacey Pestrin

16/09/2021.headline: French forces kill IS Sahel jihadist leader wanted by US
16/09/2021.description: The head of Islamic State in the Greater Sahara, who was wanted for deadly attacks on US soldiers and foreign aid workers, is killed in an operation by French troops.
16/09/2021.author: Evelyn Leckie and Stacey Pestrin

16/09/2021.headline: Susanne lives in the shadow of SA's naval hub, and is nervous about nuclear subs being made nearby
16/09/2021.description: Residents on Adelaide's Lefevre Peninsula — home to the nation's naval construction hub — have mixed feelings about the federal government's new nuclear submarine deal.
16/09/2021.author: Stacey Pestrin and Gabriella Marchant

16/09/2021.headline: Shayna Jack free to return to swimming after CAS dismisses appeal
16/09/2021.description: Jack can return to competitive swimming immediately, as the Court of Arbitration for Sport dismisses the appeal lodged by the World Anti-Doping Agency and Sport Integrity Australia.
16/09/2021.author: Tracey Holmes

17/09/2021.headline: 'Get on your knees': Inquiry told female mine worker allegedly propositioned for sex at Rio, FMG
17/09/2021.description: Astacia Stevens alleges men on several mine sites asked her for sexual favours in exchange for career advancement. She declined, is on maternity leave and is scared to go back.
17/09/2021.author: Eliza Borrello and Eliza Laschon

17/09/2021.headline: Private school teacher charged with child exploitation offences
17/09/2021.description: Police charge a Sunshine Coast man after spending nine months combing through his electronic devices.
17/09/2021.author: Jacqui Street and Jake Kearnan

17/09/2021.headline: Let's talk about the final season of Brooklyn Nine-Nine
17/09/2021.description: The writers leaned into the headlines about police brutality and institutional racism while trying to maintain the light-hearted spirit.
17/09/2021.author: Paul Donoughue

17/09/2021.headline: Nuclear subs have 'long history of accidents', environmentalist warns
17/09/2021.description: Environmentalists are concerned by the public safety implications of Australia developing nuclear-powered submarines — but the retired naval officer who chaired SA's nuclear royal commission says the risks can be managed.
17/09/2021.author: Daniel Keane

17/09/2021.headline: 'Gross breach of trust': Judge jails travel agent who stole to fuel pokies habit
17/09/2021.description: A pokies-addicted travel agent is jailed for pilfering refunds from travellers who cancelled their holidays because of the coronavirus pandemic.
17/09/2021.author: Danny Tran

17/09/2021.headline: 'Nobody should be forced to have a vaccine': Paramedic's legal challenge
17/09/2021.description: A NSW paramedic's Supreme Court challenge to a COVID vaccine mandate may not be heard before it's due to take effect.
17/09/2021.author: Isadora Bogle and Emily Doak

17/09/2021.headline: Teen jailed over COVID-19 medi-hotel breach in Adelaide
17/09/2021.description: A Sydney teen who tried to leave an Adelaide medi-hotel to get fresh air has been jailed for breaching COVID-19 directions.
17/09/2021.author: Candice Prosser

17/09/2021.headline: Porter's future as Minister increasingly uncertain after decision to accept mystery funds to cover part of his legal bills
17/09/2021.description: Embattled Cabinet Minister Christian Porter's future on the frontbench is looking increasingly uncertain, with the Prime Minister offering no defence of his decision to accept mystery funds to cover his legal bills.
17/09/2021.author: Jane Norman

17/09/2021.headline: 'It's not enough': Drug-affected driver who killed a WA mum, son sentenced to nine years' jail
17/09/2021.description: A WA family is still grieving after a drug-affected truck driver was jailed for causing a late-night crash that killed a young mother, her 10-year-old son and seriously injured her three other children.
17/09/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

17/09/2021.headline: StarTrack truck drivers to strike for 24 hours next week, as Australia Post struggles with record volume of parcels
17/09/2021.description: StarTrack truck drivers are striking for 24 hours next week, claiming standards are being driven down across the industry.
17/09/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

17/09/2021.headline: Taliban thanks world for $1b in aid, says US needs 'to have a big heart'
17/09/2021.description: The country's new government includes some of the United States' most-wanted terrorists, and donors worry about legitimising the hardline Islamist group.
17/09/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

17/09/2021.headline: Man accused of having 'desire to inflict pain and suffering' in massive suburban street brawl granted bail
17/09/2021.description: Court documents alleged the five men charged with grievous bodily harm were "all united against a believed common enemy" and that Maan Singh had "significant emotional involvement".
17/09/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

17/09/2021.headline: After-school appointments offered to students and staff in new plan to boost vaccination in WA schools
17/09/2021.description: A rolling school-based vaccination program will begin in Term 4, making it easier for WA students and staff to get a COVID-19 jab.
17/09/2021.author: Eliza Laschon

17/09/2021.headline: At 101, Virginia Oliver says she has no plans to retire from catching lobsters
17/09/2021.description: The oldest lobster catcher in the US state of Maine says there is no place she would rather be than working on the water.
17/09/2021.author: Eliza Laschon

17/09/2021.headline: This shire in regional WA has backflipped on cash incentives for staff to get vaccinated
17/09/2021.description: The Shire of Manjimup will discuss the incentive program at a council meeting after the decision was met with backlash from the local community.
17/09/2021.author: Eliza Laschon

17/09/2021.headline: South Australia's home quarantine trial expands to overseas travellers
17/09/2021.description: South Australia's home quarantine trial, which uses a facial recognition app, will ramp up next month with up to 250 households to be managed each week.
17/09/2021.author: Sara Garcia

17/09/2021.headline: NSW's rules for returning international travellers will change soon — this is what you need to know
17/09/2021.description: Sydney is taking the first steps to regaining its status as an international city, with plans for some overseas arrivals to skip hotel quarantine for the first time in 18 months.
17/09/2021.author: Maryanne Taouk

17/09/2021.headline: Mexico raffles off safe house where El Chapo escaped from marines
17/09/2021.description: El Chapo escaped through a tunnel hidden beneath the bathtub when Mexican marines surrounded the house in 2014.
17/09/2021.author: Maryanne Taouk

17/09/2021.headline: 'Historic is an understatement': Excitement builds ahead of NRL semi-finals in Mackay
17/09/2021.description: The first of two historic NRL semi-finals will be played tonight in the rugby league-loving north Queensland city.
17/09/2021.author: Tobi Loftus

17/09/2021.headline: Three-day-old baby Zamia could have been saved if homebirth was refused, inquest finds
17/09/2021.description: A baby who died three days after a homebirth on the Gold Coast in 2018 could have been saved had she been born in a hospital, a Queensland Coroner has found.
17/09/2021.author: Kimberley Bernard

17/09/2021.headline: Stephanie's older boyfriend pushed her into 'increasingly demeaning' sex. She didn't know how to say no
17/09/2021.description: Stephanie thought sexual assault was a stranger jumping out from a bush in a park to attack. Then she realised it could be somebody "pushing you and pushing you" until you said yes.
17/09/2021.author: Neelima Choahan

17/09/2021.headline: Adelaide man sentenced over 'vile' abuse of Cambodian children
17/09/2021.description: An Adelaide man who sexually assaulted children in Cambodia has been sentenced to eight years in prison.
17/09/2021.author: Mahalia Carter

17/09/2021.headline: Melbourne Demons keep sick coach Simon Goodwin away from players
17/09/2021.description: Melbourne's grand final preparations hit a hurdle, with coach Simon Goodwin and his assistant Adam Yze falling ill and kept away from training a week out from the big game.
17/09/2021.author: Mahalia Carter

17/09/2021.headline: Australian Wool Innovation preparing to commercialise WoolQ online market platform
17/09/2021.description: The company says it is preparing to commercialise a part of WoolQ, its online wool market platform that woolgrowers have criticised as a waste of industry levy funds.
17/09/2021.author: Luke Wong

17/09/2021.headline: That's the spirit: Winemaker, distiller come together for muscat gin collaboration
17/09/2021.description: A north-east winemaker and distiller are refusing to let regional Victoria's lockdowns dampen their creative mindset.
17/09/2021.author: Annie Brown

17/09/2021.headline: Olympic gold medallist Emilee Cherry forges a new path in coaching
17/09/2021.description: With an Olympic gold medal and 31 caps for Australia, Emilee Cherry felt lost when she retired from playing rugby. Now she's part of a move to bring more female coaches into elite sport.
17/09/2021.author: Daniela Intili

17/09/2021.headline: New to Australia? Here are the culture shocks no-one tells you about
17/09/2021.description: From the lack of homework at school, to ferocious possums — here are six things that shock migrants most about Australia.
17/09/2021.author: Wing Kuang and Prianka Srinivasan

17/09/2021.headline: What impact does the nuclear option have on Australian submarine contractors and jobs?
17/09/2021.description: There are two overwhelming reactions from the local defence industry to this week's announcement that Australia will tear up its contract with Naval Group and build either US or UK designed nuclear submarines instead. One is relief, the other fear.
17/09/2021.author: Michael Janda

17/09/2021.headline: Research discovery suggests AFL pioneer Tom Wills participated in massacres of Indigenous people
17/09/2021.description: Tom Wills was Australia's first great sportsman and helped invent Australian Rules football. But a startling discovery suggests he took part in the mass murder of Aboriginal people.
17/09/2021.author: Russell Jackson

17/09/2021.headline: 'You will face a hefty fine': People told to stay away from central Melbourne ahead of anti-lockdown protest
17/09/2021.description: Public transport is suspended in central Melbourne as police attempt to disrupt planned anti-lockdown protests.
17/09/2021.author: Leanne Wong

17/09/2021.headline: Daylight saving was originally brought in to reduce power use. But does it?
17/09/2021.description: Australia's three time zones will soon become five as daylight saving time kicks in.  So, does the "saving" part of daylight saving time still hold up today?
17/09/2021.author: Belinda Smith

17/09/2021.headline: What if you really can't be vaccinated? Grant and Heather have a long wait to see what happens
17/09/2021.description: People with a history of serious allergic reactions to medication and vaccine ingredients say they've been struggling to get an appointment with their specialist as Australia moves closer to opening up.
17/09/2021.author: Maani Truu

17/09/2021.headline: Long-standing shibboleths have been demolished — and Morrison isn't looking back
17/09/2021.description: This week's moves – the announcement that Australia may build submarines with US and British technology and news of more US troops rotated here – fundamentally change our relationship with the world, writes Laura Tingle.
17/09/2021.author: Laura Tingle

17/09/2021.headline: Carlton receives much-needed boost after snaring former Geelong CEO
17/09/2021.description: Brian Cook joins Carlton as its new chief executive following a brilliant administrative career at the Cats, as the Blues looks to rebuild themselves on and off the field.
17/09/2021.author: Laura Tingle

17/09/2021.headline: Lawyer charged with fraud and conspiracy after planning own murder for $13 million payout
17/09/2021.description: A lawyer in the US is charged with planning his own murder to enrich his son, after battling depression in the wake of his wife's shooting death.
17/09/2021.author: Laura Tingle

17/09/2021.headline: New Zealand calls off Pakistan cricket tour citing 'security concerns'
17/09/2021.description: New Zealand postpones its cricket tour of Pakistan over security concerns that mystified the hosts, just days before the Black Caps' first scheduled match in Pakistan in 18 years.
17/09/2021.author: Laura Tingle

17/09/2021.headline: Penrith dealt injury blow with To'o ruled out of semi-final against Parramatta
17/09/2021.description: Outstanding winger Brian To'o is sidelined with an ankle injury, as the Panthers look to keep their premiership campaign on track following the shock loss to the Rabbitohs.
17/09/2021.author: Laura Tingle

17/09/2021.headline: SA police raid alternative community meeting alleging group becoming 'ideological and erratic'
17/09/2021.description: A 53-year-old man has been refused bail following his arrest during a police raid in Adelaide's south. Police allege he is part of a group that is becoming increasingly ideological and erratic.
17/09/2021.author: Eric Tlozek

17/09/2021.headline: Tom Trbojevic scores double as Sea Eagles hammer Roosters to advance to NRL preliminary finals
17/09/2021.description: Trbojevic is at his scintillating best against the Roosters in Mackay, as the Sea Eagles post a 42-6 win to reach their first preliminary final since 2013.
17/09/2021.author: Eric Tlozek

17/09/2021.headline: 'We were deliberately ignored': French Ambassador found out about submarine deal through the media
17/09/2021.description: The French Ambassador accuses Australia of deliberately keeping his country in the dark over a decision to scrap a $90 billion submarine contract.
17/09/2021.author: Andrew Probyn

17/09/2021.headline: Chinese astronauts return to earth after 90 days on space station
17/09/2021.description: Three Chinese astronauts are spending their first night on Earth in three months after completing the longest mission in the country's space program.
17/09/2021.author: Andrew Probyn

17/09/2021.headline: 'This will be a staged farce': Chinese embassy unhappy with Australia-US joint statement
17/09/2021.description: The Chinese embassy in Canberra has accused Australia and the US of making "erroneous accusations" against China in a joint statement. The exchange comes a day after the announcement of the AUKUS deal.
17/09/2021.author: Andrew Probyn

17/09/2021.headline: Why this Brisbane scientist is one of the world's 100 most influential people
17/09/2021.description: Professor Lidia Morawska is named by Time magazine as one of the 100 most influential people in the world for helping highlight the airborne spread of COVID-19.
17/09/2021.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

17/09/2021.headline: Iron ore safe for now amid China ruckus over subs, but experts warn on long-term outlook
17/09/2021.description: While China's scathing reaction to Australia's nuclear submarine deal is unlikely to translate into short-term trade sanctions, experts caution some exports — including iron ore — may come under threat in the long term.
17/09/2021.author: Lucy Martin

17/09/2021.headline: Biennial World Cup proposals slammed
17/09/2021.description: German and Portuguese national football federations attack FIFA plans for a biennial World Cup, claiming players would suffer and women's tournaments would be marginalised.
17/09/2021.author: Simon Smale

17/09/2021.headline: For Nadine, going to boarding school is 'pretty cool', but experts worry other Indigenous kids are missing out
17/09/2021.description: Experts warn the COVID-19 pandemic could send Closing the Gap targets backwards as the Australian Boarding School Association reveals the number of Indigenous students attending boarding schools in SA has almost halved.
17/09/2021.author: Sara Tomevska

17/09/2021.headline: Bumper wildflower season in outback sets deserts blooming
17/09/2021.description: Alice Springs Desert Park has been bursting with flashes of colourful outcrops of wildflowers thanks to perfect rainfall conditions earlier in the year.
17/09/2021.author: Emma Haskin

17/09/2021.headline: When 9/11 happened, I spent eight hours in a Washington bunker thinking about my baby son on the other side of the world
17/09/2021.description: ABC cameraman David McMeekin was travelling with former prime minister John Howard in Washington on September 11, 2001. Twenty years on, he recalls a harrowing experience documenting the aftermath of the terror attacks.
17/09/2021.author: Emma Haskin

17/09/2021.headline: Victoria records 535 new COVID cases and one death as contact tracers 'under pressure'
17/09/2021.description: Victoria records 535 new locally acquired COVID-19 cases and one further death as the state wakes to a slight easing of restrictions.
17/09/2021.author: Emma Haskin

17/09/2021.headline: Vending machines bring safe, cheap water to Nairobi slums
17/09/2021.description: Mukuru residents will soon be able to source clean water from vending machines that the city government is installing in an effort to ease the slum's water stress.
17/09/2021.author: Emma Haskin

17/09/2021.headline: 'A declaration of war': Farming groups call out 'parasitic' alternative-meat labelling
17/09/2021.description: Vegan and animal rights groups have hit back at claims plant-based meat products are misleading consumers, arguing the government should be promoting the industry.
17/09/2021.author: Hugh Hogan

18/09/2021.headline: Bettongs, nature's soil engineers, thriving on the Yorke Peninsula
18/09/2021.description: A group of brush-tailed bettongs sent from an island off the SA coast is flourishing.
18/09/2021.author: Gillian Aeria

18/09/2021.headline: Outback ingenuity on display as vaccination clock ticks for Delta
18/09/2021.description: Northern communities are getting creative as urgency builds to get Indigenous people in remote areas vaccinated before the WA border reopens.
18/09/2021.author: Erin Parke

18/09/2021.headline: Coal power waste could help to create jobs in this mining town
18/09/2021.description: A new recipe for concrete isn't just about finding a use for coal combustion waste buried in Collie — it could also create local jobs.
18/09/2021.author: Kate Stephens

18/09/2021.headline: Police arrest offender involved in fatal hit and run at Browns Plains in Logan
18/09/2021.description: Queensland police say they've arrested a 20-year-old-man who allegedly hit and killed a man in a road rage incident south of Brisbane.
18/09/2021.author: Nibir Khan and Baz Ruddick

18/09/2021.headline: Melbourne man spends $280,000 on a tent site that he can't visit
18/09/2021.description: How much would you pay for a tent site with no mains power, water or sewerage on a remote island?
18/09/2021.author: Phil Brandel

18/09/2021.headline: 'Absolute spirit lifters': How four-year-olds are creating joy with seniors
18/09/2021.description: A program connecting seniors and children, which is being credited with mending broken hearts, creating intergenerational connections and improving IT skills, is expanding in Queensland.
18/09/2021.author: Kylie Bartholomew and Sheridan Stewart

18/09/2021.headline: The average Aussie eats six kilos of bacon every year, but where does it come from?
18/09/2021.description: Almost 50 per cent of Australians have bought bacon in the past week, but research shows most don't realise that what they think is local produce is often imported.
18/09/2021.author: Kylie Bartholomew and Sheridan Stewart

18/09/2021.headline: ACT records 15 new COVID-19 cases as Barr says new Doherty modelling shows opening at 70 per cent 'not prudent'
18/09/2021.description: The ACT has recorded 15 new COVID-19 cases, at least seven of which spent part of their infectious period in the community and eight currently unlinked to other known cases or clusters.
18/09/2021.author: Charlotte Gore

18/09/2021.headline: Federal Labor staffer charged with two counts of rape
18/09/2021.description: Alexander Matters, 20, who works for ACT federal Labor MP David Smith, is charged with two counts of rape, over an incident alleged to have taken place in April this year.
18/09/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

18/09/2021.headline: Robert Durst found guilty of murdering best friend
18/09/2021.description: Durst, a multimillionaire real estate heir who was the subject of documentary series The Jinx, is also suspected of killing two other people in the US.
18/09/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

18/09/2021.headline: NSW records 1,331 COVID-19 cases and six deaths as state runs Indigenous vaccine blitz
18/09/2021.description: NSW Police prevent another anti-lockdown protest from taking place in Sydney's inner-west as the state records 1,331 new COVID-19 cases and six deaths.
18/09/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

18/09/2021.headline: Australia is sitting on a seriously valuable crop of canola
18/09/2021.description: The ducks are lining up for Australian canola growers, as Canada starts harvesting one of its poorest crops in years.
18/09/2021.author: Matt Brann and Joanna Prendergast

18/09/2021.headline: One new COVID case in Queensland as large numbers turn out at vaccination hubs
18/09/2021.description: One new locally acquired case of COVID-19 is recorded in Queensland overnight, as high numbers of people gather at vaccination hubs for today's major push on Pfizer jabs.
18/09/2021.author: Matt Brann and Joanna Prendergast

18/09/2021.headline: Sunshine Coast brothers ride into US motocross history
18/09/2021.description: Jett and Hunter Lawrence both finish in the top three of the US motocross championship standings, and make history.
18/09/2021.author: Jake Kearnan

18/09/2021.headline: 'How can we trust Australia?': Government braces for EU backlash over France submarines
18/09/2021.description: Senior figures in France are hinting at possible economic repercussions after the federal government's decision to walk away from a $90 billion submarine contract with the European nation.
18/09/2021.author: James Glenday

18/09/2021.headline: Federal government chose not to stockpile COVID treatment despite being warned of likely global shortage
18/09/2021.description: The peak body of immunologists and allergists last year urged the government to stock up on Tocilizumab, marketed as Actemra. Now arthritis sufferers are struggling to access the drug because it is being used to treat COVID.
18/09/2021.author: Dan Oakes

18/09/2021.headline: The X-factor: Why Australia's fate is tied to China's Xi Jinping
18/09/2021.description: China is a great power and demands to be treated as such. It is clearly not a democracy but that doesn't mean its rise is not legitimate, writes Stan Grant.
18/09/2021.author: Stan Grant

18/09/2021.headline: I used to drink until I passed out so I could forget my  past. Then I got a cat
18/09/2021.description: When I was recovering from a devastating sexual assault, my cat helped me to feel things again. He helped me feel things that were stronger than my urge to die, writes Lucia Osborne-Crowley.
18/09/2021.author: Lucia Osborne-Crowley

18/09/2021.headline: As a psychologist, this is how I navigate difficult decisions around kids and COVID
18/09/2021.description: There is a new variant of Monday-itis. The symptoms may include the endless roundabout of decision-making about what's safe for kids, writes Brittany McGill.
18/09/2021.author: Lucia Osborne-Crowley

18/09/2021.headline: How did the global solar boom end up in China, not Australia? 'Tinpot companies' and hope
18/09/2021.description: Twenty years ago, Australia appeared set to be a global player in the solar panel manufacturing industry. Today, with panels in high demand, we hardly make any of them. Here's how we lost our head start.
18/09/2021.author: James Purtill

18/09/2021.headline: Picnics, teen vaccines and a flattening curve — but it all depends on where you live
18/09/2021.description: There was a palpable sense this week that Australia’s strategy to tackle the third COVID wave had at last clocked up some small wins and momentum was building. But there is a long way to go.
18/09/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

18/09/2021.headline: Meet the frontline healthcare workers driving the COVID response among our most vulnerable
18/09/2021.description: Meet some of the frontline healthcare workers treating COVID patients in homeless, remote and diverse community settings.
18/09/2021.author: Ahmed Yussuf

18/09/2021.headline: Experts add weight to implication of sporting hero Tom Wills in mass murder of Indigenous people
18/09/2021.description: Biographers and frontier violence experts add legitimacy to an archival newspaper discovery that suggests Australian Rules football pioneer Tom Wills participated in a massacre of Indigenous people in 1861.
18/09/2021.author: Russell Jackson

18/09/2021.headline: Popular tourist spots across Asia-Pacific are reopening, but risks remain
18/09/2021.description: Popular tourist destinations like Phuket, Fiji and Bali are looking to reopen their borders to foreign travellers experimenting with various programs intended to contain future outbreaks.
18/09/2021.author: Russell Jackson

18/09/2021.headline: What happens once you escape the Taliban's clutches? This is life inside a secret safe house
18/09/2021.description: In an unremarkable home, unlikely housemates share the same fear — 'Maybe the Taliban will find us'.
18/09/2021.author: Tom Joyner
