18/09/2021.headline: Leading epidemiologist weighs in as Victoria awaits roadmap out of sixth lockdown
18/09/2021.description: A leading epidemiologist has warned Victorians to temper their expectations ahead of the state government's roadmap reveal, saying case numbers will continue to shape the state's future.
18/09/2021.author: Tom Joyner

18/09/2021.headline: Malaysia warns Australia nuclear sub project could 'provoke other powers' in Asia
18/09/2021.description: Malaysia joins criticism of Australia's plan to build nuclear-powered submarines, warning it could spark a renewed arms race in the region, while the diplomatic crisis with France sparked by the decision continues to escalate.
18/09/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

18/09/2021.headline: Taliban seizes women's ministry building for new 'preaching and guidance' ministry
18/09/2021.description: Afghanistan's new Taliban rulers set up a ministry for the "propagation of virtue and the prevention of vice" in the building that once housed the women's affairs ministry, escorting out World Bank staffers as part of the forced move.
18/09/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

18/09/2021.headline: Former Knight McManus misses out on NRL concussion compensation
18/09/2021.description: Former Newcastle Knights winger James McManus walks away empty-handed in his $1 million concussion claim against the NRL club.
18/09/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

18/09/2021.headline: Panthers survive gritty semi-final against Eels to set up clash with Storm
18/09/2021.description: The Panthers hold on to beat the resilient Eels 8-6 in Mackay, with the defending premiers their next opponent in the preliminary finals.
18/09/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

18/09/2021.headline: 'A clumsy, inadequate and unAustralian situation': French Ambassador departs Canberra after recall
18/09/2021.description: Jean-Pierre Thebault leaves Canberra offering a scathing analysis of Australia's diplomacy in recent days, describing the decision to scrap the government's $90 billion submarine contract as a "huge mistake".
18/09/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

18/09/2021.headline: 'Virus is real': Sydney man leaves hospital 399 days after getting COVID
18/09/2021.description: David spent more than a year in hospital after being infected with COVID-19. He finally went home this month, grateful to his carers, and with a message for the community.
18/09/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

18/09/2021.headline: Everything you need to know about this year's Brownlow Medal
18/09/2021.description: The showpiece award ceremony of the 2021 AFL season is almost upon us, with the Brownlow Medal presentation taking place in Perth on Sunday. Here's everything you need to know.
18/09/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

18/09/2021.headline: Impressive Wallabies chalk up back-to-back wins over Springboks
18/09/2021.description: For the first time under coach Dave Rennie, the Wallabies score consecutive victories after beating the world champion Springboks 30-17 in their Rugby Championship Test in Brisbane.
18/09/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

18/09/2021.headline: Six big questions six months out from the next South Australian state election
18/09/2021.description: No Australian state or territory government has lost office in the five elections held since the pandemic broke out last year — a trend the ruling Liberal Party hopes will continue
18/09/2021.author: Rory McClaren

18/09/2021.headline: French football fans storm pitch at half time
18/09/2021.description: Lens secures its first Ligue 1 northern derby win over Lille in 15 years in a clash marred by the second major incident of crowd unrest in French football this season.
18/09/2021.author: Rory McClaren

18/09/2021.headline: Young mum eyes the rugby field again after 'terrifying' day her heart stopped on the pitch
18/09/2021.description: Jess Allen doesn't remember her heart stopping on a Gladstone rugby pitch, but she will never forget the outpouring of love and support that set her on a remakable path to recovery.
18/09/2021.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis and Karyn J Wilson

19/09/2021.headline: Live: Stars arrive for the 2021 Brownlow medal
19/09/2021.description: One of the tightest Brownlow medal counts in many years is about to get underway in Perth, as AFL stars and their partners arrive in style. Follow all the action in our live blog.
19/09/2021.author: Dean Bilton

19/09/2021.headline: 'We bear witness to and are deeply sorry for the grief': CA acknowledges evidence Tom Wills may have taken part in massacres of Indigenous people
19/09/2021.description: Cricket Australia and the AFL acknowledge evidence from an 1895 newspaper interview with Tom Wills suggesting the cricket and Australian rules icon may have taken part in the mass murder of Aboriginal people, and vows to consult with Indigenous communities and experts on the "next steps".
19/09/2021.author: Dean Bilton

19/09/2021.headline: Here's what Melbourne's roadmap out of lockdown says about the months ahead
19/09/2021.description: In five stages, the Victorian government's roadmap outlines how restrictions are set to be eased in Melbourne as the state moves past key vaccination thresholds. Here's what's changing between now and Christmas.
19/09/2021.author: Joseph Dunstan

19/09/2021.headline: Christian Porter resigns from ministry
19/09/2021.description: Christian Porter has resigned from Scott Morrison's ministry after revealing he had accepted an anonymous donation to help cover his personal legal fees.
19/09/2021.author: Jane Norman

19/09/2021.headline: Darts 'Queen' Fallon Sherrock makes more history after stunning comeback
19/09/2021.description: Fallon Sherrock, who made history by becoming the first woman to win a match at the 2020 World Darts Championships, reached her first World Series final at the Nordic Masters.
19/09/2021.author: Simon Smale

19/09/2021.headline: NT Deputy Police Commissioner says sorry for 'murder' comment made in accidental Facebook video
19/09/2021.description: NT Deputy Police Commissioner Murray Smalpage apologises after accidentally live-streaming a video on social media in which he jokingly refers to the collective noun of officers as "a murder".
19/09/2021.author: Jano Gibson

19/09/2021.headline: Fire ignites in tandoori oven inside car that crashed into Adelaide business
19/09/2021.description: Firefighters extinguish a blaze inside a minivan after it crashed into an accountancy firm at Park Holme while carrying a tandoori oven with coals inside to an Indian restaurant.
19/09/2021.author: Eugene Boisvert and Eric Tlozek

19/09/2021.headline: Victorian roadmap unveiled as Geelong region re-enters lockdown
19/09/2021.description: Melbourne will be in lockdown until late October and greater freedoms will be granted to fully vaccinated Victorians once 80 per cent of the eligible population is double dosed, the state's roadmap reveals.
19/09/2021.author: Richard Willingham, Bridget Rollason, and Yara Murray-Atfield

19/09/2021.headline: Humpback highway detour suspected in 'very different' east coast whale migration
19/09/2021.description: Mothers and calves are heading south on their return migration but experts say spotting a breach or tail slap has been a rare treat.
19/09/2021.author: Sarah Cumming

19/09/2021.headline: 'Upfront, open and honest': Dutton defends Australia's handling of submarine contract
19/09/2021.description: Defence Minister Peter Dutton says he understands why the French are upset but insists Australia's decision to scrap the submarine deal between the countries should not have come as a complete surprise.
19/09/2021.author: Stephanie Borys

19/09/2021.headline: John Zakula sleeps in his car away from his property to escape wind turbine 'noise'. Now he's suing the operator
19/09/2021.description: The operator of a Victorian wind farm being sued by neighbours for allegedly emitting excessive noise says its turbines have a mechanical issue which create a distinctive sound.
19/09/2021.author: Emma Field

19/09/2021.headline: SpaceX capsule with world's first all-civilian crew splashes down in Atlantic
19/09/2021.description: The first ever civilian-only space flight to orbit earth on board the Space-X mission have splashed down successfully in the Atlantic ocean.
19/09/2021.author: Emma Field

19/09/2021.headline: Victorian police union says officers have become 'punching bags' for frustrated residents in lockdown
19/09/2021.description: Victoria's police union says it's concerned its members are bearing the brunt of community frustration with lockdown, after officers suffered broken bones and facial injuries during violent anti-lockdown protests in Melbourne on Saturday.
19/09/2021.author: Emma Field

19/09/2021.headline: ACT records another 17 COVID-19 cases, with 12 infectious in the community
19/09/2021.description: Despite recording another 17 new locally acquired cases of COVID-19, Chief Health Officer Kerryn Coleman says the ACT is seeing fewer transmissions at public exposure sites.
19/09/2021.author: Penny Travers

19/09/2021.headline: Restrictions eased for Sydney hotspots as NSW records deadliest day of pandemic
19/09/2021.description: NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian announces an easing of restrictions for Sydney's COVID hotspots from tomorrow after the state recorded 1,083 new COVID-19 cases and 13 deaths.
19/09/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen

19/09/2021.headline: Our experiment with a 'closed economy' saw unemployment drop rapidly, but what did it mean?
19/09/2021.description: When we closed our borders, and pumped the economy with stimulus, the economic recovery was swifter than expected, writes Gareth Hutchens.
19/09/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

19/09/2021.headline: Boy burnt and house destroyed in suspicious Adelaide brush fence fire
19/09/2021.description: Police say a 15-year-old is being treated for minor burns after a brush fence fire that spread to the roof of a home in West Lakes Shore, destroying it.
19/09/2021.author: Imogen Hayne

19/09/2021.headline: There are just five female commercial hot-air balloon pilots in Australia. Georgia and Bronni hope to change that
19/09/2021.description: For a long time, hot-air ballooning has been a male-dominated sport. But these women are launching a new generation of female pilots.
19/09/2021.author: Charmayne Allison

19/09/2021.headline: Older girls still excluded from study as some schools reopen in Afghanistan
19/09/2021.description: Some Afghan girls return to primary schools with gender-segregated classes, but older girls face an anxious wait with no clarity over if and when they will resume their studies at the secondary school level.
19/09/2021.author: Charmayne Allison

19/09/2021.headline: Queensland records no new cases as 'super Pfizer weekend' sees vaccination rates soar
19/09/2021.description: There are no new locally acquired COVID-19 cases recorded in Queensland as people turn out in large numbers to get vaccinated at walk-in hubs.
19/09/2021.author: Charmayne Allison

19/09/2021.headline: Secret government maps detail salmon farming expansion plans
19/09/2021.description: Secret salmon farming expansion maps, attributed to the state government, show much of Tasmania's north and north-west coasts, along with sections of the east coast, could be made available to fish farming.
19/09/2021.author: Kate Ainsworth

19/09/2021.headline: Rolling Stone magazine crowns Aretha Franklin's Respect the 'greatest song of all time'
19/09/2021.description: Rolling Stone's latest list of the "500 greatest songs of all time" reflects more than ever the work of women and people of colour with the top three all by African American artists singing songs of respect, revolution and rights.
19/09/2021.author: Matt Neal

19/09/2021.headline: Federal Group fights back against proposed end to exclusive gambling licence
19/09/2021.description: Tasmania's oldest-run family casino business is pushing back against state government plans to end its exclusive licence within two years.
19/09/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

19/09/2021.headline: Tier 2 sites listed in Bendigo and Kyneton as Ballarat COVID exposures grow
19/09/2021.description: Retailers in Bendigo and Kyneton, two supermarkets in Ballarat and schools and childcare centres in Melbourne's north are among the latest additions to the list.
19/09/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

19/09/2021.headline: 'I really want to be a mother': How Sarah fought to be able to raise her daughter
19/09/2021.description: A service supporting families going through the courts has helped people like Sarah keep caring for their children. An RMIT University evaluation recommends making the pilot program more widely available based on its success so far.
19/09/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

19/09/2021.headline: The AFL won't overhaul its judiciary system following a season that has drawn criticism
19/09/2021.description: The AFL's incoming executive general manager of football, Andrew Dillon, says there won't be an overhaul of the league's disciplinary process, following a season in which there has been criticism of the system.
19/09/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

19/09/2021.headline: Experts examine fears and misconceptions fuelling Queensland’s slow vaccine uptake
19/09/2021.description: From fertility concerns to low regional transmission rates, experts answer five key concerns of unvaccinated Queenslanders, as the state retains a firm grip on last place in the race to get COVID jabs in the arms of Australians.
19/09/2021.author: Brittney Kleyn

19/09/2021.headline: Central Queensland bushfire outlook a relief for locals still rebuilding after 2019 disaster
19/09/2021.description: As this year’s bushfire season approaches, residents of an area badly damaged by previous blazes are getting their plans in place.
19/09/2021.author: Jessica Rendall

19/09/2021.headline: Kaliah got COVID-19 at school and her pop wound up in hospital. There's a push to spare other Indigenous kids the same fate
19/09/2021.description: First Nations children are now a focus for ramping up vaccination rates, as vulnerable families continue to become infected with COVID-19.
19/09/2021.author: Shahni Wellington and Kirstie Wellauer

19/09/2021.headline: Kabul's female government workers told to stay home by Taliban
19/09/2021.description: The female employees are ordered to stay home until further notice as women protest outside the former women's ministry and a deadly explosion strikes Jalalabad.
19/09/2021.author: Shahni Wellington and Kirstie Wellauer

19/09/2021.headline: Coralie wants to be sterilised, but doctors won't allow it
19/09/2021.description: Some studies show up to 28 per cent of women regret being sterilised, making it harder for some women to access this type of medical procedure.
19/09/2021.author: Elise Kinsella

19/09/2021.headline: Premier defends 'least-worst option' of stricter lockdown for Sydney's COVID hotspots
19/09/2021.description: A Mayor of one of Sydney's COVID-19 hotspots says the Greater Sydney lockdown "should never have been a tale of two cities" after Premier Gladys Berejiklian defended the tougher restrictions which eased from today.
19/09/2021.author: David Hirst

19/09/2021.headline: Gillespie hopes Australian team has mended relationship with Langer
19/09/2021.description: Australian cricket great Jason Gillespie says the criticism of national coach Justin Langer should have remained within the inner sanctum and he hopes relationships have since been repaired.
19/09/2021.author: David Hirst

19/09/2021.headline: 'There's a lot of camera adjustments to get the feet in': The unusual jobs Australians are doing from home
19/09/2021.description: With the Delta variant popping up all over Australia, many of us have had to find flexible ways of working — and for some, that means more than sitting in front of a laptop at the dining table.
19/09/2021.author: Maani Truu

19/09/2021.headline: Kids under 12 years aren't yet eligible for the COVID vaccine. What's their risk when they go back to school?
19/09/2021.description: Millions of Australian children are set to head back to school for face-to-face classes in term 4 after several months of remote learning. For parents, this may bring both relief and trepidation.
19/09/2021.author: Olivia Willis

19/09/2021.headline: How to hack brain chemicals to help kids feel excited by lockdown holidays
19/09/2021.description: With  options for juggling childcare and work-from-home limited in some states as COVID lockdown drags, my social media feeds are full of versions of one fraught question: "I'm having a cold sweat thinking about the school holidays coming up. What ideas have you?"
19/09/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

19/09/2021.headline: No one can pinpoint the moment when Porter became PM material — but his dream is now over
19/09/2021.description: Christian Porter has been touted as a future Prime Minister since he was a boy. But achieving that long-held dream has just become much harder, writes political correspondent Brett Worthington.
19/09/2021.author: Brett Worthington

19/09/2021.headline: How Amy Poehler turned the tables on the Emmys to create the award show's best ever moment
19/09/2021.description: From fake feuds, to celebrating pandemic heroes - and a cartwheel! - sometimes the Emmy moments we remember aren't necessarily who wins.
19/09/2021.author: Ellyn Duncan

19/09/2021.headline: Premier defends 'least-worst option' of stricter lockdown for Sydney's COVID hotspots
19/09/2021.description: A Mayor of one of Sydney's COVID-19 hotspots says the Greater Sydney lockdown "should never have been a tale of two cities" after Premier Gladys Berejiklian defended the tougher restrictions which eased from today.
19/09/2021.author: David Hirst

19/09/2021.headline: Born in Australia. Raised in detention. Facing deportation. How did it come to this?
19/09/2021.description: The children of the "Biloela family" will end up in an orphanage if they’re returned to Sri Lanka, an expert says. That’s the best case scenario; the worst is unthinkable. This is the inside story of the family living on borrowed time.
19/09/2021.author: David Hirst

19/09/2021.headline: Inside COVID ICU: 'I always think, what would I do if that were my family member?'
19/09/2021.description: Behind the daily case numbers, this is what our frontline health workers see day in, day out — but be warned, it's confronting, grim and exhausting.
19/09/2021.author: Jason Om

19/09/2021.headline: Why the Reserve Bank and government don't want to rein in property prices
19/09/2021.description: If we've learned anything from the past week, the Australian housing market is on a one-way trajectory into outer space and no one is in any mood to alter its course, writes Ian Verrender.
19/09/2021.author: Ian Verrender

19/09/2021.headline: Australia's limited preparation promises an intriguing multi-format women's cricket series against India
19/09/2021.description: Things went pretty well for Australia the last time they faced India in an international women's game, but will they come out on top this time with such limited preparation?
19/09/2021.author: Ian Verrender

19/09/2021.headline: 2021 Emmy nominations: The best TV shows this year
19/09/2021.description: The 73rd Primetime Emmy Awards kick off later this morning. Here are the shows vying for honours.
19/09/2021.author: Ian Verrender

19/09/2021.headline: 'True legend': England World Cup winner Jimmy Greaves dies aged 81
19/09/2021.description: Jimmy Greaves, a member of the England squad that won the 1966 World Cup and one of Britain's greatest forwards, dies at the age of 81.
19/09/2021.author: Ian Verrender

19/09/2021.headline: Indonesia's most wanted militant killed in jungle gun battle
19/09/2021.description: Indonesia's most wanted militant with ties to the Islamic State group has been killed in a shootout with security forces, the country's military says, in a sweeping counter-terrorism campaign against extremists in the remote mountain jungles.
19/09/2021.author: Ian Verrender

19/09/2021.headline: AFL stars wow on multiple Brownlow red carpets
19/09/2021.description: AFL stars have taken the spotlight on the Brownlow red carpet, dazzling at ceremonies across Australia, with the main count being held in Perth for the first time.
19/09/2021.author: Ian Verrender

20/09/2021.headline: Temperatures to plummet by 10C in NSW as wintry blast to bring snow and hail
20/09/2021.description: A cold front will sweep across NSW this week, bringing back the frost of winter with gale-force winds, hail and snow.
20/09/2021.author: Tony Ibrahim

20/09/2021.headline: Perth murder accused 'rehearsed' attack in black latex suit, court hears
20/09/2021.description: The man accused of murdering a sister and brother in a Victoria Park apartment recorded a rehearsal of the attack on his mobile phone, a Perth court hears.
20/09/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

20/09/2021.headline: Emaciated animals removed from property where horse graveyard found, court told
20/09/2021.description: A 64-year-old woman is contesting more than 60 animal cruelty charges relating to horses and cats on a property in western Victoria.
20/09/2021.author: Christopher Testa

20/09/2021.headline: Killer of restaurant worker found in luxury home of senior public servants pleads guilty to murder
20/09/2021.description: A 23-year-old man, whose identity is suppressed, admits to murdering an Adelaide restaurant worker at the luxury home of two South Australian government executives in 2019.
20/09/2021.author: Mahalia Carter

20/09/2021.headline: AUKUS 'not a defence alliance' says Australian diplomat as South-East Asian neighbours voice concerns
20/09/2021.description: Australian diplomats are intensifying their efforts to reassure South-East Asian nations about the federal government's plan to build nuclear-powered submarines.
20/09/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

20/09/2021.headline: Melbourne Demons not the only ones under AFL grand final pressure, Western Bulldogs say
20/09/2021.description: The Western Bulldogs dismiss suggestions Melbourne is under more pressure heading into Saturday's AFL grand final at Perth Stadium, saying they too feel the weight of expectation to reward their loyal fans.
20/09/2021.author: Blake Kagi

20/09/2021.headline: BlueScope's climate change boss warns green steel still decades off
20/09/2021.description: Addressing investors for the first time in her new role, Gretta Stephens says breakthrough technologies that will allow the company to transition to green steel production are not likely to be available until the 2040s.
20/09/2021.author: Ainslie Drewitt-Smith

20/09/2021.headline: Northern Territory offers travel vouchers to entice fully vaccinated tourists
20/09/2021.description: In an Australian first, a new $5 million Tourism NT campaign discounting travel in the Territory for interstate visitors will only be available to tourists fully vaccinated against COVID-19.
20/09/2021.author: Ainslie Drewitt-Smith

20/09/2021.headline: Moderna COVID vaccine to arrive in the NT this week
20/09/2021.description: Hundreds of Moderna COVID vaccine doses will be distributed to pharmacies across the Territory in coming days, NT Health Minister Natasha Fyles says.
20/09/2021.author: Samantha Dick

20/09/2021.headline: Perth babysitter faces spate of fresh child sex abuse charges
20/09/2021.description: WA Police charge a 23-year-old babysitter, who advertised through an online service, with a further 190 child sexual offences.
20/09/2021.author: David Weber

20/09/2021.headline: Man accused of stabbing woman to death was her neighbour, court told
20/09/2021.description: Jesse Green who is accused of murdering neighbour Teah Rose Luckwell, 22, is facing a special hearing, after being found unfit to stand trial.
20/09/2021.author: David Weber

20/09/2021.headline: Coroner says police pursuits should only occur if officers believe 'serious risk of public health and safety'
20/09/2021.description: Raymond Noel Thomas was on his way to the supermarket to buy chocolate. Less than a minute later, the 30-year-old was dead. Now the coroner wants the police to change its policies.
20/09/2021.author: Kristian Silva

20/09/2021.headline: NZ Breakers cut Tai Webster because of anti-vaccination stance
20/09/2021.description: NBL player Tai Webster is now teamless, as the Breakers star's refusal to get vaccinated leaves him without freedom to travel between states and countries during the upcoming season.
20/09/2021.author: Kristian Silva

20/09/2021.headline: Best moments from the 2021 Emmys from Evan Peters' joy to many moving speeches
20/09/2021.description: There were tears of joy and tears of sadness at the 2021 Emmy Awards, which were swept by series Ted Lasso, Mare of Easttown and The Crown.
20/09/2021.author: Sarah Motherwell

20/09/2021.headline: Arrest warrant issued for man charged over house parties during SA lockdown
20/09/2021.description: The Adelaide Magistrates Court has issued a warrant for Bitanya Sibeko after he failed to appear at his hearing today. Mr Sibeko was one of five people charged over a house party during SA's lockdown in July.
20/09/2021.author: Eric Tlozek

20/09/2021.headline: Carly McBride 'discarded like something of no worth', court hears, as killer awaits his fate
20/09/2021.description: The Supreme Court hears from Ms McBride's shattered mother as part of the sentencing of murderer Sayle Kenneth Newson, who insists he is innocent.
20/09/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

20/09/2021.headline: Man charged with attempted murder over attack on 17yo boy at Brisbane apartment accused of bail breaches
20/09/2021.description: An 18-year-old man charged with the attempted murder of a teenager critically injured in a "severe assault" by up to a dozen people in inner Brisbane is arrested for breaching his bail less than a week after being released from custody.
20/09/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

20/09/2021.headline: Gabby Petito set out for the trip of a lifetime — her fiance returned alone, then disappeared
20/09/2021.description: Gabby Petito's "van life" trip across the US ended in tragedy, but there are still more questions than answers about what happened to her.
20/09/2021.author: Jordan Hayne

20/09/2021.headline: Victoria and NSW are trying to get to the same place. So why do their pathways look different?
20/09/2021.description: Plenty of Victorians are drawing comparisons with the New South Wales roadmap, as they push for a faster easing of restrictions. These are the key differences between the paths laid out by Australia's two most populous states.
20/09/2021.author: Sian Johnson

20/09/2021.headline: Not sure which series to dive into post-Emmys? We'll give you a recommendation
20/09/2021.description: The Emmys celebrate the best content TV has to offer. From all the titles nominated, the ABC Chatbot can help you decide what to dive into next.
20/09/2021.author: Emily Sakzewski

20/09/2021.headline: Health official 'really nervous' about tests dropping off as virus spreads around Newcastle
20/09/2021.description: Newcastle health officials worry people are losing enthusiasm for COVID tests but that risks spreading it to vulnerable family members and friends.
20/09/2021.author: Nick Hose and Bindi Bryce

20/09/2021.headline: First death of Illawarra resident from COVID in Wollongong Hospital
20/09/2021.description: NSW Health has recorded the first death of an Illawarra resident from the coronavirus at Wollongong Hospital.
20/09/2021.author: Kelly Fuller and Tim Fernandez

20/09/2021.headline: 'How can a human being do that?': Ann Marie Smith's family face carer guilty of her manslaughter
20/09/2021.description: The family of Ann Marie Smith have faced the care worker charged over her death. Rosa Maione was today arraigned in the Supreme Court ahead of her sentencing for manslaughter.
20/09/2021.author: Rebecca Opie and Mahalia Carter

20/09/2021.headline: AFL grand final broadcast explained: Can you stream the decider online?
20/09/2021.description: AFL fans were left scrambling on Sunday when they realised the Brownlow wasn't being streamed online. So is it the same deal for the 2021 grand final?
20/09/2021.author: Rebecca Opie and Mahalia Carter

20/09/2021.headline: Bitcoin Babe was banned from 91 banks. A senate inquiry is trying to stop that happening to other cryptocurrency businesses
20/09/2021.description: A senate inquiry hears the nation needs to act quickly to protect the one in six Australians who own cryptocurrency, and to stop entrepreneurs moving overseas.
20/09/2021.author: Rhiana Whitson

20/09/2021.headline: Risk from COVID-positive traveller transiting at Brisbane Airport is 'low': immunologist
20/09/2021.description: What is a "red-zone flight" and how does it protect other passengers transiting through Brisbane Airport?
20/09/2021.author: Jessica Rendall

20/09/2021.headline: Anita used to lead a full life. With long COVID she now struggles to comprehend TV shows
20/09/2021.description: More than a year on from Tasmania's first major COVID outbreak, healthcare workers are still living with the impacts of long COVID. They say more support is desperately needed.
20/09/2021.author: Emily Baker

20/09/2021.headline: How much more deadly is Delta? And should kids be counted in vaccine targets?
20/09/2021.description: Canadian research into COVID-19 variants finds a person with Delta is almost twice as likely as someone with the Alpha variant to be hospitalised.
20/09/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

20/09/2021.headline: The plot twists in this year’s Emmys storyline
20/09/2021.description: New records achieved (good and bad), more accusations of institutional racism and, because we're in a pandemic, some legitimate health and safety concerns.
20/09/2021.author: Paul Donoughue

20/09/2021.headline: If you could speak your mind in federal parliament, what would you say? Some young people are getting that chance
20/09/2021.description: Ashleigh Streeter-Jones and Ruby Bisson were sick of young people not being represented in Parliament, so they convinced over 50 federal politicians to use their 90-second statements to read out speeches sent in by constituents under the age of 21.
20/09/2021.author: Claudia Long

20/09/2021.headline: Community sport clubs struggling in COVID, thousands could shut down
20/09/2021.description: A new survey says most community sporting clubs are losing money and more than 10 per cent could go under because of COVID. Local clubs say the shutdown is having a big social impact on communities, who can't get together to play and train.
20/09/2021.author: David Mark

20/09/2021.headline: Connected, safe, peaceful: How it feels to belong on country
20/09/2021.description: From the Snowy River to Central Australia, respect and connectedness to the land are key Indigenous values.
20/09/2021.author: Anna Salleh and Joel Zander

20/09/2021.headline: Sickies go legit: 'Doona days' are becoming the norm, but that alone won't stop burnout
20/09/2021.description: Mental health days have become the norm in the corporate world, but as the pandemic takes its toll on essential workers experts say there's still a long way to go in addressing burnout.
20/09/2021.author: Maani Truu

20/09/2021.headline: 'You've got to be courageous': Men speak about their role in changing attitudes towards women's safety
20/09/2021.description: What do men think about campaigns urging them to examine their role in preventing family and sexual violence? We asked young men — and those who work with them — about their experiences, and what they think will turn the tide.
20/09/2021.author: Norman Hermant

20/09/2021.headline: What is a blind trust and what role did it play in Christian Porter's resignation?
20/09/2021.description: Christian Porter's decision to step down from the frontbench was sparked by a disclosure he made last week about money donated to him through a blind trust. This is how they work and why it's become an issue.
20/09/2021.author: Georgia Hitch and Michael Janda

20/09/2021.headline: Beijing decided to burst China's property bubble. Now the world's most indebted company is teetering
20/09/2021.description: It was once a darling of China's booming property sector, but share markets around the world now watch in horror as Evergrande threatens to sink.
20/09/2021.author: Georgia Hitch and Michael Janda

20/09/2021.headline: Scott Morrison's hand-picked General given new military challenge following COVID vaccine rollout
20/09/2021.description: The General appointed to fix Australia’s faltering COVID-19 vaccine rollout has been named for another challenging job back in Defence, but it remains unclear when he will be able begin his new role.
20/09/2021.author: Andrew Greene

20/09/2021.headline: Man who inspired the film Hotel Rwanda convicted of terror charges
20/09/2021.description: The verdict comes more than a year after Paul Rusesabagina disappeared during a visit to Dubai and appeared days later in Rwanda in handcuffs, accused of supporting the armed wing of his opposition political platform.
20/09/2021.author: Andrew Greene

20/09/2021.headline: Princess Beatrice 'doing well' after giving birth to her first child
20/09/2021.description: It is the 33-year-old princess's first child with husband Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi, who also has a son from a previous relationship.
20/09/2021.author: Jack Hawke

20/09/2021.headline: Construction industry to shut down for two weeks following violent Melbourne protests
20/09/2021.description: Violent protests in Melbourne's CBD have triggered a complete shutdown of all construction work in the city.
20/09/2021.author: Jack Hawke

20/09/2021.headline: Witness in Malka Leifer case tells court she didn't speak to police because she feared being sued
20/09/2021.description: An Israeli social worker who an alleged victim of Malka Leifer confided in has testified before a Melbourne court, sharing her concerns of being sued over speaking to police.
20/09/2021.author: Danny Tran

20/09/2021.headline: Paramedic says he's been suspended after taking vaccine battle to court
20/09/2021.description: John Larter, who started legal action last week against mandatory COVID jabs for NSW health workers, says he's been advised via email today that he can't work.
20/09/2021.author: Isadora Bogle

20/09/2021.headline: Russian teen kills six, wounds several at Perm University
20/09/2021.description: A teenage student shoots six people dead and wounds several others at a Russian university.
20/09/2021.author: Isadora Bogle

20/09/2021.headline: Teenagers involved in fatal skate park fight subjected to reprisal attacks, ACT court hears
20/09/2021.description: A Canberra family allegedly had a Molotov cocktail thrown at their house as part of reprisal attacks on teenagers who were involved in a fatal skatepark fight, a court hears.
20/09/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

20/09/2021.headline: Only GP clinic in small town to close for failing to have whole workforce vaccinated
20/09/2021.description: A private GP practice has chosen to close its doors when vaccines become mandatory for health workers, leaving 1,200 people without a doctor or pharmacy.
20/09/2021.author: Will Murray, Lucy MacDonald, and Monte Bovill

20/09/2021.headline: 'He has not done anything illegal': Joyce backs Porter's decision to remain in Parliament
20/09/2021.description: Acting Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce defends Christian Porter's decision to remain in Parliament as a backbencher, saying he hasn't done anything illegal and is entitled to stay.
20/09/2021.author: Georgia Hitch

20/09/2021.headline: Man jailed for terrifying, humiliating knifepoint attack on partner
20/09/2021.description: A judge says it was only luck that saved the woman, who was dragged through the streets of Broome by the man who was threatening to kill her in front of children.
20/09/2021.author: Hannah Barry

20/09/2021.headline: North Korea warns Australia's nuclear submarine pact could trigger 'nuclear arms race'
20/09/2021.description: North Korea says a new security alliance between Australia, the US and the UK could trigger a "nuclear arms race" in the region.
20/09/2021.author: Hannah Barry

20/09/2021.headline: Temperatures to plummet by 10C in NSW as wintry blast brings snow and hail
20/09/2021.description: A cold front will sweep across NSW this week, bringing back the frost of winter with gale-force winds, hail and snow.
20/09/2021.author: Tony Ibrahim

21/09/2021.headline: I'm a Celebrity … Get Me Out of Here! crew member sparked North Coast lockdown
21/09/2021.description: The woman was an authorised worker but it is understood she did not follow stay-at-home orders while in the area.
21/09/2021.author: Leah White

21/09/2021.headline: Sunken French sub deal puts Australia's trade negotiations with the EU in tricky place
21/09/2021.description: The government says it is not worried about the future of its free trade negotiations with the EU, but a European leader warns French anger may spill over into other trade deals.
21/09/2021.author: Kath Sullivan

21/09/2021.headline: Sister of unarmed man shot dead by police denies warning he had knife and says interpreter was needed
21/09/2021.description: Tong Ly's sister testifies at a coronial inquest into the fatal shooting of her brother that she did not tell officers he was carrying a knife, and says she and her father should have been provided with a translator by police.
21/09/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

21/09/2021.headline: Last blast of winter grips Queensland, but more pleasant conditions to return by the weekend
21/09/2021.description: The tail of a low pressure trough is whipping across much of the state, bringing strong winds to parts of Queensland and sending temperatures plummeting up to 10 degrees Celsius below average.
21/09/2021.author: Nibir Khan

21/09/2021.headline: More Americans lost to coronavirus than 1918 flu pandemic, data reveals
21/09/2021.description: The latest grim milestone comes as the country is experiencing a fourth-wave driven by the highly contagious Delta variant.
21/09/2021.author: Nibir Khan

21/09/2021.headline: Black latex suit video an 'audition for couple with role-play fantasy', murder accused claims
21/09/2021.description: A man accused of murdering two people in a Victoria Park apartment claims a video found on his mobile phone was not a rehearsal for the killing.
21/09/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

21/09/2021.headline: Bushfire victim battled to save his mate's property
21/09/2021.description: An inquiry has heard David Harrison spent the last hours of his life in horrendous weather conditions, helping to save his best mate's property and cattle.
21/09/2021.author: Jessica Clifford

21/09/2021.headline: In Tasmania, deer aren't classified as pests. That's causing problems for farmers like Julian
21/09/2021.description: Australia has grappled with feral deer since they were introduced as game species in the 1800s — but deer populations are increasing and spreading.
21/09/2021.author: Ellen Coulter

21/09/2021.headline: COVID-19 positive woman charged with drink driving after allegedly flouting Canberra's lockdown rules
21/09/2021.description: Police warn Canberrans to obey the lockdown restrictions after allegedly catching a COVID-positive woman drink driving with passengers in the car while breaching home quarantine rules.
21/09/2021.author: Kate Christian

21/09/2021.headline: Police believed Aboriginal man was faking a medical episode before his death in custody, court hears
21/09/2021.description: An inquest into the death of an Aboriginal man in custody has heard the police officer who arrested him believed he was faking a medical episode in response to being arrested. Readers are advised that the following article contains the name of a person who has died.
21/09/2021.author: Mahalia Carter

21/09/2021.headline: Pilot responsible for DFO tragedy failed proficiency test before incident, court hears
21/09/2021.description: A Melbourne court hears a senior aviation safety inspector was forced to fail Max Quartermain during a proficiency test, two years before his deadly crash.
21/09/2021.author: Danny Tran

21/09/2021.headline: US government awards tender for $270m defence fuel storage facility in Darwin
21/09/2021.description: The biggest fuel storage facility in the Northern Territory will be built in Darwin in coming years in a $270 million US investment to support continued American defence operations in the Top End.
21/09/2021.author: Danny Tran

21/09/2021.headline: 'Writing a new story': Caleb Daniel reveals secrets behind Bulldogs resurrection
21/09/2021.description: As the Bulldogs prepare for their second grand final in six seasons, Daniel highlights how the club has risen to be on the cusp of just its third AFL flag.
21/09/2021.author: Georgie Tunny

21/09/2021.headline: ACT government sued over 'vile and racist' hangman drawing allegedly of Indigenous prisoner at Canberra's jail
21/09/2021.description: A man who says he was depicted in a hangman drawing on a whiteboard at Canberra's jail sues the ACT government for failing in its duty of care.
21/09/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

21/09/2021.headline: Michael Maguire to coach Wests Tigers in 2022 after avoiding sacking
21/09/2021.description: The Wests Tigers confirm the under-fire Maguire will continue as coach next season following a review of the club's football operations, despite again missing out on the finals.
21/09/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

21/09/2021.headline: Cy Walsh granted unsupervised leave from mental health facility
21/09/2021.description: The son of former Adelaide Crows coach Phil Walsh has been granted permission to leave the mental health facility where he lives without supervision.
21/09/2021.author: Mahalia Carter

21/09/2021.headline: Young man returns 'weak positive' COVID-19 result after travelling from SA to NSW
21/09/2021.description: Five close contacts of a young man who recently travelled to NSW are in quarantine, as SA Health investigates any potential "overlap" between the man's movements and those of six interstate truck drivers.
21/09/2021.author: Mahalia Carter

21/09/2021.headline: Four-year-old girl hit by car in Hobart in critical condition
21/09/2021.description: A Hobart child who is believed to have run out of her family's broken-down car on the side of a road is in a critical condition in hospital after being hit by another car.
21/09/2021.author: Liz Gwynn

21/09/2021.headline: Australian kids under 12 could get Pfizer jab before the end of the year
21/09/2021.description: Australian kids aged between five and 11 could get a COVID vaccine jab this year, depending on when and if Pfizer makes an application to the nation's medical regulator, Chief Nursing Officer Alison McMillan says.
21/09/2021.author: Georgia Hitch

21/09/2021.headline: Unvaccinated workers allowed on sites as NSW building industry to return to full capacity
21/09/2021.description: From next week the NSW construction industry will be permitted to operate at 100 per cent capacity and some unvaccinated workers will be able to return to work.
21/09/2021.author: Georgia Hitch

21/09/2021.headline: Sam Kerr set for 100th Matildas cap in match against Ireland
21/09/2021.description: Superstar striker Sam Kerr will play her 100th game for the Matildas when they face the Republic of Ireland in an international friendly on Wednesday.
21/09/2021.author: Georgia Hitch

21/09/2021.headline: 'He just looked like he wanted help': Canberra men pull kangaroo from Lake Burley Griffin
21/09/2021.description: Two Canberra men took an early morning dip in Lake Burley Griffin, to help a "shivering" kangaroo back onto dry land.
21/09/2021.author: Charlotte Gore

21/09/2021.headline: New WA ad targets apathetic West Australians as Premier flags tougher border to Victoria
21/09/2021.description: A new $3.6 million advertising campaign aims to tackle vaccine hesitancy as Premier Mark McGowan warns Victoria may move to an 'extreme risk' state.
21/09/2021.author: James Carmody

21/09/2021.headline: Rex to become Australia's first airline to fully vaccinate frontline staff
21/09/2021.description: The regional carrier says vaccinations will be mandatory for employees working at check-in and all pilots and cabin crew.
21/09/2021.author: Emily JB Smith and Jarrod Lucas

21/09/2021.headline: 'MVP of emmys': Conan O'Brien goes viral after trolling CEO, winners
21/09/2021.description: American media personality Conan O'Brien steals the show, trolling executives and winners and becoming an online sensation at the 2021 Emmy Awards.
21/09/2021.author: Melissa Maykin

21/09/2021.headline: Governments failing to heed 'paradigm change' call on ventilation to slow COVID spread, experts say
21/09/2021.description: Experts say Australia lags behind the rest of the world on regulating indoor air quality and it's about to become a very big deal in schools as cities and borders start to open up when vaccination targets are met.
21/09/2021.author: Emma Pollard

21/09/2021.headline: Thousands of Queenslanders waiting for public housing amid 'crisis'
21/09/2021.description: More than 2,000 households were added to the social housing register in Queensland last financial year, though demand is stabilising, according to the state government.
21/09/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

21/09/2021.headline: The wild west coast is slowly swallowing this town. Its people aren't giving up without a fight
21/09/2021.description: The residents of Fowlers Bay in South Australia are grappling with Mother Nature in an effort to save their cherished town from being engulfed by creeping sand dunes.
21/09/2021.author: Evelyn Leckie, Daniel Franklin, and Ruslan Kulski

21/09/2021.headline: 'Oh sugar, I hope they can't tell': Jane was just 36 when she lost all of her teeth
21/09/2021.description: Fourteen years ago Jane Bridges's cheeks swelled up and she was rushed to hospital. She now struggles with a problem dentists say is all too common.
21/09/2021.author: Lucy Shannon

21/09/2021.headline: Prime Minister Scott Morrison and US President Joe Biden meet on UN sidelines
21/09/2021.description: In his inaugural address to the United Nations as leader, Mr Biden rallies Australia and other fellow democracies to deal with he calls an "inflection point" in world history.
21/09/2021.author: Kathryn Diss

21/09/2021.headline: Leading epidemiologist warns NSW construction sites fully reopening is 'a bit dangerous'
21/09/2021.description: From Monday, the rule limiting NSW construction sites to 50 per cent capacity if they have any unvaccinated workers will be removed. A leading epidemiologist says that's taking a big risk.
21/09/2021.author: Tony Ibrahim

21/09/2021.headline: Wondering what Victoria's construction shutdown really means? Here's what we know
21/09/2021.description: Roadworks are off but landscaping at private homes is allowed, as the state's construction industry closes for a fortnight in the locked-down cities of Melbourne, Ballarat and Geelong.
21/09/2021.author: Elise Kinsella

21/09/2021.headline: Many carbon credits for deforestation could be 'nothing more than hot air', report finds
21/09/2021.description: A new analysis finds the level of deforestation "avoided" by carbon offset schemes is too high to have occurred in the first place, likening them to "paying someone not to drive to work when they never drove to begin with".
21/09/2021.author: Michael Slezak and Penny Timms

21/09/2021.headline: When a racing team entered their electric car in a petrol race, they were laughed at. Then they won
21/09/2021.description: A team of volunteers and electric vehicle enthusiasts took on the challenge of racing an EV against petrol cars in a "tarmac rally". It went pretty well.
21/09/2021.author: James Purtill

21/09/2021.headline: Job applications are about to change — and there's one big downside
21/09/2021.description: Hard and even soft copy resumes are becoming outdated, recruiters say: More employers literally want to see your face, and hear your voice, in a video clip,.
21/09/2021.author: David Taylor

21/09/2021.headline: Afraid of needles? India has developed the world's first DNA vaccine, and it's needle-free
21/09/2021.description: You've heard of Pfizer, Moderna and AstraZeneca, but what about Medigen and Zydus Cadila?
21/09/2021.author: Erin Handley

21/09/2021.headline: Revenge killings, forced evictions and the 'elimination of women': The Taliban are 'showing their real face'
21/09/2021.description: Two weeks after announcing their Cabinet, the Taliban are showing the people of Afghanistan and the world how they intend to rule: with "no mercy".
21/09/2021.author: Emily Clark

21/09/2021.headline: Morrison has upended defence policy. Are climate targets next?
21/09/2021.description: Rewriting our submarine deal required a frank assessment of global politics and power, and a willingness to take a difficult stand for a long-term objective. In the next six weeks, Scott Morrison has the chance to apply the same critical lens to climate change, writes Melissa Clarke.
21/09/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

21/09/2021.headline: Evergrande's collapse could be very bad news for Australia and the world. Here's why
21/09/2021.description: The financial woes of a developer half a world away wouldn't seem to have much direct impact on Australians' daily lives, but Evergrande's looming default is already sending shock waves Down Under and around the world of finance, writes David Taylor.
21/09/2021.author: David Taylor

21/09/2021.headline: 'I should have been safe': Can employers who expose their workers to COVID be sued?
21/09/2021.description: Angie's life was forever changed by COVID-19 and now she's considering legal action against the employers who put her at risk.
21/09/2021.author: Dana Morse

21/09/2021.headline: Trudeau has won a third term as PM, but Canada's 'shiny pony' appears to be losing some sheen
21/09/2021.description: He called an election two years ahead of schedule, hoping to turn the goodwill generated by his handling of the pandemic into a parliamentary majority. What went wrong for Justin Trudeau?
21/09/2021.author: Dana Morse

21/09/2021.headline: Live: The Matildas fall to defeat against battling Ireland in Dublin
21/09/2021.description: The Matildas have fallen to a disappointing defeat against the Republic of Ireland in their international friendly in Dublin. Follow all the action in our live blog.
21/09/2021.author: Simon Smale

21/09/2021.headline: India seizes $3.7 billion Afghan heroin haul amid Kabul takeover chaos
21/09/2021.description: Two people accused of trying to smuggle the drugs into India in shipping containers have been arrested.
21/09/2021.author: Simon Smale

21/09/2021.headline: First witness in Darwin CBD shooting trial gives evidence about alleged threat to kill
21/09/2021.description: The first witness in the trial of a man accused of killing four people in Darwin two years ago gives evidence about allegations he threatened to kill her at a property in Humpty Doo, near Darwin.
21/09/2021.author: Felicity James

21/09/2021.headline: High-roller room at Crown Perth stayed open in lockdown despite casino saying it had 'ceased all gaming activities'
21/09/2021.description: Crown Perth's high-roller room remained open during a COVID lockdown, in an apparent breach of WA government rules and in contradiction of the company's disclosures to the ASX, a royal commission hears.
21/09/2021.author: Rebecca Turner

21/09/2021.headline: European court finds Russia responsible for poisoning murder of former spy
21/09/2021.description: The European Court of Human Rights finds Russia responsible for the poisoning murder of former KGB officer Alexander Litvinenko.
21/09/2021.author: Rebecca Turner

21/09/2021.headline: Son of Wallabies great named in England rugby training squad
21/09/2021.description: Louis Lynagh, whose father Michael skippered the Wallabies, is named in England's extended 45-player squad, as former NRL coach Anthony Seibold begins working with Eddie Jones.
21/09/2021.author: Rebecca Turner

21/09/2021.headline: His last grand final was followed by a bitter trade. Four years on, Jake Lever has no regrets
21/09/2021.description: Jake Lever is the only Demon to have reached an AFL grand final, losing the 2017 decider with Adelaide. But he's approaching Saturday's Perth Stadium clash differently.
21/09/2021.author: Garrett Mundy

21/09/2021.headline: Iron ore price plunge 'very concerning' but McGowan says WA will ride out slump
21/09/2021.description: The iron ore price has halved in the past six weeks to $US106 a tonne and experts predict it may yet fall to $US70, but the WA government says there is no need for panic.
21/09/2021.author: Tara de Landgrafft

21/09/2021.headline: Tasmanian GP clinic closure has health service scrambling for solution for isolated community
21/09/2021.description: The Tasmanian government is scrambling to find a solution ahead of the closure of a regional Tasmanian GP clinic, with another clinic forced to turn away "dozens and dozens" of patients hoping to get on its books.
21/09/2021.author: Alexandra Alvaro

22/09/2021.headline: George Christensen stands by police 'thug' comments
22/09/2021.description: The comments draw condemnation from people including former Nationals leader Michael McCormack, who says the Queensland MP needs to be "brought into line".
22/09/2021.author: Tobi Loftus

22/09/2021.headline: COVID cases 'having visitors' over partly to blame for Kempsey lockdown, officials say
22/09/2021.description: Authorities said some of the infected people's failure to isolate "100 per cent" was a contributing factor to stay-at-home orders being imposed.
22/09/2021.author: Luisa Rubbo

22/09/2021.headline: Teen accused of Danny Hodgson assault facing 24 charges
22/09/2021.description: A teenage boy accused of assaulting Perth soccer player Danny Hodgson, who is fighting for his life in hospital, is facing more than 20 charges.
22/09/2021.author: David Weber

22/09/2021.headline: From junior footy to AFL grand final — the tight bond driving Clayton Oliver and Christian Petracca
22/09/2021.description: A "super strong friendship" that began in their school days underpins the connection the star Melbourne duo enjoy on the field, as they strive to deliver the club its first flag in 57 years.
22/09/2021.author: Georgie Tunny

22/09/2021.headline: Fire and ice: Queenslanders face 'paradox' of weather extremes in one wild day
22/09/2021.description: Fire and sleet on a wild day of weather that saw Queensland record its coldest September day in half a decade.
22/09/2021.author: Lucy Robinson and David Chen

22/09/2021.headline: Australia's international border reopened by Christmas, Tourism Minister hopes. But outbound travel is still unclear
22/09/2021.description: A truck driver who spent 48 hours in WA tests positive for COVID-19, the WA Health Minister says, but no restrictions are being enforced at this stage.
22/09/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

22/09/2021.headline: Prince Andrew served with a sexual assault lawsuit in US as Ghislaine Maxwell awaits trial
22/09/2021.description: The Duke of York is accused of historical sex crimes, allegedly committed at the residences of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and his associate Ghislaine Maxwell.
22/09/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

22/09/2021.headline: COVID-positive TV crew member in Byron Bay charged with health order breaches
22/09/2021.description: Locked-down mayors in northern NSW want the film industry called to account as a crew member is charged after allegedly visiting venues and failing to use QR codes.
22/09/2021.author: Hannah Ross

22/09/2021.headline: Men caught smuggling buckets of KFC and over $100,000 cash into locked-down Auckland
22/09/2021.description: Under alert level 4 in Auckland's lockdown, restaurants and food delivery services were closed – but that didn't stop these two men from getting their KFC.
22/09/2021.author: Hannah Ross

22/09/2021.headline: International border reopened by Christmas 'at the latest', Tourism Minister hopes
22/09/2021.description: Dan Tehan flags the international border will "hopefully" reopen by Christmas, saying by then states should have home quarantine arrangements set up for returning Australians.
22/09/2021.author: Georgia Hitch

22/09/2021.headline: China's strategy is about wearing us down – and the West is playing the wrong game
22/09/2021.description: Joe Biden says he is not seeking to start a new Cold War; Scott Morrison says we can avoid a new Cold War. But Cold War language of the status quo or revisionism doesn't explain the complexities of this historical moment, writes Stan Grant.
22/09/2021.author: Stan Grant

22/09/2021.headline: Two more COVID-related deaths as cases continue to rise in the Illawarra
22/09/2021.description: The man in his 70s and the woman in her 80s had both received jabs, but NSW Health says they had underlying conditions. Meanwhile a building in Wollongong's CBD has been deemed "high risk".
22/09/2021.author: Ainslie Drewitt-Smith

22/09/2021.headline: Afghan taekwondo athletes in Australia after daring escape from Taliban
22/09/2021.description: Seven female taekwondo athletes are planning life in Melbourne after completing quarantine following a rescue mission to get them out of Taliban-controlled Afghanistan.
22/09/2021.author: David Mark

22/09/2021.headline: Matildas great says Sam Kerr is a 'marked woman' in international football
22/09/2021.description: Julie Dolan, one of the pioneers of women's football in Australia, feels the Matildas need to draw some of the defensive attention away from Kerr.
22/09/2021.author: Daniela Intili

22/09/2021.headline: Fisherman's YouTube ban over animal cruelty claims
22/09/2021.description: An Albany angler has copped a temporary ban after the video giant said his content breached its animal cruelty policies.
22/09/2021.author: Tim Wong-See

22/09/2021.headline: COVID-19 infections surge in Newcastle and Lake Macquarie
22/09/2021.description: There are 45 new COVID cases in the Hunter, as local authorities reveal recent cases remained in the community while feeling sick.
22/09/2021.author: Bindi Bryce

22/09/2021.headline: 'Lost opportunities' to protect lives of seven children known to child protection system: coroner
22/09/2021.description: An inquest into the deaths of seven Tasmanian children finds while failures of Child Safety Service did not have a causal role in their deaths, there were "lost opportunities" to protect them.
22/09/2021.author: Alexandra Alvaro

22/09/2021.headline: The Storm offer Victorians free 2022 membership to say thanks
22/09/2021.description: The Melbourne Storm are showing their appreciation for the ongoing support of their Victorian fans by providing free memberships for the 2022 NRL season.
22/09/2021.author: Chloe Hart

22/09/2021.headline: Local council has power to decide fate of Clive Palmer’s company’s coal-fired power station project
22/09/2021.description: Clive Palmer's company Waratah Coal is quietly seeking approval from Barcaldine Regional Council for a new coal-fired power station in Central Queensland.
22/09/2021.author: Michael Atkin

22/09/2021.headline: Shire CEO accused of spending $50K of council cash on sex worker
22/09/2021.description: A Corruption and Crime Commission report tabled in WA Parliament accuses former Shire of Ravensthorpe chief executive Gavin Pollock of creating false invoices to pay the sex worker over a 12-month period.
22/09/2021.author: John Dobson and Kyle Pauletto

22/09/2021.headline: Witness at trial of body modifier denies woman who died after snowflake procedure was 'too high' to get help
22/09/2021.description: A witness in the trial of body modifier Brendan Russell denies a client declared she was "way too high" to see him immediately over a sore implant shortly before she died.
22/09/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

22/09/2021.headline: China – the world's largest carbon emitter – pledges to stop funding coal power abroad
22/09/2021.description: Xi Jinping's announcement is hailed by climate activists as a potential game-changer, as China and the US compete to show leadership on climate change at the UN.
22/09/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

22/09/2021.headline: Goodwin reveals how Daniher played crucial part in his coaching development
22/09/2021.description: Days out from Melbourne's first grand final since Neale Daniher's side made it in 2000, Simon Goodwin wins AFL Coach of the Year, and reveals Daniher's role in his early development.
22/09/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

22/09/2021.headline: Anxiety, anger, a sense of alienation: How anti-vaxxers, conspiracy theorists and the far-right have united on Melbourne streets
22/09/2021.description: Far right nationalists, anti-vaxxers, libertarians and conspiracy theorists have come together over COVID, and capitalised on the anger and uncertainty simmering in some sections of the community, writes Josh Roose.
22/09/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

22/09/2021.headline: Council manager takes ratepayer to court
22/09/2021.description: A Tasmanian council general manager takes legal action against a ratepayer and claims his reputation and profession have been "brought into ridicule".
22/09/2021.author: Manika Champ

22/09/2021.headline: US pledges to purchase and share 500 million more COVID vaccines with poor countries
22/09/2021.description: President Joe Biden doubles the United States' vaccine promise to help vaccinate 70 per cent of the world by September next year, as world leaders criticise the slow rollout of vaccines.
22/09/2021.author: Manika Champ

22/09/2021.headline: Environmentalist fears $420k Adani legal bill could bankrupt him
22/09/2021.description: Adani took the Brisbane man to court seeking compensation for business losses from his campaigns against contractors on its central Queensland mine with the protest group Galilee Blockade.
22/09/2021.author: George Roberts

22/09/2021.headline: Historic multi-million-dollar Sydney property at centre of development tug-of-war
22/09/2021.description: The owners of the historic Glenlee waterfront home, tucked away in Sydney's southern suburbs, want to sell to developers to build dozens of new homes, but the local council is fighting back.
22/09/2021.author: Tony Ibrahim

22/09/2021.headline: How effective is Victoria's plan for reopening schools?
22/09/2021.description: After 18 months of on-and-off home learning, the Victorian government has outlined how it plans to keep schools open when kids return to the classroom.
22/09/2021.author: Leonie Thorne

22/09/2021.headline: France will return its ambassador to the US after Biden and Macron phone call
22/09/2021.description: The US and French Presidents agree to meet in Europe at the end of the October as a joint statement acknowledges the AUKUS agreement could have "benefitted from open consultations".
22/09/2021.author: Leonie Thorne

22/09/2021.headline: Penny Wong questions impact of AUKUS deal on Australia's defence autonomy
22/09/2021.description: The Shadow Foreign Minister probes whether AUKUS will impact Australia's "sovereign capability" as the Vice Chief of the Defence Force prepares to visit South-East Asia to reassure neighbours about the submarine deal.
22/09/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

22/09/2021.headline: How COVID-19 is reviving Australian manufacturing
22/09/2021.description: Australian manufacturing rose at a record pace last year but the current lockdowns have slowed it right back down.
22/09/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

22/09/2021.headline: Worried about aftershocks? Here's what you should do
22/09/2021.description: Victorians have been warned to be ready for aftershocks in the wake of the Mansfield earthquake. But what should they do if they feel one? Here are some answers.
22/09/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

22/09/2021.headline: How much damage did COVID-19 do to our sporting nation? Here's what the data shows
22/09/2021.description: Many professional sporting codes have beaten the odds to complete another COVID-19 season, but the pandemic has dealt some blows – and not just financial ones.
22/09/2021.author: Cody Atkinson, Sean Lawson, and Paul Kennedy

22/09/2021.headline: 'Lying flat': The millennials quitting China's hard work culture to live 'free of anxiety'
22/09/2021.description: Li Chuang had a high pressure job in a Beijing publishing house. Then one day he quit and went to a monastery. He's never turned back.
22/09/2021.author: Cody Atkinson, Sean Lawson, and Paul Kennedy

22/09/2021.headline: Ministers pouring fuel on the fire with anti-lockdown, anti-mandate messages
22/09/2021.description: The pressure cooker of Melbourne's lengthy lockdowns hasn't helped. Nor have some of those trying to exploit the politics of the moment, writes David Speers.
22/09/2021.author: David Speers

22/09/2021.headline: Hate broccoli? Despise Brussels sprouts? Blame the bugs in your mouth
22/09/2021.description: You either love or loathe broccoli and cauliflower, and now researchers have found a new clue as to why kids in particular find these veggies offensive.
22/09/2021.author: Genelle Weule

22/09/2021.headline: Damage from earthquakes can be hidden. Here's what you should look for
22/09/2021.description: An unexpected earthquake has rattled south-eastern Australia, felt across four states. Here's what you should do to make sure your home is still safe.
22/09/2021.author: Maani Truu

22/09/2021.headline: Expectations rise for Wallabies, as fans dare to dream after Springbok wins
22/09/2021.description: Two outstanding wins over reigning world champions South Africa has Wallabies supporters determined not to get too far ahead of themselves — but the team's rise in the rankings inevitably raises expectations, writes Brett McKay.
22/09/2021.author: Brett McKay

22/09/2021.headline: Scientists and parents unite against potential changes to emmission offsets in NT
22/09/2021.description: Parents groups and climate scientists are appealing to the NT government not to ditch its commitment to offset all the emissions from a new fracking industry, a move it has foreshadowed in its greenhouse gas policies.
22/09/2021.author: Jane Bardon

22/09/2021.headline: Emotional snacking is hard to avoid, but there are other easy ways to spark joy in lockdown
22/09/2021.description: A south-west Sydney nutritionist says she has been receiving an increased amount calls from people struggling with binge eating to cope with the harsh lockdown.
22/09/2021.author: Erwin Renaldi

22/09/2021.headline: Infamous killer Carlos the Jackal launches court bid to cut life sentence
22/09/2021.description: The self-declared "professional revolutionary", who carried out attacks across the globe in the 1970s and 1980s and once took OPEC's oil ministers hostage, has been behind bars since being captured by French special forces in 1994. Now 71, he is appealing against his prison sentence.
22/09/2021.author: Erwin Renaldi

22/09/2021.headline: Shots fired at car carrying Ukrainian President's key aide in attack labelled assassination attempt
22/09/2021.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy says domestic or foreign powers could be behind the attack which saw more than more than 10 bullets fired at the car.
22/09/2021.author: Erwin Renaldi

22/09/2021.headline: Witness in Darwin CBD shooting trial tells court her partner tried to shield her from bullets
22/09/2021.description: On the second day of Benjamin Glenn Hoffmann's murder trial, witnesses who lived at or near the Palms Motel in Darwin's CBD have given evidence about the alleged gunman's movements.
22/09/2021.author: Felicity James

22/09/2021.headline: Patients and staff at Sydney hospital test positive for COVID after multiple outbreaks
22/09/2021.description: Twenty-four patients and five staff members, including an intensive care unit nurse, test positive for the virus at Liverpool Hospital, the local health service confir
22/09/2021.author: Felicity James

22/09/2021.headline: Olam's Dally M snub an NRL 'administrative error', Melbourne Storm says
22/09/2021.description: The NRL tells the Storm Justin Olam is in the running for the Dally M centre of the year award, after it appeared he had been omitted as a nominee.
22/09/2021.author: Felicity James

22/09/2021.headline: Adelaide teenager spared conviction over 'distressing' youth exploitation material charges
22/09/2021.description: A 19-year-old who previously pleaded guilty to four charges related to sharing, trading and selling child exploitation material online avoids conviction in the Adelaide Youth Court.
22/09/2021.author: Mahalia Carter

22/09/2021.headline: Police officer who fatally shot unarmed man wishes incident ended 'differently'
22/09/2021.description: A police officer believed an unarmed Vietnamese man may have been holding his mother hostage when he shot him dead, despite having met the woman on his way into the house.
22/09/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

22/09/2021.headline: Parramatta Eels confirm Blake Ferguson's departure as code switch looms
22/09/2021.description: Ferguson is not offered a contract extension by the Eels, with the ex-NSW and Kangaroos winger linked with a move to rugby union.
22/09/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

23/09/2021.headline: Regional aged care staff sacked after refusing COVID vaccine
23/09/2021.description: Centres in Broken Hill and Mildura are impacted after the federal government made it mandatory for all aged care staff, volunteers and students on placement to have received at least one dose by September 17.
23/09/2021.author: Jonathon Poulson and Bill Ormonde

23/09/2021.headline: ATAGI puts off decision on booster shots, but leaves door open for third doses for some
23/09/2021.description: The federal government's vaccine advisory body says some Australians might need a third dose of a COVID-19 vaccine to be best protected against the virus.
23/09/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

23/09/2021.headline: EnergyAustralia pledges to ditch coal by 2040
23/09/2021.description: One of the nation's biggest energy suppliers says it will aim for net zero emissions by 2050.
23/09/2021.author: Xanthe Gregory

23/09/2021.headline: 'Bike path rapist' admits to another attack on Queensland beach
23/09/2021.description: A chance sighting on a TV show led a victim to get her rape case reopened, and the attacker pleading guilty 15 years later.
23/09/2021.author: Jacqui Street

23/09/2021.headline: Wayne Bennett feels South Sydney Rabbitohs deserve more respect
23/09/2021.description: The Rabbitohs are playing in their fourth straight preliminary final, but the seven-time premiership coach believes they are unfairly overlooked as one of the NRL heavyweights.
23/09/2021.author: Chloe Hart

23/09/2021.headline: Vaccine push tackles conspiracy theories
23/09/2021.description: Authorities are hoping a boots-on-the-ground approach will help dispel vaccine myths spread on social media and by religious leaders.
23/09/2021.author: Saskia Mabin and Justin Fenwick

23/09/2021.headline: Anti-vaxxer chiropractor banned for 'dangerous' views
23/09/2021.description: A tribunal finds Simon Floreani's comments about childhood vaccines "flawed, inaccurate and dangerous", saying they had the potential to cause significant harm.
23/09/2021.author: Saskia Mabin and Justin Fenwick

23/09/2021.headline: 'A bit of brightness and love': Adelaide CBD blooms with thousands of flowers
23/09/2021.description: Thousands of brightly coloured flowers are bringing a smile to the faces of those who venture into the city today, as the council and state government try to lure people back to the CBD.
23/09/2021.author: Sarah Mullins and Stacey Pestrin

23/09/2021.headline: No end in sight for WA hotel quarantine as state chases $40m in hotel bills
23/09/2021.description: The WA Health Minister says the end of hotel quarantine is like asking 'how long is a piece of string' as he reveals about half of all hotel quarantine bills are still unpaid.
23/09/2021.author: Jessica Warriner

23/09/2021.headline: 'If we knew, we would never let him go — never, ever, ever': Family's first reunion since COVID hit
23/09/2021.description: Hobart mother Preet Chechi last saw her son nearly two years ago when he flew to India with his grandmother on a holiday. Then COVID-19 hit. Today, Preet can hug her boy again.
23/09/2021.author: Alexandra Alvaro and Andrew Cunningham

23/09/2021.headline: National Gallery of Australia commissions its most expensive acquisition — a mammoth sculpture representing diversity and inclusion
23/09/2021.description: Commissioned against a backdrop of a world afflicted by contagion, human loss and racial tension, Ouroboros will symbolise unity and diversity when it goes on display in the gallery's sculpture garden in 2024.
23/09/2021.author: Niki Burnside

23/09/2021.headline: Former Melbourne school principal Malka Leifer committed to stand trial over child sex abuse charges
23/09/2021.description: A former ultra-orthodox Jewish school principal who is facing dozens of child sex abuse charges vows to fight the allegations against her after being ordered to stand trial.
23/09/2021.author: Danny Tran

23/09/2021.headline: Couple charged after threats made against police during firearms audit at 'private sovereign property'
23/09/2021.description: A man and a woman are arrested and charged after threatening police officers who arrived at a regional South Australian property for a routine firearms audit on Thursday. The home was covered in signs telling people to stay off the property if they were "loyal to the satanic state".
23/09/2021.author: Danny Tran

23/09/2021.headline: It wasn't the earthquake that almost killed me, but the building that crushed my bus
23/09/2021.description: After Christchurch, New Zealand learned our lesson and reformed our building legislation. Victoria can skip the truly painful part of the lesson — the deaths and injuries in the streets — and turn straight to changing laws, writes Ann Brower.
23/09/2021.author: Danny Tran

23/09/2021.headline: Australian billionaires eye massive lot for sale in NSW Southern Highlands
23/09/2021.description: Real estate agent flooded with calls from Australian billionaires wanting to buy the largest landholding up for sale in the state's Southern Highlands.
23/09/2021.author: Ainslie Drewitt-Smith and Melinda James

23/09/2021.headline: Setka slammed for 'degrading', 'stigmatising' fruit picking comment
23/09/2021.description: Politicians, horticultural leaders and workers say John Setka was out of line to suggest violent protesters should leave Melbourne and "go pick fruit in Mildura".
23/09/2021.author: Emmie Dowling and Richard Crabtree

23/09/2021.headline: Caravan park owners 'stunned' by torrent of abuse over their vaccination stance
23/09/2021.description: On the banks of the Murray River, the owners of the Curlwaa Caravan Park are not backing down from their vaccination policy despite the trolling on social media.
23/09/2021.author: Richard Crabtree

23/09/2021.headline: Before the quake hit, did the animals at Mansfield's zoo 'know something was coming?'
23/09/2021.description: A seismology expert says animals feel the "first wave" of an earthquake before humans, which is why some of them give the impression they "know" something is happening.
23/09/2021.author: Mikaela Ortolan, Shannon Schubert, and Gladys Serugga

23/09/2021.headline: Man who took off with kids in car told acquaintance they 'would not see him again' before triple fatality
23/09/2021.description: A man who crashed his car with his young children in the back, killing three people including himself, was high on ice and had violently assaulted his partner before the collision, a Tasmanian coroner finds.
23/09/2021.author: April McLennan

23/09/2021.headline: Geelong's coaching exodus continues as Cats great quits
23/09/2021.description: Three-time premiership player Matthew Scarlett leaves his role as one of Chris Scott's assistant coaches, joining Matthew Knights and Corey Enright among the off-season departures since the club exited the finals.
23/09/2021.author: April McLennan

23/09/2021.headline: More than 100 close contacts of COVID-positive truck driver identified as Moderna vaccine rolls out in SA
23/09/2021.description: About 130 close contacts of an infected truck driver who passed through South Australia last week are now in quarantine as the Moderna vaccine becomes available at the state's pharmacies for anyone aged 12 or over.
23/09/2021.author: April McLennan

23/09/2021.headline: Grandma winched to safety after husband, grandkids swept off rocks
23/09/2021.description: A rescue helicopter has been called to help winch an elderly woman to safety after she was swept off rocks with her husband and two grandchildren south of Sydney.
23/09/2021.author: Ainslie Drewitt-Smith

23/09/2021.headline: Three members of Biloela family granted 12-month visa extension, lawyer says
23/09/2021.description: The Nadesalingam family seeking asylum in Australia are granted temporary visas allowing them to stay in Australia for another 12 months.
23/09/2021.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis and Paul Culliver

23/09/2021.headline: 'Hold off and calm down': Why next Friday may help Queenslanders to decide on Christmas travel plans
23/09/2021.description: A frustrated Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk tells Queenslanders eager to see interstate family and friends this Christmas to "take a deep breath" and wait for next Friday's National Cabinet meeting about the COVID-19 roadmap.
23/09/2021.author: Jessica van Vonderen

23/09/2021.headline: After enraging the French, Morrison turns to climate change and a new COVID challenge
23/09/2021.description: One is tempted to think Scott Morrison's hero must be Harry Houdini, the great escape artist. Put our Prime Minister in a corner, and he'll talk his way out, or try to, writes Michelle Grattan.
23/09/2021.author: Michelle Grattan

23/09/2021.headline: These three women had mastectomies. Today, only one has both breasts
23/09/2021.description: These three women fought for their lives and won, but is the system allowing them to truly recover?
23/09/2021.author: Mary Lloyd

23/09/2021.headline: Will 'revenge travel' derail Indonesia's success in flattening its second COVID wave?
23/09/2021.description: Indonesia's active COVID-19 cases has fallen from more than 570,000 in July to about 50,000. But experts are concerned so-called "revenge travel" as a result of eased travel restrictions could fuel yet another wave of the virus.
23/09/2021.author: Sastra Wijaya

23/09/2021.headline: Melbourne's AFL grand final run is about more than the players who'll run onto the ground
23/09/2021.description: Melbourne looks to break 57-year hoodoo on AFL grand final day, but its quest for the flag is equally about the loyal players, coaches and fans who've sustained the club through leaner times.
23/09/2021.author: Russell Jackson

23/09/2021.headline: Subsidies dubbed 'CoalKeeper' could be quashed, with states and territories revolting against federal government plan
23/09/2021.description: The federal government's plan to subsidise coal and gas-fired power stations could be thwarted, with states and territories moving to block the plan.
23/09/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

23/09/2021.headline: Are we about to see Melbourne's COVID curve start to bend?
23/09/2021.description: Mathematical modellers are hopeful vaccines will start to push Victoria's coronavirus cases down soon, but lagging vaccination levels in parts of Melbourne could yet be a problem, writes Casey Briggs.
23/09/2021.author: Casey Briggs

23/09/2021.headline: I'm vaccinated. What's my risk of catching COVID and passing it on?
