19/10/2021.description: State media announces more than 5,600 people arrested or wanted over their roles in anti-coup protests — including Aung San Suu Kyi's party spokesman and a famous comedian — are being released.
19/10/2021.author: Alexandra Humphries

19/10/2021.headline: 200 Queenslanders may die of COVID-19 when borders reopen, modelling predicts
19/10/2021.description: COVID-19 modelling suggests about 200 people in Queensland could die in the three months after borders reopen to New South Wales, Victoria and the ACT.
19/10/2021.author: Kate McKenna

19/10/2021.headline: 'Little me would be over the moon': Meet new yellow wiggle, Tsehay Hawkins
19/10/2021.description: Fifteen-year-old Latin dance champion, Tsehay Hawkins, takes over as Yellow Wiggle after trailblazer Emma Watkins calls time on her 11-year stint.
19/10/2021.author: Michael Doyle and Melissa Maykin

19/10/2021.headline: Albury aged care cluster claims life, officials 'expect more cases'
19/10/2021.description: A resident at the Mercy Place aged care facility in Albury has died after testing positive to COVID-19 and at least five other residents have the virus.
19/10/2021.author: Mikaela Ortolan and Erin Somerville

19/10/2021.headline: Wine exports to China down 77 per cent, but Hong Kong develops raging thirst
19/10/2021.description: Hong Kong's demand for Australian wine lifted by 135 per cent and South-East Asia by 43 per cent in the 12 months to September, showing Australian winemakers are diversifying away from their former key market.
19/10/2021.author: Sarina Locke and Cassandra Hough

19/10/2021.headline: 'The zip was open, Cleo was gone': Mother recalls last time she saw missing four-year-old daughter
19/10/2021.description: Ellie Smith says she has 'no idea' what happened to her daughter Cleo Smith as she recalls the last time she saw the four-year-old, who has been missing in WA's Gascoyne region since Saturday.
19/10/2021.author: James Carmody and Nicolas Perpitch

19/10/2021.headline: Woman raped, assaulted by ex-partner in Darwin says attacks 'changed the way I live'
19/10/2021.description: A woman who was physically and sexually assaulted by her ex-partner over the course of several days in May last year tells the NT Supreme Court the incident left her scarred and afraid.
19/10/2021.author: Melissa Mackay

19/10/2021.headline: Injured Boomers star ruled out of entire NBA season
19/10/2021.description: Australian centre Aron Baynes is still hopeful of continuing his NBA career, despite being sidelined for the upcoming season with a serious neck injury sustained during the Tokyo Olympics.
19/10/2021.author: Melissa Mackay

19/10/2021.headline: Young Aussie prospect chases Major League Baseball career after dreaming of playing in the AFL
19/10/2021.description: Adelaide's Curtis Mead wanted to be an AFL player as a teenager, but he is now laying the foundations of a promising professional baseball career in the United States.
19/10/2021.author: Neil Cross

19/10/2021.headline: Geraldton police officer accused of murder fights back tears as he recounts day of fatal shooting
19/10/2021.description: WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains an image of a person who has died. A police officer accused of murdering an Indigenous woman tells a court he thought she was going to stab him when he pulled the trigger and fatally shot her.
19/10/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

19/10/2021.headline: Tasmanian college apologises over skirt-length incident
19/10/2021.description: A Tasmanian principal has apologised after year 8 female students were asked to kneel to have their skirts measured
19/10/2021.author: Loretta Lohberger

19/10/2021.headline: Queensland holiday bookings are surging, but will international airlines stay away?
19/10/2021.description: Flight bookings and Christmas holiday inquiries are surging since the Queensland government announced its road map to reopen the state once double-dose vaccinations hit 80 per cent, but Brisbane Airport Corporation says the plan is too strict for overseas visitors.
19/10/2021.author: Nibir Khan

19/10/2021.headline: What the future will look like: SA's 'COVID-ready' plan to be released within days
19/10/2021.description: South Australia's Police Commissioner says the state's plan for how it will cope when the wave of COVID-19 enters the state will soon be released.
19/10/2021.author: Rebecca Opie

19/10/2021.headline: Search for missing fisher suspended after mask, spear gun and flippers found
19/10/2021.description: The 26-year-old went missing on Sunday afternoon, triggering a huge search operation. While there is no sign of the man, police say they've confirmed articles found on the ocean floor belonged to him.
19/10/2021.author: Jemima Burt

19/10/2021.headline: This 4yo called police — hear what happened next
19/10/2021.description: When you're four, the meaning of "emergency" can be flexible — in one New Zealand boy's case, he just really wanted to show police his toys.
19/10/2021.author: Jemima Burt

19/10/2021.headline: May stood down, NRL fines Panthers trio
19/10/2021.description: Tyrone May is stood down, while Nathan Cleary and Stephen Crichton are fined over their behaviour during Penrith's NRL grand final celebrations.
19/10/2021.author: Jemima Burt

19/10/2021.headline: Chief Minister's family fled home after address disclosed at anti-vaccine protest
19/10/2021.description: Michael Gunner says his wife and infant son had to leave their home address after it was disclosed in front of a large contingent of anti-vaccine protestors at the weekend.
19/10/2021.author: Jesse Thompson

19/10/2021.headline: Supreme Court dismisses challenges by unions, MP, in the wake of branch stacking scandal
19/10/2021.description: A group of 10 powerful unions and MP Marlene Kairouz have lost their legal challenges against the federal ALP's intervention in the Victorian branch after serious allegations emerged.
19/10/2021.author: Danny Tran and Richard Willingham

19/10/2021.headline: Qantas charged for standing down cleaner who had COVID-19 concerns about planes from China
19/10/2021.description: Qantas is facing criminal action for standing down a health and safety representative who spoke up about COVID-19 risks and instructed some workers to stop cleaning planes from China at the start of the pandemic.
19/10/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

19/10/2021.headline: Suspect in Norway attack used 'stabbing weapon' not bow and arrow to kill, say police
19/10/2021.description: Police say five people killed in a small Norwegian town last week were all stabbed to death and not shot with a bow and arrows as initially suspected.
19/10/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

19/10/2021.headline: SA public servant took advantage of children's poverty to exploit them sexually, court hears
19/10/2021.description: A retired senior public servant of 45 years preyed on the economic disadvantage of young children in the Philippines, forcing them to perform sex acts for him online, or starve, an Adelaide court hears.
19/10/2021.author: Claire Campbell

19/10/2021.headline: WA will not ease COVID-19 hard border with NSW and Victoria before Christmas
19/10/2021.description: WA stands firm on its hard border with Victoria and NSW, refusing to open to those states before Christmas, as other jurisdictions roll out clear roadmaps for reopening. But travellers from Queensland will no longer need to quarantine from Friday.
19/10/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

19/10/2021.headline: Melbourne community group received $75,000 of taxpayer funds, which its leader pocketed most of, IBAC hears
19/10/2021.description: A corruption inquiry hears the Mayor of a Melbourne council successfully lobbied for state government grants to be given to the Somali Australian Council Of Victoria, a "recruiting ground" for the Labor Party.
19/10/2021.author: Bridget Rollason

19/10/2021.headline: Waiting for a new car? Blame the 'devastating' invasive stink bug
19/10/2021.description: Australians waiting months for new cars in the midst of a global parts shortage may have to wait even longer as cargo ships are fumigated offshore to kill an invasive stink bug.
19/10/2021.author: Lucy Stone and Rebecca Levingston

19/10/2021.headline: More wild weather brewing for Queensland as authorities brace for 'state of extremes'
19/10/2021.description: Large hail, damaging winds and heavy rain are expected across parts of central and south-east Queensland again today, while other parts of the state experiences heatwave conditions.
19/10/2021.author: Jessica Rendall

19/10/2021.headline: What happens when a community bands together to fight childhood obesity?
19/10/2021.description: Childhood obesity affects one in four Australian children. Now, a team of researchers believe they have found a way to help bring that number down
19/10/2021.author: Daniel Miles

19/10/2021.headline: 'I actually got quite emotional': Canberrans excited to reunite with family members across NSW
19/10/2021.description: Catherine Gill's children haven't seen their grandparents in three years, but following yesterday's announcement easing travel restrictions with NSW, that will soon change.
19/10/2021.author: Antoinette Radford and Harry Frost

19/10/2021.headline: Fears hospitality staff could become 'COVID cops', face spike in abuse in plan for vaccine-only venues
19/10/2021.description: A plan to require Queensland venues to check if patrons are vaccinated against COVID-19 sparks concern that hospitality staff could become "COVID cops" and face increased abuse.
19/10/2021.author: Phoebe Hosier

19/10/2021.headline: Massage parlour operators who threatened to kill families of underpaid staff breached workplace laws, court finds
19/10/2021.description: Operators of a Canberra massage parlour who threatened to kill family members of workers if they complained are found to have breached workplace laws.
19/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

19/10/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: Train strike in Sydney expected to cause long delays
19/10/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Sydney Trains urges commuters to consider other modes of transport as train workers take industrial action.
19/10/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

19/10/2021.headline: Would you survive the Squid Game dalgona challenge?
19/10/2021.description: The hit TV thriller Squid Game has brought the frighteningly fragile sweet treat dalgona to the world but, for two Tasmanian Koreans, it has taken them back to their childhood.
19/10/2021.author: Georgie Burgess

19/10/2021.headline: Health authorities list new tier 1 COVID-19 exposure sites in Victoria
19/10/2021.description: New tier 1 exposure sites have been listed in Bendigo, Donald, and Traralgon.
19/10/2021.author: Georgie Burgess

19/10/2021.headline: How much do you really know about The Wiggles? Put your knowledge to the test
19/10/2021.description: What were The Wiggles called before they donned the iconic skivvies? And how does the yellow Wiggle get around? Test you knowledge with our quiz.
19/10/2021.author: Georgie Burgess

19/10/2021.headline: What's happening in SA's parliament and why could it spell trouble for the Attorney-General?
19/10/2021.description: South Australia's Attorney-General Vickie Chapman is facing an inquiry into her conduct — it's just one of the unfolding consequences of a recent Liberal backbench defection. Here's what's been happening in state parliament.
19/10/2021.author: Leah MacLennan

19/10/2021.headline: What do vertical childcare, eco-tourism and e-scooters have in common? They're all part of UTAS's plans for its retiring Sandy Bay campus
19/10/2021.description: As the University of Tasmania progresses its move into the Hobart CBD, it is creating plans for its old Sandy Bay campus.
19/10/2021.author: Alexandra Alvaro

19/10/2021.headline: Closed borders kept this couple apart for 551 days — this is how they finally reunited
19/10/2021.description: Despite never having local transmission in the Solomon Islands, Australia refused to let Tommy come join Stephanie over here.
19/10/2021.author: Jordan Fennell

19/10/2021.headline: A look back at why the Australian cricket team has never won the men's T20 World Cup
19/10/2021.description: In six attempts, Australia's cricket team has never won the men's T20 World Cup. We look at Australia’s history in the tournament as it attempts to lift the trophy for the first time in Dubai.
19/10/2021.author: Duncan Huntsdale

19/10/2021.headline: Sarah Snook says we're obsessed with Succession because its fun to watch angry and conniving people
19/10/2021.description: Australian actor Sarah Snook says one of the most intriguing elements of Succession, in which she plays Shiv Roy, is that while members of the family fail, they have a propensity to fail upwards.
19/10/2021.author: Ahmed Yussuf

19/10/2021.headline: Remote workers might save rural USA. But they can also drive up house prices and tempt hungry bears
19/10/2021.description: Shrinking American towns and cities are tempting remote workers with big cash bonuses to relocate. But an influx of new residents can also drive up property prices, put a strain on resources and, in one case, lure bears.
19/10/2021.author: Peter Jones and Barbara Miller

19/10/2021.headline: More than 40 Australian children still languishing in Syrian detention camp
19/10/2021.description: Australian children left behind by Islamic State are facing indefinite detention in north-east Syria with little hope of being released.
19/10/2021.author: Suzanne Dredge and Alex McDonald

19/10/2021.headline: How phones and two tech giants helped shape NSW's pandemic response
19/10/2021.description: Wherever your phone was, tech giants tracked its movement, helping university researchers in their modelling on the pandemic and informing the roadmap out of lockdown.
19/10/2021.author: Catherine Hanrahan

19/10/2021.headline: We can rein in the power of big tech companies like Facebook with three simple words
19/10/2021.description: Far from unassailable, Facebook and Google act like organisations terrified they are about to peak. But we can make it harder for them to buy growth, writes Peter Martin.
19/10/2021.author: Catherine Hanrahan

19/10/2021.headline: When will this end? How the transition from pandemic to endemic might look
19/10/2021.description: The COVID-19 pandemic won't end with a bang, but more likely a fizzle — and a long, protracted one at that.
19/10/2021.author: Olivia Willis

19/10/2021.headline: Tribal wars, a kidnapping and the long journey home of a stolen Maori treasure
19/10/2021.description: For more than a century, the sacred treasure was hidden in a New Zealand swamp. Then it was sold off and spirited away to Europe. This is how it was returned.
19/10/2021.author: Simon Leo Brown and Marc Fennell

19/10/2021.headline: Philadelphia suspend Ben Simmons after training incident before Joel Embiid delivers scathing remarks
19/10/2021.description: The relationship between Australian NBA star Ben Simmons and his club the Philadelphia 76ers continues to break down as they suspend him over an incident in training.
19/10/2021.author: Paul Johnson

19/10/2021.headline: Moscow residents aged over 60 to be locked down as nation battles daily high COVID death tolls
19/10/2021.description: As Russia's daily death toll continues to reach new highs, Muscovites aged 60 and over are told they will hae to stay at home for the next four months in a bid to curb the trend.
19/10/2021.author: Paul Johnson

19/10/2021.headline: Tax Office boss facing Senate investigation after refusing to provide JobKeeper details to parliament
19/10/2021.description: The Senate had ordered ATO boss Chris Jordan to reveal the names of businesses with a turnover of $10 million that received taxpayer funds, but he has refused, citing privacy provisions.
19/10/2021.author: Nour Haydar and Matthew Doran

19/10/2021.headline: Foreign spies a bigger threat to Australia than terrorism in coming years, ASIO warns
19/10/2021.description: ASIO's director-general says while the threat of terrorism should not be understated, foreign actors trying to interfere in Australia's affairs is the country's most pressing threat going forward.
19/10/2021.author: Matthew Doran

19/10/2021.headline: North Korea test-fires submarine-launched ballistic missile
19/10/2021.description: North Korea launches at least one ballistic missile into the sea, testing what South Korea's military described as a weapon likely designed for submarine-based launches.
19/10/2021.author: Matthew Doran

20/10/2021.headline: Traditional owners and climate advocates slam NT's approval of more fracking in Beetaloo Basin
20/10/2021.description: Empire Energy says drilling will start before the end of this month, while climate groups have accused the NT government of throwing "petrol on a burning house".
20/10/2021.author: Jacqueline Breen and Samantha Dick

20/10/2021.headline: Leaked contracts reveal Pfizer's power to 'silence' governments and 'maximize profits', consumer group alleges
20/10/2021.description: Under secretive contracts, pharmaceutical company Pfizer has the power to block countries from donating their COVID-19 vaccines to other nations, and can demand that governments put up their public assets as collateral.
20/10/2021.author: David Chau

20/10/2021.headline: Shopping centre roof collapses as golf ball-sized hail, ferocious winds slam into NSW city
20/10/2021.description: The SES has fielded hundreds of calls after a savage hailstorm lashed Coffs Harbour and its surrounds this afternoon, damaging homes and businesses and leaving some residents wishing they had snow chains for their tyres.
20/10/2021.author: Emma Siossian, Luisa Rubbo, and Keely Johnson

20/10/2021.headline: Government blocks bid to investigate Christian Porter over legal fee donation
20/10/2021.description: The Coalition blocks a bid to have former attorney-general Christian Porter investigated over his financial disclosures, despite the Speaker of the House having argued there was a case for further scrutiny.
20/10/2021.author: Matthew Doran

20/10/2021.headline: Victoria's largest meat processor found guilty following employee's death
20/10/2021.description: Almost four years after the death of one of its employees in western Victoria, Midfield Meats has been found guilty on one of two charges for failing to provide a safe work environment.
20/10/2021.author: Rosanne Maloney

20/10/2021.headline: Celeste Barber on $51m bushfire fundraiser: 'It broke my heart that it didn't fix everything'
20/10/2021.description: Celeste Barber's fundraiser during the Black Summer brushfires drew global attention and broke records, but the comedian and actor says she felt the pressure on her growing.
20/10/2021.author: Rosanne Maloney

20/10/2021.headline: More than 120,000 lightning strikes recorded as severe storms whip through central Queensland
20/10/2021.description: More than 120,000 lightning strikes are recorded at Mackay as intense storms hammer parts of central Queensland, with reports of giant hail, fast-paced winds and localised heavy rain.
20/10/2021.author: Rosanne Maloney

20/10/2021.headline: China tests world's largest rocket engine powered by high-energy gunpowder
20/10/2021.description: China test fires the world's most powerful solid rocket engine, with the largest thrust, powered by 150 tons of solid fuel.
20/10/2021.author: Rosanne Maloney

20/10/2021.headline: Perth mother felt 'relieved' after pouring bleach down sick baby's feeding tube, court hears
20/10/2021.description: A Perth mother 'needed a good night's sleep' and felt 'relieved and relaxed' after feeding bleach to her sick child, a court hears, while her lawyer argues the incident was 'a cry for help'.
20/10/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

20/10/2021.headline: Police investigating after bones found in sand dunes near Robe
20/10/2021.description: SA Police say a member of the public found bones at Nora Creina this morning. Forensic investigators will examine the scene tomorrow.
20/10/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

20/10/2021.headline: Why is this WA suburb slipping down a hill?
20/10/2021.description: The WA government commissions an independent geotechnical report to investigate a slow-moving landslip on the south coast, as residents refuse to leave their homes despite safety concerns.
20/10/2021.author: Kyle Pauletto and Tom Edwards

20/10/2021.headline: Mining industry fears attracting women may be harder than ever, FIFO sexual harassment inquiry told
20/10/2021.description: The head of WA's resource industry peak body tells a parliamentary inquiry into sexual harassment in the FIFO industry that attracting women to the sector is a struggle.
20/10/2021.author: Briana Shepherd and Eliza Borrello

20/10/2021.headline: Man located at Silverwater jail charged with murder of caravan park resident
20/10/2021.description: A 39-year-old man has been charged with the murder of Jervis Bay resident David McArthur at Palm Beach Caravan Park in July.
20/10/2021.author: Jessica Clifford

20/10/2021.headline: Ambulance Tasmania vows to improve workplace culture
20/10/2021.description: Ambulance Tasmania commits to overhauling its workplace culture in the face of "concerning" feedback from staff, as the organisation braces for the findings of an inquest into the death of one of its paramedics.
20/10/2021.author: Jessica Clifford

20/10/2021.headline: 'Australia is still the dinosaur': UN report says government funding of fossil fuels contributing to warming
20/10/2021.description: Despite climate targets being ramped up, the world is set to increase the production of fossil fuels all the way to 2040 and beyond, producing nearly triple as much as is compatible with stopping global warming at 1.5 degrees Celsius.
20/10/2021.author: Michael Slezak and Lori Youmshajekian

20/10/2021.headline: 'A dumpling on legs': Native mouse thought extinct found on Flinders Island
20/10/2021.description: A native species of mouse that was last seen in Tasmania's north-east 17 years ago has been caught on camera on Flinders Island — sniffing a stick dipped in peanut butter.
20/10/2021.author: April McLennan

20/10/2021.headline: Critically endangered 'Goldilocks' birds gifted 13,000ha of habitat by farmers
20/10/2021.description: About 25 private landholders and the NSW government have set aside conservation habitat across about 200 kilometres for one of Australia's rarest birds, the plains-wanderer.
20/10/2021.author: Shannon Corvo

20/10/2021.headline: Search to focus on third missing person, after two bodies wash ashore
20/10/2021.description: Two bodies wash ashore during a search for three people missing at sea off Tasmania's north-west coast for two days.
20/10/2021.author: Shannon Corvo

20/10/2021.headline: WA Premier says fines will be issued if workers don't get vaccinated, with spot checks for businesses
20/10/2021.description: Most workers in Western Australia will be subjected to mandatory vaccination, Premier Mark McGowan announces, as the number of people fully vaccinated approaches 60 per cent.
20/10/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

20/10/2021.headline: Details of Sport Integrity Australia's probe of women's football to be released
20/10/2021.description: Football Australia says an announcement of the details and scope of the investigation into allegations of inappropriate behaviour in women's football is days away, as the Matildas prepare for their first match on home soil since 2020.
20/10/2021.author: Chloe Hart

20/10/2021.headline: Search for missing four-year-old girl Cleo Smith growing more urgent every hour, police warn
20/10/2021.description: Mounted police join the search for Cleo Smith as it enters a fifth day around the Blowholes campsite in WA's Gascoyne region, amid fears she may have been abducted and may not even be in the area anymore.
20/10/2021.author: James Carmody

20/10/2021.headline: Mills shines in Nets debut but Bucks win
20/10/2021.description: Patty Mills has continued his exceptional form from the Olympics into the opening night of the NBA, scoring 21 points in Brooklyn's defeat in Milwaukee.
20/10/2021.author: James Carmody

20/10/2021.headline: 'Just stop so that I can kill you': Chilling details revealed as convicted jihadi pleads guilty to more terror charges
20/10/2021.description: Momena Shoma had a "strange smile" on her face and was seen laughing after trying to drive a pair of garden shears into a fellow inmate's neck, the Supreme Court of Victoria hears.
20/10/2021.author: Danny Tran

20/10/2021.headline: Thousands wait for Queensland border pass as lucky few enter as part of home quarantine trial
20/10/2021.description: Jane Caswell is grateful to be chosen for a home quarantine trial in Queensland, with the latest data revealing about 13,000 people are still waiting to have their border pass applications processed.
20/10/2021.author: Ashleigh Stevenson

20/10/2021.headline: Mian built a new home for his family. Two weeks before moving in he was told the house would be demolished
20/10/2021.description: Dozens of residents will lose their homes to make way for a public transport project planned for the Brisbane 2032 Olympics.
20/10/2021.author: Rachel McGhee

20/10/2021.headline: Soldiers body-shamed after photos taken on military bases posted to Instagram with 'cruel' comments
20/10/2021.description: Defence says it was trying to shut down a social media account that body-shamed soldiers and complained to Facebook but was told the page did not breach the social media company's policies.
20/10/2021.author: Rory Callinan

20/10/2021.headline: Why more women are choosing a solo van life over traditional bricks and mortar
20/10/2021.description: Hitting the open road in search of adventure sounds undeniably romantic, but for many women living the solo van life, it's more about economic necessity than escapism.
20/10/2021.author: Tom Forbes and Nicole Dyer

20/10/2021.headline: Family wins two-year battle against Public Trustee to keep brother's financial independence
20/10/2021.description: Two years and $80,000 later, Sue Nunn stops the Public Trustee of Queensland from charging a family member 40 per cent of his disability pension to administer his finances.
20/10/2021.author: Amy Sheehan

20/10/2021.headline: It's been a strange month for Vivian — she had to visit a petrol station.
20/10/2021.description: Watching petrol prices is something Vivian and her husband used to do all the time until they bought their first electric car. After unexpectedly finding themselves back at the pump, they're not loving the old routine.
20/10/2021.author: Sarah Motherwell

20/10/2021.headline: 'Australia's responsibility': Advocates call for action as refugees struck down with COVID-19 in PNG
20/10/2021.description: Bangladeshi refugee Nurul Islam says he is scared for his unvaccinated wife and five-month-old daughter after they tested positive to COVID-19 in Papua New Guinea.
20/10/2021.author: Marian Faa

20/10/2021.headline: Outback council's 'free land' scheme attracts flood of enquiries, overseas interest
20/10/2021.description: Quilpie's council has fielded more than 215 enquiries since a plan to ease its housing crisis by refunding the total cost of 28 blocks of land made international headlines 10 days ago.
20/10/2021.author: Ellie Grounds

20/10/2021.headline: Overseas holidays are making a comeback. But they’re going to require a lot more trav-min
20/10/2021.description: As Australia prepares to reopen international borders for fully vaccinated travellers, many are planning their next getaway. But before you start packing, there are a few other things you need to consider.
20/10/2021.author: Lucy Sweeney

20/10/2021.headline: China Evergrande to face its day of reckoning as a formal default looms. So what happens next?
20/10/2021.description: The 30-day grace period for a bond interest payment that Evergrande initially missed will expire this week. If no payments are made, a formal default will occur, meaning creditors could place the company into liquidation.
20/10/2021.author: Samuel Yang

20/10/2021.headline: You might get exposed to COVID as Victorian reopens. But don't expect a call from contact tracers
20/10/2021.description: As vaccination rates hit milestones and case numbers grow, epidemiologists say Victorians are still catching up to the changed approach to contact tracing that accompanies learning to live with COVID-19.
20/10/2021.author: Sian Johnson

20/10/2021.headline: Eddie Obeid, son Moses and Ian Macdonald face jail over Bylong mine conspiracy
20/10/2021.description: Former Labor Minister Eddie Obeid may be heading back to jail after being found guilty over the Bylong Valley coal exploration licence conspiracy.
20/10/2021.author: Jamelle Wells

20/10/2021.headline: A sports car could be the key to solving latest Sydney gangland killings
20/10/2021.description: Police narrow in on a Ford Mustang as they hunt down those responsible for the brazen daylight shootings of two Sydney men who were part of the infamous Hamze family.
20/10/2021.author: Mridula Amin

20/10/2021.headline: Aboriginal group threatens action over lack of Marinus Link consultation
20/10/2021.description: An Aboriginal group says a Tasmanian government business has failed to properly consult on a multi-billion dollar project planned to run through an "incredibly sensitive" area subject to a native title claim.
20/10/2021.author: Mridula Amin

20/10/2021.headline: Courtney was heavily pregnant when she was potentially exposed to COVID in hospital. She's not happy with how it was handled
20/10/2021.description: WorkSafe Victoria issues improvement notices to Latrobe Regional Hospital in Gippsland after staff and patients raised concerns about how the hospital dealt with a recent COVID case.
20/10/2021.author: Elise Kinsella and Jarrod Whittaker

20/10/2021.headline: Everything you need to know about Sydney's gangland war
20/10/2021.description: There's a long history of violence police link to turf wars in Sydney's south-west. Here are the main figures from both families.
20/10/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

20/10/2021.headline: Joel dresses up as a polar bear in the Arctic and waits for wildlife to charge at him
20/10/2021.description: Joel Berger studies animals that live at the edges of the world, often getting dangerously close, in order to understand the impacts of climate change.
20/10/2021.author: Nick Baker

20/10/2021.headline: How the rise of COVID-19 crushed the flu — and maybe wiped one virus out forever
20/10/2021.description: The Yamagata flu virus, one of four flu viruses we're vaccinated against each year, hasn't been recorded anywhere in the world since April 2020.
20/10/2021.author: Belinda Smith

20/10/2021.headline: Experts say non-COVID states missing out on vaccine 'maximum protection period'
20/10/2021.description: Experts say the research showing a waning efficacy of the Pfizer and AstraZeneca vaccines means a slower rollout could equate to more circulation of the virus when the states eventually open up, putting the vulnerable at risk
20/10/2021.author: Nick Sas

20/10/2021.headline: The policy dance on net zero suits both the Nationals and the Liberals but for very different reasons
20/10/2021.description: There are performances worthy of a theatre show being acted out at Parliament House at the moment, but there are only a few more days before the house lights are turned on and voters can see beyond the stage in front of them.
20/10/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

20/10/2021.headline: Parkland school shooter pleads guilty to 17 counts of murder
20/10/2021.description: Nikolas Cruz committed one of America's deadliest school shootings. In pleading guilty to 17 counts of murder he now faces a penalty trial that will decide whether he is executed or spends life in prison without the possibility of parole.
20/10/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

20/10/2021.headline: Australia condemns China's trade tactics at World Trade Organization
20/10/2021.description: Saying there is a "growing gap" between China's actions and its rhetoric, Australia's World Trade Organization representative argues China is acting contrary to WTO rules.
20/10/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

20/10/2021.headline: Aussie top order undone by spin yet again in final T20 World Cup warm-up
20/10/2021.description: No-one in Australia's top three manages to get out of single digits as India romps home to win their Twenty20 World Cup warm-up match by eight wickets.
20/10/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

20/10/2021.headline: Jailed Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny awarded EU's top human rights prize
20/10/2021.description: Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny may still be imprisoned in Russia but it has not stopped him being awarded the European Union's top human rights prize.
20/10/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

21/10/2021.headline: Prisoners occupy roof as 'dangerous' protest erupts at Queensland jail
21/10/2021.description: About 30 prisoners have "retreated" to a roof after trouble involving damaged property and threats to other prisoners started at Capricornia Correctional Centre.
21/10/2021.author: Jasmine Hines and Guy Williams

21/10/2021.headline: AFL introduces no jab no play COVID-19 vaccination policy
21/10/2021.description: COVID-19 vaccination will be mandatory for AFL and AFLW players and staff, with those who refuse possibly being put on an inactive list or having their contracts terminated by agreement.
21/10/2021.author: Jasmine Hines and Guy Williams

21/10/2021.headline: Woman struck and pinned by vehicle in Alice Springs possible domestic violence incident, police say
21/10/2021.description: The 33-year-old woman was hit and injured while she was walking through a car park in Alice Springs, and police say they have identified her partner as a person of interest.
21/10/2021.author: Jasmine Hines and Guy Williams

21/10/2021.headline: Queensland parliamentary committee urged to terminate CCC chair over Logan council probe
21/10/2021.description: A parliamentary inquiry into the Queensland Crime and Corruption Commission's fraud investigation into Logan City Council hears the committee could recommend parliament terminate the head of the watchdog, Alan MacSporran.
21/10/2021.author: Kate McKenna

21/10/2021.headline: Tennant Creek Aboriginal leaders say $80m aid package prompted by toddler's rape is being misdirected
21/10/2021.description: Aboriginal traditional owners in the Central Australian town of Tennant Creek are accusing governments of misdirecting an $80 million assistance package promised following the rape of a toddler three years ago.
21/10/2021.author: Jane Bardon

21/10/2021.headline: India celebrating after administering 1 billion COVID-19 vaccine doses
21/10/2021.description: Indian authorities are prepare to celebrate the milestone by holding music events and lighting up national monuments, but only 30 per cent of the country's eligible population is fully vaccinated.
21/10/2021.author: Jane Bardon

21/10/2021.headline: Before MONA, Tom Samek 'lit the place up' with his 'quirky, witty, engaging' art
21/10/2021.description: Tom Samek's contributions to Tasmania's arts scene and broader community are being remembered.
21/10/2021.author: Liz Gwynn

21/10/2021.headline: Giddey impresses in NBA debut for Thunder but Jazz win
21/10/2021.description: Australian rookie Josh Giddey's Oklahoma City Thunder fall short in their NBA season-opener against Joe Ingles's Utah Jazz.
21/10/2021.author: Liz Gwynn

21/10/2021.headline: Plans to relax WA border with Queensland dumped after Gold Coast man infectious for days
21/10/2021.description: Western Australia's border with Queensland will not be relaxed tomorrow as previously announced, after a new COVID-19 case was detected in Queensland.
21/10/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

21/10/2021.headline: Top diplomat says US 'looking for increased ambition' from Australia on emissions targets
21/10/2021.description: US charge d'affaires Mike Goldman tells a climate conference the Morrison government's commitments to cut emissions "will be noticed" by the US, Europe and China.
21/10/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

21/10/2021.headline: Eddie Obeid jailed, then immediately given bail, after lawyers raise jail COVID-19 concerns
21/10/2021.description: Former Labor minister Eddie Obeid is jailed over a mine licence conspiracy, then released on bail minutes later after his lawyers lodge an appeal in a dramatic Supreme Court hearing in Sydney.
21/10/2021.author: Jamelle Wells

21/10/2021.headline: Woolworths, Coles, Aldi to mandate COVID-19 vaccinations for staff
21/10/2021.description: Supermarket giants Woolworths and Aldi announce plans to mandate COVID-19 vaccinations for all staff across Australia, but Coles will only require workers in NSW, Victoria and the ACT to get the jab.
21/10/2021.author: Samuel Yang

21/10/2021.headline: Federal Court issues arrest warrant for alleged fraudster Bill Papas
21/10/2021.description: The Federal Court issues a warrant for the arrest of alleged fraudster Bill Papas, the former president of Sydney Olympic Football Club, paving the way for his  extradition from Greece.
21/10/2021.author: David Chau

21/10/2021.headline: Australia's third-richest person to invest $1.5b in fight against climate change
21/10/2021.description: Atlassian co-founder Mike Cannon-Brookes says he's putting up the huge sum in a bid to help dramatically reduce carbon emissions by 2030.
21/10/2021.author: Justin Huntsdale

21/10/2021.headline: 'Apathy' blamed for department's long delay after ancient trees bulldozed
21/10/2021.description: Two years after widespread "illegal" land clearing on Yakka Munga Station in the Kimberley, traditional owners are still waiting to learn if the pastoral company will be held to account.
21/10/2021.author: Vanessa Mills

21/10/2021.headline: Man who stabbed and bashed his boss to death granted bail
21/10/2021.description: Jordan Van Doorn, who repeatedly stabbed his boss and bashed him in the head with a spanner, told police he was acting in self-defence when he killed him, after being hit first "unexpectedly and without warning", a court hears.
21/10/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

21/10/2021.headline: Police believe missing four-year-old Cleo Smith was abducted, $1 million reward offered
21/10/2021.description: WA Police say they believe Cleo Smith was abducted from her family's tent, as Premier Mark McGowan announces a million-dollar reward for information about her disappearance.
21/10/2021.author: Jacob Kagi and James Carmody

21/10/2021.headline: Man who punched elderly victim in random attack pleads guilty to manslaughter
21/10/2021.description: A man who caused the death of an elderly man by punching him in the face in an unprovoked attack in Adelaide's CBD has pleaded guilty to manslaughter.
21/10/2021.author: Candice Prosser

21/10/2021.headline: NSW families to receive $250 vouchers as 'thank you' for homeschooling
21/10/2021.description: Premier Dominic Perrottet says the vouchers are a "thank you to every single mum and dad" who took up homeschooling during lockdown.
21/10/2021.author: Candice Prosser

21/10/2021.headline: Been waiting for a parcel? A national strike by StarTrack workers could further slow the strained network
21/10/2021.description: StarTrack workers are taking strike action across Australia today as they try to negotiate a new agreement with the company, which is owned by Australia Post. There are fears the action will cause more parcel delivery delays across the network.
21/10/2021.author: Candice Prosser

21/10/2021.headline: 'Serious injustice': Indigenous fishers call for moratorium on prosecutions for cultural catch
21/10/2021.description: Aboriginal people account for a disproportionate number of jail terms for fisheries offences on the NSW South Coast.
21/10/2021.author: Joshua Becker

21/10/2021.headline: Mildura's lockdown to lift early despite worries about Indigenous population
21/10/2021.description: Mildura will have some freedoms restored as of midnight tonight, but the lagging vaccination rate among Aboriginal communities continues to worry authorities.
21/10/2021.author: Alexandra Treloar and Richard Crabtree

21/10/2021.headline: 'At the end of the day I am only 19': Tilly Ramsay calls out 67yo male radio host who criticised her weight
21/10/2021.description: Tilly Ramsay, the daughter of celebrity chef Gordon Ramsay, has hit back at a British radio host who made a derogatory comment about her weight.
21/10/2021.author: Alexandra Treloar and Richard Crabtree

21/10/2021.headline: WA government lets cat out of the bag about plan to mandate vaccine for all interstate travellers
21/10/2021.description: The West Australian government is left red-faced after the early release of a document stating the COVID-19 vaccine will be mandatory for all interstate travellers.
21/10/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

21/10/2021.headline: Thousands in limbo as 'orphaned' homes crisis affects Australia's building industry
21/10/2021.description: Thousands of homeowners are being stranded with "orphaned" houses they cannot live in because of regulatory failures and bureaucratic dithering, industry experts say.
21/10/2021.author: Daniel Mercer

21/10/2021.headline: Asia is engaged in a race for the stars. But is it really about preparing for war?
21/10/2021.description: The pool of countries deploying huge amounts of cash as part of a new space race is growing larger. But experts fear this could be a sign of a new arms race, too.
21/10/2021.author: Daniel Mercer

21/10/2021.headline: Wallabies-Japan Test needs to be much more regular event
21/10/2021.description: This weekend's Test between the Wallabies and Japan will only be the sixth time the teams have met in 46 years. That level of engagement has to change, writes Brett McKay.
21/10/2021.author: Brett McKay

21/10/2021.headline: 'I can't handle today, I need to go home': A journey from anxiety to employment
21/10/2021.description: When you suffer from a mental illness, the career path is not straightforward. Here's how mother-of-three Anita recovered from a breakdown and found a job she loves.
21/10/2021.author: Conor Byrne

21/10/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: PM and Premier to announce take-off plans for international flights
21/10/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING: Prime Minister Scott Morrison and NSW Premier Dominic Perrottet are set to reveal more details about what international travel will look like for Australians when it resumes next month.
21/10/2021.author: Conor Byrne

21/10/2021.headline: Khalid fled Afghanistan in August — today he explores Melbourne for the first time
21/10/2021.description: Like many Melburnians, Khalid Amiri is looking forward to coming out of lockdown. But he'll be discovering the city for the first time, having fled Afghanistan just a few weeks ago.
21/10/2021.author: Madi Chwasta

21/10/2021.headline: Friday news quiz: Do you remember the headlines from this week?
21/10/2021.description: Another week, another news quiz. Reckon you've been paying enough attention to get 10/10?
21/10/2021.author: Madi Chwasta

21/10/2021.headline: End of LinkedIn in China will cut ties to people 'inside the wall', activists say
21/10/2021.description: A Chinese activist is dismayed LinkedIn in China will shut down later this year, after internet rules were tightened by Beijing.
21/10/2021.author: Joyce Cheng

21/10/2021.headline: How the Formula 1 championship could be decided by two major unknown factors
21/10/2021.description: With just six points separating this year's title contenders, Lewis Hamilton and Max Verstappen will both have used engines and new circuits to deal with.
21/10/2021.author: Michael Doyle

21/10/2021.headline: We all know the health risks of smoking and drinking. But is renting a health risk?
21/10/2021.description: As many as a million Australians live in housing that harms their health, according to experts, and renters suffer the most.
21/10/2021.author: Stephen Smiley, Ange Lavoipierre, and Scott Mitchell

21/10/2021.headline: New generation speed cameras will be able to spot more than speeding
21/10/2021.description: Eight new speed cameras could bust Tasmanian drivers committing other offences — but that will require a law change
21/10/2021.author: Adam Langenberg

21/10/2021.headline: Many questions left unanswered after Queensland records first local COVID case in more than two weeks
21/10/2021.description: A COVID-19 patient who sparked a health scare on Queensland's Gold Coast after returning from Victoria and being infectious in the community for over a week has links to a Victorian trucking business and a Queensland chauffeur service.
21/10/2021.author: Rory Callinan

21/10/2021.headline: Does this penguin hold an Australian bank account? If not, who owns the money from Bouvet Island?
21/10/2021.description: If you've never heard of Bouvet Island, you're not alone. It's the most remote island on Earth and no-one lives there. But there are a dozen Australian bank accounts whose owners are registered as residents.
21/10/2021.author: Michael Janda

21/10/2021.headline: The puppets and puppetmasters behind the Olympics 2032 and how your $5 billion will be spent
21/10/2021.description: A week after they were expected to be introduced, the laws governing the Brisbane 2032 organising committee remain under negotiation.
21/10/2021.author: Jack Snape

21/10/2021.headline: Andrew Gaze to Ben Simmons: 'Get back on the floor'
21/10/2021.description: Australian basketball legend, Andrew Gaze, says Ben Simmons has to make up with the Philadelphia 76ers and "get back on the floor" if he is going to salvage anything out of his prodigious talent.
21/10/2021.author: David Mark

21/10/2021.headline: The Spring Carnival explained: Handicaps, weights and WFA — what does it all mean?
21/10/2021.description: The Spring Racing Carnival is well underway, and as we get closer to the Melbourne Cup, we explain the differences between handicaps and weight-for-age races — and what a horse's weight tells us about its chances in the race that stops the nation?
21/10/2021.author: Andrew McGarry

21/10/2021.headline: 'Will we survive?': Canberrans can shop again as retail stores reopen in the ACT
21/10/2021.description: Canberra's non-essential retail stores reopen to the public today as COVID-19 restrictions ease again — and for some businesses, it couldn't have come at a better time.
21/10/2021.author: Niki Burnside

21/10/2021.headline: Tasmania's COVID roadmap will be released today. Here's what to expect
21/10/2021.description: Tasmanians are set to learn today how the state will emerge from border restrictions and what it will mean for the economy and the health system.
21/10/2021.author: Alexandra Humphries

21/10/2021.headline: Salim Hamze kept a gun close by, but his daily routine made him an easy target
21/10/2021.description: Sydney's latest victim of gangland violence was only 18 but was already part of multiple criminal networks when he and his father were shot in broad daylight. Their killers remain on the run, leaving residents in Western Sydney on edge.
21/10/2021.author: Alexandra Humphries

21/10/2021.headline: Elephants are ditching their tusks to dodge poachers — but there's a downside
21/10/2021.description: Ivory hunting has pressured a population of African elephants to lose their tusks, researchers say, providing striking evidence of rapid evolution driven by humans.
21/10/2021.author: Anna Salleh

21/10/2021.headline: These graphs tell the story of Sydney coming back to life after 100 days of lockdown
21/10/2021.description: Mobility and traffic data shows Sydneysiders are making the most of their new freedom. But, it might be a while before things go back to pre-pandemic levels.
21/10/2021.author: Casey Briggs

21/10/2021.headline: Murder downgraded to manslaughter and 57 months jail for former policeman who killed Justine Damond
21/10/2021.description: Mohamed Noor was initially convicted of third-degree murder and manslaughter in the 2017 fatal shooting, but had his murder conviction overturned.
21/10/2021.author: Casey Briggs

21/10/2021.headline: Congratulations Melbourne, you made it out of lockdown. Here's a reminder of what's changed
21/10/2021.description: Lost track of how many people you're allowed at your picnic, whether you can get a haircut or when you can start planning your wedding? Here's a reminder of what changes under this step out of COVID-19 restrictions.
21/10/2021.author: Casey Briggs

21/10/2021.headline: At least 150 dead, thousands stranded as flooding wreaks havoc in Nepal and India
21/10/2021.description: Days of heavy rains take their toll as landslides destroy homes and infrastructure and leave thousands of people stranded.
21/10/2021.author: Casey Briggs

22/10/2021.headline: Court told alleged stabbing, shooting in Adelaide's north-west sparked by naked photo
22/10/2021.description: Two men charged over an alleged attack on a Semaphore man yesterday have faced court, both applying for bail.
22/10/2021.author: Sara Tomevska

22/10/2021.headline: Iconic outback hotel to get $100m makeover
22/10/2021.description: Iris Capital expects to spend more than $100 million on refurbishing Lasseters Hotel and Casino, which was made famous in the iconic 1994 film Priscilla, Queen of the Desert.
22/10/2021.author: Stewart Brash and Emma Haskin

22/10/2021.headline: After months in lockdown, a weary world is ready to dance
22/10/2021.description: Even in the depths of the pandemic including in lockdown, some are dancing in their kitchen, on the streets, on rooftops.
22/10/2021.author: Stewart Brash and Emma Haskin

22/10/2021.headline: Gut-wrenching evidence heard after death of a 'beautiful boy in a not-so-beautiful system'
22/10/2021.description: The father of the 20-year-old, who died in custody in NSW in 2019, has told an inquest that to anyone else his boy "may be just another number". "To me," the father said, "he was my oldest son".
22/10/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

22/10/2021.headline: Many of Garry's friends disappeared or were killed during dark chapter of Sydney's history
22/10/2021.description: If you were a gay man in Sydney during the 1970s to 1990s, there was a chance you could get beaten up or killed, Garry Wotherspoon says. A memorial to the victims now stands on the eastern suburbs site where many of these acts of violence took place.
22/10/2021.author: Harriet Tatham and Kevin Nguyen

22/10/2021.headline: World's biggest Triceratops skeleton sells for more than $10 million
22/10/2021.description: The enormous skeleton, estimated to be over 66 million years old and known as Big John, is sold to a private buyer from the United States.
22/10/2021.author: Harriet Tatham and Kevin Nguyen

22/10/2021.headline: When can I come to Tasmania? How many COVID cases is the state expecting? Here's what we know
22/10/2021.description: Tasmania was quick to pull up the drawbridge when coronavirus started to spread throughout Australia but it now faces the prospect of hundreds of COVID-19 cases a day.
22/10/2021.author: Emily Baker

22/10/2021.headline: Kids' clothing shops, bakeries across WA urged to help in search for Cleo Smith
22/10/2021.description: Police urge businesses such as children's clothing stores and bakeries within a 1,000 kilometre radius of the camp site where Cleo Smith disappeared to submit CCTV or dashcam footage.
22/10/2021.author: Elicia Kennedy and Matt Bamford

22/10/2021.headline: Police say Alec Baldwin fired a gun. One person is dead, another is in hospital. What happened?
22/10/2021.description: One of Hollywood's biggest names, Alec Baldwin, has been caught up in a tragedy on the set of his movie Rust, allegedly firing a prop gun that killed one person and injured another. Here's what we know.
22/10/2021.author: Elicia Kennedy and Matt Bamford

22/10/2021.headline: $330m pumped into Murray-Darling projects 'that support thriving agriculture and communities'
22/10/2021.description: NSW and the Commonwealth have thrown $330 million to ensure the Murray-Darling Basin Plan is met on time and "in a way that doesn't impact irrigators".
22/10/2021.author: Kath Sullivan

22/10/2021.headline: Biden says United States would come to Taiwan's defence
22/10/2021.description: President Joe Biden tells a town hall meeting that the United States has a commitment to defend Taiwan, the island China claims as its own territory.
22/10/2021.author: Kath Sullivan

22/10/2021.headline: 'Better than nothing', but Bluesfest stallholders 'appalled' after long wait for partial refund
22/10/2021.description: Bluesfest stallholders will be recouped most of what they paid to trade at the cancelled 2020 event, but a food van owner says he's "disappointed" that it came down to a tribunal hearing.
22/10/2021.author: Miranda Saunders

22/10/2021.headline: Perth mum who felt 'relieved' after feeding bleach to seriously ill baby is jailed
22/10/2021.description: A Perth mother who told police she wanted 'a good night's sleep' when she confessed to feeding bleach to her seriously ill baby will spend at least 15 months behind bars.
22/10/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

22/10/2021.headline: Tasmania to throw open borders to COVID hotspots December 15
22/10/2021.description: All vaccinated interstate and international arrivals can enter Tasmania without a need for quarantine from December 15, as long as they have returned a negative COVID test, the state government announces.
22/10/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

22/10/2021.headline: Former NSW Labor minister Obeid ordered to go to prison tomorrow
22/10/2021.description: Eddie Obeid was allowed home on bail yesterday after being convicted over a mine licence conspiracy because of fears he could catch COVID-19 in prison.
22/10/2021.author: Jamelle Wells

22/10/2021.headline: Students will no longer have to wear masks as SA's COVID-19 first dose vaccination rate reaches 80pc
22/10/2021.description: Masks will no longer be compulsory at high schools from Monday, South Australian Premier Steven Marshall announces as the state is on track to reach 80 per cent of first doses during a COVID-19 vaccination blitz this weekend.
22/10/2021.author: Isabel Dayman and Stacey Pestrin

22/10/2021.headline: Alec Baldwin fires prop gun, killing cinematographer on set of latest film, authorities say
22/10/2021.description: Actor Alec Baldwin fired a prop gun on a movie set in New Mexico on Thursday, killing cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and wounding director Joel Souza, authorities say.
22/10/2021.author: Isabel Dayman and Stacey Pestrin

22/10/2021.headline: Leaving everyone, everything she knew behind saved Ruby's life
22/10/2021.description: Ruby was just 11 when she was introduced to an outlaw bikie gang, and she spent the next 20 years immersed in its violent, underground world. Here's how she escaped.
22/10/2021.author: Monica Adair and Tegan Philpott

22/10/2021.headline: 'There is no evidence': Judge ends perjury trial of Queensland police superintendent
22/10/2021.description: A senior Gold Coast police officer is acquitted of perjury after a judge instructed a jury to find her not guilty for giving false testimony to the Crime and Corruption Commission.
22/10/2021.author: Monica Adair and Tegan Philpott

22/10/2021.headline: Evergrande reportedly pays bondholders $110 million, averting default for now
22/10/2021.description: Reports reveal Evergrande remitted $US83 million ($110 million) to a trustee account at Citibank on Thursday, allowing it to pay bondholders overdue interest before a grace period expires tomorrow.
22/10/2021.author: Samuel Yang

22/10/2021.headline: Why did the Queen go to hospital? Here's what we know about the monarch's health
22/10/2021.description: The Queen recently proclaimed you're "as old as you feel", but a number of reports about her health recently suggest doctors are advising caution for the 95-year-old monarch.
22/10/2021.author: Samuel Yang

22/10/2021.headline: Western Bulldogs premiership captain Easton Wood retires after 14-year AFL career
22/10/2021.description: After 188 games and a famous premiership, Western Bulldogs defender Easton Wood is calling time on his 14-year AFL career.
22/10/2021.author: Samuel Yang

22/10/2021.headline: Australia and the world right to be worried about democracy after Trump: Bob Woodward
22/10/2021.description: The Washington Post journalist best known for his coverage of the Watergate scandal says tens of thousands of Americans still support Donald Trump and the media is not paying them enough attention.
22/10/2021.author: Matilda Marozzi

22/10/2021.headline: 'Sorry, a slight distraction': Ardern remains unfazed as earthquake interrupts COVID press conference
22/10/2021.description: An earthquake rattles Wellington as Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern tells New Zealand strict coronavirus lockdown measures will end only when 90 per cent of its eligible population is fully vaccinated.
22/10/2021.author: Matilda Marozzi

22/10/2021.headline: Here's where Qantas and Jetstar are flying to as international travel opens up
22/10/2021.description: Flights to the international destinations will only be available to passengers who are fully vaccinated and return a negative COVID test.
22/10/2021.author: Matilda Marozzi

22/10/2021.headline: How strange internet conspiracy theories led one US pundit to ask: 'When do we invade Australia?'
22/10/2021.description: For months, Fox News hosts, podcasters and conservative politicians have claimed Australia is succumbing to tyranny. But a conspiracy theory that the nation is being ruled by dystopian overlords stretches back decades.
22/10/2021.author: Rebecca Armitage

22/10/2021.headline: What happens when you're stuck in China but all your stuff is still in Australia?
22/10/2021.description: The travel bans that trapped thousands of international students, who had been studying at Australian universities, in China also created an unexpected business opportunity.
22/10/2021.author: Dong Xing

22/10/2021.headline: Inside an Instagram influencer's daring escape from Malaysia to Australia
22/10/2021.description: Nur Sajat was dressed like any other Malaysian Muslim woman. But her clothing choice angered strict Islamic authorities and forced her to leave her home, business empire and two small children behind in fear for her life.
22/10/2021.author: Anne Barker

22/10/2021.headline: How the words 'sweetheart deal' raised eyebrows at the ICAC inquiry into Gladys Berejiklian
22/10/2021.description: As he penned a jest-filled memo quoting a Tom Cruise character to the NSW premier in 2016, a political strategist could never have known it would become evidence at a corruption inquiry.
22/10/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

22/10/2021.headline: On Sunday, Emma could go to a cafe. On Monday the 'vaccine gap' meant her freedom was gone
22/10/2021.description: While Sydney has been enjoying eased restrictions after NSW hit its COVID vaccination targets, many of the state's regional areas have seen their freedoms falter. And it's not just anti-vaxxers who are affected.
22/10/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

22/10/2021.headline: The Matildas vs Brazil: It's one of the most gripping rivalries in football
22/10/2021.description: If two teams know what competition is, it’s the Matildas and Brazil. They go into upcoming friendlies with new head coaches, fresh talent, and familiar stars — and with their 20-year rivalry as fierce as ever.
22/10/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

22/10/2021.headline: Australia's borders may be opening but we're still stubbornly, dangerously closed off from the world
22/10/2021.description: Australia has been dubbed the 'new Hermit Kingdom' over its tough stance on borders, but as the country opens up there are a few more reasons to make the comparison, writes Laura Tingle.
22/10/2021.author: Laura Tingle

22/10/2021.headline: iPod turns 20: Why Apple's music player faces an uncertain future
22/10/2021.description: The iPod has an undeniable legacy, but is there a future for one of Apple's most important products?
22/10/2021.author: Tom Williams

22/10/2021.headline: Wisdom is helping these older Victorians weather pandemic
22/10/2021.description: They've experienced war, displacement and the AIDS epidemic. A group of older Victorians share the things that have helped them through the past 18 months.
22/10/2021.author: Danielle Bonica

22/10/2021.headline: Seven days ago, Cleo Smith disappeared from a tent at a remote WA campsite. No one can yet say why
22/10/2021.description: One week ago, at a remote campsite on the West Australian coast, a mother woke up to find her four-year-old daughter missing. Despite one of the state's largest-ever search operations, Cleo Smith is yet to be found. This is how the search unfolded.
22/10/2021.author: James Carmody

22/10/2021.headline: Alec Baldwin says his 'heart is broken' for family of dead cinematographer Halyna Hutchins
22/10/2021.description: The 63-year-old 30 Rock and Saturday Night Live actor was seen distraught outside the sheriff's office after what his spokesperson called a misfire of a prop gun.
22/10/2021.author: James Carmody

22/10/2021.headline: 'Rules of the jungle': China ups the rhetoric against Australia, US and UK over AUKUS deal
22/10/2021.description: China's Foreign Ministry spokesman accuses the AUKUS countries of non-compliance with the nuclear non-proliferation treaty, as they seek to assuage concerns around regional security.
22/10/2021.author: James Carmody

22/10/2021.headline: Robert Durst, subject of documentary of The Jinx, charged over 1982 murder of wife
22/10/2021.description: Days after being given a life sentence for the murder of a friend in 2000, Robert Durst is charged over the death of his former wife Kathie.
22/10/2021.author: James Carmody

22/10/2021.headline: K-Pop superstars BTS deal Sony music a fresh blow
22/10/2021.description: BTS's beats might be "cha ching, like money" but moving forward, a large chunk of that will not be going to Sony, with the band ditching the record label for a rival.
22/10/2021.author: James Carmody

22/10/2021.headline: EU postpones free trade talks with Australia for second time after cancelled submarine deal with France
22/10/2021.description: Trade Minister Dan Tehan says the 12th round of talks with the EU had been postponed for the second time this month, this time until February 2022, dashing hopes a deal could be struck by the end of the year.
22/10/2021.author: James Carmody

22/10/2021.headline: Pacific Island climate groups demand world leaders halt support for fossil fuel
22/10/2021.description: The Pacific Island Climate Action Network says world leaders must take action at the COP26 summit in Glasgow, capping global warming at 1.5C and helping developing nations cope with the impact of climate change.
22/10/2021.author: Joshua Boscaini

22/10/2021.headline: Pablo Escobar's hippos recognised as 'legal persons' in US court
22/10/2021.description: In a first, the US Federal Court recognises animals as legal persons -- specifically, the descendants of Pablo Escobar's hippopotamuses who have thrived in Colombia since the notorious drug lord was killed almost 30 years ago.
22/10/2021.author: Joshua Boscaini

22/10/2021.headline: Queensland Police Service employees lose legal bid against mandatory COVID jab
22/10/2021.description: A legal bid by a group of Queensland Police Service employees' to defy their Commissioner's direction to be vaccinated for COVID19 fails, meaning all QPS employees must be vaccinated by January 23 next year or face suspension without pay or dismissal.
22/10/2021.author: Paula Doneman

22/10/2021.headline: Tasmanian hotel quarantine tightened after COVID-positive man spent 18 hours in the community
22/10/2021.description: A review into a hotel quarantine breach in Hobart, which led to a three-day lockdown in southern Tasmania, finds a COVID-positive NSW man probably left via a fire escape during a brief window when security guards had left their posts.
22/10/2021.author: Adam Langenberg

22/10/2021.headline: Sheriff says family on California hike died of extreme heat
22/10/2021.description: A Northern California family has been found dead on a hiking trail near the Merced River died after they overheated and ran out of drinking water.
22/10/2021.author: Adam Langenberg

22/10/2021.headline: Matildas not distracted ahead of Brazil friendlies
22/10/2021.description: Matildas coach Tony Gustavsson insists allegations of harassment and abuse in Australian football have not been a distraction ahead of their homecoming match against Brazil.
22/10/2021.author: Adam Langenberg

22/10/2021.headline: Family question 'all-white' jury after police officer found not guilty of murdering Aboriginal woman
22/10/2021.description: A police constable who shot dead a 29-year-old woman during a street confrontation in a town in WA’s Mid West is acquitted of her murd
22/10/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

23/10/2021.headline: TGA to look at booster doses next week, with hopes for aged care rollout in November or sooner
23/10/2021.description: Australia's medical regulator will look at new data from Pfizer on COVID-19 booster doses on Monday, with health authorities hopeful of a November rollout.
23/10/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

23/10/2021.headline: Minister flags 'announcements' on opening up WA when 80 per cent double-vaccination target nearer
23/10/2021.description: The WA Health Minister says "announcements" about the government's plan to open up the state will be made before Western Australia reaches the crucial milestone of having 80 per cent of its population aged 16 and over fully vaccinated.
23/10/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

23/10/2021.headline: State Of Rest wins dramatic Cox Plate after dismissed protest
23/10/2021.description: Irish horse State Of Rest claims victory in Australasia's premier weight-for-age race after a protest — lodged by second-placed Anamoe's jockey Craig Williams — is dismissed at Moonee Valley.
23/10/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

23/10/2021.headline: SA Labor promises preschool overhaul plus early learning royal commission
23/10/2021.description: An SA Labor government would bring forward the age at which children could start preschool by one year, but the party could not provide precise cost details, saying that was a matter for a royal commission it intends to establish.
23/10/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

23/10/2021.headline: Forensics officers gathering evidence at Cleo Smith's home
23/10/2021.description: A week after four-year-old Cleo Smith disappeared, a forensics squad is gathering evidence at the family's Carnarvon home. The ABC understands police are investigating the possibility of a break-in, but there is no suggestion that Cleo's family were involved in her disappearance.
23/10/2021.author: Keane Bourke

23/10/2021.headline: Drone footage shows La Palma volcano continuing to erupt
23/10/2021.description: Footage taken above the volcano on the Spanish island of La Palma shows hypnotic images of lava, smoke and ash being shot into the air, as scientists say the eruption could continue for three months.
23/10/2021.author: Keane Bourke

23/10/2021.headline: Johnson says fresh UK lockdown not on cards as COVID-19 cases rise
23/10/2021.description: As advisers suggest that acting early with lighter measures to cut rising case numbers would reduce the need for tougher restrictions later, UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson says a new COVID-19 lockdown is not on the cards.
23/10/2021.author: Keane Bourke

23/10/2021.headline: Wallabies get home against plucky Japan in gripping Test
23/10/2021.description: The Wallabies are made to earn their 32-23 victory over Japan in Oita, as their spring tour kicks off in triumphant fashion.
23/10/2021.author: Keane Bourke

23/10/2021.headline: Friend of man missing in outback Queensland tests positive to COVID-19
23/10/2021.description: The search for a man missing in outback Queensland has taken a bizarre twist, with one of the people he was camping with since testing positive to COVID-19.
23/10/2021.author: Danielle O'Neal and Dan Prosser

23/10/2021.headline: 'I was stunned': Scientists assess massive sunfish caught in tuna nets in Mediterranean Sea
23/10/2021.description: A marine biologist called into to assess the 3.2 metre-long creature said his team first tried to put it on a 1,000-kilogram scale, but it would have broken it. See its inspection and release.
23/10/2021.author: Danielle O'Neal and Dan Prosser

23/10/2021.headline: Prop guns, blanks on set: How does it work?
23/10/2021.description: As police continue to investigate the fatal shooting of Ukrainian cinematographer Halyna Hutchins by actor Alec Baldwin, we take a look at the use of prop firearms in film productions and the protocols in place.
23/10/2021.author: Danielle O'Neal and Dan Prosser

23/10/2021.headline: Get vaccinated, Dan Andrews tells 'non-compliant' regional council CEO
23/10/2021.description: Swan Hill Council's chief executive elicits a firm response from Mr Andrews about his reported "very strong views" on vaccine requirements and "personal choice".
23/10/2021.author: Alexandra Treloar and Richard Crabtree

23/10/2021.headline: Boy in critical condition after being hit by car on major Adelaide road
23/10/2021.description: A six-year-old boy is rushed to hospital with critical injuries after being hit by a car on The Parade in Adelaide's east.
23/10/2021.author: Alexandra Treloar and Richard Crabtree

23/10/2021.headline: The Queen is 'back at her desk' after spending first night in hospital in years, says British PM
23/10/2021.description: The Queen stayed at the King Edward VII hospital in central London for practical reasons and her medical team had taken a cautious approach to her care, according to a royal source.
23/10/2021.author: Alexandra Treloar and Richard Crabtree

23/10/2021.headline: How chewing the fat at saleyards may save farmers' lives
23/10/2021.description: Grace is among mental health advocates urging farmers and others in the livestock industry to open up and talk about their struggles when they see mates at the saleyard.
23/10/2021.author: Lara Webster

23/10/2021.headline: Confidence to connect sends artist's career soaring
23/10/2021.description: Inspired by her newly found bond with country, Emma Stenhouse has created art that is being showcased in Myer's biggest-ever collaboration with an Indigenous artist.
23/10/2021.author: Jonathon Poulson

23/10/2021.headline: Actor Peter Scolari, known for roles in Newhart, Bosom Buddies and Girls, dies aged 66
23/10/2021.description: The versatile character actor, whose television roles included a yuppie producer on Newhart and a gay father on Girls, dies after fighting cancer for two years.
23/10/2021.author: Jonathon Poulson

23/10/2021.headline: Former swim coach extradited to Brisbane on indecent dealing charges taken to hospital
23/10/2021.description: John Reginald Wright was flown to Brisbane after being extradited from Western Australia. Queensland police allege he indecently dealt with children on nine occasions between 1980 and 1986.
23/10/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

23/10/2021.headline: 'Very, very disappointed': WA Aboriginal Legal Service calls on police to improve relations after JC trial
23/10/2021.description: The WA Aboriginal Legal Service urges police to improve relations with the Indigenous community after a police officer charged with murdering a Yamatji woman he shot dead is found not guilty.
23/10/2021.author: Herlyn Kaur

23/10/2021.headline: 'Ben is our still our brother': Calls for support from Simmons's teammates before home opener
23/10/2021.description: Joel Embiid and Tobias Harris express public support for Ben Simmons, whose future with the Philadelphia 76ers remains in doubt despite a "productive" meeting with team leadership.
23/10/2021.author: Herlyn Kaur

23/10/2021.headline: Cinematographer shot on movie set grew up on Soviet military base and had worked as investigative reporter
23/10/2021.description: Devastated colleagues and friends ask the world to focus on the immense talent of the cinematographer fatally shot with a prop gun by Alec Baldwin on a movie set.
23/10/2021.author: Herlyn Kaur

23/10/2021.headline: Alleged nightclub dancing breach referred to Cricket Australia
23/10/2021.description: An SA cricket investigation has "not found evidence" for "most" allegations against a group of state cricketers, but has referred claims the group broke COVID-19 dancing rules at an Adelaide bar to Cricket Australia.
23/10/2021.author: Herlyn Kaur

23/10/2021.headline: ACT records 24 new cases of COVID-19 as first weekend of eased retail restrictions begins
23/10/2021.description: The ACT records 24 new locally acquired cases of COVID-19, as Canberrans begin their first weekend since both essential and non-essential retail outlets were permitted to reopen.
23/10/2021.author: Niki Burnside

23/10/2021.headline: Rudy Giuliani ally Lev Parnas guilty of violating US campaign finance laws
23/10/2021.description: Florida businessman Lev Parnas, who helped Rudy Giuliani dig up dirt on Joe Biden in Ukraine, is convicted of campaign finance crimes.
23/10/2021.author: Niki Burnside

23/10/2021.headline: Anthony Fields confident new Yellow Wiggle can fill big shoes left by Emma Watkins
23/10/2021.description: The last remaining founding member of The Wiggles discusses his love of performing, the secrets of the group's success and his confidence in the new Yellow Wiggle.
23/10/2021.author: Michael Doyle

23/10/2021.headline: Female surfers' fight for equal pay part of ongoing battle for recognition, respect
23/10/2021.description: A group of unrelenting women want to reach a point where female surfing is appreciated for the compelling, ground-breaking sport that it is, and prize money matching the men's is a stepping stone along that journey.
23/10/2021.author: Michael Doyle

23/10/2021.headline: Conservationists are buying back blocks in the Daintree, but not all the locals are happy
23/10/2021.description: In the early 1980s, a controversial subdivision of 1,137 blocks was approved in the Daintree rainforest. Now conservationists are racing to raise funds to buy the blocks as southerners eye off a tropical COVID tree change.
23/10/2021.author: Nick Kilvert

23/10/2021.headline: Seoul's secretive tattoo industry inks up Brad Pitt and BTS. But they are in constant fear of arrest
23/10/2021.description: Long the markings of slaves and gangsters, tattoos are suddenly everywhere in South Korea. But the nation's stringent laws mean they're often inked in the shadows by artists risking arrest.
23/10/2021.author: Carrington Clarke

23/10/2021.headline: Budget is not the only strain on first home buyers. The emotional toll is harder to calculate
23/10/2021.description: As the average house price jumps by more than 20 per cent — the biggest increase in more than 30 years — first home buyers say they're struggling to remain positive.
23/10/2021.author: Carrington Clarke

23/10/2021.headline: North Korea remains on war footing — and Joe Biden is right to be wary
23/10/2021.description: It's been more than 70 years since an armistice was signed in the Korean War. But make no mistake, the war between the United States and North Korea is still going, writes Stan Grant.
23/10/2021.author: Stan Grant

23/10/2021.headline: Olympic sprinter Alex Quiñónez killed in Ecuador along with another man
23/10/2021.description: The Ecuadorian sprinter became a national hero in 2012 when he reached the final of the Men's 200 metres sprint along with Usain Bolt.
23/10/2021.author: Stan Grant

23/10/2021.headline: Roadside bombing targeting the Taliban kills two, including a child, in Afghanistan
23/10/2021.description: The bomb targeted a Taliban vehicle moving past but authorities say no Taliban fighters were harmed. No one has claimed responsibility but the Islamic State group is known to be active in the region.
23/10/2021.author: Stan Grant

23/10/2021.headline: Russian, Chinese warships hold first joint patrols in Pacific Ocean
23/10/2021.description: Russia's defence ministry releases a statement saying that exercises between Moscow and Beijing were conducted between October 17 and 23 in another sign of closer ties between the two nations.
23/10/2021.author: Stan Grant

23/10/2021.headline: Aussies scrape home to beat South Africa in tense T20 World Cup opener
23/10/2021.description: Chasing what appeared to be a modest victory target of 119, Australia brings up the winning runs with just two balls to spare against the Proteas in Abu Dhabi.
23/10/2021.author: Stan Grant

23/10/2021.headline: Macarthur FC rocked as former Socceroo announces retirement
23/10/2021.description: The Bulls are looking for a new captain ahead of the A-League Men season, after goalkeeper Adam Federici calls time on his decorated career.
23/10/2021.author: Stan Grant

23/10/2021.headline: Impressive Matildas take down Brazil in opening friendly
23/10/2021.description: The Matildas — playing their first match in Australia since early 2020 — outclass Brazil with a 3-1 victory in wet conditions in Sydney.
23/10/2021.author: Stan Grant

23/10/2021.headline: Asylum seekers detained in Melbourne hotel test positive to COVID-19
23/10/2021.description: At least 17 asylum seekers detained in a Melbourne facility test positive to COVID-19, with one person being treated in hospital.
23/10/2021.author: Stan Grant

23/10/2021.headline: Thousands of teachers could be absent from schools on Monday
23/10/2021.description: When the state government changed the date of when schools could reopen across Greater Sydney, it left thousands of teachers unable to get fully vaccinated and allowed to return to classrooms next week, the NSW Teachers Federation president says.
23/10/2021.author: Stan Grant

23/10/2021.headline: Rollout of COVID-19 vaccine booster shots likely to follow a familiar timeline
23/10/2021.description: Australia's medical regulator will look at new data from Pfizer on COVID-19 booster doses on Monday, with health authorities hopeful of a November rollout.
23/10/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

23/10/2021.headline: Forensics officers gathering evidence of possible scoping at Cleo Smith's home
23/10/2021.description: A week after four-year-old Cleo Smith disappeared, a forensics squad is gathering evidence at the family's Carnarvon home. The ABC understands police are investigating someone had scoped the house, but there is no suggestion that Cleo's family were involved in her disappearance.
23/10/2021.author: Keane Bourke

23/10/2021.headline: Wallabies earn gritty Test win over plucky Japan
23/10/2021.description: The Wallabies are made to earn their 32-23 victory over Japan in Oita, as their spring tour kicks off in triumphant fashion.
23/10/2021.author: Keane Bourke

23/10/2021.headline: COVID twist in search for man still missing in outback Queensland
23/10/2021.description: A camper who was with the missing man has tested positive to the virus and five Queensland police are isolating or in quarantine, complicating the search for a man last seen almost a week ago.
23/10/2021.author: Danielle O'Neal and Dan Prosser

23/10/2021.headline: Advantage Red Bull as Verstappen takes pole in US Grand Prix
23/10/2021.description: Red Bull's Formula One championship leader Max Verstappen takes pole position for the US Grand Prix in Austin with title rival Lewis Hamilton alongside on the front row for Mercedes.
23/10/2021.author: Penny Travers

23/10/2021.headline: Stoinis says rotation will be key for Australia after World Cup selection shock
