08/11/2021.author: Tara Cassidy and Alexandria Utting

08/11/2021.headline: Christchurch shooter flags appeal, claiming guilty pleas were made under duress
08/11/2021.description: The Australian man convicted of killing 51 people in the attacks on two Christchurch mosques is claiming he experienced inhumane and degrading treatment while in custody.
08/11/2021.author: Emily Clark

08/11/2021.headline: Bikie gang member is second man to be charged with sniper-style murder of Rebels boss
08/11/2021.description: A second man is charged in connection with the sniper-style murder of Rebels bikie boss Nick Martin in Perth last year.
08/11/2021.author: Lucy Martin

08/11/2021.headline: Two Josh Allens make NFL history as the Jaguars stun the Bills
08/11/2021.description: In the NFL, Jacksonville Jaguars have earned a shock win over the highly fancied Buffalo Bills — but the result was overshadowed by the battle between Bills quarterback Josh Allen, and his Jaguars nemesis … Josh Allen.
08/11/2021.author: Lucy Martin

08/11/2021.headline: COVID lockout restrictions extended in Greater Darwin amid concern about new exposure site
08/11/2021.description: COVID lockout restrictions in Greater Darwin will be extended by an extra 24 hours after the identification of several new exposure sites, including one authorities have labelled of "particular concern", but the lockout in Katherine is on track to end at 5pm today.
08/11/2021.author: Lucy Martin

08/11/2021.headline: South Australian children who contract COVID-19 to receive at-home treatment through hospital service
08/11/2021.description: South Australian children who contract coronavirus will be able to be treated at home through a new service to be run by the Women's and Children's Hospital, health authorities say.
08/11/2021.author: Rory McClaren

08/11/2021.headline: New data reveals how much protection COVID-19 jabs are giving people in NSW
08/11/2021.description: People in NSW who are not vaccinated against COVID-19 were 16 times more likely to die, or end up in intensive care during the state's Delta outbreak, new government data reveals.
08/11/2021.author: Catherine Hanrahan

08/11/2021.headline: Big Bird posted about getting his COVID vaccine. An American senator and anti-vax Twitter was having none of it
08/11/2021.description: It started with a fairly innocent Twitter post shared by a beloved Sesame Street character. Then came the accusations of propaganda and brainwashing.
08/11/2021.author: Catherine Hanrahan

08/11/2021.headline: Port Beach unpatrolled at time of fatal shark attack, Health Minister reveals
08/11/2021.description: WA Health Minister Roger Cook says the location of surf lifesaving patrols will be examined as beaches in the vicinity of this weekend's fatal shark attack reopen.
08/11/2021.author: Keane Bourke

08/11/2021.headline: Time running out for 10-metre sperm whale stranded on Flinders Island
08/11/2021.description: Conservation experts are attending to a sperm whale stranded off the coast of northern Tasmania — but an expert has warned the species are "not the easiest to refloat".
08/11/2021.author: Liz Gwynn

08/11/2021.headline: US citizen flown to Australia to make meth jailed over major bust in Adelaide drug house
08/11/2021.description: An Iranian-born United States citizen who was found in his underwear hiding in the bedroom of a suburban Adelaide drug house is sentenced to at least five-and-a-half years in jail over an $18 million meth bust in 2018.
08/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

08/11/2021.headline: 'Unreasonable': Flight Centre threatens to challenge WA's hard border in court
08/11/2021.description: Western Australia's Health Minister Roger Cook says he is confident the state can fight another legal challenge against its hard border, as Flight Centre threatens a fresh court dispute.
08/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

08/11/2021.headline: Adelaide cafe owner who sexually exploited child waitress seeks lenient sentence
08/11/2021.description: The lawyer for a cafe owner who sexually exploited a child waitress urges an Adelaide court to hand down a lenient sentence, saying her client lacked the social skills to date adult women.
08/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

08/11/2021.headline: The rate of cancer cases in Victoria has dropped massively in the past two years, but experts say it's not good news
08/11/2021.description: Health experts fear there are thousands of Australians who are unaware they have cancer due to COVID-19 lockdowns, with new data showing the number of detected cancer cases during the pandemic is way down.
08/11/2021.author: Nadia Daly

08/11/2021.headline: Adelaide paedophile pleads guilty to more than 180 crimes against children
08/11/2021.description: An Adelaide paedophile pleads guilty to more than 180 charges in what has previously been described in court as one of the "worst and most degrading" cases of child exploitation.
08/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

08/11/2021.headline: Police trying to establish if others involved in Cleo Smith alleged abduction
08/11/2021.description: Detectives say they expect to remain in Carnarvon for at least a week as they try to determine if more than one person was involved in Cleo Smith's alleged abduction.
08/11/2021.author: Evelyn Manfield

08/11/2021.headline: Schools could be kept open with 'test to stay' approach instead of quarantine, Doherty Institute says
08/11/2021.description: A final report to government recommends using rapid antigen tests instead of quarantine for school children exposed to COVID-19 to safely limit the number of classroom teaching hours lost.
08/11/2021.author: Jake Evans

08/11/2021.headline: Targeting 'fence-sitters' with 'FOMO' could lift Queensland's vaccination rates, experts say
08/11/2021.description: The Queensland government needs to do more to appeal to "fence-sitters" and smarter, stronger marketing strategies are needed to boost vaccination uptake and get the state over the finish line before borders reopen, experts warn.
08/11/2021.author: Ciara Jones

08/11/2021.headline: Live: NSW Now: 65,000 students to sit HSC exams after COVID-19 delays
08/11/2021.description: MORNING BRIEFING: More than 65,000 New South Wales year 12 students will sit the HSC written exams from today after two years of COVID-19 disruptions and lockdowns.
08/11/2021.author: Ciara Jones

08/11/2021.headline: Flying doctors on alert for looming COVID outbreak in the bush
08/11/2021.description: The medical lifelines that sustain rural and regional Queensland are set to be tested, with rescue planes and helicopters bracing for what a COVID outbreak means in the bush.
08/11/2021.author: Owen Jacques

08/11/2021.headline: How domestic violence became a $2b business problem
08/11/2021.description: Domestic and family violence leads to staff absenteeism and lower productivity and  the estimated cost to business is about $2 billion annually, a new report shows. Workplaces are being asked to do more to fight the problem.
08/11/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

08/11/2021.headline: Robbie Young made headlines as the target of a racist comment, but it's his off-field work that defines him
08/11/2021.description: Footballer Robbie Young has carved out a reputation as being lightning-fast on the football field in both the AFL and SANFL, but it was a racist comment aimed at the small forward that made him a household name. Now, he's hoping his off-field work with children will change that.
08/11/2021.author: Sara Tomevska

08/11/2021.headline: Parisa left Afghanistan utterly 'empty'. Now, she's rebuilding her life in Melbourne
08/11/2021.description: Clothes, toothbrushes and everyday necessities donated by communities and essential services are helping thousands of Afghan evacuees in Melbourne resettle, after the Taliban takeover in August.
08/11/2021.author: Nicole Asher

08/11/2021.headline: Catching COVID would be dire for baby Austin. His parents hope rapid antigen tests will help protect him
08/11/2021.description: Families desperate to keep their most vulnerable members safe are wondering if the new test will shore up their fight against the virus.
08/11/2021.author: Sian Johnson

08/11/2021.headline: When a crowd surges forward, the artist on stage has a role to play
08/11/2021.description: There is a lot we don't know about what occurred in the Astroworld Festival. But what Travis Scott did or did not do on stage in Houston is now being scrutinised. So what role does the artist play when it comes to 'mosh pit etiquette'?
08/11/2021.author: Paul Donoughue

08/11/2021.headline: How to protect yourself from dodgy builders and defects ruining your dream home
08/11/2021.description: Building a home is a huge investment. So when it goes wrong, it can be devastating. Here's what to do to make sure it goes to plan, and the steps you can take when it's all too late.
08/11/2021.author: Adam Langenberg

08/11/2021.headline: ABC secures broadcast rights to WorldPride and Sydney Mardi Gras
08/11/2021.description: The ABC has secured the broadcast rights for Sydney Mardi Gras for the first time in 28 years and WorldPride 2023 — the largest global event in NSW since the 2000 Olympic Games.
08/11/2021.author: Paige Cockburn

08/11/2021.headline: Swimming near sharks in freezing water might sound horrifying but for Ross Frylinck, it was life-changing
08/11/2021.description: The South African filmmaker says his friend, creator of My Octopus Teacher Craig Foster, taught him that cold water swimming can seriously impact your life.
08/11/2021.author: Michael Mackenzie and Anna Kelsey-Sugg

08/11/2021.headline: Niki's kids have had to isolate twice since the end of lockdown. She's had enough — and she's not alone
08/11/2021.description: Niki Mahaffey is sick of homeschooling her two children. But two coronavirus exposures at school mean the family has had to isolate twice since the end of lockdown.
08/11/2021.author: Casey Briggs

08/11/2021.headline: How much does your morning coffee cost? It could be about to get more expensive
08/11/2021.description: Your morning coffee or the next cocktail on a night out could be about to cost you more, thanks to some lingering effects of the pandemic.
08/11/2021.author: Stephanie Borys

08/11/2021.headline: Barack Obama takes aim at China, Russia for missing COP26
08/11/2021.description: The former US president calls for rich countries to help poorer nations battling the effects of climate change.
08/11/2021.author: Stephanie Borys

08/11/2021.headline: At 83, the ‘Nimblewill Nomad' is now the oldest to hike Appalachian Trail
08/11/2021.description: For more than 3,500 kilometres this 83-year-old was walking across a large chunk of the eastern United States as he set a new record.
08/11/2021.author: Stephanie Borys

08/11/2021.headline: Government commits to expanding electric vehicle charging stations but no subsidies to increase uptake
08/11/2021.description: The federal government will partner with the private sector to fund 50,000 charging stations in Australian homes, in a bid to encourage more people to buy electric vehicles.
08/11/2021.author: Henry Belot

08/11/2021.headline: Australian cricket team to tour Pakistan for first time in 24 years
08/11/2021.description: Australia have not played in Pakistan since Mark Taylor hit an unbeaten 334 in Peshawar in 1998, with security concerns meaning all tours since have been played in the UAE.
08/11/2021.author: Henry Belot

08/11/2021.headline: Mystery surrounds kangaroo that got stuck on a hot tin roof in Mount Isa
08/11/2021.description: Firefighters in the north-west Queensland town say they are used to rescuing cats, dogs and birds, but finding a kangaroo on the roof on a house is a first.
08/11/2021.author: Andrew Saunders and Larissa Waterson

08/11/2021.headline: Chinese exchange student drowns while snorkelling in Tasmania
08/11/2021.description: A boy who drowned while snorkelling with friends in Tasmania is identified as a Chinese exchange student.
08/11/2021.author: James Dunlevie

08/11/2021.headline: Labor leader wore wire to record former SA MP accused of blackmailing him, court documents state
08/11/2021.description: SA Labor leader Peter Malinauskas was secretly fitted with a wire by detectives to record an interaction with former MP Annabel Digance and her husband who have since been accused of blackmail, according to court documents.
08/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

08/11/2021.headline: Two boys plead guilty to aggravated kidnapping of Peter Keeley but not guilty to murder
08/11/2021.description: Two out of three teenage boys accused of murdering the Canberra man on the NSW Far South Coast  have pleaded guilty to an additional charge of aggravated kidnapping.
08/11/2021.author: Adriane Reardon

08/11/2021.headline: Scott Boland stars with the ball as Victoria beat NSW in Sheffield Shield
08/11/2021.description: Victoria grabs another outright Sheffield Shield win late on day four against New South Wales, with bowler Scott Boland making the key breakthroughs in front of Australian selector Tony Dodemaide at the MCG.
08/11/2021.author: Adriane Reardon

08/11/2021.headline: Murder trial begins for WA father who allegedly inflicted 'head to foot' injuries on baby boy
08/11/2021.description: A father on trial for murder allegedly inflicted "head to foot" injuries on his baby son — either by "vigorously" shaking or through other violent behaviour — towards the seven-month-old boy, the Supreme Court of WA hears.
08/11/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

09/11/2021.headline: WA record shedding sheep hits $90,000 with new breed blend coming
09/11/2021.description: A Western Australian meat sheep has sold for $90,000, smashing the state record, as breeders prepare to blend their high-priced shedding varieties with rams fetching $150,000.
09/11/2021.author: Angus Mackintosh

09/11/2021.headline: 'Puts everyone at risk': Medical adviser warns NT double vax figures are inaccurate
09/11/2021.description: Aboriginal Medical Services Alliance NT's John Boffa says the territory government's vaccination figures are inaccurate and may create a potentially dangerous situation when border restrictions relax after Christmas.
09/11/2021.author: Stewart Brash and Emma Haskin

09/11/2021.headline: Domestic violence order application against senior NT police officer withdrawn, subject to court undertaking
09/11/2021.description: Senior Northern Territory police officer Daniel Shean is no longer facing an application for a domestic violence order, after his wife agreed to withdraw the matter.
09/11/2021.author: Stewart Brash and Emma Haskin

09/11/2021.headline: Convicted Canberra gang rapists lose appeal over convictions
09/11/2021.description: Simon Vunilagi, Isimeli Vatanitawake and Josefa Masivesi sexually assaulted the victim after meeting her at Mooseheads and taking her to a Downer unit in 2019.
09/11/2021.author: Holly Tregenza

09/11/2021.headline: Calls for more testing after asbestos found in imported toys and building materials
09/11/2021.description: Unions and anti-asbestos campaigners are demanding more testing at Australia's border after revelations the deadly mineral is still slipping into the country despite a strict ban.
09/11/2021.author: Angelique Donnellan

09/11/2021.headline: Man accused of attempted murder claims woman accidentally lit herself on fire
09/11/2021.description: The man accused of lighting his former partner on fire has taken the stand for the first time during the trial, claiming his alleged victim poured fuel on herself before unwittingly igniting a flame.
09/11/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

09/11/2021.headline: Qantas A380 soars back to Sydney after gathering dust in desert for more than 500 days
09/11/2021.description: After more than 500 days gathering dust in storage in the Californian desert, a Qantas A380 superjumbo roars back across Australian skies for the first time since 2020.
09/11/2021.author: Sarah Gerathy

09/11/2021.headline: Do you really know what's healthy and what's not when filling up your shopping trolley?
09/11/2021.description: Food Standards Australia New Zealand is developing a food database to help consumers understand the nutritional value of the food they eat.
09/11/2021.author: Jane McNaughton

09/11/2021.headline: Murdered woman Suzanne Poll's husband breaks down in court as he recounts night he found her body
09/11/2021.description: The husband of a woman murdered in an Adelaide stationery shop nearly three decades ago has broken down in court recalling the moment he discovered his wife's bloodied body in the back storage area of the shop where she worked. The following story contains content some readers may find distressing.
09/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

09/11/2021.headline: Scott Morrison isn't undergoing a climate conversion but an awakening to public sentiment
09/11/2021.description: The Prime Minister is no longer comparing electric vehicles with a war on the weekend. This isn't a climate conversion but an awakening to a changing political landscape, writes political correspondent Brett Worthington.
09/11/2021.author: Brett Worthington

09/11/2021.headline: More COVID deaths linked to Albury aged care centre outbreak
09/11/2021.description: Albury's Mercy Place aged care facility is not allowing any visitors — except for compassionate end-of-life visits — as they try to manage a COVID-19 outbreak that has claimed nine lives.
09/11/2021.author: Brett Worthington

09/11/2021.headline: 'Sophisticated email scam' costs Queensland grazier thousands of dollars
09/11/2021.description: This Queensland grazier was paying what appeared to be a legitimate business invoice, when he fell victim to a 'very sophisticated' email scam.
09/11/2021.author: Johanna Marie

09/11/2021.headline: Satellite images show mockups of US Navy ships in Chinese desert
09/11/2021.description: Satellite images by space tech company Maxar have captured mockups in the shape of US Navy aircraft carriers and other warships in the Chinese desert.
09/11/2021.author: Johanna Marie

09/11/2021.headline: Ash Gardner builds deeper connection with Indigenous identity
09/11/2021.description: For Ashleigh Gardner, spending more time at home in Australia during the pandemic meant she could reconnect with her Indigenous roots.
09/11/2021.author: Johanna Marie

09/11/2021.headline: Alec Baldwin calls for police on film sets to monitor gun safety
09/11/2021.description: Actor Alec Baldwin says he believes film and TV productions should hire police officers to monitor weapons on sets as Hollywood considers new safety measures following the fatal shooting of Halyna Hutchins.
09/11/2021.author: Johanna Marie

09/11/2021.headline: 'Less than human': Inquest hears 'contemptuous' attitude to Aboriginal inmate led to avoidable death
09/11/2021.description: An inquest into the death of First Nations man Bailey Mackander, who died after falling 8 metres while trying to escape custody, hears a "real lack of humanity" by correctional staff contributed to his death.
09/11/2021.author: Giselle Wakatama

09/11/2021.headline: Singapore to bill unvaccinated COVID-19 patients as cases surge across island
09/11/2021.description: Singapore's Ministry of Health announces that from December 8 all COVID-19 patients who are eligible for vaccination but choose not to do so will need to cover their own medical expenses.
09/11/2021.author: Jason Dasey

09/11/2021.headline: Mandatory COVID-19 vaccination for aged care visitors but not for SA schoolies festival
09/11/2021.description: As plans are unveiled for a COVID-safe schoolies festival in South Australia later this month, mandatory vaccination requirements have expanded to include residential aged care visitors and disability support workers.
09/11/2021.author: Jason Dasey

09/11/2021.headline: Ancient 'penis worms' may have been first to hermit themselves away in shells
09/11/2021.description: Millions of years before crabs did it, lowly penis worms were already living the hermit lifestyle,  fossils found in China suggest.
09/11/2021.author: Anna Salleh

09/11/2021.headline: 'I get goosebumps': Emma Gilmour becomes McLaren's first female driver
09/11/2021.description: Emma Gilmour says she never imagined she would have the opportunity to race for McLaren as she becomes the renowned team's first female driver.
09/11/2021.author: Chloe Hart

09/11/2021.headline: WA government to take on 30 recommendations after inquiry into death of 7yo who died waiting for treatment
09/11/2021.description: An independent inquiry into the death of a seven-year-old girl at Perth Children's Hospital makes several recommendations for change after finding staff were "exhausted, demoralised and isolated", but leaves her parents without closure.
09/11/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

09/11/2021.headline: Fisherman fights off crocodile on Far North Queensland riverbank
09/11/2021.description: The 60-year-old man is recovering in hospital after the attack on the banks of the Mcivor River near Hope Vale. He escaped by stabbing the reptile with a knife after it grabbed him by the leg.
09/11/2021.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath

09/11/2021.headline: How much is your study for the HSC related to your present job?
09/11/2021.description: Three former students share their experiences with the HSC and how they deviated from those career plans to make it in areas they couldn't possibly imagine.
09/11/2021.author: Michael Luu

09/11/2021.headline: Dress worn by Amy Winehouse in her final performance sells for more than $335,000
09/11/2021.description: Amy Winehouse wore the green and black dress during a show in June 2011 in Serbia one month before she died.
09/11/2021.author: Michael Luu

09/11/2021.headline: Unvaccinated NRL players won't be able to play in Victoria and Queensland
09/11/2021.description: The NRL says it will adapt to public health orders that stop unvaccinated players from having access to or playing at the home grounds of four teams in Queensland and Victoria.
09/11/2021.author: David Mark

09/11/2021.headline: Queensland businesses worried about staff copping abuse over vaccination freedoms and restrictions
09/11/2021.description: Queensland hospitality businesses are concerned the state's new freedoms that are only for those fully vaccinated against COVID-19 from next month will have serious repercussions on their busiest trade time of the year.
09/11/2021.author: Jessica Stewart

09/11/2021.headline: Mick Byrne went from being sacked by Ron Barassi to VFL glory, and now boss of rugby's big hope
09/11/2021.description: After playing and coaching in three football codes, Hawthorn premiership winner Mick Byrne has been handed the task of making the Fijian Drua the next rugby powerhouse.
09/11/2021.author: Jack Snape

09/11/2021.headline: Inside a terrifying crowd crush: The moment a packed venue turns into stifling 'fluid mass'
09/11/2021.description: After the Astroworld disaster that claimed eight lives, investigators and organisers are scrambling to get to the bottom of what caused the deadly crowd crush. The science behind it is frighteningly simple.
09/11/2021.author: Lucy Sweeney and Rebecca Armitage

09/11/2021.headline: Holocaust memorial remembers 64,440 murdered Austrian Jews
09/11/2021.description: The country where Adolf Hitler was born was annexed by Nazi Germany in 1938, yet Austria has been slow to recognise its role in the Holocaust.
09/11/2021.author: Lucy Sweeney and Rebecca Armitage

09/11/2021.headline: Which car brands are going all electric and when?
09/11/2021.description: The federal government says it will not force Australians out of the car they want to drive, but the choice may have already been taken away from them. Here are the car brands that are making the permanent switch to electric.
09/11/2021.author: Lucy Sweeney and Rebecca Armitage

09/11/2021.headline: Tourism pressure mounts on Tasmanian government to end native forest logging
09/11/2021.description: Tasmania's tourism lobby ends its agreement with the forestry industry in the wake of mounting concerns from operators that logging is jeopardising the state's "clean and green" image.
09/11/2021.author: Adam Langenberg

09/11/2021.headline: NSW COVID-19 vaccination data reveals which areas are lagging
09/11/2021.description: NSW has fully vaccinated 90 per cent of its population aged 16 and over against COVID-19, but how well protected you are depends on where you live.
09/11/2021.author: Catherine Hanrahan

09/11/2021.headline: How slapping solar on the MCG could help Melbourne to net zero
09/11/2021.description: With Australia committing to net zero, a study has found central Melbourne could meet most of its energy needs with rooftop solar on skyscrapers and big public buildings like the MCG.
09/11/2021.author: James Purtill

09/11/2021.headline: One reason 2022 looks like an ideal time for a government to land re-election
09/11/2021.description: All sorts of things determine election outcomes but the economy is one and right now it could scarcely look better for the government, writes Peter Martin.
09/11/2021.author: James Purtill

09/11/2021.headline: 'Data entry error' caused vaccine report mistake, TGA says
09/11/2021.description: Australia's medicines regulator has clarified a mistake on its website that wrongly showed a six-year-old girl had experienced "heavy menstrual bleeding" and other illnesses after receiving the Pfizer vaccine, symptoms which were supposed to be attributed to a 41-year-old woman.
09/11/2021.author: Nour Haydar

09/11/2021.headline: What happens if you catch COVID-19 at work? You could sue your boss
09/11/2021.description: Workers compensation claims are expected to rise as restrictions ease, leaving bosses potentially liable if their staff get sick.
09/11/2021.author: Rhiana Whitson

09/11/2021.headline: How did China's 'anti-Valentine's Day' turn into the world's biggest shopping event?
09/11/2021.description: Selling more goods than Black Friday and Cyber Monday combined, China's "anti-Valentine's Day" has transformed from a movement dedicated to singles' self-care into the world's largest 24-hour shopping spree.
09/11/2021.author: Dong Xing

09/11/2021.headline: Lukashenko accused of 'inhuman, gangster-style approach' to migrants
09/11/2021.description: The humanitarian crisis on the Belarusian border deepens as thousands wait while EU nations stiffen border patrols and accuse the Belarusian government of 'gangster style' behaviour.
09/11/2021.author: Dong Xing

09/11/2021.headline: China's military conducts combat readiness patrol near Taiwan Strait
09/11/2021.description: The military conducts the combat readiness patrol aimed at the Taiwan Strait just as US politicians touch down in Taiwan.
09/11/2021.author: Dong Xing

09/11/2021.headline: Knife-wielding man shot dead by Norwegian police
09/11/2021.description: Weeks after a bow and arrow attack leaves five dead, Norwegian police shoot a knife-wielding man dead in the national capital of Oslo.
09/11/2021.author: Dong Xing

09/11/2021.headline: Private 'catch-and-release' quarantine scheme could soon be up and running for non-Australians
09/11/2021.description: A company established by an influential Liberal party figure says it could bring up to 160,000 foreign workers and students a year into Australia via a private hotel quarantine system with support from the Home Affairs Department.
09/11/2021.author: Andrew Greene

09/11/2021.headline: Federal government to overhaul clean energy fund to allow investment in carbon capture and storage
09/11/2021.description: The federal government has renewed plans to overhaul the Clean Energy Finance Corporation (CEFC) so it can invest in carbon capture and storage, promising $500 million of investment in emerging technology.
09/11/2021.author: Henry Belot

09/11/2021.headline: NT Chief Minister apologises for Facebook post labelling COVID source a sex worker
09/11/2021.description: A Facebook post on the Northern Territory Chief Minister Michael Gunner's Facebook page said a COVID source case was a sex worker. She wasn't.
09/11/2021.author: Samantha Dick

09/11/2021.headline: 'A crisis and catastrophe': Children suffer with malnutrition in Taliban-run Afghanistan
09/11/2021.description: The United Nations says the number of Afghans living in near-famine conditions has risen to 8.7 million, up by 3 million from earlier this year, as a worsening drought and Taliban-run hospitals add to the suffering.
09/11/2021.author: Samantha Dick

09/11/2021.headline: Push for inquiry into gay hate crimes to investigate claims police turned blind eye
09/11/2021.description: Legal observers say a judicial inquiry into gay and transgender hate crimes in NSW must investigate claims that police officers turned a blind eye or were involved in the attacks.
09/11/2021.author: Jason Om

09/11/2021.headline: Planning minister to give community a say on Clive Palmer's coal-fired power station proposal
09/11/2021.description: Clive Palmer's Waratah Coal wants to build a coal-fired power station near the town of Alpha in central western Queensland. The plan is before Barcaldine Regional Council, but Deputy Premier and Planning Minister Steven Miles might take over the assessment process.
09/11/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

09/11/2021.headline: Pandemic law protesters gather at Victorian Parliament as lawyers urge government to hit pause on bill
09/11/2021.description: Victorian barristers urge the state government to halt the progression of its revamped pandemic laws through parliament, as protests over the controversial new bill continue.
09/11/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

09/11/2021.headline: Service NSW calls in police to investigate fraudulent claims for COVID-19 business grants
09/11/2021.description: Police will use artificial intelligence to check all applications after the state government unearthed more than $20 million worth of fraud.
09/11/2021.author: Tony Ibrahim

09/11/2021.headline: 'Dangerous, dirty play' from Nikola Jokic leads to Miami players waiting for Denver in stadium corridor
09/11/2021.description: The NBA's Nuggets and Heat clash in Denver over an ugly incident that results in MVP Nikola Jokic and Miami's Markieff Morris being ejected — and a furious Jimmy Butler and other Heat players waiting for the Nuggets outside afterwards.
09/11/2021.author: Tony Ibrahim

09/11/2021.headline: NT police officer 'may have committed offences' in connection with partner's death, coroner finds
09/11/2021.description: Greg Cavanagh says in his 25 years as the Northern Territory coroner there has never been an occasion "a serving officer has refused to answer questions because the answers might incriminate him or her in an offence relating to a death".
09/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

10/11/2021.headline: 'Prevention is our priority': FIFO boss admits failing female workers
10/11/2021.description: One of Australia's biggest mining contractors, Macmahon, has conceded it's failed to protect female workers against sexual harassment. During a WA parliamentary inquiry hearing, the company revealed it's sacked five people this year alone for inappropriate behaviour.
10/11/2021.author: Eliza Borrello

10/11/2021.headline: Jury finds WA man guilty of murdering best friend with samurai sword
10/11/2021.description: A jury takes three hours to determine that Damian Kyle Beckerleg murdered his best friend James Reimers (pictured) after a day of fishing and drinking went horribly wrong.
10/11/2021.author: Zoe Keenan

10/11/2021.headline: Police lay charges over Hillarys incident that has left Perth father in critical condition
10/11/2021.description: Police charge a man with grievous bodily harm following an alleged physical altercation in Hillarys on Sunday that has left a Perth father-of-two in a critical condition.
10/11/2021.author: Kate Christian

10/11/2021.headline: Japan culls 143,000 chickens to contain bird flu, as more European countries record cases
10/11/2021.description: The Japanese Agriculture Ministry says it does "not believe there is any possibility of avian influenza being transmitted to humans through the consumption of chicken meat or eggs".
10/11/2021.author: Kate Christian

10/11/2021.headline: Blame it on the boogie: Dance ban killing the vibe
10/11/2021.description: Despite having no active cases of COVID in the community and 80 per cent of eligible residents double-vaccinated, Tasmania still has strict limitations on music events and dancing — and promoters say it is killing the vibe.
10/11/2021.author: April McLennan

10/11/2021.headline: Teenagers drinking at 'vacant' home found murder victim's body in the backyard, jury hears
10/11/2021.description: A group of teenagers drinking at what they thought was a vacant home in Adelaide's north-eastern suburbs discovered a body dumped in the backyard after investigating an unusual smell, a court hears.
10/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

10/11/2021.headline: Reigning NBA MVP suspended without pay following on-court altercation
10/11/2021.description: The NBA suspends Nikola Jokic and fines Markieff Morris for their role in an ugly incident during the game between the Denver Nuggets and Miami Heat.
10/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

10/11/2021.headline: Socceroos primed for emotional homecoming
10/11/2021.description: Socceroos boss Graham Arnold says he's seen a lot of emotion in his players ahead of playing on home soil for the first time in 763 days.
10/11/2021.author: Simon Smale

10/11/2021.headline: 'A big deal': Donald Trump fails in bid to block probe into attack on US Capitol
10/11/2021.description: Federal Judge Tanya Chutkan rejects an argument by Mr Trump's lawyers that White House telephone records, visitor logs and other documents should be hidden from a US House of Representatives committee investigating the January 6 riot.
10/11/2021.author: Simon Smale

10/11/2021.headline: The difficulty in preserving Australia's last living flamingos
10/11/2021.description: Immortalised by taxidermy, Adelaide Zoo's much-loved flamingo companions were unveiled today in the SA Museum's mammal display, drawing a round of applause from onlookers.
10/11/2021.author: Sara Tomevska

10/11/2021.headline: Queensland passes vaccination threshold for easing of mask rules
10/11/2021.description: Queensland meets the state government's threshold for the easing of mask rules, with 80.1 per cent of the state's population over 16 now at least partially vaccinated.
10/11/2021.author: Sara Tomevska

10/11/2021.headline: Katherine close contacts to be re-tested, residents urged to monitor health after wastewater samples test positive for COVID
10/11/2021.description: COVID viral fragments have been detected in wastewater in the Northern Territory town of Katherine, prompting health authorities to ask residents to monitor their health for any symptoms.
10/11/2021.author: Sara Tomevska

10/11/2021.headline: 'What the Chinese want is respect': Paul Keating says Australia shouldn't interfere in Taiwan conflict
10/11/2021.description: Former prime minister Paul Keating warns the federal government not to be drawn into a military conflict over Taiwan and plays down the prospect of a Chinese military invasion.
10/11/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

10/11/2021.headline: 'Allowing a coup to be staged': Prince Harry says he warned Twitter CEO about deadly assault on US Capitol
10/11/2021.description: Prince Harry says he warned Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey via email that "his platform was allowing a coup to be staged" a day before the deadly assault on the US Capitol.
10/11/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

10/11/2021.headline: 'You just can't escape the smell': The troubling legacy of mammoth waste disposal pits in the US wars on terror
10/11/2021.description: Thousands of veterans of the conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan are coming down with illnesses they link to their exposure to toxins from massive waste sites known as burn pits.
10/11/2021.author: Barbara Miller

10/11/2021.headline: Lion takeover of Stone & Wood would 'free up' taps for independent brewers, ACCC says
10/11/2021.description: The nation's competition regulator says it won't oppose Lion's proposed acquisition of Fermentum, owner of Byron Bay-based Stone & Wood.
10/11/2021.author: Kim Honan

10/11/2021.headline: 'This is the biggest one yet': Major flooding expected as heavy rain descends upon the east
10/11/2021.description: November rain records have already been smashed through Australia's west and centre — now, heavy rain and erratic storms are shifting towards northern NSW and southern Queensland.
10/11/2021.author: Kate Doyle

10/11/2021.headline: 'Make it feel like it's the WWF': 'Raging' in the spotlight as Travis Scott video resurfaces after Astroworld disaster
10/11/2021.description: As the entertainment industry grapples with fallout of the Astroworld disaster, in which eight people were killed and hundreds injured in an apparent crowd surge, attention has turned to Travis Scott's past conduct — and his unique style of performance.
10/11/2021.author: Kate Doyle

10/11/2021.headline: Brazil legend Formiga to retire from international football
10/11/2021.description: After competing in a record seven FIFA World Cups, Brazilian veteran Formiga is set to retire from international football at the age of 43.
10/11/2021.author: Samantha Lewis

10/11/2021.headline: Officials update Queensland's COVID-19 exposure sites list after new cases emerge
10/11/2021.description: More sites in Warwick and on the Gold Coast are expected to be added by Queensland Health contact tracers.
10/11/2021.author: Samantha Lewis

10/11/2021.headline: 'Zoe's Law' introduced to NSW Parliament 12 years after Brodie lost unborn baby to drunk driver
10/11/2021.description: A bill first proposed after a drunk driver hit Brodie Donegan, causing the loss of her foetus, Zoe, 12 years ago, is introduced to NSW Parliament in a bid to impose harsher penalties for crimes that result in the loss of an unborn baby.
10/11/2021.author: Ruby Cornish

10/11/2021.headline: 'Littered with cockroaches': Former pizza bar operator faces court over food safety breaches
10/11/2021.description: The former operator of an Adelaide pizza bar has faced court today after pleading guilty to 20 charges after council inspectors found cockroaches and mouldy food on the premises.
10/11/2021.author: Mahalia Carter

10/11/2021.headline: Teenage driver and passenger accused of breaching WA hard border by speeding through checkpoint
10/11/2021.description: A 17-year-old boy driving from New South Wales and his 24-year-old passenger are charged after their car allegedly sped through the West Australian border checkpoint at Eucla, failing to stop for police.
10/11/2021.author: Abby Richards

10/11/2021.headline: 41yo truck driver charged over ambulance crash killing nurse and elderly patient
10/11/2021.description: A man has been charged over the deaths of nurse Ray Wyeth and his 87-year-old patient, who were killed when his truck hit the ambulance they were travelling in west of Rockhampton last month.
10/11/2021.author: Erin Semmler and Katrina Beavan

10/11/2021.headline: Hawks, Blues confirm positive COVID-19 cases
10/11/2021.description: Hawthorn AFL player Finn Maginness is in quarantine, while Carlton says a member of its AFLW program has returned a positive COVID-19 test.
10/11/2021.author: Erin Semmler and Katrina Beavan

10/11/2021.headline: Thieves steal camera installed to capture once-in-a-decade bloom of rare flower
10/11/2021.description: A few "choice words" slipped past the Warrnambool Botanic Gardens curator's lips when he discovered the camera, mounted four metres up a tree, had been stolen.
10/11/2021.author: Daniel Miles and Jeremy Lee

10/11/2021.headline: Flood watch continues for parts of Queensland as final wintry blast set to delivers more wild weather
10/11/2021.description: Queenslanders are being told to prepare for an onslaught of erratic thunderstorms and torrential rain up to three times the November average over coming days as parts of the state remain on flood watch.
10/11/2021.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

10/11/2021.headline: Planning a trip to Queensland? Beware of the fine print around COVID vaccines
10/11/2021.description: From November 19, fully-vaccinated travellers entering Queensland from interstate can quarantine at home. But there's a catch.
10/11/2021.author: Ciara Jones

10/11/2021.headline: Growing up, Mon Schafter rarely saw queer people like her in the media. Now she's leading an ABC project to change that
10/11/2021.description: ABCQueer aims to make young LGBTQIA+ feel less alone and was inspired by a brother's love for his gay sister.
10/11/2021.author: Monique Schafter

10/11/2021.headline: Victorian restaurant owner faces cancelling Christmas bookings amid 'dire' staff shortage
10/11/2021.description: Hospitality businesses are calling on the federal government to make it easier for the international workforce to return to Australia, while some hospitality workers contemplate how they can better their pay and conditions while they are in high demand.
10/11/2021.author: Oliver Gordon

10/11/2021.headline: 'I'm worrying about the kids': Aboriginal children left without on-country mental health staff in APY Lands
10/11/2021.description: Some of Australia's most vulnerable remote communities have been left without on-country mental health staff to support Aboriginal children.
10/11/2021.author: Patrick Martin

10/11/2021.headline: 'Desperate' families set to reunite as Fiji's international borders reopen to Australia
10/11/2021.description: Ten months after giving birth to her son in Melbourne, Farisha's parents will finally be able to meet their grandson as Fiji's international border opens to Australia today.
10/11/2021.author: Marian Faa and Edwina Seselja

10/11/2021.headline: Daniel Craig ends 15 years as 007 with new Bond film that packs emotional punch
10/11/2021.description: No Time To Die wraps up a five-film cycle that's variously shaken, stirred and shamelessly serviced the expectations of its generations-spanning audience.
10/11/2021.author: Luke Goodsell

10/11/2021.headline: Zoey could have been a kid who never came back to school after lockdown, but one simple step changed everything
10/11/2021.description: Her classmates were continuing lessons and enjoying social support, but Zoey had dropped out of class — and barely anyone noticed.
10/11/2021.author: Conor Duffy

10/11/2021.headline: Researchers have mapped the presence of our poo entering the world's oceans. It's not pretty
10/11/2021.description: Researchers have mapped the discharge of global wastewater — treated, septic, and raw sewage — into coastal ecosystems in what they say is the finest detail yet. And the numbers are intimidating.
10/11/2021.author: Nick Kilvert

10/11/2021.headline: Abuse report author shocked at discoveries
10/11/2021.description: The co-author of a review into how Tasmania's education department responded to child sexual abuse allegations was shocked to discover he went to school alongside some victims and was taught by some accused abusers.
10/11/2021.author: Adam Langenberg

10/11/2021.headline: Freezing November weather nothing to crow about
10/11/2021.description: "Don't plant tomatoes before Show Day" — so the saying goes in Tasmania. Well, Show Day was three weeks ago, and those poor little tomato plants could soon be covered in snow.
10/11/2021.author: James Dunlevie

10/11/2021.headline: Police video shows the dramatic moment a wanted fugitive is found hiding in a shipping container
10/11/2021.description: The video shows police handcuffing accused drug trafficker Mostafa Baluch at a border checkpoint and seizing large wads of banknotes.
10/11/2021.author: Ursula Malone

10/11/2021.headline: As big Australian backyards disappear, experts fear our summers might get hotter. Here's why
10/11/2021.description: Demand for housing has led to a rise in subdivisions, and a loss of yard space and the trees they contain, in turn exacerbating an urban heat island effect which could be making our suburbs hotter.
10/11/2021.author: Prianka Srinivasan and Hellena Souisa

10/11/2021.headline: Abusive cops will stop being given 'special treatment' under Australian-first plan, police say
10/11/2021.description: Victoria Police has launched a landmark policy for dealing with family violence perpetrators in its ranks. But advocates fear critical flaws in the new advice will mean the welfare of abusive officers will continue being prioritised over victim safety.
10/11/2021.author: Hayley Gleeson

10/11/2021.headline: We witnessed Morrison's 'Freedom Day' this week — and his reversal on electric vehicles was the main event
10/11/2021.description: Reducing emissions without touching anything that could be interpreted as a "price" on carbon has become a political imperative for Scott Morrison, writes David Speers.
10/11/2021.author: David Speers

10/11/2021.headline: When Keating speaks about China it pays to listen. This is why
10/11/2021.description: Paul Keating is not an apologist for Chinese authoritarianism but a cold-eyed realist about Chinese power. He argues China seeks and deserves respect. But in making a case for legitimising Chinese power Keating risks defending a potentially rogue leader, writes Stan Grant.
10/11/2021.author: Stan Grant

10/11/2021.headline: Daryl Mitchell carries his bat and hits New Zealand into T20 World Cup final
10/11/2021.description: New Zealand opener Daryl Mitchell carries his bat to become a cricketing hero as the Black Caps stun England and move into the final of the Twenty20 World Cup.
10/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

10/11/2021.headline: Hindus know this water is toxic but they are bathing in it anyway to celebrate the festival of Chhath Puja
10/11/2021.description: Hundreds of Hindu devotees flock to the heavily polluted Yamuna River and take a dip in its toxic waters as part of a religious festival.
10/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

10/11/2021.headline: Dalai Lama criticises China's leaders for having too much control
10/11/2021.description: China's foreign ministry says the door to dialogue is open with the Dalai Lama as the country praises comments made by former Australian prime minister Paul Keating.
10/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

10/11/2021.headline: Draft COP26 agreement calls on countries to strengthen 2030 targets
10/11/2021.description: Australia could be pushed to strengthen its 2030 emissions reduction targets by the end of next year if the draft COP26 agreement released by host the United Kingdom is agreed to.
10/11/2021.author: Jack Hawke

10/11/2021.headline: French women's footballer arrested after attack by masked men on teammate
10/11/2021.description: Paris St-Germain confirms Aminata Diallo is in custody over her alleged role in an attack that saw her teammate Kheira Hamraoui pulled from a car and hit in the legs with an iron bar last week.
10/11/2021.author: Jack Hawke

10/11/2021.headline: Italy issues arrest warrant for grandfather of orphaned boy who survived cable car disaster
10/11/2021.description: The boy's maternal grandfather picked him up and brought him back to Israel without the consent of the paternal aunt he was living with.
10/11/2021.author: Jack Hawke

10/11/2021.headline: US parents sue fertility clinic after receiving another couple's embryo and raising the wrong baby
10/11/2021.description: According to a lawsuit filed in Los Angeles, two couples spent three months raising children that weren't theirs before swapping the infants after a mistake by the California Center for Reproductive Health.
10/11/2021.author: Jack Hawke

11/11/2021.headline: The Loop: It's looking like a wet one, Alec Baldwin named in shooting lawsuit and blast-off for Elon Musk's SpaceX
11/11/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
11/11/2021.author: Bridget Judd

11/11/2021.headline: Producers rejoice as Tasmania's Launceston named world foodie city by UNESCO
11/11/2021.description: Launceston, in Tasmania's north, has been named as UNESCO's Creative City of Gastronomy — a gong local producers hope will help them tap into global markets.
11/11/2021.author: Manika Champ

11/11/2021.headline: Inquest into suicide of teen in state care hears residential group home had 'a culture of bullying'
11/11/2021.description: A teenage boy who took his own life in state care in Adelaide's south feared he would be forever stuck in one of the "worst placements" he'd been in, an inquest has heard.
11/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

11/11/2021.headline: Unvaccinated BHP coal miners stood down without pay
11/11/2021.description: Around 50 workers at the Hunter Valley's largest thermal coal mine have been stood down without pay over their COVID-19 vaccination status.
11/11/2021.author: Ben Millington

11/11/2021.headline: Rare 'Ringo Starr' cockatoo listed as endangered due to habitat loss in far north Queensland
11/11/2021.description: A spectacular bird that creates musical instruments has been listed as endangered.
11/11/2021.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath and Adam Stephen

11/11/2021.headline: Collingwood AFLW co-captain apologises for historical redface incident
11/11/2021.description: Collingwood AFLW co-captain Steph Chiocci issues an apology after old photos emerged of her wearing redface.
11/11/2021.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath and Adam Stephen

11/11/2021.headline: Police arrest two men over crash that killed father of four in Melbourne's south-east
11/11/2021.description: Detectives arrest and interview two men, aged 25 and 30, over the alleged hit-and-run crash that killed father of four Timmy Rakei early Tuesday morning.
11/11/2021.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath and Adam Stephen

11/11/2021.headline: Nurse stranded in NZ for months despite letter from WA Chief Health Officer supporting return
11/11/2021.description: A fully-vaccinated Esperance nurse and her two children have been stranded in New Zealand for three months because of Western Australia's strict border policies.
11/11/2021.author: Emily JB Smith

11/11/2021.headline: Man charged after allegedly injuring police with glass bottle at Melbourne's anti-lockdown protests
11/11/2021.description: The 52-year-old is facing 20 charges for his alleged involvement in the violent protests, which resulted in hundreds of arrests, injuries to 10 police officers and a newspaper photographer being pepper sprayed.
11/11/2021.author: Emily JB Smith

11/11/2021.headline: Saluting their service: Descendants of WWII veterans keeping diggers' stories alive
11/11/2021.description: A unique documentary project launched in regional Queensland on Remembrance Day shows a fresh and compelling perspective on the legacy of war.
11/11/2021.author: David Iliffe

11/11/2021.headline: Why does Queensland need two quarantine facilities, when other states are relaxing COVID-19 controls?
11/11/2021.description: The state's Deputy Premier has defended the two COVID-19 quarantine facilities, arguing it would leave Queensland better prepared than New South Wales and Victoria.
11/11/2021.author: Peter McCutcheon

11/11/2021.headline: In the original land of a fast food deal, dining out is getting more expensive
11/11/2021.description: Prices — or core inflation — are rising at their highest rate in three decades in the United States. Here's why and what it could mean for Australia.
11/11/2021.author: Emilia Terzon

11/11/2021.headline: American boy named world's most premature infant to survive
11/11/2021.description: Born 132 days premature with a twin who didn't survive, Curtis Means is now healthy and 16 months old.
11/11/2021.author: Emilia Terzon

11/11/2021.headline: Noosa property prices jump $6,000 a week as market surges through October
11/11/2021.description: Latest figures from CoreLogic show homes on the Sunshine Coast are increasing in value weekly as demand for Queensland property ramps up.
11/11/2021.author: Owen Jacques and Meg Bolton

11/11/2021.headline: 'Phenomenal' roadkill numbers in SA prompt pleas to slow down
11/11/2021.description: A massive increase in roadkill this spring is littering South Australian highways, with one wildlife rescuer finding 13 wombats and 10 kangaroos dead on a single road in the Murraylands.
11/11/2021.author: Malcolm Sutton

11/11/2021.headline: 'Great injustice': Family of 'beautiful little baby' killed by father say sentence inadequate
11/11/2021.description: Kozan Samuel Thomas Ware had been looking after his five-month-old son Adrian by himself for the first time when the incident occurred in March, 2017.
11/11/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

11/11/2021.headline: Aussie pitcher Liam Hendriks claims coveted MLB award
11/11/2021.description: Hendriks wins the American League's relief pitcher award for the second straight year, reaffirming his status as one of the MLB's top closers.
11/11/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

11/11/2021.headline: Forged signatures, deleted text messages and secret phone calls feature in latest IBAC hearing
11/11/2021.description: Former Victorian government minister Adem Somyurek tells IBAC it is "probably fair" to conclude he was aware his staff were forging other people's signatures, on his third day of evidence to an inquiry investigating misuse of taxpayer-funded staff.
11/11/2021.author: Bridget Rollason

11/11/2021.headline: Investigation launched after child swallows button battery at Queensland childcare centre
11/11/2021.description: C&K Kindergarten Association says it is cooperating fully with authorities after the incident at an undisclosed early learning centre on October 11.
11/11/2021.author: Amy Sheehan

11/11/2021.headline: Crime scene declared on Palm Island after man found dead with head injuries
11/11/2021.description: Queensland Police are investigating the suspicious death of a man on Palm Island, off the coast of Townsville.
11/11/2021.author: Jade Toomey

11/11/2021.headline: EPA investigation finds no evidence of deliberate oil dumping in Adelaide's Chinatown
11/11/2021.description: An Environment Protection Authority investigation finds new pavers in Adelaide's Chinatown were likely stained while oil was being transported but does not discover evidence it was deliberately dumped in drains.
11/11/2021.author: Jade Toomey

11/11/2021.headline: EV maker Rivian valued at more than Ford despite only having made 150 cars
11/11/2021.description: Shares of Rivian surged as much as 53 per cent on its Nasdaq debut, giving the EV maker a market valuation of more than $US100 billion.
11/11/2021.author: Rhiana Whitson

11/11/2021.headline: 'What hope do we have?': Residents denied COVID-19 test despite exposure risk
11/11/2021.description: Gold Coast Health says testing clinics have been "flexed up" to cope with increased demand after people were turned away at Robina.
11/11/2021.author: Cathy Border, Tom Forbes, Nicole Dyer, and Heidi Sheehan

11/11/2021.headline: Queensland researcher finds gut problems not a cause of autism
11/11/2021.description: Researchers say children on the autism spectrum are more likely to have gut complaints, but the study didn't find that the microbiome causes autism.
11/11/2021.author: Emma Pollard

11/11/2021.headline: Gold Coast residents could return to lockdown if mystery COVID outbreak continues
11/11/2021.description: Gold Coast residents are warned to expect a short, sharp lockdown if further unlinked cases are detected in the next 48 hours. The mystery outbreak has boosted the otherwise sluggish vaccine uptake in the city.
11/11/2021.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

11/11/2021.headline: 'Not your shame to carry': How to tell your boss you're in an abusive relationship and need time off work
11/11/2021.description: More Australian employers are implementing policies to fight domestic and family violence, recognising it's a workplace health and safety issue. Here are your rights as a worker.
11/11/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

11/11/2021.headline: Drought-stricken Queensland comes alive after drenching
11/11/2021.description: Rural residents are celebrating after storms bring heavy rain to the region with spirits high for more of the wet stuff.
11/11/2021.author: Maddelin McCosker, Ellie Grounds, and Julia André

11/11/2021.headline: African Nations Cup returns to South Australia in celebration of culture, community and football
11/11/2021.description: Cancelled last year due to COVID-19, South Australia's African Nations Cup is back. The tournament brings together African communities from all over Australia to celebrate culture and football.
11/11/2021.author: Camron Slessor

11/11/2021.headline: Doctor takes bid to treat patient with MDMA to court, in first case of its kind in Australia
11/11/2021.description: A lawyer representing the Victorian psychiatrist tells a court the doctor believes using ecstasy would help his severely ill patient, after the Department of Health knocks back his request to use the drug.
11/11/2021.author: Danny Tran

11/11/2021.headline: Live music is ramping up again. These memories kept the spirit alive
11/11/2021.description: While the pandemic forced long, dark months of silence, our yearning for the shared experience of live performance has only grown stronger.
11/11/2021.author: Danny Tran

11/11/2021.headline: Morrison coined a new slogan this week, but there's a problem with it
11/11/2021.description: It seemed remarkable chutzpah that Scott Morrison, back from Glasgow where Australia remains a criticised laggard despite its embrace of a 2050 target, would hit the trail to campaign on climate policy, writes Michelle Grattan.
11/11/2021.author: Michelle Grattan

11/11/2021.headline: NSW Police opposed plan to protect Aboriginal communities before fatal COVID-19 outbreaks
11/11/2021.description: One of Australia's most senior policemen swayed the New South Wales government to reject a plan to protect Aboriginal communities, before this year's spiralling COVID-19 outbreak in which at least 15 Aboriginal people have died.
11/11/2021.author: Sean Rubinsztein-Dunlop

11/11/2021.headline: Mohan and Kumar lost thousands in a social media scam that preyed on Tamil refugees
11/11/2021.description: The Hope Business scheme promised rapid returns on investments and commissions for signing up family and friends before it vanished without a trace.
11/11/2021.author: Tim Swanston

11/11/2021.headline: Cannibalism, disease and smothering are just some of the dangers free-range chickens face
11/11/2021.description: The welfare of Australia's nearly 22 million chickens has been under scrutiny recently. But not everyone agrees on what constitutes a good life for a hen.
11/11/2021.author: Simon Leo Brown

11/11/2021.headline: Chip off the ol' Moon? Mysterious near-Earth asteroid may have lunar origins
11/11/2021.description: A mysterious asteroid that travels around the Sun close to Earth may be a chunk of the Moon, a study suggests.
11/11/2021.author: Genelle Weule

11/11/2021.headline: Socceroos in 'great position' in World Cup qualifying, but can't afford any slip ups
11/11/2021.description: Graham Arnold says the Socceroos are in a "great position" after Thursday's draw with Saudi Arabia in World Cup qualifying, but cannot afford any slip ups.
11/11/2021.author: Simon Smale

11/11/2021.headline: Russia again sends nuclear-capable bombers on patrol over Belarus
11/11/2021.description: Two Russian Tu-160 strategic bombers practice bombing runs at the Ruzany firing range, about 60 kilometres east of Belarus' border with Poland.
11/11/2021.author: Simon Smale

11/11/2021.headline: Keating's 'benign and wrong' views on China ridiculed on Q+A
11/11/2021.description: Former prime minister Paul Keating's views on China are heavily criticised, as one Q+A panellist speaks of how Liberal Senator Eric Abetz wanted her to denounce the Chinese Communist Party.
11/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

11/11/2021.headline: Matthew Wade blasts Australia into World Cup final
11/11/2021.description: Brilliant performances with the bat from David Warner, Marcus Stoinis and Matthew Wade against Pakistan lift Australia into the Twenty20 World Cup final against New Zealand.
11/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

11/11/2021.headline: Chinese leaders agree to historic resolution cementing Xi Jinping's power
11/11/2021.description: The Central Committee declares Mr Xi's ideology the "essence of Chinese culture" and praises his role in the country's economic and political rise.
11/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

11/11/2021.headline: Steven Gerrard appointed new coach of English Premier League side Aston Villa
11/11/2021.description: The Liverpool great, who last season led Rangers to their first Scottish league title since 2011, replaces Dean Smith as manager of the Birmingham club.
11/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

11/11/2021.headline: Former South African president FW de Klerk dies aged 85
11/11/2021.description: Frederik Willem de Klerk, the last president of apartheid South Africa, dies aged 85 after a battle with cancer.
11/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

11/11/2021.headline: Elon Musk sells $US5 billion in Tesla shares after support in Twitter poll
11/11/2021.description: Tesla boss Elon Musk sells about $US5 billion in shares days after polling Twitter users about selling 10 per cent of his stake, amid debate in the US about tax avoidance by billionaires.
11/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

11/11/2021.headline: Hannah Clarke's parents Queensland's Australians of the Year for domestic violence campaigning
11/11/2021.description: Sue and Lloyd Clarke have become Queensland's 2022 Australians of the Year — the state's nominees for the national award in January — for their tireless work in campaigning against domestic violence despite their horrific loss.
11/11/2021.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

11/11/2021.headline: Singles' Day is the biggest shopping event in the world. But this year e-commerce has less 'gunpowder'
11/11/2021.description: A more muted Singles' Day shopping extravaganza is held amid a regulatory crackdown on the technology industry in China.
11/11/2021.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

11/11/2021.headline: Security staffing levels unclear during Travis Scott's Astroworld set, Houston police chief says
11/11/2021.description: Houston's police chief says the show's promoter was responsible for providing security to two mosh pits in front of the stage, and the records provided by the company were "just not good".
11/11/2021.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

11/11/2021.headline: 'Tasmania wasted the ink': WA cricket officials confident of staging Ashes Test in Perth
11/11/2021.description: Following Tasmania's bid to snatch the fifth men's Ashes Test, the Western Australian Cricket Association remains "positive" the match will go ahead in Perth.
11/11/2021.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

12/11/2021.headline: The Loop: Bert Newton's final moments, big-nosed dinosaur discovered in the UK and how Run Run the 'puppy' outfoxed its owner
12/11/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today.
12/11/2021.author: Bridget Judd

12/11/2021.headline: 'Silenced': Wife of constable killed on duty prevented from reading victim statement at inquest hearing
12/11/2021.description: Susan Forte, herself a serving police officer, says she has been waiting for more than four years to "have my say" over her husband's death on duty, but counsel assisting the coroner and several other lawyers argued her victim impact statement contained "scandalous" and defamatory allegations.
12/11/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

12/11/2021.headline: Former NT border worker who leaked confidential COVID information avoids jail
12/11/2021.description: Cristal Archer is handed a one-year suspended sentence for divulging restricted information to her then-boyfriend when she was working for the NT government's Department of Health, screening passengers in the Darwin Airport border control unit.
12/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

12/11/2021.headline: Manfred achieves his dream of becoming a physicist — at age 89
12/11/2021.description: Manfred Steiner, 89, decided to study physics rather than hit around golf balls after retirement — earning his PhD and inspiring others to pursue their ambitions at any age.
12/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

12/11/2021.headline: Nyrstar to cover lead material to reduce emissions in Port Pirie from dust
12/11/2021.description: A large building will be built in Port Pirie to cover material containing lead to prevent emissions from the city's smelter increasing lead levels in local children.
12/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

12/11/2021.headline: American journalist jailed for 11 years in Myanmar
12/11/2021.description: A court in military-ruled Myanmar sentences US journalist Danny Fenster to 11 years in jail, as he still faces several more serious charges including terrorism.
12/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

12/11/2021.headline: The net zero modelling's been released. Here are some of the big assumptions
12/11/2021.description: To save you spending your Friday night sifting through the government's modelling for its net zero by 2050 plan, here are a few of the key takeaways.
12/11/2021.author: Georgia Hitch

12/11/2021.headline: Construction giant Multiplex fined $150,000 over Canberra worksite death
12/11/2021.description: Construction company Multiplex is fined $150,000 over the death of a construction worker on one of its building sites five years ago.
12/11/2021.author: Holly Tregenza

12/11/2021.headline: SA Police Commissioner lashes out at select committee looking into harm caused by ICAC investigations
12/11/2021.description: SA's Police Commissioner criticises a parliamentary select committee that is looking into harm caused by anti-corruption commissioner investigations.
12/11/2021.author: Mahalia Carter

12/11/2021.headline: Businesses still looking for clarity — and 'loopholes' — with NT vaccine mandate about to take affect
12/11/2021.description: As the clock ticks on a wide-ranging vaccine mandate, the NT government has quietly changed the rules and warned against looking for loopholes – including one business that wants to separate out "vulnerable" members.
12/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian and Nicholas Hynes

12/11/2021.headline: Tedesco facing $10,000 fine following NRL investigation into alleged Squid Game incident
12/11/2021.description: Sydney Roosters captain James Tedesco is issued with a breach notice for "drunken and disorderly behaviour" after he was alleged to have made a racial slur against a woman, citing the Netflix series Squid Game.
12/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian and Nicholas Hynes

12/11/2021.headline: Child rescued from alleged porn operation, as man faces 43 charges
12/11/2021.description: A child has been rescued, and a man from the Sunshine Coast has been charged with more than 40 child abuse offences, including rape, after a five-day police operation.
12/11/2021.author: Owen Jacques

12/11/2021.headline: Leo watched his hometown burn. Now, he's being celebrated for saving it
12/11/2021.description: Mallacoota SES unit controller Leo op den Brouw is named Victorian Local Hero of the Year for helping his East Gippsland town rebuild after the 2019-20 bushfires.
12/11/2021.author: Madi Chwasta

12/11/2021.headline: The world's biggest meat processor says Huon Aquaculture is the start of its foray into seafood
12/11/2021.description: Executives from Brazilian meat processing giant JBS are in Tasmania surveying its new seafood company Huon Aquaculture ahead of its takeover next Wednesday.
12/11/2021.author: Fiona Breen and Tony Briscoe

12/11/2021.headline: 'Daigou is dying', but Australian products remain popular in China despite trade tensions
12/11/2021.description: The world's largest online shopping festival sets a new sales record, with Australian products playing a big part, but year-on-year growth falls to its slowest since the event began.
12/11/2021.author: Bang Xiao

12/11/2021.headline: SA storm damage bill tipped to rise as clean-up support announced
12/11/2021.description: Residents in 24 areas across South Australia will have access to cash to clean-up storm damage after initial assessments show infrastructure and crop losses have already reached $350 million.
12/11/2021.author: Victor Petrovic, Eliza Berlage, Sophie Landau, and Matt Stephens

12/11/2021.headline: Record snow falls in north-eastern China cause chaos as authorities warn of more to come
12/11/2021.description: China's National Meteorological Agency raises an orange blizzard warning – the second-highest in China's four-tiered alert system — as the country's first snowfall of the year arrives a month earlier than usual.
12/11/2021.author: Victor Petrovic, Eliza Berlage, Sophie Landau, and Matt Stephens

12/11/2021.headline: All eyes are on Xi's history-making move, but there are important pointers to the future too
12/11/2021.description: It is reasonable to assume Xi has close supporters within the CCP leadership. But they are not as visible as was the case for his predecessors, Mao Zedong and Deng Xiaoping, writes David Goodm
12/11/2021.author: Victor Petrovic, Eliza Berlage, Sophie Landau, and Matt Stephens

12/11/2021.headline: China Evergrande avoids default, but where is the money coming from?
12/11/2021.description: The world's most indebted developer, China Evergrande, keeps avoiding default. But where is the company getting the money from?
12/11/2021.author: Rhiana Whitson

12/11/2021.headline: Queen to attend Remembrance Day service, in first public appearance since hospitalisation
12/11/2021.description: After weeks of bed rest and light duties as a result of an unspecified ailment, the 95-year-old monarch will watch the Remembrance Day ceremony at the Cenotaph memorial in London from a balcony, as she has for several years.
12/11/2021.author: Rhiana Whitson

12/11/2021.headline: 'No good guys in the Labor Party': Somyurek breaks down in tears at IBAC inquiry
12/11/2021.description: The fourth and final day of Adem Somyurek's testimony to IBAC were emotional, with the former minister shedding tears over mudflinging from political rivals.
12/11/2021.author: Bridget Rollason

12/11/2021.headline: Woman pleads guilty to starting deadly house fire in Wagga Wagga
12/11/2021.description: A woman who set fire to a house killing her former housemate was retaliating after a "falling out", police tell the District Court.
12/11/2021.author: Shannon Corvo

12/11/2021.headline: 'He's never forgotten where he comes from': NBA star Patty Mills named ACT Australian of the Year
12/11/2021.description: International basketball star and Indigenous rights campaigner Patty Mills is named as the ACT's 2022 Australian of the Year nominee for his social justice work.
12/11/2021.author: Niki Burnside

12/11/2021.headline: 'Warrior' Rizwan nearly gets Pakistan over the line against Australia after ICU stay
12/11/2021.description: Mohammad Rizwan's knock of 67, which gave Pakistan a shot at victory against Australia in the T20 World Cup semi-final, came just hours after his release from hospital where he spent two nights in the ICU with a chest infection.
12/11/2021.author: Niki Burnside

12/11/2021.headline: Michelle was excited to take a sales job with an online flower company, but quickly she 'didn't feel right'
12/11/2021.description: The consumer watchdog is investigating whether large flower delivery companies are misleading people using tactics online to make their services appear local.
12/11/2021.author: Eden Hynninen

12/11/2021.headline: The 'soul destroying' crime against children so unspeakable it goes undetected
12/11/2021.description: Of the 1.4 million adults sexually abused as children, only a fraction were first abused by a stranger.
12/11/2021.author: Tracey Shelton

12/11/2021.headline: 'The anxiety had taken hold': How care in a psychiatric ward for new mothers saved Renee's life
12/11/2021.description: In the past year, there has been a 50 per cent increase in the number of new parents asking for help before or after the birth of a child because they are struggling with their mental health.
12/11/2021.author: Nicole Asher

12/11/2021.headline: Preselection headaches for Victorian Liberals as shadow treasurer moves on seat of drink-driving MP Tim Smith
12/11/2021.description: The Victorian Liberal party faces weeks of internal distraction with five sitting MPs being challenged for preselection and Shadow Treasurer David Davis making a bold bid to move to the lower house.
12/11/2021.author: Richard Willingham

12/11/2021.headline: ‘We can push the dialogue along’: This art festival is changing institutions from the inside
12/11/2021.description: In its sixth year, Tarnanthi, the Art Gallery of South Australia’s festival of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander art, remains committed to supporting First Nations artists and elevating their voices.
12/11/2021.author: Jo Higgins

12/11/2021.headline: England coach Eddie Jones shines in a week of Master Coach trickery, but the Wallabies have too many issues to take note
12/11/2021.description: Injuries force Wallabies into a selection reshuffle, with a shock Test debutant named in the side to take on England this Sunday. But all the English focus has been on master coach Eddie Jones, who did what he always does when his team faces scrutiny: distraction.
12/11/2021.author: Brett McKay

12/11/2021.headline: Jeongyeong's baby girl is the 'most beautiful decision' he's made. But he still hasn't met her
12/11/2021.description: Jeongyeong's first child, a baby girl, was born in August last year. But he's never been able to hold her, and temporary residents like his wife are left in limbo as Australia's borders reopen.
12/11/2021.author: Erin Handley

12/11/2021.headline: 'Relax on demand': What a freediver and a yoga teacher know about breathing
12/11/2021.description: Breathing is instinctual but that doesn't mean it can't be improved. Using different techniques for different types of exercise can impact your performance and daily life.
12/11/2021.author: Amanda Smith and Sophie Kesteven

12/11/2021.headline: Why a huge surge in US inflation could derail the Australian property market
12/11/2021.description: The Australian property market has for many years defied the laws of gravity. But analysts are warning a huge surge in US inflation has the potential to derail the Australian property market, writes David Taylor.
12/11/2021.author: David Taylor

12/11/2021.headline: The lasting scars of lockdown will shape the election, but the Prime Minister is looking elsewhere
12/11/2021.description: Whether you take a benign view of China's intentions, or an alarmed one, Taiwan and China are now becoming a very, very complex problem for everyone — including Australia, writes Laura Tingle.
12/11/2021.author: Laura Tingle

12/11/2021.headline: What happens when Australia's COVID-19 'honeymoon' ends? Singapore offers warning
12/11/2021.description: Many Australians are rightly looking forward to a carefree summer. However, experts warn Singapore's current COVID-19 surge may be a prime example of how Australia could struggle to remain virus-free for very long.
12/11/2021.author: Anne Barker

12/11/2021.headline: Australian-first study paves way for mothers returning to elite sport
12/11/2021.description: Some of Australia's top female sportswomen have criticised the lack of support for new mums, prompting the Australia Institution of Sport to investigate.
12/11/2021.author: Brittney Kleyn

12/11/2021.headline: This sleepy country town is a secretive centre for Big Pharma drug production
12/11/2021.description: This is the strange story of how a small, unassuming country town and a native plant became the epicentre for a major pharmaceutical drug industry and an alleged criminal cartel.
12/11/2021.author: Jon Daly

12/11/2021.headline: A princess and a rugby royal are working to counter vaccine misinformation in the Pacific
12/11/2021.description: Influential figures from across the Pacific are working to ensure public health messages relating to COVID-19 reach communities at a time where misinformation and vaccine hesitancy are rife across the region.
12/11/2021.author: Marian Faa

12/11/2021.headline: Pacific leaders vow to halt increasing fossil fuel subsidies and share COVID-19 vaccine technology
12/11/2021.description: Pacific leaders, hosted entirely online by New Zealand, agree to chart a road to post-pandemic recovery to ensure the Asia-Pacific region "remains the world’s most dynamic and interconnected regional economy".
12/11/2021.author: Joshua Boscaini

12/11/2021.headline: Second COP26 draft agreement softens language on coal and fossil fuel reduction
12/11/2021.description: The draft decision, the second released this week, is being negotiated by representatives from nearly 200 countries and the final version has to be agreed to by all countries at the summit
12/11/2021.author: Jack Hawke

12/11/2021.headline: SA's Deputy Premier makes defamation threat in attempt to halt conflict inquiry
12/11/2021.description: South Australia's Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman has launched a defamation threat in a bid to halt a parliamentary inquiry examining whether she has a conflict of interest
12/11/2021.author: Leah MacLennan and Nick Harmsen

12/11/2021.headline: Perth Airport 'missed the mark' in move to recognise traditional owners on boarding gates
12/11/2021.description: Perth Airport becomes the first major airport in Australia to recognise traditional owners on its domestic boarding gates, but there are claims not all the labels are correct.
12/11/2021.author: Abby Richards

12/11/2021.headline: Aussies highlight positives from poor T20 World Cup build-up after reaching final
12/11/2021.description: Australia lost five consecutive T20 series prior to the men's World Cup, but coach Justin Langer believes the experience ultimately benefited his squad.
12/11/2021.author: Abby Richards

12/11/2021.headline: Massive funnel-web nicknamed Megaspider donated to venom-milking facility
12/11/2021.description: A massive funnel-web spider with fangs so long they could bite through a human fingernail is donated to a lifesaving antivenom program at the Australian Reptile Park.
12/11/2021.author: Abby Richards

12/11/2021.headline: Court hears alleged murder victim's house was unusually clean and smelt like bleach
12/11/2021.description: The trial of Paul Winston Oatey continues in Adelaide's Supreme Court. He is accused of murdering 53-year-old Darren Perry in December 2019. The teenage girl who the court heard discovered Mr Perry's body in a backyard gives evidence.
12/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

12/11/2021.headline: Katherine mask mandate extended after positive COVID-19 wastewater results
12/11/2021.description: A mask mandate in the town of Katherine is extended for a further 24 hours after positive wastewater results were detected in the region.
12/11/2021.author: Housnia Shams

12/11/2021.headline: 'Not the smartest thing': Black Caps star breaks hand punching bat, ruled out of T20 World Cup final
12/11/2021.description: An outburst of frustration leaves Devon Conway nursing a broken hand following New Zealand's semi-final victory over England, ruling the wicketkeeper-batter out of the tournament decider against Australia.
12/11/2021.author: Housnia Shams

12/11/2021.headline: Graeme Edge, co-founder of The Moody Blues, dies at 80
12/11/2021.description: Moody Blues frontman Justin Hayward confirms Graeme Edge's death on the group's website. The cause of his death has not been revealed.
12/11/2021.author: Housnia Shams

12/11/2021.headline: Aussie world champion cyclist announces retirement
12/11/2021.description: Track cycling star Kaarle McCulloch calls time on a decorated career, which includes four world championships and an Olympic bronze medal.
12/11/2021.author: Housnia Shams
