18/11/2021.description: Police arrest an Adelaide man after he allegedly attempted to intimidate a witness in a major indictable matter.
18/11/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

18/11/2021.headline: Tim Sheens lands major signing with star Eel to join Wests Tigers in 2023
18/11/2021.description: The Wests Tigers' 2005 premiership coach — recently appointed as the club's director of football — makes his impact felt upon his return, with the recruitment of Parramatta's Isaiah Papali'i.
18/11/2021.author: Lauren Roberts

18/11/2021.headline: The Loop: House prices are 'rolling over', get ready for a micro-moon and winds whip up volcanic ash from over 100 years ago
18/11/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
18/11/2021.author: Bridget Judd

18/11/2021.headline: Labor compares Morrison's comments about Melbourne protests to Trump's support for violent extremists
18/11/2021.description: A Labor frontbencher has likened the Prime Minister's reaction to protests in Melbourne to how Donald Trump behaved after violent protests in the US city of Charlottesville in 2017.
18/11/2021.author: Bridget Judd

18/11/2021.headline: Listeria concerns prompt the recall of more cheese products after first alert earlier this week
18/11/2021.description: Two Aldi cheese products are the latest to be recalled over listeria contamination fears, just days after similar action was announced for products sold at Woolworths and IGA stores.
18/11/2021.author: Bridget Judd

18/11/2021.headline: Former Canberra football coach gives evidence in his child sex offences trial
18/11/2021.description: Stephen James Porter pleaded guilty to three child sex offences earlier this year. He appeared in court today, where he gave his version of events.
18/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

18/11/2021.headline: Spain's Muguruza makes history with WTA Finals triumph
18/11/2021.description: Garbiñe Muguruza becomes the first Spaniard to win the season-ending championship, following a straight-sets defeat of Estonian Anett Kontaveit in Mexico.
18/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

18/11/2021.headline: Hong Kong begins culling wild boars in urban areas
18/11/2021.description: The government says it will capture and euthanise all wild boars found in the city, after a policeman was bitten in an incident last week.
18/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

18/11/2021.headline: Stroke survivor hit by car during charity ride around Australia's 'most extreme' compass points
18/11/2021.description: Melbourne stroke survivor Tommy Quick, who set himself the task of cycling 9,000 kilometres around Australia, is now in a hospital bed with broken bones after being hit by a car in SA.
18/11/2021.author: Evelyn Leckie and Sara Garcia

18/11/2021.headline: COVID-inspired extremism isn't new for Australian intelligence agencies
18/11/2021.description: The recent ugly scenes in Melbourne have been shocking, but for intelligence agencies who monitor various security threats to the country, they are neither surprising nor unexpected.
18/11/2021.author: Andrew Greene

18/11/2021.headline: Perth naturopath guilty of indecently assaulting 18 female patients including teenager
18/11/2021.description: A WA jury convicts Mauricio Bascunan Cabrera of touching the women on their breasts and buttocks during consultations, while the 41-year-old is also found guilty of touching one patient on her genital area.
18/11/2021.author: Joanna Menagh and David Weber

18/11/2021.headline: Longest lunar eclipse since 15th century will grace our skies tomorrow night
18/11/2021.description: Step outside after sunset tomorrow and you may be lucky enough to see the Moon change colour on the horizon as an end-of-week treat.
18/11/2021.author: Genelle Weule

18/11/2021.headline: Genomic sequencing confirms link between current NT COVID outbreak and earlier cluster
18/11/2021.description: Genomic sequencing has confirmed the Northern Territory’s current COVID-19 outbreak is linked to a previous cluster that was sparked earlier this month by an interstate arrival who lied on her border entry form.
18/11/2021.author: Jano Gibson

18/11/2021.headline: Former Labor MP Craig Thomson to 'vigorously fight' charges over alleged visa migration fraud
18/11/2021.description: Former federal Labor MP Craig Thomson "denies any wrongdoing" and will fight charges over his involvement in an alleged multi-million-dollar visa migration fraud.
18/11/2021.author: Jano Gibson

18/11/2021.headline: Bank tips house prices will fall in 2023. But they'll still be 27 per cent higher than they were in 2019
18/11/2021.description: ANZ is tipping house price falls in 2023 as the pandemic boom in Australian housing comes to an end amid worsening affordability, more stock on the market and rising interest rates.
18/11/2021.author: Michael Janda

18/11/2021.headline: SA parliament passes vote of no confidence in Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman
18/11/2021.description: South Australia's parliament has passed a vote of no confidence in Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman.
18/11/2021.author: Michael Janda

18/11/2021.headline: Could you afford to spend $300 a week on COVID tests just so you could work?
18/11/2021.description: Thousands of people in the Queensland-New South Wales border zone fear they will have to pay through the nose just to get to their jobs.
18/11/2021.author: Bern Young

18/11/2021.headline: Victorian COVID-19 restrictions ending in time for Boxing Day Test, Australian Open
18/11/2021.description: After last summer's MCG Test and Australian Open had severe restrictions, Victoria's government is lifting crowd caps in time for both events to have capacity crowds.
18/11/2021.author: Bern Young

18/11/2021.headline: Sunbaking croc forces closure of Port Douglas beach
18/11/2021.description: A popular beach favoured by US presidents and celebrities has been closed after a crocodile was spotted sunning itself on the beach.
18/11/2021.author: Kristy Sexton-McGrath

18/11/2021.headline: Man charged over allegedly scaling down three-storey quarantine hotel
18/11/2021.description: Authorities are awaiting COVID-19 test results from a man who allegedly left hotel quarantine in Tasmania and spent nine hours in the community.
18/11/2021.author: Adam Langenberg

18/11/2021.headline: Darwin shooter left without lawyers after sacking expert legal team
18/11/2021.description: Darwin shooter Benjamin Hoffmann could represent himself through sentencing, after firing his expert legal team.
18/11/2021.author: Melissa Mackay

18/11/2021.headline: While some national festivals will go ahead in Canberra next year, one has fallen victim to COVID-19
18/11/2021.description: The National Multicultural Festival, held each year in Canberra, won't go ahead in 2022. After a year of COVID-19 lockdowns, the territory will have to wait until 2023 to celebrate the festival's 25-year milestone.
18/11/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

18/11/2021.headline: Major Queensland hotels lock out the unvaxxed ahead of December deadline
18/11/2021.description: Some tourism businesses say they would rather refuse bookings from unvaccinated people than try to navigate the state’s impending COVID-19 restrictions.
18/11/2021.author: Owen Jacques

18/11/2021.headline: 'For their own safety': Queensland under growing pressure over vaccine mandate for teachers
18/11/2021.description: Queensland is one of only two states without COVID-19 vaccination mandates for teachers and childcare workers as the state prepares for a wave of cases in unvaccinated children with health experts warning a school outbreak will be "extremely disruptive".
18/11/2021.author: Emma Pollard

18/11/2021.headline: Why this family is keeping a ceremonial fire burning at the Carmichael mine
18/11/2021.description: After years of controversy, the Carmichael mine is weeks away from exporting coal. But the fight's not over for this group who fear cultural heritage sites are in danger of being lost.
18/11/2021.author: Angel Parsons

18/11/2021.headline: Police video reveals the lies a killer told as he tried to get away with murdering his wife
18/11/2021.description: In what could easily be a scene from a Hollywood thriller, a police camera captures 59-year-old father Andrew John Cobby spin a web of lies about the murder of his estranged wife Kym.
18/11/2021.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

18/11/2021.headline: Why Canada's floods could make Christmas trees cost more
18/11/2021.description: Canada exports about 2.3 million Christmas trees a year. Now, at a time of high demand, this year's crop has been damaged by historic flooding.
18/11/2021.author: Lexy Hamilton-Smith

18/11/2021.headline: Roaring Twenties or a decade-long economic slump? RBA says it's up to us
18/11/2021.description: The Reserve Bank is looking at its economic forecasts and is all too aware economic conditions could go either way: boom times or bust.
18/11/2021.author: David Taylor

18/11/2021.headline: 'Whatever it takes': GP clinic to charge unvaccinated patients for masks
18/11/2021.description: A Launceston GP is flagging its own COVID protocols ahead of borders reopening, as Premier Peter Gutwein admits there will only be spot checks of vaccination status at airports.
18/11/2021.author: Sean Wales

18/11/2021.headline: Pandemic workers kill pet dog in China while helpless owner watches on
18/11/2021.description: The owner of the pet corgi watched the killing via her home security camera, after being forced to leave the dog in her apartment to undergo quarantine.
18/11/2021.author: Sean Wales

18/11/2021.headline: 23 under 23: The best young players to look out for this A-League Men's season
18/11/2021.description: You might not know these players now, but once this year's A-League gets underway, they'll be aiming to put their names up in lights. Here's 23 players under 23 to keep your eyes on this season.
18/11/2021.author: Simon Smale

18/11/2021.headline: This week’s news quiz theme is 'Who am I?' Reckon you know?
18/11/2021.description: Every week, we ask you if you’ve been paying attention to the news. We bet you thought we meant the words, right? Well, here’s a test — this week, did you take note of who was saying what?
18/11/2021.author: Simon Smale

18/11/2021.headline: Last Night in Soho: Anya Taylor-Joy goes full blonde bombshell in blood-soaked thriller
18/11/2021.description: In this psychosexual horror, Edgar Wright (Baby Driver; Shaun of the Dead) exposes the seedier side of London’s swinging 60s.
18/11/2021.author: Jason Di Rosso

18/11/2021.headline: Meet the politician more powerful than Biden and Trump: 'I wouldn't wish this upon anyone'
18/11/2021.description: Joe Manchin spent more than a decade being largely ignored in the US Senate. Then a twist of fate turned him into America's most influential politician.
18/11/2021.author: Joanna Robin

18/11/2021.headline: 'The country is divided': Could border closures impact the federal election?
18/11/2021.description: Many in Australia lost family members during India's brutal second wave of coronavirus, while Australians living overseas say they feel abandoned by the federal government.
18/11/2021.author: Max Walden

18/11/2021.headline: Federal government champions gas-fired recovery, but regulator questions the cost to consumers
18/11/2021.description: The energy regulator is concerned households that use gas could face significant future costs if the federal government continues to promote the gas sector while also aiming to reach net zero emissions by 2050.
18/11/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

18/11/2021.headline: 'The public have no idea': Australian nurses reveal the true extent of burnout in the workforce
18/11/2021.description: Across the country nurses are burnt out, exhausted and looking for new jobs, saying COVID-19 has only exacerbated workload pressures and staffing issues that existed long before the pandemic. Here's a look at the state of the workforce.
18/11/2021.author: Emily Sakzewski

18/11/2021.headline: Morrison bracing for a fortnight from hell
18/11/2021.description: Since he returned from overseas, Scott Morrison has been where he's most comfortable — on the campaign trail. But no more, writes Michelle Grattan.
18/11/2021.author: Michelle Grattan

18/11/2021.headline: 'They kill them': Fears for man's life after ethnic targeted arrest in country on brink of civil war
18/11/2021.description: The mother of an Australian man stranded in Ethiopia's capital Addis Ababa is pleading with the federal government to help get him out of the war-torn nation.
18/11/2021.author: Lydia Feng

18/11/2021.headline: After seven years of nothing, a William Tyrrell breakthrough — then more nothing
18/11/2021.description: After seven long years, there was a flurry of excitement on the William Tyrrell search site in Kendall this week. Meanwhile, in Sydney, the case becomes personal between the state's top cop and a former detective.
18/11/2021.author: Riley Stuart

18/11/2021.headline: Centrelink and a coffin club: Why some men's sheds are opening their doors to more people
18/11/2021.description: Men's sheds have been vital parts of their communities in the decades since they started in Australia. But now they may need to change in order to survive.
18/11/2021.author: Anna Kelsey-Sugg and Chris Bullock

18/11/2021.headline: Kim Kardashian helps Afghanistan's women's youth development soccer team flee to UK
18/11/2021.description: After weeks in limbo waiting for a flight out of Pakistan, about 30 teenage players and 100 members of their families land in the UK, thanks to a trio of benefactors.
18/11/2021.author: Anna Kelsey-Sugg and Chris Bullock

18/11/2021.headline: What does living with COVID look like? Europe's bleak winter is the world's worst-case scenario
18/11/2021.description: The days in the northern hemisphere are growing short and cold, allowing the Delta variant to take hold as people retreat indoors, while vaccine immunity wanes and inoculation rates stagnate.
18/11/2021.author: Isabella Higgins

18/11/2021.headline: Victoria opens up as state nears 90pc vaccination milestone
18/11/2021.description: Victorians embrace post-lockdown life as restrictions ease substantially in the state, offering even more freedoms than in neighbouring New South Wales.
18/11/2021.author: Isabella Higgins

18/11/2021.headline: 'Pure discrimination' against Q+A guest's daughter panned by disability advocate
18/11/2021.description: Whether Australia endures a "great resignation" remains a future issue but issues of workplace discrimination and gender equality are placed squarely in the spotlight on a Q+A that ends with some sad news.
18/11/2021.author: Paul Johnson

18/11/2021.headline: Three-year-old drowns in suburban pool south of Perth
18/11/2021.description: Police confirm a three-year-old boy has drowned in a suburban swimming pool south of Perth, as a report finds there has been a spike in drownings among children aged under four across Australia.
18/11/2021.author: Keane Bourke

18/11/2021.headline: What you need to know about the EU-Belarus migrant crisis
18/11/2021.description: The European Union and Belarus are locked in a stand-off over migrants that has come against a backdrop of tensions between the West and Minsk's backer Moscow.
18/11/2021.author: Keane Bourke

19/11/2021.headline: Disgraced WA public servant Paul Whyte sentenced to 12 years in jail over taxpayer theft
19/11/2021.description: The corrupt West Australian bureaucrat at the centre of Australia's single biggest case of public sector fraud will serve a minimum of 10 years behind bars for masterminding the theft of $27 million of taxpayers' money and using it to fund a lavish lifestyle.
19/11/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

19/11/2021.headline: Gabon is the last bastion of endangered African forest elephants
19/11/2021.description: African forest elephants are critically endangered, but a new study has found that the heavily forested central African nation of Gabon is a last stronghold, with 95,000 animals identified.
19/11/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

19/11/2021.headline: The shock Tim Paine scandal that was four years in the making
19/11/2021.description: Cricket fans were taken aback when news of Tim Paine's indiscretions and resignation broke, but Cricket Australia probably wasn't — and that is much of the problem, Dean Bilton writes.
19/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton

19/11/2021.headline: India to repeal controversial farm laws after more than a year of protests
19/11/2021.description: The controversial farm laws were passed in September last year, prompting widespread protests from farmers who argued the law would shatter their livelihoods.
19/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton

19/11/2021.headline: The Loop: Tim Paine asks for forgiveness, Philippines to welcome back tourists and ever seen a blow-dried booby?
19/11/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
19/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton

19/11/2021.headline: Australia's Cricketers' Association saddened Tim Paine 'felt the need to resign'
19/11/2021.description: The ACA shows its support for Tim Paine, saying it didn't feel he needed to step down as Australian men's Test captain despite the sexting scandal revelations.
19/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton

19/11/2021.headline: Man sentenced to 20 years in jail for murdering bikie boss at popular Canberra bar
19/11/2021.description: Frederick Tuifua is sentenced for the murder of Canberra Comanchero commander Pitasoni Ulavalu in Civic at Kokomo's bar last year.
19/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

19/11/2021.headline: Where is Peng Shuai? Chinese tennis star's whereabouts remain unknown after assault claim
19/11/2021.description: Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai posted an allegation against a former prominent Chinese government official on Weibo earlier this month. Since then the tennis world has asked the question, where is she?
19/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

19/11/2021.headline: Regions with low vax rates at risk of being cut off from rest of WA, McGowan warns
19/11/2021.description: The Premier issued the warning during his visit to the Pilbara, which has the lowest vaccination rates in the country.
19/11/2021.author: Verity Gorman, Laura Birch, and Rhiannon Shine

19/11/2021.headline: Expensive COVID test requirement may be scrapped as Queensland reviews border rules
19/11/2021.description: The Queensland government reviews border requirements which currently see families faced with paying hundreds of dollars for COVID tests when entering the state.
19/11/2021.author: Ciara Jones

19/11/2021.headline: It's been a very wet spring in Hobart, but water restrictions could be next
19/11/2021.description: The garden is groaning and the kids are cranky after what seems like non-stop spring rain, but water restrictions could be ahead for southern Tasmania because ageing water treatment systems can't keep up.
19/11/2021.author: Loretta Lohberger

19/11/2021.headline: Here are the websites, apps and certificates required to get into South Australia next week
19/11/2021.description: Technology is key to South Australia's strategy to contain COVID-19 when the state reopens its borders to NSW, Victoria and the ACT next Tuesday, November 23. Here's how it will all work.
19/11/2021.author: Eugene Boisvert

19/11/2021.headline: Dutton mocks Chinese ambassador, labels comments 'so silly it's funny'
19/11/2021.description: Wang Xining gave a wide-ranging interview where he slammed Australia's plans to acquire nuclear-powered submarines, warning the government might expose its own citizens to the risk of a nuclear accident.
19/11/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

19/11/2021.headline: Tennis star Peng Shuai is the latest in a growing list of high-profile disappearances in China
19/11/2021.description: Peng Shuai disappeared after making an explosive #MeToo claim about a top government official on social media. She joins a growing list of those who have gone missing.
19/11/2021.author: Annika Burgess

19/11/2021.headline: Platoon that was accused of killing Afghan prisoner to save space on aircraft now under criminal investigation, Defence confirms
19/11/2021.description: The Defence Department reveals there is an active criminal investigation into the conduct of an Australian commando platoon in Afghanistan in 2012.
19/11/2021.author: Josh Robertson

19/11/2021.headline: Carer sentenced to home detention for assaulting teenager with cerebral palsy
19/11/2021.description: A carer is sentenced to eight months' home detention for assaulting a teenager with cerebral palsy, after she was caught on a home security camera.
19/11/2021.author: Candice Prosser

19/11/2021.headline: Meet the gifted drummer beating a path to stardom
19/11/2021.description: Jack Butcher may not own a drum kit, but that hasn't stopped him from following the footsteps of his grandfather — one of the original members of Papunya's Warumpi Band.
19/11/2021.author: Emma Haskin

19/11/2021.headline: 'I'm deeply sorry': Paine steps down as Australian Test captain amid sexting scandal
19/11/2021.description: Tim Paine announces he will quit the role immediately after a 2017 text exchange with a woman is revealed, describing his decision as being "incredibly difficult" to make.
19/11/2021.author: Emma Haskin

19/11/2021.headline: Tim Paine quits as Australia Test captain, as it happened
19/11/2021.description: Australian cricketer Tim Paine stands down as Test captain over a sexting incident from four years ago, as it happened.
19/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton and Simon Smale

19/11/2021.headline: Three Canberrans end up in hospital after eating suspected death cap mushrooms
19/11/2021.description: Three people presented to hospital emergency rooms in the ACT this week after eating wild mushrooms, suspected to be poisonous death caps.
19/11/2021.author: Charlotte Gore

19/11/2021.headline: 'We can't cut people off': Draft code aims to ensure aged care visits can continue in lockdown
19/11/2021.description: Advocates say the Council on the Ageing's draft code is the first step towards implementing national standards to limit the devastating impact of isolation on aged care residents.
19/11/2021.author: Mikaela Ortolan, Katherine Smyrk, and Sandra Moon

19/11/2021.headline: 'My old tribe and my new tribe': Dani Laidley returns to North Melbourne
19/11/2021.description: Former North Melbourne coach Dani Laidley makes a warm return to Arden St in a rare public appearance as the club celebrates clearing its debt.
19/11/2021.author: Mikaela Ortolan, Katherine Smyrk, and Sandra Moon

19/11/2021.headline: 'We have serious concerns': US considers diplomatic boycott of Beijing Olympics
19/11/2021.description: United State activists and members of Congress from both parties are pressing the Biden administration to boycott the Beijing Winter Olympics over alleged human rights violations against Muslim minorities.
19/11/2021.author: Mikaela Ortolan, Katherine Smyrk, and Sandra Moon

19/11/2021.headline: 'Misadventure' to blame for missing NSW toddler AJ Elfalak's three-day ordeal
19/11/2021.description: The disappearance of a toddler from a property in the NSW Hunter Valley earlier this year, that sparked a massive land and air search, is confirmed as a case of misadventure.
19/11/2021.author: Ruby Cornish

19/11/2021.headline: MLC Insurance fails more than 260,000 customers, regulator claims
19/11/2021.description: The Australian Securities and Investments Commission is alleging in court that MLC Life Insurance has been mishandling insurance policies for more than two decades.
19/11/2021.author: Gareth Hutchens

19/11/2021.headline: Sarah Gigante is in pursuit of a spot in the Tour de France Femmes
19/11/2021.description: Sarah Gigante is getting closer to a spot in the very first women's Tour de France, a childhood dream that for so long seemed impossible.
19/11/2021.author: Daniela Intili

19/11/2021.headline: The self defence question at the centre of the Rittenhouse verdict
19/11/2021.description: Kyle Rittenhouse has been found not guilty of homicide after shooting dead two men and injuring a third at a Black Lives Matter protest. The question at the centre of his trial: Was it self defence?
19/11/2021.author: Jordan Hayne

19/11/2021.headline: Ghislaine Maxwell's life of privilege ended with her dramatic arrest. Now she faces trial on grooming charges
19/11/2021.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was once photographed with New York's celebrity elite. Now she is known as inmate 02879-509 and is about to go on trial for grooming girls for Jeffrey Epstein.
19/11/2021.author: Lucia Stein

19/11/2021.headline: Couple separated by border closures renew wedding vows in video call minutes before husband dies
19/11/2021.description: Iva was on a train to work in Sydney when she renewed her wedding vows to her dying husband in Fiji. Five minutes later, he took his last breath.
19/11/2021.author: Marian Faa

19/11/2021.headline: Their shop was their retirement plan. But after two billionaires came to town, Adrian and Liz are walking away with nothing
19/11/2021.description: Residents of Pearcedale, an hour's drive from Melbourne, still think of it as a country town, and the local shops are the heart of the community. When two billionaires snapped up the strip six years ago, locals didn't bat an eyelid.
19/11/2021.author: Jessica Longbottom, Eden Hynninen, Danielle Bonica, Kate Higgins, and Joseph Dunstan

19/11/2021.headline: Jury clears Kyle Rittenhouse of all charges in Kenosha shootings
19/11/2021.description: A Wisconsin jury has cleared Illinois teen Kyle Rittenhouse of all charges after he shot and killed two people and wounded another during protests in the city of Kenosha last year.
19/11/2021.author: Jessica Longbottom, Eden Hynninen, Danielle Bonica, Kate Higgins, and Joseph Dunstan

19/11/2021.headline: Take on EVs? What Australia can learn from Norway and 80s synth-pop band A-ha
19/11/2021.description: Norway is leading the world in EV adoption, while Australia seems stuck in first gear. How can we catch up?
19/11/2021.author: James Purtill

19/11/2021.headline: Morrison was slow to respond to violent threats in Victoria. Then one 'of course' too many left him on the back foot
19/11/2021.description: The ugly escalation in Melbourne is the sort of moment you would expect leaders to quickly respond to and settle down — but the Prime Minister couldn't resist adding a political kicker, writes Laura Tingle.
19/11/2021.author: Laura Tingle

19/11/2021.headline: At 75, the Queen of the Netherlands sat down for dinner. The next day she lost her title
19/11/2021.description: In 2013, not long after turning 75, Queen Beatrix of the Netherlands hosted a dinner party. What happened next changed the course of history and some people think the British royal family should take note.
19/11/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

19/11/2021.headline: Britain outlaws Palestinian militant group Hamas
19/11/2021.description: Announcing the decision, Britain's Interior Minister says "Hamas has significant terrorist capability, including access to extensive and sophisticated weaponry", while the militant group says the move shows "absolute bias toward the Israeli occupation".
19/11/2021.author: Catherine Taylor

19/11/2021.headline: Melbourne City hold on to get their title defence off to a winning start at home agaisnt Brisbane Roar
19/11/2021.description: Two goals in three minutes guided Melbourne City to victory in the opening game of the new A-League Men season
19/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

19/11/2021.headline: Austria to reimpose national lockdown, make vaccines mandatory as COVID-19 cases surge
19/11/2021.description: The lockdown, starting on Monday, will be the first in western Europe this autumn as a fourth wave drives case numbers upwards across the continent.
19/11/2021.author: Jack Hawke

19/11/2021.headline: Charges laid over anti-vaccination protest which unfolded in front of schoolchildren
19/11/2021.description: Police charge two men over a vaccination clinic protest, while other protesters rallying outside WA schools are labelled "pathetic" and "gutless".
19/11/2021.author: Keane Bourke

19/11/2021.headline: The NT COVID outbreak has gotten 'even stranger' and could be silently spreading. Here are the new testing rules
19/11/2021.description: Chief Minister Michael Gunner says there's a "a very real possibility" there are people with COVID in the NT who don't know it, as authorities bring in new testing rules to get to the bottom of the latest cluster.
19/11/2021.author: Keane Bourke

19/11/2021.headline: China calls Taiwan office in Lithuania an 'extremely egregious act', says Baltic state will be responsibile for consequences
19/11/2021.description: China says Lithuania "shall be responsible" for the consequences that come after the opening of a de facto Taiwan embassy in the European nation.
19/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

19/11/2021.headline: Van with an 'angel onboard': Motorbike rider praises tourists for helping save his mate's life
19/11/2021.description: The Zavros family weren't the only travellers to be rescued from the remote SA outback this week. Bill Kidd says a van "with an angel onboard" helped save his mate's life.
19/11/2021.author: Tom Fedorowytsch

19/11/2021.headline: 'Enormous' $27 million public sector theft sees corrupt WA bureaucrat handed 12-year jail term
19/11/2021.description: Corrupt West Australian bureaucrat Paul Whyte will serve a minimum of 10 years behind bars for masterminding the theft of $27 million of taxpayers' money and using it to fund a lavish lifestyle.
19/11/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

19/11/2021.headline: Tim Paine's resignation as Australian cricket captain is a shock four years in the making
19/11/2021.description: Cricket fans were taken aback when news of Tim Paine's indiscretions and resignation broke, but Cricket Australia probably wasn't — and that is much of the problem, Dean Bilton writes.
19/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton

19/11/2021.headline: Victoria records 1,166 new local COVID-19 cases and five deaths
19/11/2021.description: There are now 9,581 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 458 people have died during the state's current Delta outbreak.
19/11/2021.author: Danuta Kozaki, Danuta Kozaki, and Danuta Kozaki

20/11/2021.headline: More than a pretty picture: These calendar boys want to get their community talking
20/11/2021.description: Meet some of the men from Kangaroo Valley who decided their best option to improve men's health was to take their clothes off.
20/11/2021.author: Sarah Moss

20/11/2021.headline: 'That route is closed': Unvaccinated travellers banned from entering Northern Territory
20/11/2021.description: The Northern Territory will become the second jurisdiction in Australia to ban unvaccinated arrivals, with only limited exceptions, under sweeping changes to border rules announced by the Chief Minister.
20/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

20/11/2021.headline: PM's performance at COP26 behind Allegra Spender's tilt at seat of Wentworth
20/11/2021.description: The realisation that Scott Morrison was "never going to get there" at the climate conference in Glasgow was the tipping point for Carla Zampatti's daughter to run in next year's federal election.
20/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

20/11/2021.headline: 'Pillars of our democracy': Labor pledges to restore funding to ABC and SBS
20/11/2021.description: Arguing the electoral cycle is leaving public broadcasters vulnerable, Opposition Leader Anthony Albanese says a Labor government would provide funding certainty for the ABC and SBS.
20/11/2021.author: Matthew Doran

20/11/2021.headline: China disavows knowledge of tennis star's disappearance following rape allegation
20/11/2021.description: Chinese authorities maintain they are unaware of the controversy surrounding missing tennis player Peng Shuai, as men's player Novak Djokovic says he supports the idea of cancelling tournaments in China until the issue is resolved.
20/11/2021.author: Matthew Doran

20/11/2021.headline: Photos from the sky show lush green paddocks turning into brown inland seas
20/11/2021.description: Aerial and satellite imagery reveals the extent of inland NSW flooding, but it may only be a preview of what is on the way.
20/11/2021.author: Mollie Gorman

20/11/2021.headline: Mayor of Dutch city condemns protests that led to police firing shots at rioters
20/11/2021.description: Crowds of rioters in the Dutch port city of Rotterdam torch cars and throw rocks at police after gathering to voice opposition to government plans to restrict access to indoor venues.
20/11/2021.author: Mollie Gorman

20/11/2021.headline: Thousands march around the country at anti-lockdown, vaccine mandate rallies
20/11/2021.description: Crowds voicing anti-lockdown and anti-vaccine mandate messages have taken to the streets across the country, with the largest rallies in Melbourne and Sydney. Demonstrators have met in parks in Brisbane and Hobart, while those in Perth have gathered in a public square.
20/11/2021.author: Sian Johnson and Judd Boaz

20/11/2021.headline: 'This behaviour has no place in our country': MPs receive death threats over vaccine mandate
20/11/2021.description: Queensland authorities hit out at "reckless and unwelcome" anti-vaxxers as the state again records no new locally acquired COVID-19 cases.
20/11/2021.author: Tobias Jurss-Lewis

20/11/2021.headline: NT records one new COVID-19 case as Territory-wide mask mandate lifts
20/11/2021.description: The Chief Minister says the Northern Territory recorded one new case of coronavirus, a 31-year-old woman from Robinson River who was not infectious while in the community.
20/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian

20/11/2021.headline: Rittenhouse verdict pours fuel on America's heated gun debate
20/11/2021.description: Kyle Rittenhouse‘s acquittal for the fatal shootings of racial justice protesters last year spurs strong opinions on both sides of the US gun debate.
20/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian

20/11/2021.headline: In pictures: Longest partial lunar eclipse since 1440
20/11/2021.description: The longest partial lunar eclipse in more than 500 years dazzles night skies around the world in an event dubbed the "blood moon" due to its red haze.
20/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian

20/11/2021.headline: No two-legged intercontinental playoffs for last places at Qatar World Cup
20/11/2021.description: If Australia has to go in the intercontinental playoffs for the World Cup finals in Qatar, they won't be able to clinch a spot in front of home fans or a hostile away crowd, with FIFA saying playoffs will be one-off games at neutral venues.
20/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian

20/11/2021.headline: Queensland scientists studying placenta stem cells to help growth-restricted babies
20/11/2021.description: Placenta stem cells donated by Brisbane mums are being studied as a potential treatment to reduce brain injury in growth-restricted babies.
20/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian

20/11/2021.headline: Photographer Mick Rock, known as 'the man who shot the 70s', dies aged 72
20/11/2021.description: The UK rock photographer, who took iconic images of Lou Reed, Iggy Pop and Queen as well as being David Bowie's official photographer in the early 1970s, is remembered as a "photographic poet".
20/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian

20/11/2021.headline: Can time-poor parents manage a buy-nothing, recycled Christmas?
20/11/2021.description: The idea of writing a song to celebrate one of the most waste-inducing events of the year was a huge challenge for eco-musician Charlie McGee, but he found a way to make it work.
20/11/2021.author: Zachary Bruce

20/11/2021.headline: Transplant side effect GVHD can feel like mozzies biting, but it's your own cells attacking you
20/11/2021.description: Researchers are looking for new ways to ease the harmful side effects of a condition that affects around 70 per cent of bone marrow transplant recipients.
20/11/2021.author: David Iliffe

20/11/2021.headline: Wallabies forced to make more changes as they finish off spring tour against Wales
20/11/2021.description: Wales vs Australia features two injury-plagued sides robbed of their spiritual leaders and desperately trying to finish the last game of the year with a win. It could be terrible, but might just be brilliant, writes Brett McKay.
20/11/2021.author: Brett McKay

20/11/2021.headline: Players must be vaccinated to take part in Australian Open, says tournament director Craig Tiley
20/11/2021.description: Tournament director Craig Tiley ends speculation over next year's Australian Open, confirming all players — including world number one Novak Djokovic — must be vaccinated to play at Melbourne Park.
20/11/2021.author: Brett McKay

20/11/2021.headline: NSW passes Zoe's Law to impose harsher penalties for the death of an unborn baby
20/11/2021.description: A bill first proposed after a drunk driver hit Brodie Donegan, causing the loss of her foetus, Zoe, 12 years ago, passes NSW Parliament and will see tougher penalties for crimes that result in the loss of an unborn child.
20/11/2021.author: Danuta Kozaki, Danuta Kozaki, and Danuta Kozaki

20/11/2021.headline: The deadly new risk Afghan women face: It starts with a strange phone call and can end with murder
20/11/2021.description: There were warnings that women's rights activists in Afghanistan were in danger, Now, they are disappearing and being killed in the streets.
20/11/2021.author: Som Patidar, Emily Clark, and Tom Joyner

20/11/2021.headline: No jab, no job: Why Chantal has chosen to quit rather than get the COVID vaccine
20/11/2021.description: Chantal has baked her final loaf in a job she loves, choosing to leave rather than get the COVID vaccine. She's not alone, with business owners fearing a worker drought when government-mandated vaccine rules soon kick in.
20/11/2021.author: Rebecca Trigger

20/11/2021.headline: What are my chances of getting long COVID if I'm fully vaccinated?
20/11/2021.description: Vaccination reduces the risk of severe disease, but what does it mean for long COVID? Here's what the science says.
20/11/2021.author: Olivia Willis

20/11/2021.headline: Just like Sparta and Athens, America and China are on a collision course
20/11/2021.description: The Thucydides Trap states that when a rising power meets a waning one, war becomes inevitable. But China-US relations are more complicated than a simple power battle, writes Stan Grant.
20/11/2021.author: Stan Grant

20/11/2021.headline: Four friends, one album and a disaster of epic proportions: A fresh look inside the Beatles' last stand
20/11/2021.description: What The Beatles: Get Back will show is that all the elements of the band's break-up were there in January 1969, along with the good things. But as history tell us, sooner or later something had to give.
20/11/2021.author: Mark Bannerman

20/11/2021.headline: I've grieved derailed career plans and gone on wild diets, but I've finally come to appreciate my disability
20/11/2021.description: Although I've had to grieve my past self, my disability, Myalgic encephalomyelitis, has freed me from the weight of my own expectations about who I should be — and helped me become braver than I ever imagined, writes Alice Rumble.
20/11/2021.author: Mark Bannerman

20/11/2021.headline: An activist, a director and an MMA fighter: Harry Potter stars have come a long way from Hogwarts, 20 years on
20/11/2021.description: It's been 20 years since the release of Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone, which inspired a new generation of Potterheads and skyrocketed the young cast to superstardom. Here's what they've been up to since.
20/11/2021.author: Maani Truu

20/11/2021.headline: Chinese state media says Peng Shuai will appear 'soon', amid speculation over missing tennis star
20/11/2021.description: Chinese state media employees post photos of missing sportswoman Peng Shuai, saying she is staying in her own home "freely" and "didn't want to be disturbed", ahead of an imminent public appearance.
20/11/2021.author: Maani Truu

20/11/2021.headline: Disallowed goals see Daniel Sturridge's A-League Men debut end in 1-1 draw
20/11/2021.description: In front of a crowd of more than 17,000, the former Liverpool and England striker had 10 minutes at the end to try and snatch victory for Perth Glory.
20/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

20/11/2021.headline: Diving save ensures goalless Sydney derby, Tony Popovic gets winning start as Victory boss
20/11/2021.description: A long-range strike from Wanderers' former England international Jack Rodwell nearly sends the boisterous crowd of 23,118 into raptures during the tight derby.
20/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

20/11/2021.headline: Heavy rain in India leaves 17 dead, dozens missing
20/11/2021.description: The southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh has been hit by intense torrents since Thursday, sparking massive floods in at least five districts, officials say.
20/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

20/11/2021.headline: North Melbourne's Ben Cunnington to undergo chemotherapy
20/11/2021.description: Cunnington needs a nine-week course of chemotherapy, but the Kangaroos say he is expected to make a full recovery.
20/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

20/11/2021.headline: Flood-hit Canadian province limits petrol purchases, non-essential travel
20/11/2021.description: British Columbia imposes restrictions on fuel and non-essential travel to ease supply chain disruptions and support recovery work after floods and mudslides that have destroyed roads, houses and left thousands stranded.
20/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

20/11/2021.headline: Cricket Australia admits it mishandled Paine investigation
20/11/2021.description: Cricket Australia's current leadership team says the organisation "sent the wrong message" with its management of the 2018 investigation into Tim Paine's role in a sexting incident, conceding he should have been removed as Test captain at the time.
20/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

20/11/2021.headline: 'Mud on their hands': Cricket Australia criticised for handling of Paine sexting scandal
20/11/2021.description: Former players question the governing body's management of the incident, which has led to Tim Paine stepping down as the Australian men's Test captain ahead of the Ashes series.
20/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

20/11/2021.headline: Twelve people to stand trial over Kardashian West jewel heist in Paris
20/11/2021.description: The charges relate to a 2016 robbery when the reality TV star was tied up at gunpoint and locked in a bathroom in her rented Paris apartment.
20/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

20/11/2021.headline: Worker is second to die in two years at central Queensland coal mine
20/11/2021.description: Police confirm a 54-year-old man was killed in a mining accident at the Curragh open-cut coal mine in central Queensland early this morning.
20/11/2021.author: Mollie Gorman

20/11/2021.headline: 'This is the best crop of import talent our country's ever seen': WNBA players arrive in Townsville
20/11/2021.description: The Townsville Fire rebrand a nostalgia-inducing venue as they welcome some of the best WNBA players for the upcoming WNBL season.
20/11/2021.author: Brittney Kleyn

20/11/2021.headline: 'It's really challenging': Waiting 10 hours for the first cuddle
20/11/2021.description: Tide and Kove were born prematurely at 34 weeks and are still at the hospital's specialist nursery. Their parents hope the whole family will be home by Christmas.
20/11/2021.author: Inga Stunzner and Erin Semmler

20/11/2021.headline: Can Qatar reshape its image on the back of the 2022 FIFA World Cup?
20/11/2021.description: With only a year until it hosts the World Cup, Qatar has undergone significant change. But for some of its critics, it is still not enough, writes Tracey Holmes.
20/11/2021.author: Tracey Holmes

20/11/2021.headline: Wales earn last-gasp win over Wallabies and All Blacks go down again in Paris
20/11/2021.description: Dave Rennie's Wallabies team is denied victory in its final match of the European tour, going down to Wales from a kick after time expired in Cardiff — while the All Blacks lose to a rampant French outfit in Paris.
20/11/2021.author: Tracey Holmes

20/11/2021.headline: Father's missing war medal finds its way back to his daughters
20/11/2021.description: A "bizarre" chain of events leads to three sisters being reunited with their father's Korean War medal, more than half a century after he left his family, never to return.
20/11/2021.author: Meg Bolton and Amy Sheehan

20/11/2021.headline: Having access to toilets is a basic human right, but for those with a disability, access is still a common problem
20/11/2021.description: It wasn't until Robyn Thompson's multiple sclerosis progressed that future trips to the loo became a major part of preparing for any trip outside the house. She says the issue is all too common.
20/11/2021.author: Meg Bolton and Amy Sheehan

21/11/2021.headline: Remembering the 645 lives lost on HMAS Sydney in Australia's greatest naval tragedy
21/11/2021.description: Hundreds of people in the Western Australian fishing town of Denham turn out to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the sinking of HMAS Sydney, claiming 645 lives.
21/11/2021.author: James Liveris

21/11/2021.headline: NT's COVID-19 outbreak has jumped to the poverty-stricken fringes of Katherine. Here's the latest
21/11/2021.description: Military forces and police have been deployed to the remote communities of Binjari and Rockhole, with residents facing weeks confined to their homes amid a hard lockdown, the toughest actions deployed against the virus in the Northern Territory to date.
21/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

21/11/2021.headline: Venezuela claims Guinness World Record for largest orchestra
21/11/2021.description: Venezuela's National System of Youth and Children's Orchestras sets a new Guinness World Record for the largest orchestra, with 8,573 musicians playing simultaneously.
21/11/2021.author: Roxanne Fitzgerald

21/11/2021.headline: Local surfers dominate state junior surfing titles in Wollongong
21/11/2021.description: Hosting the NSW state junior surfing titles seems to have paid off with Illawarra surfers Oceanna Rogers and Lennix Smith winning the Under 18s female and male events at East Corrimal Beach.
21/11/2021.author: Nick McLaren

21/11/2021.headline: China reduces diplomatic ties with Lithuania over opening of Taiwan office
21/11/2021.description: In retaliation for Lithuania allowing Taiwan to open a representative office in its capital city, Vilnius, China reduces the level of its diplomatic relations with the Baltic nation to below ambassador level.
21/11/2021.author: Nick McLaren

21/11/2021.headline: More than 1,500 Queensland drivers caught with phones in just one week
21/11/2021.description: Dozens of offenders were caught breaking Queensland's mobile phone and seatbelt rules multiple times within just four days this month. If the trend continues, the government warns 12 drivers could lose their licence each day.
21/11/2021.author: Alex Brewster

21/11/2021.headline: Villani century thwarts Strikers as WBBL finals are locked in
21/11/2021.description: The WBBL final will be played at Perth Stadium next Saturday after the Scorchers clinched top spot with a comfortable eight-wicket win over the Sydney Sixers.
21/11/2021.author: Alex Brewster

21/11/2021.headline: Queen Elizabeth II marks first wedding anniversary without Prince Philip
21/11/2021.description: Queen Elizabeth II marks her first wedding anniversary alone, seven months after the death of her husband of 73 years, Prince Philip.
21/11/2021.author: Melissa Maykin

21/11/2021.headline: 'Bring it on': Labor would welcome election fought on cost of living
21/11/2021.description: Citing the rising cost of petrol and a drop in real wages, Shadow Treasurer Jim Chalmers says Prime Minister Scott Morrison has been "lying" about the economy, with "real consequences" for families.
21/11/2021.author: Andrew Probyn and Claudia Long

21/11/2021.headline: Federer and Nadal voice concern for Peng Shaui
21/11/2021.description: Tennis greats Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal voice concern for Chinese player Peng Shuai, as advocates call on the IOC to push China for proof of her safety.
21/11/2021.author: Andrew Probyn and Claudia Long

21/11/2021.headline: Protests erupt over COVID lockdown and vaccination rules across Europe
21/11/2021.description: Tens of thousands of protesters, many from far-right groups, march in Austria and other European nations as COVID-19 restrictions tighten.
21/11/2021.author: Andrew Probyn and Claudia Long

21/11/2021.headline: 'Nothing's going to stop me': Queensland's Health Minister says she has received death threats
21/11/2021.description: Yvette D'Ath insists she still feels safe in her ministerial role despite receiving death threats, saying she sees her role as extremely important and "I love what I do".
21/11/2021.author: Andrew Probyn and Claudia Long

21/11/2021.headline: 'Threat to lives is extreme': Army brought in to help contain NT COVID-19 outbreak amid nine new cases
21/11/2021.description: The NT's Chief Minister says the federal government has offered to deploy 20 ADF personnel, as well as army trucks, to assist with the unfolding situation in the remote community of Binjari.
21/11/2021.author: Steve Vivian

21/11/2021.headline: 'Heroic' police officer saves two boys from almost certain death in flooded NSW river
21/11/2021.description: A NSW police officer will be recommended for a bravery award after he jumped into the flooded Lachlan River to rescue two boys clinging desperately to a log in the fast-moving current.
21/11/2021.author: Mollie Gorman

21/11/2021.headline: SA details COVID-19 home care plans for positive cases when borders reopen
21/11/2021.description: COVID-positive patients who are isolating at home once SA's borders reopen on Tuesday will have access to devices allowing health staff to regularly monitor their symptoms.
21/11/2021.author: Mollie Gorman

21/11/2021.headline: 'We'll have to wait and see': Djokovic non-committal about Australian Open after ATP Finals loss
21/11/2021.description: World number one Novak Djokovic's season is over with a loss at the ATP Finals — and the Serbian says he has not made up his mind whether he will play at the Australian Open.
21/11/2021.author: Mollie Gorman

21/11/2021.headline: Another piece of fabric found at William Tyrrell search site
21/11/2021.description: NSW Police find another piece of fabric as they push ahead with a search for the remains of missing boy William Tyrrell, despite bad weather on the NSW Mid-North Coast
21/11/2021.author: Mollie Gorman

21/11/2021.headline: How Sam McDaniel is rebuilding the relationship with his famous dad, Wayne
21/11/2021.description: Years after his father, Wayne, lit up Australian basketball, Sam McDaniel is set to lead the Tasmania JackJumpers into a new era of NBL — and he will do it with the help of his dad, despite them spending years apart.
21/11/2021.author: Chris Rowbottom

21/11/2021.headline: Missing tennis star Peng Shuai says she 'wants her privacy respected' in video call with IOC president
21/11/2021.description: After concerns for her safety following her sexual assault allegation against a former Communist Party official, the International Olympic Committee says Ms Peng has told its president that she is "safe and well".
21/11/2021.author: Chris Rowbottom

21/11/2021.headline: From terminator to germinator: Find out how these farmers are helping Australia reach net zero
21/11/2021.description: When Joe Vaughan started his vineyard, he approached farming like a battlefield — killing unwanted pests and plants. Now he is among a growing number of farmers promoting life through regenerative agriculture.
21/11/2021.author: Matilda Marozzi

21/11/2021.headline: SA Deputy Premier Vickie Chapman steps down pending investigation
21/11/2021.description: South Australia's Deputy Premier steps down from her ministerial roles, pending the outcome of an ombudsman's inquiry into her decision to knock back a seaport on Kangaroo Island.
21/11/2021.author: Isabel Dayman

21/11/2021.headline: How this homemade barber shop reunited three brothers to address men's mental health
21/11/2021.description: Sam and his brothers spent 10 months handcrafting a mobile barber shop to encourage more men to talk about what's going on in their lives.
21/11/2021.author: Donal Sheil

21/11/2021.headline: Facebook group 'seeing laugh reacts on death' as COVID misinformation spreads
21/11/2021.description: COVID-19 has intensified misinformation and community polarisation along issues like vaccination, but it's a symptom of a broader problem facing social media.
21/11/2021.author: Dominic Cansdale

21/11/2021.headline: Community reels as investigators piece together tragic fire that tore through Werribee home
21/11/2021.description: Neighbours shed tears and firefighters looked visibly shaken after a blaze in Melbourne's west in the early hours of Sunday morning resulted in the deaths of four children.
21/11/2021.author: Dominic Cansdale

21/11/2021.headline: AFL draft top 30: Ranking the best talents in this year's crop
21/11/2021.description: With the AFL draft just around the corner, check out our rankings of the best 30 young players available to find out who is really the cream of the crop.
21/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton

21/11/2021.headline: Shared e-scooters locked out of Brisbane party districts after midnight in six-month trial
21/11/2021.description: Shared e-scooters will be locked from midnight to 5am on weekends in Brisbane's CBD and Fortitude Valley in a six-month safety trial from December 1.
21/11/2021.author: Lucy Stone

21/11/2021.headline: Cashing in: ASX fuels billions of dollars of wealth through floats in 2021
21/11/2021.description: Why are so many companies listing on the ASX, who is benefiting and what exactly is involved in an initial public offering anyway?
21/11/2021.author: Rachel Pupazzoni

21/11/2021.headline: For real life! New Bluey episodes are out this week. Here's when to watch
21/11/2021.description: There's new games to play with Mum and Dad, and some lessons to be learned along the way for Bluey and her sister Bingo in season three.
21/11/2021.author: Rachel Pupazzoni

21/11/2021.headline: Grace wanted to speak. But telling her story time and time again has taken its toll
21/11/2021.description: Just 26, and still processing years of trauma, Grace Tame was thrust into the limelight when she became Australian of the Year. She looks back over a turbulent 10 months.
21/11/2021.author: Greg Hassall and Winsome Denyer

21/11/2021.headline: 'Inheriting my father's enemies': The pros and cons of having a famous parent
21/11/2021.description: Three people with famous parents open up about the opportunities and challenges that come with the family name.
21/11/2021.author: Nick Baker

21/11/2021.headline: From bowsers to batteries: When demand for petrol dries up, what will happen to servos?
21/11/2021.description: Electric vehicles are coming, and they don't need liquid fuel. That spells trouble for service stations.
21/11/2021.author: James Purtill

21/11/2021.headline: Hamilton dominates in Qatar as Verstappen's championship lead shrinks to eight points
21/11/2021.description: Lewis Hamilton is just eight points behind Max Verstappen in the fight for the Formula 1 title after dominating the Qatar Grand Prix.
21/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

21/11/2021.headline: PNG is expected to have only one-third of its population vaccinated by 2026
21/11/2021.description: Fewer than 4 per cent of eligible adults are currently vaccinated against COVID-19 in Papua New Guinea, while the outlook for other parts of Melanesia is also pessimistic.
21/11/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

21/11/2021.headline: Shooting at holy site in Jerusalem kills one and injures four
21/11/2021.description: Police say the attack took place near an entrance to a contested flashpoint shrine known to Jews as the Temple Mount and to Muslims as the Noble Sanctuary.
21/11/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

21/11/2021.headline: Baby boy tests positive for COVID-19 in Hobart quarantine after flight from Melbourne
21/11/2021.description: Both mother and son were tested for COVID-19 while in quarantine in Hobart, with Public Health Tasmania informed of the infant's positive result on Sunday.
21/11/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

21/11/2021.headline: Manchester United's Ole Gunnar Solskjaer sacked as manager
21/11/2021.description: The sacking comes after a humiliating 4-1 defeat to Watford, their fourth loss in five Premier League games.
21/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

21/11/2021.headline: Sudan military to reinstate ousted prime minister, release arrested officials
21/11/2021.description: Military and government officials say a deal has been reached between Sudan's military and civilian leaders to reinstate Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok, who was deposed in the October 25 coup, with detained government officials and politicians also to be released.
21/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

21/11/2021.headline: Sydney washout sees Shane van Gisbergen seal Supercars championship
21/11/2021.description: Shane van Gisbergen is celebrating his Supercars championship after heavy rain washed out Sunday's Sydney SuperNight event and made his lead insurmountable.
21/11/2021.author: Michael Doyle

22/11/2021.headline: Prime Minister forced to backtrack after claiming he told opposition about Hawaiian holiday
22/11/2021.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison claimed he had told the opposition he was headed to Hawaii during the catastrophic bushfires in 2019 — only to be made to clarify his comments twice just hours later.
22/11/2021.author: Nour Haydar

22/11/2021.headline: Patient accused of punching GP for refusing vaccine exemption
22/11/2021.description: Queensland doctors say threats against staff are on the rise amid fear among some people about the impacts vaccine mandates will have on their lives.
22/11/2021.author: Tobi Loftus

22/11/2021.headline: New Zealand to move away from COVID zero, Air New Zealand cancels 1,000 Australian flights
22/11/2021.description: New Zealand will end a three-and-a-half-month lockdown in Auckland next week as it adopts a new coronavirus control strategy, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says. It comes as Air New Zealand cancels 1,000 flights to Australia.
22/11/2021.author: Tobi Loftus

22/11/2021.headline: Public servants offered $10,000 'bonus' as hundreds of staff sacked for refusing COVID jab in NT
22/11/2021.description: To get public servants to agree to a four-year pay freeze, NT Chief Minister Michael Gunner is offering a $10,000 "bonus" which would be funded using the salaries of staff recently sacked for refusing to get vaccinated.
22/11/2021.author: Jano Gibson

22/11/2021.headline: WTA are not convinced Chinese tennis player Peng Shuai is safe and well, despite call with IOC president
22/11/2021.description: Concerns continue to grow for Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai's safety following her sexual assault allegation against a former Communist Party official.
22/11/2021.author: Jano Gibson

22/11/2021.headline: Jen's teenage son has tried to end his life three times. She says the lack of regional youth mental health care is at 'crisis point'
22/11/2021.description: Regional Victorian children are in critical need of specialist mental health care services. More care has been promised, but desperate parents fear it will be too little, too late.
22/11/2021.author: Charmayne Allison and Rosanne Maloney

22/11/2021.headline: 'Life will never be the same': Young mother's despair as father pleads guilty to killing six-month-old
22/11/2021.description: Evander Wilson, 21, pleaded guilty before the Supreme Court over his actions at his Mildura home in April 2020 that led to the death of his baby son, Jakobi.
22/11/2021.author: Josie Taylor and Richard Crabtree

22/11/2021.headline: The Loop: Wisconsin Christmas parade turns to tragedy, NASA's gonna kick some asteroid and BTS dominate American Music Awards
22/11/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
22/11/2021.author: Bridget Judd

22/11/2021.headline: Perth Scorchers star awarded coveted WBBL honour
22/11/2021.description: Sophie Devine is named captain of the WBBL team of the season, with her Scorchers opening partner Beth Mooney also included in the star-studded XI.
22/11/2021.author: Bridget Judd

22/11/2021.headline: 'Anti-mandate is anti-vax': Chief Minister hits out at critics of COVID-19 mandates as NT senator backs One Nation
22/11/2021.description: Michael Gunner accuses opponents of vaccine mandates of being "anti-vaxxers", even if they have willingly received the COVID-19 jab themselves.
22/11/2021.author: Jano Gibson

22/11/2021.headline: Perth Modern School suspends principal and deputy following investigation
22/11/2021.description: Perth Modern School suspends principal Lois Joll and associate principal Val Furphy after a review of workplace culture as Shenton College's principal, Mike Morgan, steps in as interim head.
22/11/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

22/11/2021.headline: Adelaide's last drive-in cinema to close after more than 65 years
22/11/2021.description: Metropolitan Adelaide's last drive-in cinema will close its gates for the final time in early 2022, with its owners citing a changing film industry, piracy, the COVID-19 pandemic and the introduction of daylight saving as reasons it is no longer viable.
22/11/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

22/11/2021.headline: You wouldn't recognise them in a line up, but two of his own senators are about to make Morrison's job hell
22/11/2021.description: Two Liberal senators, who few in the party expected to be elected, have found themselves holding the Prime Minister's legislative agenda just months out from an election, potentially making Scott Morrison's job even harder, writes political correspondent Brett Worthington.
22/11/2021.author: Brett Worthington

22/11/2021.headline: St Basil's aged care manager accused of failing to pass on keys, passwords as outbreak struck
22/11/2021.description: The manager of Melbourne's St Basil's aged care home is accused of failing to pass on clinical notes, keys and computer passwords to the staff who came in to run the facility as a deadly COVID-19 outbreak took hold.
22/11/2021.author: Danny Morgan

22/11/2021.headline: Investors swindled by Sydney businesswoman a step closer to getting money back
22/11/2021.description: A court finds missing Sydney businesswoman Melissa Caddick broke the law by operating without the required financial services licence, ordering her company be wound up and permanent receivers appointed.
22/11/2021.author: Sarah Gerathy

22/11/2021.headline: Collingwood coy about De Goey's Magpies future
22/11/2021.description: Collingwood coach Craig McRae is unsure whether Jordan De Goey will play again for the Magpies after the 25-year-old's arrest in New York last month.
22/11/2021.author: Sarah Gerathy

22/11/2021.headline: Canberra woman charged with hitting man with car at Mount Ainslie lookout
22/11/2021.description: Kiah Knight, 18, pleads not guilty to charges of negligent driving causing grievous bodily harm and failing to give assistance.
22/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne and Antoinette Radford

22/11/2021.headline: SA Premier apologises after surge in applications to enter SA crash website
22/11/2021.description: SA's website for entry assessment is inundated with more than 25,000 applications ahead of the state borders opening at 12:01am on Tuesday.
22/11/2021.author: Rebecca Opie

22/11/2021.headline: Mother left 'dead inside' after daughter's murder by partner in Mount Gambier
22/11/2021.description: The mother of a woman murdered by her partner in South Australia's south-east tells the Supreme Court she is haunted by the memories of her daughter "beaten, battered, bruised, lifeless" while hooked up to a life machine in hospital.
22/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

22/11/2021.headline: Family of Melbourne woman who died after 'unnecessary' CT scan calls for change
22/11/2021.description: A lawyer for the family of Melbourne mother-of-two Peta Hickey says they intend to launch civil action after the Victorian coroner finds doctors' poor judgement, inadequate training and lax industry standards contributed to the death.
22/11/2021.author: Melissa Brown

22/11/2021.headline: Worker dies on building site in Perth's southern suburbs
22/11/2021.description: A man dies while working on a residential building site in North Coogee in Perth's south, after he is believed to have been struck on the head.
22/11/2021.author: Lana Taranto

22/11/2021.headline: Lakers, Pistons game halted for melee after enraged Detroit player goes after LeBron James
22/11/2021.description: LA Lakers star LeBron James elbows Detroit Pistons player Isaiah Stewart in the face during a game, and all hell breaks loose with an on-court melee.
22/11/2021.author: Lana Taranto

22/11/2021.headline: What is sustainable when it comes to fashion? Europe's new laws rate synthetics over natural fibre
22/11/2021.description: Tackling "greenwashing" in the fashion industry, Australian wool and cotton growers have joined forces to take on Europe's new textile labelling laws over the very definition of sustainable.
22/11/2021.author: Joshua Becker

22/11/2021.headline: 'We miss you Mommy': What is happening with Monaco's Princess Charlene?
22/11/2021.description: Princess Charlene's long-awaited return to Monaco under a cloud ahead of major celebrations in the wealthy nation. Here's what we know about it.
22/11/2021.author: Joshua Becker

22/11/2021.headline: Woman dies after being struck by falling tree branch while bushwalking
22/11/2021.description: Police say the weather conditions in NSW's Watagans National Park were poor following heavy rainfall and, despite rescue efforts, the woman could not be revived.
22/11/2021.author: Madeline Lewis and Liz Farquhar

22/11/2021.headline: Find the AFL draft prospect that would be perfect for your team
22/11/2021.description: Does your AFL team need a new full forward? An explosive midfielder? An intercepting gun? Use our interactive tool to see which players fit the brief.
22/11/2021.author: Dean Bilton

22/11/2021.headline: Australian MPs fight Chinese bid to join Interpol's governing body
22/11/2021.description: Several Australian politicians are fighting to block a Chinese official from Interpol's executive committee, fearing Beijing may use the crime fighting body to target political dissidents.
22/11/2021.author: Andrew Greene

22/11/2021.headline: Internet speeds in Canberra vary from suburb to suburb, and these residents have had enough
22/11/2021.description: Canberrans tired of slow internet speeds are calling from changes to the ACT's NBN connections, which experts say vary depending on which suburb you live in.
22/11/2021.author: Rosie King

22/11/2021.headline: 'It's not going to fix the delays': Advocates fear new bill won't ease Queensland's parole backlog
22/11/2021.description: Prisoners Legal Service estimates the backlog comes at a monthly cost of $3.9 million to the Queensland taxpayer.
22/11/2021.author: Rosie King

22/11/2021.headline: Tourists might swerve holiday destinations with low vaccination rates, experts warn
22/11/2021.description: Chief executive of the Queensland Tourism Industry Council Daniel Gschwind says data shows holiday-makers will take health into consideration when choosing a destination.
22/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Cramsie

22/11/2021.headline: Getting a job with a proper wage is Olivia's 'greatest achievement'. But advocates say it shouldn't be that hard
22/11/2021.description: The disability royal commission heard more than 50 per cent of people with disability of working age were unemployed in 2018. Advocates say it's time for change.
22/11/2021.author: Celina Edmonds and Nas Campanella

22/11/2021.headline: A federal anti-corruption commission was promised at the last election — now it may not happen before the next one
22/11/2021.description: It is looking less and less likely that a bill to establish a federal anti-corruption commission will be introduced before Christmas. And, if an election is called for March, there will be no time to legislate it before people head to the polls.
22/11/2021.author: Matthew Doran

22/11/2021.headline: New age of the asterisk? Integrity of elite sport under pressure as pandemic goalposts shift
22/11/2021.description: The positive COVID-19 test of cricketer Will Sutherland exposed a threat to the integrity of sporting competitions set to be repeated time and again over the coming months as Australia learns to live with COVID-19.
22/11/2021.author: Jack Snape

22/11/2021.headline: How migration fraud works and ways to avoid visa scams in Australia
22/11/2021.description: Linh* was desperate when she handed over $110,000 to a self-proclaimed migration agent, her case is now under police investigation.
22/11/2021.author: Michael Luu

22/11/2021.headline: Waukesha police chief says Christmas parade deaths 'not a terrorist event'
22/11/2021.description: Waukesha's police chief provides an update into the investigation into the incident which left five people dead and dozens injured.
22/11/2021.author: Michael Luu

22/11/2021.headline: Working from home is here to stay. How will it change the face of Melbourne?
22/11/2021.description: One in three Victorian workers could be working several days a week from home by 2036, with Infrastructure Victoria predicting it will put further strain on transport networks on Melbourne's urban fringe.
22/11/2021.author: Kristian Silva

22/11/2021.headline: Tourists may have to pay to visit Cape York's tip
22/11/2021.description: Thousands of people visited the peninsula this year, but it may be the last cohort who get to visit its tip for free. And any money raised would help tackle a host of problems.
22/11/2021.author: Jemima Burt

22/11/2021.headline: SA border opens. Here's who can come in and what rules are in place
22/11/2021.description: At the stroke of midnight, South Australia's border opened. Here's a breakdown of who can enter the state and what rules are in place.
22/11/2021.author: Rebecca Opie

22/11/2021.headline: Woman stole $940k to play online game with no chance of 'real money' win
22/11/2021.description: A Tasmanian woman has pleaded guilty to stealing $940,000 from her employer to fund her addiction to an online gambling game that does not pay out real money.
22/11/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

22/11/2021.headline: Video reveals 'bastardisation' of recruit at army base
22/11/2021.description: Lawyers for a young former military recruit are taking the Australian Defence Force to court over his experience at an army barracks in Victoria.
22/11/2021.author: Michael Vincent

22/11/2021.headline: Costello says RBA 'irresponsible' on rates, but who is responsible for housing affordability?
22/11/2021.description: Australia's skyrocketing property market has seen house prices increase 22 per cent in 12 months. As Alan Kohler writes, there's no easy answer to housing affordability.
22/11/2021.author: Alan Kohler

22/11/2021.headline: New space at Sydney Opera House provides chance for people to get creative
22/11/2021.description: The Sydney Opera House unveils its latest performance space aimed at encouraging the audience to explore their creativity.
22/11/2021.author: Sofie Wainwright

22/11/2021.headline: 'Ruthless and dangerous': How Australia's most powerful lobby sways votes and swings seats
22/11/2021.description: When Andrew Wilkie took on one of the country's most persuasive political operators, he wasn't prepared for the bloodbath that followed.
22/11/2021.author: Inga Ting, Katia Shatoba, Michael Workman, Nathanael Scott, and Alex Palmer

22/11/2021.headline: What's with all the bird flu outbreaks lately, and should we be worried?
22/11/2021.description: The COVID-19 pandemic may have crushed seasonal flu to historically low levels, but another type of flu — avian influenza or bird flu — has shown no signs of slowing.
22/11/2021.author: Belinda Smith

22/11/2021.headline: Will Australia follow Europe into a fourth COVID wave?
22/11/2021.description: Europe is facing a fourth wave of COVID. As we watch on, it is reasonable to ask whether Australia will be confronted with the same fate, writes Raina MacIntyre.
22/11/2021.author: Belinda Smith

22/11/2021.headline: This pastor thinks it's 'anti-Christian' to back the religious discrimination bill
22/11/2021.description: The religious discrimination bill is expected to be introduced into Parliament this week. These queer pastors question the bill's necessity, and worry about its consequences.
22/11/2021.author: Siobhan Marin

22/11/2021.headline: This expert says too many social media platforms are 'wild west-y' when it comes to protecting women's safety
22/11/2021.description: Twenty-three-year-old Kate says she's impacted by the personal abuse she's faced online as well as a constant slew of degrading content. What are platforms doing about it?
22/11/2021.author: Siobhan Marin

22/11/2021.headline: With a nod to Adele, Spotify did something many big tech companies don't: They listened
22/11/2021.description: For years, Spotify ignored pleas from artists and customers to change one aspect of their streaming service. But when Adele spoke, the streaming giant listened.
22/11/2021.author: Mawunyo Gbogbo

22/11/2021.headline: 'You've got to risk it for the biscuit': Is equity crowdfunding worth the risk?
22/11/2021.description: First-time investors are pouring millions of dollars into unlisted start-ups and small-to-medium-sized businesses through online crowdfunding campaigns. But is it really a smart way to invest?
22/11/2021.author: Rhiana Whitson

22/11/2021.headline: Xi tells ASEAN that China will not 'bully' smaller neighbours
22/11/2021.description: The Philippines criticised China's recent actions in the South China Sea at a conference of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations.
22/11/2021.author: Rhiana Whitson

23/11/2021.headline: Officer warns of more deaths on popular Mt Augustus climbing trail if paths not closed in hot months
23/11/2021.description: An inquest into the deaths of four hikers on Western Australia's remote Mount Augustus is told a police officer believes the summit trail should be closed during the hottest half of the year.
23/11/2021.author: Joanna Menagh

23/11/2021.headline: Canberra man found guilty of threatening partner with chainsaw released on good behaviour bond
23/11/2021.description: A 48-year-old man who was caught on CCTV threatening his partner with a chainsaw is released by the ACT Magistrates Court.
23/11/2021.author: Antoinette Radford

23/11/2021.headline: Confusion over former SA deputy premier's pay while in cabinet but not a minister
23/11/2021.description: Premier Steven Marshall says Vickie Chapman will relinquish her ministerial perks, car, office and additional salary while under investigation, but there appears to be no mechanism under the Parliamentary Remuneration Act for a minister to relinquish part of his or her salary.
23/11/2021.author: Nick Harmsen

23/11/2021.headline: Dani Laidley returning to North Melbourne 'just being herself is a very, very positive sign'
23/11/2021.description: Transgender advocates say Dani Laidley's return to Arden Street last week was an important step in recognising the trans community and showing how important a support network is in making people feel comfortable in their own skin.
23/11/2021.author: Tom Maddocks

23/11/2021.headline: Australians who make 'statements of belief' protected under watered-down religious discrimination bill
23/11/2021.description: The details of a long-awaited and highly contentious bill to strengthen protections for religious beliefs are revealed, including safeguards for organisations that want workers to practise their religion.
23/11/2021.author: James Glenday

23/11/2021.headline: Major hint revealed about who may replace Tim Paine as Aussie men's captain
23/11/2021.description: In what may be a sign as to who takes Paine's place as men's Test skipper, Pat Cummins is added to the cover of the digital version of the official Ashes video game.
23/11/2021.author: James Glenday

23/11/2021.headline: Mark McGowan considers moving family from home in Perth's south amid alleged threats
23/11/2021.description: Western Australia's Premier Mark McGowan is considering moving his family out of their Rockingham home after threats were made against him and his wife and children.
23/11/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

23/11/2021.headline: Kyle Rittenhouse gives his first inteview since being acquitted over fatal shooting and wounding of protesters
23/11/2021.description: In the interview with Fox News host Tucker Carlson, Mr Rittenhouse gives his opinion of the trial he faced and his plans for the future.
23/11/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

23/11/2021.headline: The Loop: We're in for a wet one, mammoth's tusk found 3,000 metres undersea and man alive after night in morgue freezer
23/11/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today.
23/11/2021.author: Bridget Judd

23/11/2021.headline: Police called after transgender flags 'desecrated' in Tasmania
23/11/2021.description: Transgender flags — raised at Hobart's Town Hall to mark a Day of Remembrance — have been vandalised after flying for less than 24 hours, with a local advocate saying the "desecration" was a "reminder of the stigma and hate" faced by the community.
23/11/2021.author: Emily Baker

23/11/2021.headline: Speculation over 'hidden message' in Peng Shuai selfie
23/11/2021.description: A photo frame featuring Winnie the Pooh in one of Peng Shuai's selfies has some people speculating it could be a subtle hint from the Chinese tennis star.
23/11/2021.author: Emily Baker

23/11/2021.headline: NSW Premier defends Western Sydney lockdown despite Chant email calling for 'consistency'
23/11/2021.description: A war of words erupts over an email sent by the state's Chief Health Officer in August with the Opposition Leader saying it's evidence the government didn't follow health advice. Premier Dominic Perrottet says the email did not amount to health advice.
23/11/2021.author: Ashleigh Raper

23/11/2021.headline: 'Burnt to ash': Bus catches fire in Bulgaria, killing 45 people onboard, including children
23/11/2021.description: The North Macedonian bus catches fire on a highway in western Bulgarian killing dozens, including children, as survivors are rushed to hospital with burns.
23/11/2021.author: Ashleigh Raper

23/11/2021.headline: Jason Horne-Francis says he can 'handle the pressure' if picked first in tomorrow's AFL Draft
23/11/2021.description: Jason Horne-Francis is all but locked in to join the Kangaroos with the number one pick in tomorrow night's AFL National Draft and he says he can handle any pressure that comes his way.
23/11/2021.author: Camron Slessor

23/11/2021.headline: Indian cricket star Poonam Yadav opens up on record-breaking WBBL season
23/11/2021.description: Poonam Yadav is part of the largest Indian cohort driving record WBBL ratings. The leg-spinner opens up on bonds formed with her Heat teammates.
23/11/2021.author: Kate O'Halloran

23/11/2021.headline: Another Christmas in Siberia for stranded Aussies with unapproved vaccines
23/11/2021.description: NSW model James Cater and his partner Anna are fully vaccinated with the Sputnik vaccine. They want to come home but instead are facing another Christmas overseas.
23/11/2021.author: Lindsay McDougall and Kelly Fuller

23/11/2021.headline: Woodside's Scarborough gas decision sparks inner-city protests as CEO defends project
