28/11/2021.description: Australian boxer George Kambosos Jr has defeated Teófimo López in a monumental upset to become the world unified lightweight champion. Follow all the action in our live blog.
28/11/2021.author: Simon Smale

28/11/2021.headline: Public servants have been told to return to the office, but what risk do they face as COVID-19 remains in the community?
28/11/2021.description: Federal public servants have been told to return to the office in the wake of eased COVID-19 restrictions, sparking debate over whether it is the safest approach as the virus continues to circulate in the community.
28/11/2021.author: Niki Burnside

28/11/2021.headline: By dethroning a would-be king, George Kambosos Jr sits atop Australian boxing
28/11/2021.description: George Kambosos Jr’s stunning win over Teófimo López could lay claim to being the best ever by an Australian overseas, making Kambosos Australian boxing’s current number one, writes Simon Smale.
28/11/2021.author: Simon Smale

28/11/2021.headline: Omicron is now in Australia. What does that mean for Queensland?
28/11/2021.description: Queensland Health says officials are closely monitoring developments in NSW after the detection of two cases of the new COVID-19 variant in hotel quarantine.
28/11/2021.author: Simon Smale

28/11/2021.headline: Hubert the Eurasian hobby makes history, a long way from home
28/11/2021.description: Hubert is the first of his species ever seen in eastern Australia, and birders are wondering whether he's a climate change vagrant from Europe or he just got lost in La Niña.
28/11/2021.author: Riordan Davis

28/11/2021.headline: Louis Vuitton's star designer Virgil Abloh dies of cancer
28/11/2021.description: Louis Vuitton star designer Virgil Abloh has died of cancer, his family and employer LVMH say.
28/11/2021.author: Riordan Davis

28/11/2021.headline: The COVID-19 pandemic positives for Australians living with disabilities
28/11/2021.description: From the blind photographer observing details, to living solo for the first time, or discovering the power of roller skating — the pandemic for these Australians living with disabilities has been a chance to find joy, independence and new passions.
28/11/2021.author: Riordan Davis

28/11/2021.headline: How Nas Campanella's TV debut helped her think about motherhood
28/11/2021.description: Years ago Nas Campanella played a pregnant woman on prime time TV. The experience made her feel conflicted — but it also helped her think about motherhood.
28/11/2021.author: Nas Campanella

28/11/2021.headline: There's backlash to China's LGBTQI+ movement — but it's not led by religious groups
28/11/2021.description: Queer communities in China are increasingly seen as a political threat to state stability, writes Jinghua Qian.
28/11/2021.author: Nas Campanella

28/11/2021.headline: Around this vacant paddock in Melbourne's west, a campaign is gathering steam
28/11/2021.description: For years, the idea of a mini-CBD at Werribee East has been floated, adopted, and abandoned by government. Now, the community is making a renewed push to put planning for Melbourne's west on the state election agenda.
28/11/2021.author: Margaret Paul

28/11/2021.headline: 'A female coach really understands the female game': A-League Women welcomes record number of female coaches
28/11/2021.description: There was only one female head coach in Australia's top women's football competition last year, but the upcoming season beginning on December 3 will see that rise to four.
28/11/2021.author: Chloe Hart

28/11/2021.headline: Susan Neill-Fraser will find out tomorrow if she can walk free from prison — here's what her appeal is about
28/11/2021.description: Neill-Fraser has been fighting to clear her name ever since she was charged with murdering her partner, Bob Chappell, in 2009. A decision in her latest appeal will be handed down almost nine months after her lawyers argued there has been a miscarriage of justice.
28/11/2021.author: Loretta Lohberger

28/11/2021.headline: What happens when your builder goes bust? For some, their life savings disappear
28/11/2021.description: Kate and Rod Iskander can only look on in despair at what should be their new home — a building site littered with bricks and hardening bags of cement. Their builder went bust two months ago and they've already sunk their life savings.
28/11/2021.author: Fiona Blackwood

28/11/2021.headline: The COVID-19 tests expected to form a 'line of defence' when WA opens its doors to the world
28/11/2021.description: When Western Australia finally opens its doors to the rest of the world – potentially letting in the Omicron variant of COVID-19 – rapid antigen self-tests could form an important line of defence to prevent  outbreaks in high-risk settings.
28/11/2021.author: Kate Christian

28/11/2021.headline: How the 'threat of disclosure' could bring Ghislaine Maxwell's sex trafficking trial to a swift end
28/11/2021.description: Sixteen months after FBI agents swooped in on her remote hideaway to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell on sex abuse charges, the trial of the British socialite is beginning in New York. Here's what you need to know.
28/11/2021.author: Barbara Miller and Peter Jones

28/11/2021.headline: Your super could be taxed up to 32 per cent when you die — here's how to avoid it
28/11/2021.description: It's not called a 'death tax', but millions of Australians' retirement savings may be taxable upon death, writes Nassim Khad
28/11/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

28/11/2021.headline: Father manufactures medicine for sick son in China after COVID-19 limits treatment
28/11/2021.description: A desperate father is manufacturing medicine for his sick son after he was unable to get treatment in his country due to COVID-19.
28/11/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

28/11/2021.headline: Ashlie used to help feed the homeless, now at 64 she's homeless herself
28/11/2021.description: After falling into an unexpected cycle of disadvantage, Ashlie Stevenson is one of hundreds of thousands of Australians languishing on waiting lists for public housing.
28/11/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

28/11/2021.headline: Housing affordability is a national crisis, but for one group of young people it can be life changing
28/11/2021.description: The housing affordability crisis is being felt acutely by young people with a disability, partly because the hidden costs of having a disability can make it much more difficult to save a deposit and pay off a mortgage.
28/11/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

28/11/2021.headline: Netherlands confirms 13 Omicron cases as new COVID variant continues to spread
28/11/2021.description: Dutch authorities say investigations will continue after the new variant was detected in 13 out of 61 travellers who tested positive for COVID-19 on flights from South Africa.
28/11/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

29/11/2021.headline: The Loop: Quick Q&A on Omicron, proposed anti-troll laws and best-behaved schoolies 'ever'
29/11/2021.description: Get in The Loop with a quick wrap-up of the news you need to know about.
29/11/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

29/11/2021.headline: Home loan interest rates to keep favouring owner-occupiers over investors under new rules
29/11/2021.description: Home loan interest rates are likely to keep favouring owner-occupier borrowers over property investors under changes to bank capital rules, while business loan interest rates may also come down.
29/11/2021.author: Michael Janda

29/11/2021.headline: 'Don't let fear get in the way': No proof so far that Omicron is worse than other strains, expert says
29/11/2021.description: Worried about the new strain of COVID-19? Omicron has been grabbing plenty of headlines, but a leading infectious disease expert says there's no need to panic just yet.
29/11/2021.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

29/11/2021.headline: TikTok celebrity cosmetic surgeon banned from performing surgery
29/11/2021.description: A senior associate of the controversial clinic owner Dr Daniel Lanzer has been banned by the national health regulator from performing all types of cosmetic surgery and ordered to remove his social media posts.
29/11/2021.author: Antonia O'Flaherty

29/11/2021.headline: Australia's fashion industry mourns Louis Vuitton designer Virgil Abloh
29/11/2021.description: An Australian designer who has followed Virgil Abloh's career says he paved the way for others, in particular, people of colour.
29/11/2021.author: Mawunyo Gbogbo

29/11/2021.headline: Police search old mining site for bodies of allegedly murdered campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay
29/11/2021.description: The head of the Victoria Police Missing Persons Squad has arrived at a remote area of bushland to help search for the remains of the missing campers.
29/11/2021.author: Nicole Asher

29/11/2021.headline: 'He's the Michael Jordan': Aussie boxer inspired by Kambosos Jr's stunning world title victory
29/11/2021.description: George Kambosos Jr's stunning win over Teófimo López has young prospect Harry Garside hoping Australian boxing is about to enter a golden era.
29/11/2021.author: Nicole Asher

29/11/2021.headline: NSW confirms two more Omicron cases in travellers from southern Africa
29/11/2021.description: Genomic testing confirms another two cases of the Omicron COVID-19 variant from passengers who arrived in Sydney from southern Africa last night.
29/11/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen

29/11/2021.headline: After months of hints, Matthew McConaughey rules out bid to be next celebrity politician
29/11/2021.description: After publicly weighing up whether to run for office in America's second-largest state, Matthew McConaughey says he will instead focus on supporting businesses and foundations that create pathways for others to succeed.
29/11/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen

29/11/2021.headline: Greens call for ban on filling in wombats' burrows as Murraylands incident investigated
29/11/2021.description: Landowners who fill in burrows and "bury wombats alive" would face potential jail time under a proposal from the South Australian Greens.
29/11/2021.author: Isabel Dayman

29/11/2021.headline: What we know about Omicron's 'unusual constellation of mutations'
29/11/2021.description: Scientists around the world are racing to understand more about the latest COVID-19 variant, dubbed Omicron. While there's still a lot to learn, here's a little bit of what we do (and don't) know so far.
29/11/2021.author: Olivia Willis and Belinda Smith

29/11/2021.headline: NSW police officer allegedly lied to court to support then-girlfriend's false rape claim
29/11/2021.description: NSW police officer Scott John White is accused of lying to a court to support a fake rape claim by his then-girlfriend Sarah Jane Parkinson.
29/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

29/11/2021.headline: One new COVID-19 case in SA as doctors' union calls for pause on arrivals
29/11/2021.description: South Australia records one new COVID-19 case, in an interstate traveller, as the AMA state president calls for a stop to interstate and international arrivals while more information is gathered about the Omicron variant.
29/11/2021.author: Eugene Boisvert and Rory McClaren

29/11/2021.headline: Australian intervention in Solomon Islands 'not helpful', says province Premier
29/11/2021.description: Australia is holding up "corrupt leadership" in Solomon Islands says Daniel Suidani, Premier of Malaita, whose supporters are behind protests in Honiara.
29/11/2021.author: Evan Wasuka

29/11/2021.headline: Man who allegedly strangled former partner and took their child faces court
29/11/2021.description: Family members of a Logan mother left "fighting for her life" after her former partner allegedly strangled her and took off with their baby say she and the boy "didn't deserve" what happened.
29/11/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

29/11/2021.headline: Novak Djokovic's dad claims his son will likely skip Australian Open over vaccine mandate
29/11/2021.description: There is further doubt over whether the men's world number one will compete at Melbourne Park, with his dad likening Tennis Australia's stance on player vaccination to "blackmail".
29/11/2021.author: Talissa Siganto

29/11/2021.headline: Nation's largest live exporter has licence reinstated after three-year ban
29/11/2021.description: Live sheep exporter Emanuel Exports is given the green light to resume exporting animals from December 3, following a three-year ban.
29/11/2021.author: Jessica Hayes, Belinda Varischetti, and Kath Sullivan

29/11/2021.headline: Mother tells Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide her son was ridiculed and vilified
29/11/2021.description: Grieving mother Nikki Jamieson tells the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide her son endured endless torment and ridicule by his chain of command and felt no-one had his back.
29/11/2021.author: Sally Eeles

29/11/2021.headline: Has Omicron blocked Australians from revisiting their favourite travel spots despite open borders?
29/11/2021.description: It's been a long two years and many Australians are eager to return to their favourite holiday spots — but with a new variant of concern, is it possible to book a ticket today? Here's what you need to know.
29/11/2021.author: Sally Eeles

29/11/2021.headline: 'He has been significantly punished': Prison escape lands man in solitary confinement for a year, court hears
29/11/2021.description: The lawyer for a man who abseiled out of an Adelaide prison a year ago has told the District Court his client has been in solitary confinement since his escape and is a "good person" when not on methamphetamine.
29/11/2021.author: Claire Campbell

29/11/2021.headline: Children put at risk as Sydney gym sprayed with bullets in 'disgusting' attack
29/11/2021.description: Police investigate whether a shooting that took place at a Sydney gym this morning and left one man injured was linked to the feuding Allameddine and Hamzy families.
29/11/2021.author: Mark Reddie

29/11/2021.headline: 'Best' schoolies on record celebrated, despite resurgence of the mullet
29/11/2021.description: As schoolies comes to a close and Surfers Paradise returns to its former self, politicians, authorities and volunteers have praised partygoers as the best-behaved in the history of the tradition.
29/11/2021.author: Kimberley Bernard

29/11/2021.headline: Former private schoolboy 'can't apologise enough' after stabbing man in eye during brutal attack
29/11/2021.description: Brett Halcro, who was stabbed in the eye during an unprovoked assault in Sydney last year, sobs in court as he confronts one of his teenage attackers.
29/11/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

29/11/2021.headline: Will new government laws spell the end of online trolling? Probably not, but it could make it much harder
29/11/2021.description: Social media companies will shoulder more burden to deal with online harassment under laws proposed by the government. So what do we know, and what remains unanswered?
29/11/2021.author: Tom Lowrey

29/11/2021.headline: WA Police officers who refuse vaccine will be stood down on full pay, union says
29/11/2021.description: About 20 WA Police officers who are refusing to get vaccinated will continue to get paid in full while the police executive decides what to do, their union says.
29/11/2021.author: Blake Kagi

29/11/2021.headline: US, allies reap benefits as fallout from Australia's trade row with China hits $17b
29/11/2021.description: Australia's closest security allies, led by the United States, have been the biggest beneficiaries of Beijing's campaign of economic coercion against Canberra, according to a new report.
29/11/2021.author: Daniel Mercer and Tom Edwards

29/11/2021.headline: Storms, floods and a heatwave: The weather in store for Queensland this week
29/11/2021.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says 100-year-old November rainfall records might be about to tumble in some parts of Queensland and flooding remains a concern, as heatwave conditions descend on the outback.
29/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Cramsie

29/11/2021.headline: Three-year waitlists as rural Australia's 'horror' childcare situation worsens
29/11/2021.description: Some regional childcare providers have more than 300 children on their waitlists, as parents despair and the industry buckles under critical staff shortages.
29/11/2021.author: Julia André and Larissa Waterson

29/11/2021.headline: Rainfall goes against the grain — but record crop still looms
29/11/2021.description: Australia's largest-ever grain crop is now being harvested but recent rains mean some growers will miss out on high prices.
29/11/2021.author: Kath Sullivan and Joanna Prendergast

29/11/2021.headline: International students and visa holders urged to 'hang in there' for another two weeks as Omicron keeps borders closed
29/11/2021.description: International students barred from entering Australia for at least another two weeks are being urged to "hang in there" after the federal government postponed its reopening plan in response to the new Omicron strain of COVID-19.
29/11/2021.author: Nour Haydar

29/11/2021.headline: Margaret fled her home 20 years ago. Violence in Solomon Islands has brought back painful memories
29/11/2021.description: Margaret Teobasi Tadokata says the deadly riots and unrest in the Solomon Islands capital Honiara echo the ethnic tensions that forced her and her young family to flee the country more than two decades ago.
29/11/2021.author: Dubravka Voloder

29/11/2021.headline: Have you asked for an Airbnb refund during COVID? Ross was refused one – and then told to break lockdown
29/11/2021.description: A lack of regulation has created "buyer beware" situation where some people are being denied refunds for short-term rental bookings that they can't use during COVID. And this is lining the pockets of the head companies.
29/11/2021.author: Emilia Terzon

29/11/2021.headline: Cannes winner Titane is a surreal horror about a serial killer with a sexual fetish for cars
29/11/2021.description: For all its body-horror and swoon-inducing gore, Titane is a multifaceted exploration of identity and belonging.
29/11/2021.author: Jason Di Rosso

29/11/2021.headline: It's home to 37 government departments, but this tiny island's residents are still sick and homeless
29/11/2021.description: Thursday Island is the administration centre of the Torres Strait, but underneath all that administration and bureaucracy residents say their lives are a daily struggle.
29/11/2021.author: Jemima Burt

29/11/2021.headline: What's it like to renovate in Antarctica? These expeditioners are about to find out
29/11/2021.description: Below-freezing temperatures, gale force winds and penguins — it's what awaits expeditioners travelling to preserve the remains of Mawson's Huts in Antarctica.
29/11/2021.author: Rebecca Hewett

29/11/2021.headline: A contraceptive patch and an annual vaginal ring: The contraception Aussie women are missing out on
29/11/2021.description: Contraception is a game changer for women around the world, but for many the risks and side effects that come with it can take a real toll on their quality of life. So in 2021, what else is on offer and when are men going to a bigger part of the conversation?
29/11/2021.author: Georgia Hitch, Emma Machan, and Andrew Kesper

29/11/2021.headline: Australian deployment to Solomon Islands caught in political cross-fire engulfing Honiara
29/11/2021.description: Solomon Islands Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare defends calling in Australian police and army troops for help, saying without them his government would be left "to the mercy of criminals and hooligans."
29/11/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

29/11/2021.headline: Nearby Mount Delusion, this forest was supposed to be thriving. Instead it was a weed-infested 'moonscape'
29/11/2021.description: The ABC reveals alarming evidence that forests aren’t always being grown back after they've been logged, undermining a state-run timber company's claim to sustainability.
29/11/2021.author: Michael Slezak, Mark Doman, Stephen Hutcheon, and Alex Palmer

29/11/2021.headline: What evidence there is that identity verification stops online bullying?
29/11/2021.description: The government wants to strip social media users of their anonymity, so what evidence is there this will make the internet a better place?
29/11/2021.author: James Purtill

29/11/2021.headline: A panel of leading Australian pandemic experts convened yesterday to discuss Omicron — here's what they said
29/11/2021.description: A network of independent Australian experts established in the wake of the pandemic recommend bringing COVID-19 vaccine boosters four months forward in response to the Omicron variant.
29/11/2021.author: Nakari Thorpe and Kevin Nguyen

29/11/2021.headline: Artificial intelligence is making decisions that affect us and some of those choices aren't that smart
29/11/2021.description: Artificial intelligence is making decisions about people's insurance claims, credit scores and more. ABC Top 5 academic Jathan Sadowski explains why that matters.
29/11/2021.author: Nakari Thorpe and Kevin Nguyen

29/11/2021.headline: The Earth has more water than makes sense. The missing source may be the Sun
29/11/2021.description: The origin of Earth's water is a mystery, but one source could be the Sun, a new study that analyses the chemistry of an asteroid suggests.
29/11/2021.author: Genelle Weule

29/11/2021.headline: The two scenarios that can bring on new variants like Omicron
29/11/2021.description: Every time someone gets infected with SARS-CoV-2, there is a chance the virus could generate a more fit variant, which could then spread to others. This is the basics of how the Omicron variant emerged. So does vaccination disrupt the process?
29/11/2021.author: Genelle Weule

29/11/2021.headline: 'I decided God can't have it both ways': Fiona remembers the first time she was told she was special
29/11/2021.description: Disability advocates are warning the federal government's religious discrimination bill doesn't go far enough to protect the rights of vulnerable communities.
29/11/2021.author: Emma Myers

29/11/2021.headline: Australia's word of the the year is phonetically satisfying  — and very frustrating
29/11/2021.description: Linguistics gets political as two dictionaries, and the voting public, choose "strollout" as their word of the year for 2021, writes Tiger Webb.
29/11/2021.author: Tiger Webb

29/11/2021.headline: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey's resignation sparks surge in company's share price
29/11/2021.description: Shares in Twitter surge more than 10 per cent at opening bell as news of Mr Dorsey's resignation breaks.
29/11/2021.author: Tiger Webb

29/11/2021.headline: Sweden gets its first female Prime Minister... for the second time
29/11/2021.description: Sweden's first female Prime Minister has come out on top again, having resigned mere hours after first being elected last week.
29/11/2021.author: Tiger Webb

29/11/2021.headline: WHO warns Omicron COVID variant poses 'very high risk' of infection surge around world
29/11/2021.description: The World Health Organization is urging nations to accelerate vaccination of high-priority groups to prepare for the latest identified variant of SARS-CoV-2.
29/11/2021.author: Tiger Webb

29/11/2021.headline: Trailblazing and internationally acclaimed, David Dalaithngu walked tall in two cultures
29/11/2021.description: His career spanned nearly 50 years and took Indigenous Australia to the world, but now Northern Territory actor David Dalaithngu AM has died.
29/11/2021.author: Matt Garrick

30/11/2021.headline: Live: Australia takes on USA in second friendly in Newcastle
30/11/2021.description: Fresh off a 3-0 victory over the Matildas on Saturday, the USA will be hoping to make it two from two when they take on the hosts in tonight's final friendly. Follow our live blog.
30/11/2021.author: Samantha Lewis

30/11/2021.headline: 'Time to change our parliament forever': Former PM Gillard urges politician code of conduct following Jenkins review
30/11/2021.description: Australia's first female prime minister Julia Gillard has thrown her support behind the sex discrimination commissioner's recommendation for a code of conduct for politicians, as she responds to the review triggered by Brittany Higgins's revelations on the culture of parliament.
30/11/2021.author: Stephanie Dalzell

30/11/2021.headline: The Loop: Human remains found in Victorian bushland, Omicron causes border uncertainty, 'Luna love' changes classroom energy
30/11/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
30/11/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

30/11/2021.headline: Donut day in SA one week on from opening the borders
30/11/2021.description: There have been no new cases of COVID-19 reported in SA today. SA Health has opened a drive-through vaccination clinic in Adelaide's north.
30/11/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

30/11/2021.headline: NRL refuses to register Anthony Milford's Rabbitohs contact
30/11/2021.description: The NRL says it will not consider registering Milford's contract with South Sydney until the completion of criminal proceedings against the 27-year-old.
30/11/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

30/11/2021.headline: The Elf on the Shelf is about to arrive in homes across Australia. But what is it?
30/11/2021.description: Have you heard of the Elf on the Shelf Christmas tradition? This modern trend, adored by families worldwide, keeps children on their best behaviour before Santa arrives.
30/11/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

30/11/2021.headline: Why everything is different for Shaun Johnson's Warriors comeback
30/11/2021.description: After three seasons with Cronulla, New Zealand international Shaun Johnson returns to the Warriors as a different player and a different man.
30/11/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

30/11/2021.headline: 'They hate motorists': Brisbane Lord Mayor labels lower speed limit plea a 'socialist' Greens push
30/11/2021.description: A Greens request for 30 kilometres an hour speed limits would "punish" drivers and force "them out of their cars", Brisbane Lord Mayor Adrian Schrinner says.
30/11/2021.author: Lucy Stone

30/11/2021.headline: Jordan De Goey returns to Australia with AFL career in the balance
30/11/2021.description: The stood-down Collingwood player has been charged with assault and will virtually face a New York court on December 8.
30/11/2021.author: Lucy Stone

30/11/2021.headline: 'Extremely irresponsible': International students lash out after long-awaited travel plans cancelled again
30/11/2021.description: The snap decision to delay the easing of border restrictions leaves many international students again uncertain and confused, with experts saying it could further damage Australia's reputation as an education destination.
30/11/2021.author: Bang Xiao, Natasya Salim, Farid Ibrahim, Erwin Renaldi, and Marian Faa

30/11/2021.headline: Prominent Australians call for WA government to pull 'unacceptable' Aboriginal heritage bill
30/11/2021.description: The proposed laws were drafted in the wake of the Juukan Gorge disaster, but some Aboriginal leaders say there had not been enough consultation.
30/11/2021.author: Rhiannon Shine

30/11/2021.headline: Defence allowed to vet evidence presented to inquiry into bushfire accidentally sparked by its own helicopter
30/11/2021.description: An ACT coroner has allowed a suppression order on the brief of evidence presented to a bushfire inquiry, so the Department of Defence can determine if there are any security issues.
30/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

30/11/2021.headline: Growing doubt over Ashes finale in Perth as WA Premier sticks to 'strict' COVID rules
30/11/2021.description: WA Premier Mark McGowan casts renewed uncertainty on whether Perth will host a match of the upcoming Ashes series, in light of COVID-19 restrictions.
30/11/2021.author: James Carmody

30/11/2021.headline: Woods says a return to the top not a 'realistic expectation'
30/11/2021.description: Tigers Woods says it's unrealistic for him to make a return to the PGA Tour's full-time schedule but that he's likely to pick certain tournaments to play at.
30/11/2021.author: James Carmody

30/11/2021.headline: NSW records wettest November in 100 years — and it couldn't have come at a worse time for some
30/11/2021.description: Historic downpours this month caused mayhem in parts of the state, including for farmers who watched with dismay as rain they sorely needed two years ago came right at the wrong time.
30/11/2021.author: Amelia Bernasconi

30/11/2021.headline: Susie lives with an inoperable brain tumour. Small town community support has helped her along the way
30/11/2021.description: Life in regional Australia can be harsh and demanding for people living with a disability but our regions also offer a sense of community which can give hope in challenging times, writes Susie Alderman.
30/11/2021.author: Amelia Bernasconi

30/11/2021.headline: Coroner hears Theo Hayez wasn't a drinker, drug user or risk-taker — so why would he walk a 'scary' bush track alone at night?
30/11/2021.description: Theo Hayez's cousin says she has retraced his steps on the track he followed just before he disappeared and she believes he would not have made that trek by himself.
30/11/2021.author: Leah White

30/11/2021.headline: Japanese Crown Prince gives rare candid remarks, criticises media's coverage of daughter's wedding
30/11/2021.description: Crown Prince Akishino says people are "deeply hurt" by the slander from intense media coverage, fabricated stories and comments on the internet, after his daughter Mako developed post-traumatic stress disorder during her three-year engagement.
30/11/2021.author: Leah White

30/11/2021.headline: Human remains found in search for missing Victorian campers
30/11/2021.description: Police searching for the bodies of missing Victorian campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay find human remains in bushland in the state's remote High Country.
30/11/2021.author: Leah White

30/11/2021.headline: Patient 'left in agony' welcomes cosmetic surgery review
30/11/2021.description: The medical regulator announces a major review of patient safety in the cosmetic surgery sector, after Four Corners revealed details of serious hygiene and safety breaches in clinics operated by Dr Daniel Lanzer.
30/11/2021.author: Leah White

30/11/2021.headline: 'I could see he was purple and wasn't breathing'
30/11/2021.description: Rural women are almost twice as likely to give birth prematurely as women who live in major cities — as one Lightning Ridge mother found during her own "very scary situation".
30/11/2021.author: Olivia Ralph

30/11/2021.headline: What does it take for a COVID-19 strain to become a 'variant of concern'?
30/11/2021.description: There are actually thousands of coronavirus strains out there, but there are a few boxes that need to be ticked before they're escalated to the level Omicron's at.
30/11/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire

30/11/2021.headline: Missing man's Indigenous family plead for cultural collaboration with police
30/11/2021.description: Jeremiah Rivers' desperate relatives are feeling out of the loop six weeks after the East Kimberley man went missing in suspicious circumstances in south west Queensland.
30/11/2021.author: Ted O'Connor and Danielle O'Neal

30/11/2021.headline: Racing minister defends greyhound industry amid RSPCA probe into dog euthanasing
30/11/2021.description: Tasmania's Minister for Racing defends greyhound racing participants as "animal lovers" while confirming the state's most decorated trainer is under investigation by the RSPCA.
30/11/2021.author: Emily Baker

30/11/2021.headline: Men charged after woman allegedly stabbed and forced into car north of Adelaide
30/11/2021.description: Two men are charged with the attempted murder of a woman who was allegedly stabbed and forced into a car in a shopping centre car park in Adelaide's north this morning.
30/11/2021.author: Emily Baker

30/11/2021.headline: Golden trifecta for Queensland graziers as rain takes records by storm
30/11/2021.description: High cattle prices, low interest rates and the wettest November in 61 years is offering up a rare opportunity for Queensland cattle operations.
30/11/2021.author: Maddelin McCosker and Ashleigh Bagshaw

30/11/2021.headline: Vaccination mandate won't prevent crisis in childcare with early educators 'leaving in droves', advocate warns
30/11/2021.description: Queensland childcare advocate Georgie Dent says she is concerned the sector will lose significant numbers of staff next year, despite the vaccination mandate for educators.
30/11/2021.author: Baz Ruddick

30/11/2021.headline: 'A legacy you'd rather not have': Long-COVID study finds most patients still suffering months later
30/11/2021.description: An Australian study investigating the long-term impacts of COVID-19 found three-quarters of the participants had lingering symptoms months after their recovery.
30/11/2021.author: Ainslie Drewitt-Smith

30/11/2021.headline: After years of concealing the abuse they suffered, thousands of child sexual assault survivors are yet to see a cent
30/11/2021.description: Survivors of child sexual abuse have criticised lengthy delays in the federal government's national redress scheme, with one expert saying some elderly survivors are dying before receiving any compensation.
30/11/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne and Jamie Travers

30/11/2021.headline: 'Are you OK?': Ruben lost his dad to suicide at age 14, now he helps others in need
30/11/2021.description: As a teenager, Ruben was heartbroken and struggled to understand why his father took his own life. Eleven years later, he now volunteers as a phone counsellor at Lifeline to help save the lives of others.
30/11/2021.author: Michael Luu

30/11/2021.headline: Salmon producers develop alliance to help tackle 'negative' press
30/11/2021.description: Tasmania's salmon industry has weathered years of criticism, most recently from Booker-prize winning author Richard Flanagan. Now it's enlisting business leaders to fight back.
30/11/2021.author: Rebecca Hewett

30/11/2021.headline: How science has turned HIV into a treatable, preventable condition
30/11/2021.description: In just half a lifetime, modern science has turned HIV, one of the most fearsome diseases in human history, into a treatable, preventable condition.
30/11/2021.author: Jeremy Fernandez

30/11/2021.headline: When masks came on, my main way to understand the world was shut off
30/11/2021.description: I never realised how much I relied upon lip-reading to simply participate in the world until masks made it impossible. Now, I no longer want to carry the burden of communication, writes Vikki McNaughton.
30/11/2021.author: Jeremy Fernandez

30/11/2021.headline: Canberra gynaecologist facing nine patient complaints promises to have surgeries supervised
30/11/2021.description: The Canberra gynaecologist at the centre of an ABC investigation has stopped working at one hospital, and has promised he will no longer perform laparoscopic surgery at another without a senior clinician present.
30/11/2021.author: Sarah Curnow and Anne Connolly

30/11/2021.headline: Woman with COVID-19 isolating in Hobart after arriving on Sydney flight
30/11/2021.description: People who were on a Jetstar flight from Sydney to Hobart on Monday are asked to isolate after a passenger tests positive for COVID-19.
30/11/2021.author: Sarah Curnow and Anne Connolly

30/11/2021.headline: Susan Neill-Fraser's second appeal against her murder conviction has been dismissed. What comes next?
30/11/2021.description: Susan Neill-Fraser's second appeal against her murder conviction has failed —  but it's the dissenting opinion of one justice that could provide a pathway for her case to reach the High Court, writes Loretta Lohberger.
30/11/2021.author: Loretta Lohberger

30/11/2021.headline: Laura was meant to meet her Australian granddaughter this week — but travel rules changed mid-flight
30/11/2021.description: A South African grandmother and other passengers were placed into hotel quarantine when they arrived in Australia, after the government introduced a travel ban against nine African countries while their plane was mid-flight.
30/11/2021.author: Erin Handley

30/11/2021.headline: With the Ashes a week away, here's how Australia spent the year not preparing for Test cricket
30/11/2021.description: Australia has only played four men's Tests in the best part of two years, while England has played 20. Heading into the Ashes, we look at how the Aussies have prepared for cricket's greatest contest.
30/11/2021.author: Jon Healy

30/11/2021.headline: This couple was slugged $78k over a fire in their rental. Their story led to a 'huge win for renters' across Australia
30/11/2021.description: Big insurers agree to change their policies of pursuing renters over unintentional and accidental property damage, after consumer advocate groups and the ABC help expose the issue.
30/11/2021.author: Amy Bainbridge and Lucy Kent

30/11/2021.headline: Nervous wait across Sydney and Central Coast after Omicron COVID exposures
30/11/2021.description: People who have been to almost a dozen exposure sites across Sydney and the NSW Central Coast face a nervous wait to see if they've contracted the Omicron strain of COVID-19.
30/11/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen

30/11/2021.headline: What today's GDP figures will — and won't — show about Australia's economic health
30/11/2021.description: Looking beyond the latest quarterly GDP figures, the truth is Australians are getting better off more slowly than before, writes Peter Martin.
30/11/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen

30/11/2021.headline: Zombie cicadas, honey fungus and psychedelics: Welcome to the wild world of fungi
30/11/2021.description: The biologist says there's a lack of research into fungi despite more than 90 per cent of plants dependant on the micro-organisms to help them to extract nutrients.
30/11/2021.author: Sophie Kesteven and Michael Mackenzie

30/11/2021.headline: Jenkins says Westminster traditions no bar to punishing elected MPs for harassment, bullying
30/11/2021.description: The author of a landmark review of the workplace culture in Parliament House says it is a "myth" that MPs and senators are shielded from sanctions just because they cannot be sacked.
30/11/2021.author: James Elton

30/11/2021.headline: There are five variants of concern. This is where Omicron differs
30/11/2021.description: There have been 11 COVID-19 strains named by the WHO, including the newly-identified Omicron. But what happened to the rest of them?
30/11/2021.author: Maani Truu

30/11/2021.headline: Why has it taken so long to crack down on cosmetic cowboys?
30/11/2021.description: In a major win for Australian patients, the medical regulator AHPRA this week announced its first ever review into patient safety in the cosmetic surgery sector. But the problems with the multi-billion-dollar industry have been well known by authorities for decades, writes Lauren Day.
30/11/2021.author: Lauren Day

30/11/2021.headline: Women have been visiting this sacred place for thousands of years. But red tape has made access 'painstaking and humiliating'
30/11/2021.description: Traditional owner groups across Australia say many sacred Aboriginal sites are still at risk of destruction, despite sweeping recommendations made after the inquiry into the Juukan Gorge disaster.
30/11/2021.author: Shahni Wellington and Kirstie Wellauer

30/11/2021.headline: Former Lesotho prime minister charged with the 2017 murder of his estranged wife
30/11/2021.description: The former Lesotho prime minister and his current wife got married days after the killing of his estranged wife. The two were in the middle of an acrimonious divorce.
30/11/2021.author: Shahni Wellington and Kirstie Wellauer

30/11/2021.headline: 'Preventing the suffering of children': MPs in debate over mitochondrial donation
30/11/2021.description: Federal MPs make heartfelt speeches to Parliament on the ethical quandaries raised by a proposed law that could reduce the risk of children developing a debilitating, and sometimes fatal, genetic disease.
30/11/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

30/11/2021.headline: Taliban promised amnesty, but former Afghan government officers are still being murdered: HRW Report
30/11/2021.description: The Taliban promised amnesty to those who'd served in the previous Afghan government when it swept to power. Human Rights Watch says that amnesty is being violated.
30/11/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

30/11/2021.headline: Dutch health authority says Omicron COVID variant was there nearly two weeks ago
30/11/2021.description: Dutch health officials say the COVID-19 Omicron variant was detected in the Netherlands days before two South African flights touched down in Amsterdam with at least 14 infected passengers.
30/11/2021.author: Melissa Clarke

01/12/2021.headline: A slanging match and mysterious flyers — tensions flare ahead of council election
01/12/2021.description: Police are called to a polling booth in Sydney's north after tensions between two councillors reach fever pitch ahead of local government elections.
01/12/2021.author: Kathleen Calderwood and Echo Hui

01/12/2021.headline: Wettest November in 100 years for many places in Queensland, and La Niña will ensure the rain continues over summer
01/12/2021.description: Monthly rainfall records tumbl across Queensland with some places recording the wettest November they've seen in more than 100 years.
01/12/2021.author: George Roberts

01/12/2021.headline: NSW flood damage bill tipped to exceed $1b as farmers watch crops go under
01/12/2021.description: The flooding has inundated crops around the state and downgrades in quality are set to cost farmers dearly.
01/12/2021.author: David Claughton, Lara Webster, and Michael Condon

01/12/2021.headline: Flash flooding warnings issued as storms lash Melbourne, state's north
01/12/2021.description: Residents in some parts of Melbourne are being warned not to enter flood waters as slow-moving storms pelt the city with heavy rain and hailstones and lead to road closures.
01/12/2021.author: David Claughton, Lara Webster, and Michael Condon

01/12/2021.headline: New $185m package to lure tourists, students, workers back to WA when the borders open
01/12/2021.description: The WA government is throwing $185 million at measures aimed at boosting businesses and attracting tourists, students and workers back to the state when it eventually opens up.
01/12/2021.author: Nicolas Perpitch

01/12/2021.headline: Katy Perry's 'emotional response' to Australian designer aired in court battle
01/12/2021.description: Singer Katy Perry's manager says she was upset when she made disparaging remarks about an Australian clothes designer in emails revealed in court.
01/12/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

01/12/2021.headline: Sixth case of Omicron variant of COVID-19 confirmed in NSW
01/12/2021.description: NSW Health confirms a sixth returned traveller in the state has tested positive for the Omicron COVID-19 variant of concern and that he visited a Sydney chemist while infectious.
01/12/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

01/12/2021.headline: 'World-class' Carey backed to handle Ashes pressure
01/12/2021.description: Australian all-rounder Cameron Green says wicketkeeper Alex Carey will be suited to Test cricket should he be named as Tim Paine's replacement.
01/12/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

01/12/2021.headline: Tel Aviv named the world's most expensive city
01/12/2021.description: Rising prices for groceries, transport and alcohol push Tel Aviv to the top of the list in the latest global latest Cost of Living survey.
01/12/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

01/12/2021.headline: Mexican drug lord El Chapo's wife sentenced to three years in prison
01/12/2021.description: A US judge sentences 32-year-old Emma Coronel Aispuro, the wife of Mexican drug kingpin Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman, to three years in prison, after she pleaded guilty to helping the Sinaloa drug cartel.
01/12/2021.author: Jamie McKinnell

01/12/2021.headline: 'I feel confident now': program teaches children vital water safety skills
01/12/2021.description: Surf Life Saving SA says too many people from migrant families are drowning, and has launched a new campaign to make a difference.
01/12/2021.author: Matthew Smith

01/12/2021.headline: Christian Porter and Greg Hunt to quit politics, will not contest next election
01/12/2021.description: Two of the nation's most high-profile federal politicians will call it quits at the next election, with Health Minister Greg Hunt set to join former attorney-general Christian Porter in announcing his retirement.
01/12/2021.author: Andrew Probyn and Jake Evans

01/12/2021.headline: 'I've been told my kid will be put in a grave': Emotional NT Chief Minister reveals anti-vaxxer death threats
01/12/2021.description: During a COVID-19 press conference in Darwin, Chief Minister Michael Gunner is visibly shaken while revealing his son has been the subject of a specific death threat. The NT Police Commissioner says the threats are under investigation.
01/12/2021.author: Jano Gibson

01/12/2021.headline: Honduras set for diplomatic switch from Taiwan to China as Xiomara Castro shapes to become first woman president
01/12/2021.description: Xiomara Castro's plans for government include a possible switch of diplomatic ties from Taiwan to Beijing, and negotiating a new debt deal with the International Monetary Fund.
01/12/2021.author: Jano Gibson

01/12/2021.headline: 'My daughter is worth more than a $2 brass pin': Family offended by Defence response to seaman's suicide
01/12/2021.description: Defence finds documents relating to the bullying of a suicidal young seaman only after the royal commission into veteran suicide began, the seaman's sister reveals.
01/12/2021.author: Rory Callinan

01/12/2021.headline: SA records first cases of local transmission since state borders reopened
01/12/2021.description: South Australia has recorded three new cases of COVID-19, including the first instances of local transmission since borders reopened last week.
01/12/2021.author: Rory Callinan

01/12/2021.headline: Almost 50 police employees barred from work as WA COVID-19 vaccination mandate enforced
01/12/2021.description: WA police officers are among tens of thousands of Western Australians who are required to have had one dose of a vaccine by today.
01/12/2021.author: Lucy Martin

01/12/2021.headline: What are the key takeaways from the review into parliament's work culture?
01/12/2021.description: Yesterday's report into the culture of work in federal parliament, sparked by Brittany Higgins's allegations, painted a pretty sobering picture. These are the key recommendations for how to make Parliament House a better place to work.
01/12/2021.author: Georgia Hitch

01/12/2021.headline: NT parliament passes changes to abortion laws making it easier to terminate later-term pregnancies
01/12/2021.description: The Northern Territory parliament has passed changes to its abortion laws, making the process easier for women seeking to have a second trimester termination.
01/12/2021.author: Saskia Mabin

01/12/2021.headline: Alex, 84, is being evicted from his home after the collapse of a housing scheme
01/12/2021.description: As a Senate inquiry looks into the collapse of the Sterling Group housing scheme, some of the elderly victims are now finding themselves homeless.
01/12/2021.author: Michael Atkin

01/12/2021.headline: Victorian government dismisses 'blackmail' claims from Djokovic's dad over Aus Open vaccine mandate
01/12/2021.description: Victorian Sports Minister Martin Pakula rejects claims by Novak Djokovic's dad that Australian Open organisers are forcing players to get vaccinated against COVID-19.
01/12/2021.author: Michael Atkin

01/12/2021.headline: 'It's beyond wicked': Farmer blasts energy authority, Powercor after St Patrick's Day bushfire backdown
01/12/2021.description: Jill Porter lost half her dairy herd when bushfires tore through south-west Victoria. Now, she wants someone to be held to account so other families are spared such trauma.
01/12/2021.author: Daniel Miles and Jeremy Lee

01/12/2021.headline: Space junk has forced NASA to temporarily postpone a spacewalk. So where did it come from?
01/12/2021.description: NASA is forced to temporarily postpone a spacewalk because of space junk that could puncture an astronaut's suit or damage the International Space Station.
01/12/2021.author: Daniel Miles and Jeremy Lee

01/12/2021.headline: Backpacker tells inquest Theo Hayez didn't appear drunk on the night he disappeared in Byron Bay
01/12/2021.description: Inquest hears the missing backpacker was sober enough to talk about European politics before Google searching a small village seldom known to tourists.
01/12/2021.author: Leah White

01/12/2021.headline: 'We don't want them walking the streets': Morcombe family welcomes tougher child killer parole laws
01/12/2021.description: Queensland Parliament last night passed legislation that could see the "worst of the worst" kept behind bars for decades after their parole date.
01/12/2021.author: Amy Sheehan

01/12/2021.headline: Lady Jane in Spain: The Australian mango enjoying sweet success internationally
01/12/2021.description: It was developed near Katherine in the NT, but there are now commercial plantings of this mango in Spain and trials underway in more than 10 countries.
01/12/2021.author: Matt Brann

01/12/2021.headline: Scientists identify armoured dinosaur with tail like Aztec weapon
01/12/2021.description: The Stegouros elengassen is a four-legged creature which lived in what is now South America's southernmost tip during the Cretaceous Period.
01/12/2021.author: Matt Brann

01/12/2021.headline: We can't stop workplace sexual harassment without banning non-disclosure agreements
01/12/2021.description: NDAs are increasingly used against employees who make complaints about discrimination and harassment. But the practice has a chilling effect on people's willingness to speak out, and must be eradicated, write Maria O'Sullivan and Judith Bessant.
01/12/2021.author: Matt Brann

01/12/2021.headline: Drought, a mouse plague and now La Niña — but is that good or bad news for farmers?
01/12/2021.description: Even though Australia has just had its wettest November in more than two decades, some farmers are still waiting.
01/12/2021.author: Matt Brann

01/12/2021.headline: Claire quit her job and sold her possessions — then Omicron changed everything
01/12/2021.description: Claire Ebersohn was only two days away from starting her new life in Australia but global panic over the Omicron strain of COVID-19 has locked her out of the country.
01/12/2021.author: Kevin Nguyen

01/12/2021.headline: Jennifer visited a museum and saw her own heart on display
01/12/2021.description: The history of medical transplants stretches back millennia and includes some bizarre and gruesome milestones.
01/12/2021.author: Nick Baker

01/12/2021.headline: Was it a bear, or an early human? Mystery of 3.7-million-year-old footprints solved
01/12/2021.description: Around 3.7 million years ago, a metre-high early human gingerly walked across the slippery ground in what is now Tanzania. But what species were they?
01/12/2021.author: Belinda Smith

01/12/2021.headline: Twitter's new Indian-American CEO highlights corporate Australia's lack of cultural diversity
01/12/2021.description: American technology giants including Twitter, Google, Microsoft and IBM are among American companies promoting people of Indian origin to CEO. But in Australia, it is rare for top publicly listed company chiefs to come from culturally diverse backgrounds, Nassim Khadem writes.
01/12/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

01/12/2021.headline: Wealthy nations starved the developing world of vaccines. Omicron shows the cost of this greed
01/12/2021.description: The new variant is a warning: unless we take urgent action to correct global vaccine inequities, we risk the emergence of further variants, some of which may evade vaccines.
01/12/2021.author: Nassim Khadem

01/12/2021.headline: 'Significant momentum': How some super funds become more profitable by investing sustainably
01/12/2021.description: A new study shows Australian superannuation funds that invest responsibly are becoming increasingly profitable than traditional funds. But some analyst says they need to be more transparent.
01/12/2021.author: Samuel Yang

01/12/2021.headline: World War II bomb explodes near Munich's main train station, injuring four
01/12/2021.description: A World War II bomb explodes on a construction site near a busy train station in central Munich, injuring four people.
01/12/2021.author: Samuel Yang

01/12/2021.headline: Historic laws to ban hackers, human rights abusers and possibly Putin's cronies from Australia
01/12/2021.description: The legislation, partly based on the United States Magnitsky Act, allows the federal government to sanction people who engage in "egregious conduct" and could see cyber hackers, rights abusers and corrupt officials banned from Australia.
01/12/2021.author: James Glenday

01/12/2021.headline: SA parliament goes into COVID-19 shutdown to allow contact tracing after former premier tests positive
01/12/2021.description: South Australia's parliament will be adjourned on Thursday morning, and all MPs and staff directed to avoid in-person meetings, after former premier Jay Weatherill tested positive for COVID-19.
01/12/2021.author: Nick Harmsen

01/12/2021.headline: Former SA premier Jay Weatherill tests positive for COVID-19
01/12/2021.description: Former South Australian premier Jay Weatherill has tested positive for COVID-19 after attending an event on Saturday where other cases were present.
01/12/2021.author: Stacey Lee and Daniel Keane

01/12/2021.headline: Operation Ironside nets 18 more suspects as police seize guns and drugs
01/12/2021.description: The latest arrests come amid a wave of SA Police raids across Adelaide, with guns seized and six properties searched in relation to what police described as drug trafficking and money laundering activities.
01/12/2021.author: Stacey Lee and Daniel Keane

01/12/2021.headline: Two young men sentenced to four years in jail over fatal hit-and-run in Alice Springs
01/12/2021.description: A judge says a man aged 20 and a boy aged 16 had shown a "selfish disregard" for the safety of other road users in their actions after a hit-and-run last year that left a 47-year-old man dead.
01/12/2021.author: Mitchell Abram

01/12/2021.headline: Young woman was stabbed by own family because she was dating man of another faith, court told
01/12/2021.description: A 21-year-old woman stabbed in an Adelaide suburban shopping centre car park on Tuesday morning was attacked and ambushed by members of her own family because she was dating someone outside her faith, a court hears.
01/12/2021.author: Gabriella Marchant

01/12/2021.headline: The Loop: Hunt and Porter quit politics, man dies in Qld floods, world's most expensive city named
01/12/2021.description: Get yourself in The Loop with a speedy wrap of today's news.
01/12/2021.author: Kelsie Iorio

01/12/2021.headline: COVID case visited major Gold Coast shopping centre on Black Friday
01/12/2021.description: The city is on high alert as Queensland Health confirms a new positive COVID case went to Robina Town Centre last week.
01/12/2021.author: Alexandria Utting

01/12/2021.headline: Queensland's drenching to continue over summer, following record-breaking November
01/12/2021.description: Monthly rainfall records tumble across Queensland with some places recording the wettest November they've seen in more than 100 years.
01/12/2021.author: George Roberts

02/12/2021.headline: Woman dies in hospital days after going missing on Tiwi Islands
02/12/2021.description: A 35-year-old woman dies in Royal Darwin Hospital, days after she went missing on the Tiwi Islands and was found stranded in mangroves.
02/12/2021.author: Samantha Dick

02/12/2021.headline: The father of missing Belgian backpacker Theo Hayez storms out of coronial inquest
02/12/2021.description: The father of missing Belgian backpacker Theo Hayez has stormed out of a coronial inquest in Byron Bay, as security guards give evidence about evicting his son.
02/12/2021.author: Leah White

02/12/2021.headline: US white supremacists targeting under-vaxxed Aboriginal communities, WA Premier says
02/12/2021.description: Mark McGowan says American hate groups are specifically targeting remote Aboriginal communities by spreading misinformation about COVID-19 vaccinations.
02/12/2021.author: Jarrod Lucas

02/12/2021.headline: NSW Police officer found guilty of perjury for lying about girlfriend's fake rape claim
02/12/2021.description: A NSW police officer who helped his girlfriend fabricate a rape claim is found guilty of perjury.
02/12/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

02/12/2021.headline: Minister calls for Shandee Blackburn murder inquiry to reopen
02/12/2021.description: "It can't be left the way it is": The mother of murdered woman Shandee Blackburn welcomed the Minister's comments, a week after forensic results came under the spotlight.
02/12/2021.author: Tobi Loftus

02/12/2021.headline: 'So missed by all of us': Family of man believed to have been killed by Adelaide drug dealers speak
02/12/2021.description: The family of a man believed to have been killed by Adelaide drug dealers speak of the grief and pain they have experienced since he was last seen on December 19 last year.
02/12/2021.author: Rebecca Puddy

02/12/2021.headline: 'You can't hate yourself into being better': The misconception around feeling guilt versus shame
02/12/2021.description: Research professor Brené Brown has spent a large part of her career looking at shame, which she says has now become an epidemic in society. So how can we better deal with our feelings?
02/12/2021.author: Rebecca Puddy

02/12/2021.headline: NSW man's alleged $5,000 rampage in Tasmanian COVID quarantine hotel
02/12/2021.description: A New South Wales man who flew into Tasmania then allegedly refused to leave and caused $5,000 worth of damage to his hotel quarantine room is sent packing by police.
02/12/2021.author: Lucy MacDonald

02/12/2021.headline: After three court trials, a man has been jailed over a shooting in Canberra's south
02/12/2021.description: The juries in Christopher Cunningham's first two trials were dismissed, and the third trial had already been running for seven days when Cunningham agreed to plead guilty.
02/12/2021.author: Elizabeth Byrne

02/12/2021.headline: If you think this is rats jumping off a sinking political ship, think again
02/12/2021.description: The departure of some of the nation's most high-profile Liberal politicians on the eve of an election easily lends itself to the suggestion of rats fleeing a sinking ship. But as the last poll showed, it's not over until the votes are cast, writes political correspondent Brett Worthington.
02/12/2021.author: Brett Worthington

02/12/2021.headline: WA Premier Mark McGowan flags tighter South Australia border as government seeks 'urgent' health advice
02/12/2021.description: The West Australian border with South Australia looks to be toughened as early as this afternoon after 18 COVID-19 cases are detected in Adelaide in the space of 24 hours.
02/12/2021.author: James Carmody

02/12/2021.headline: Widow of man paralysed on 69th birthday says NDIS threshold has 'got to be fixed'
02/12/2021.description: Both major parties have been accused of "shameful" inaction over the NDIS age cut-off. Now, advocates are fighting to make it a federal election issue.
02/12/2021.author: Kelly Fuller and Sarah Harvey

02/12/2021.headline: PM accuses Labor of 'disgraceful slur' over Home Affairs contract awarded to two close friends
02/12/2021.description: Scott Morrison hits back at any suggestion he had a role in the Home Affairs Department awarding an almost $80,000 contract to a company run by two of his closest friends.
02/12/2021.author: Andrew Greene

02/12/2021.headline: Surgeon fined in Austria for amputating wrong leg, judge awards damages to widow of patient
02/12/2021.description: The surgeon marked the wrong leg of her 82-year-old patient, who died before the case came to court.
02/12/2021.author: Andrew Greene

02/12/2021.headline: Big bank mortgages below 2 per cent going, going, gone
02/12/2021.description: Mortgages from the big four banks with a '1' in front of the interest rate are now a thing of the past, while investors take over as the drivers of lending and property price growth.
02/12/2021.author: Michael Janda

02/12/2021.headline: 'We hear your voice, and we will listen': Task force recommends staged approach to criminalising coercive control in Queensland
02/12/2021.description: The approach would include public education, an implementation plan to prepare for criminalisation in 2024 and co-designing a strategy to address the over-representation of First Nations people in the criminal justice system before the legislation is introduced.
02/12/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

02/12/2021.headline: Man accused of helping to kidnap Stuart MacGill was a bikie on parole, court told
02/12/2021.description: A man accused of involvement in the alleged kidnapping of former cricketer Stuart MacGill was on parole at the time and is allegedly an affiliate of the Comanchero motorcycle gang, a Sydney court has heard.
02/12/2021.author: Emilie Gramenz

02/12/2021.headline: 'It's just wrecked everything': Inglewood begins massive flood clean-up
02/12/2021.description: Residents in the southern Queensland border town of Inglewood start the clean-up after floodwaters inundated homes and businesses.
02/12/2021.author: Georgie Hewson, Jon Daly, and Anthea Moodie

02/12/2021.headline: AFL legend Ron Barassi tests positive for COVID-19
02/12/2021.description: The 85-year-old will miss taking part in Melbourne's long-awaited AFL premiership celebrations at the MCG on Sunday.
02/12/2021.author: Georgie Hewson, Jon Daly, and Anthea Moodie

02/12/2021.headline: Greg Hunt confirms he's retiring from politics at the next election
02/12/2021.description: Federal Health and Aged Care Minister Greg Hunt announces he will retire at the next election and not recontest his seat in Victoria.
02/12/2021.author: Georgia Hitch

02/12/2021.headline: The $35 hardware in your home that could cost you $14,000
02/12/2021.description: There's a hidden flood risk in your home and it has absolutely nothing to do with the rain, or your drains. But it could cost you tens of thousands of dollars if you don't sort it out.
02/12/2021.author: Ellen-Maree Elliot

02/12/2021.headline: Victorian government's pandemic bill set to become law after passing upper house
02/12/2021.description: After weeks of negotiations and substantial amendments, the Victorian government's controversial pandemic legislation has cleared its last hurdle.
02/12/2021.author: Ellen-Maree Elliot

02/12/2021.headline: Scores of protesters demand a drink at 'freedom pub' after anti-vax licensee convicted
02/12/2021.description: Demonstrators waved placards decrying "tyranny" and called for "justice" outside Singleton Court. Inside, Bradley John Hill's matter was dealt with in five minutes.
02/12/2021.author: Jake Lapham

02/12/2021.headline: Mum threatened at knifepoint with children in car
02/12/2021.description: Police allege the woman parked her Range Rover station wagon at her Klemzig home around 3:20pm yesterday and was approached by a man armed with a knife.
02/12/2021.author: Jake Lapham

02/12/2021.headline: 'Explanation needed' after teenagers' escape from Howard Springs quarantine, NT opposition says
02/12/2021.description: After two escapes in a number of days, the NT opposition is renewing calls for the federal government to resume control of Darwin's main quarantine facility.
02/12/2021.author: Jake Lapham

02/12/2021.headline: Everything you need to know about the Bathurst 1000
02/12/2021.description: This year's Supercars season concludes on the mountain at the Bathurst 1000 this weekend. Here's everything you need to know ahead of the great race around Mount Panorama, including its later start time.
02/12/2021.author: Simon Smale

02/12/2021.headline: Higher prices predicted for watermelons, chilli after torrential rain destroys summer crops
02/12/2021.description: Australians are set to pay a premium for popular summer produce, with widespread storms destroying crops across Queensland. Some growers say the deluge has wiped out up to 85 per cent of their crops.
02/12/2021.author: Jake Kearnan and Johanna Marie

02/12/2021.headline: Queenslanders in for a brief reprieve before more flooding set to hit sodden southern Queensland
02/12/2021.description: As floodwaters recede and residents across southern Queensland clean up, the weather bureau warns isolated storms across already sodden catchment areas could lead to more flooding next week.
02/12/2021.author: Baz Ruddick

02/12/2021.headline: Elective surgery patients in Queensland may require COVID test
02/12/2021.description: Elective surgery patients may require a negative COVID-19 test in the 72 hours before their procedures under options being discussed within Queensland Health to reduce the risk of hospital transmission.
02/12/2021.author: Baz Ruddick

02/12/2021.headline: 'People not heeding our advice': Some Tasmanians stuck in floodwaters as storms strike
02/12/2021.description: Hobartians are mopping up this morning following thunderstorms that brought heavy rain and hail to the Tasmanian capital and parts of the state's south-east.
02/12/2021.author: Baz Ruddick

02/12/2021.headline: There were winners, losers and big losers amongst Australia's universities last year — and the 'big eight' didn't escape
02/12/2021.description: Some universities actually increased revenue once the pandemic started, yet some vice-chancellors are deeply unhappy. The reasons why are complex, writes Conor Duffy.
02/12/2021.author: Conor Duffy

02/12/2021.headline: Nathan was once told he'd never run his own business — now he's doing it with the support of a major corporate
02/12/2021.description: When Nathan Johnston was younger, people told him he was "dreaming" when he talked about starting his own business. But on International Day of People with Disability it becomes a reality, as he launches a social media platform he created from his dining room table.
02/12/2021.author: Nas Campanella and Celina Edmonds

02/12/2021.headline: Friday News Quiz: Rhianna, Trump and Katter were in the headlines this week. Only one was kicked out a bar
02/12/2021.description: Will you be declared a national hero for your efforts or will you be unceremoniously thrown out? Test yourself to find out.
02/12/2021.author: Nas Campanella and Celina Edmonds

02/12/2021.headline: 'Moving towards COVID-normal': ACT to overhaul state of emergency laws, but don't expect Victorian-style protests
02/12/2021.description: The ACT government says it will soon be hard to justify calling the ongoing pandemic a public health "emergency", and wants to move away from that language.
02/12/2021.author: Markus Mannheim and Rosie King

02/12/2021.headline: Rachelle Miller says she made her allegations about Alan Tudge not for revenge, but so that other women can be heard
02/12/2021.description: It took a bruising year after Rachelle Miller first told her story about minister Alan Tudge for her to finally be heard, and for him to face consequences and stand aside, writes Louise Milligan.
02/12/2021.author: Markus Mannheim and Rosie King

02/12/2021.headline: An eight-hour year and hot enough to melt iron — this planet's 'not somewhere you'd want to go on holidays'
02/12/2021.description: About 30 light-years away a rocky planet as dense as pure iron orbits a red dwarf star half the size of our Sun. A year on GJ 367 b is shorter than a day on Earth.
02/12/2021.author: Genelle Weule

02/12/2021.headline: Germany considers COVID-19 vaccine mandate as cases surge
02/12/2021.description: Germany bans unvaccinated people from non-essential stores and venues, and considers making vaccines mandatory as new case numbers hit 70,000 in 24 hours.
02/12/2021.author: Genelle Weule

02/12/2021.headline: Satellites have discovered huge cloud of undisclosed methane emissions over Australia, experts say
02/12/2021.description: Methane is a powerful, invisible gas that might be a key driver of global warming. Now satellite imagery is raising questions over whether Australia has been accurately reporting its emissions to international bodies.
02/12/2021.author: Steve Cannane

02/12/2021.headline: Myanmar junta cancels passports of high-profile opponents and shadow government figures
02/12/2021.description: Myanmar's military junta revokes the passports of dozens of its leading opponents in an apparent attempt to stop them travelling and building international opposition to the regime.
02/12/2021.author: Stephen Dziedzic

02/12/2021.headline: SA has opened it borders to COVID, what can Tasmania learn from it?
02/12/2021.description: South Australia is a little over a week into reopening their borders and what happens with COVID-19 infections — and the death rate — is being watched closely by Tasmania, where the island state is soon to open up to the world.
02/12/2021.author: Liz Gwynn

02/12/2021.headline: People in NSW have to vote tomorrow — this is what you need to know
02/12/2021.description: Almost every NSW resident has to vote in one of the more than 120 elections set to be held tomorrow. This is what you need to know.
02/12/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

02/12/2021.headline: Eye-opening moments in the classroom remind me why teaching is my dream job
02/12/2021.description: I want to change negative perspectives and misconceptions about disability that I have faced my whole life. And already I've had so many special, eye-opening moments in the classroom that remind me I'm on the right path, writes Ashleigh Gibson.
02/12/2021.author: Heath Parkes-Hupton

02/12/2021.headline: If solar is now so cheap, why is my power bill still so high?
02/12/2021.description: After years of increases, power prices are set to fall, thanks largely to cheap solar. So how cheap can solar get? And what does this mean for your electricity bill?
02/12/2021.author: James Purtill

02/12/2021.headline: Omicron has again disrupted travel plans, but one country is pushing ahead with its quarantine-free experiment
02/12/2021.description: Fiji has pushed to get its vaccination rate to more than 90 per cent and has come up with a model for international travel that requires travellers to stay in the same place for a few days, but also feels nothing like quarantine.
02/12/2021.author: Emily Clark

02/12/2021.headline: Patty Mills becomes first basketballer to take home Don Award
02/12/2021.description: Patty Mills is setting franchise records for the Brooklyn Nets in the NBA but leading the Boomers to an Olympic medal has helped him to claim on of Australian sports' top honours.
02/12/2021.author: Emily Clark

02/12/2021.headline: Health Minister 'disappointed' at being kept in the dark over detection of Legionella bacteria at Perth hospital
02/12/2021.description: A detection of Legionella bacteria at Sir Charles Gairdner Hospital in Perth leads to 16 rooms being treated for the bacteria and two patients receiving precautionary antibiotics, as the Health Minister criticises health executives over a failure to communicate.
02/12/2021.author: James Carmody

02/12/2021.headline: Meghan wins court battle with British tabloid that published private letter to her father
02/12/2021.description: The decision spares the Duchess of Sussex from having to appear at a trial in which her estranged father Thomas Markle would also have given evidence.
02/12/2021.author: James Carmody

02/12/2021.headline: 'We have concerns': US slams China's hypersonic weapons tests
02/12/2021.description: Beijing's efforts to accelerate its military capabilities were highlighted by its July test of a hypersonic weapon, capable of partially orbiting the Earth before re-entering the atmosphere and gliding on a manoeuvrable path to its target.
02/12/2021.author: James Carmody

02/12/2021.headline: Supercars veteran eyeing first Bathurst 1000 crown
02/12/2021.description: Lee Holdsworth — who is partnered with Chaz Mostert — is allowing himself to dream of a maiden Bathurst 1000 win in his 18th attempt.
02/12/2021.author: James Carmody

02/12/2021.headline: The Loop: Tudge stands aside, Australia's eighth Omicron case, Spotify Wrapped releases 'audio auras' and why shame isn't helpful
02/12/2021.description: Here's your TL;DR for today's news.
02/12/2021.author: Dannielle Maguire
